Text

ANNE OF [GREEN GABLES]107-matthew

CHAPTER I. [Mrs. Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde is Surprised

|MRS . [Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde lived just where [the Avonlea main road]321-the avonlea main road dipped down into [a little hollow , fringed with alders and [ladies]323-ladies ' eardrops]322-a little hollow , fringed with alders and ladies ' eardrops and traversed by a brook that had its source away back in [the woods of [the old Cuthbert place]325-the old cuthbert place]324-the woods of the old cuthbert place ; it was reputed to be [an intricate , headlong brook]326-an intricate , headlong brook in [its]326-an intricate , headlong brook earlier course through [those woods]327-those woods , with dark secrets of pool and cascade ; but by the time it reached [[Lynde]105-mrs. lynde 's Hollow]328-lynde 's hollow it was [a quiet , well - conducted little stream]329-a quiet , well - conducted little stream , for not even a brook could run past [Mrs. Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde 's door without due regard for decency and decorum ; it probably was conscious that [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde was sitting at [her]105-mrs. lynde window , keeping a sharp eye on everything that passed , from brooks and [children]330-children up , and that if [she]105-mrs. lynde noticed anything odd or out of place [she]105-mrs. lynde would never rest until [she]105-mrs. lynde had ferreted out the why s and wherefores thereof .

There are plenty of people in [Avonlea]2-avonlea and out of [it]2-avonlea , who can attend closely to [[their]331-their neighbor]332-their neighbor 's business by dint of neglecting [their]331-their own ; but [Mrs. Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde was one of [those capable creatures who can manage [their]331-their own concerns and those of [other folks]334-other folks into the bargain]333-those capable creatures who can manage their own concerns and those of other folks into the bargain . [She]105-mrs. lynde was [a notable housewife]335-a notable housewife ; [her]105-mrs. lynde work was always done and well done ; [she]105-mrs. lynde " ran "[105-mrs. lynde] the Sewing Circle , helped run [the Sunday - school]336-the sunday - school , and was the strongest prop of [the Church Aid Society]337-the church aid society and [Foreign Missions Auxiliary]338-foreign missions auxiliary . Yet with all this [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde found abundant time to sit for hours at [her]105-mrs. lynde kitchen window , knitting " cotton warp "[105-mrs. lynde] quilts -- [she]105-mrs. lynde had knitted sixteen of them , as [[Avonlea]2-avonlea [housekeepers]340-housekeepers]339-avonlea housekeepers were wo nt to tell in awed voices -- and keeping a sharp eye on [the main road that crossed [the hollow]342-the hollow and wound up [the steep red hill beyond]343-the steep red hill beyond]341-the main road that crossed the hollow and wound up the steep red hill beyond . Since [Avonlea]2-avonlea occupied [a little triangular peninsula jutting out into [the Gulf of]3-the gulf of [St. Lawrence]4-st. lawrence with [water on two sides of]345-water on two sides of [it]344-a little triangular peninsula jutting out into the gulf of st. lawrence with water on two sides of it]344-a little triangular peninsula jutting out into the gulf of st. lawrence with water on two sides of it , [anybody who went out of [it]344-a little triangular peninsula jutting out into the gulf of st. lawrence with water on two sides of it or into [it]344-a little triangular peninsula jutting out into the gulf of st. lawrence with water on two sides of it]346-anybody who went out of it or into it had to pass over [that hill road]347-that hill road and so run the unseen gauntlet of [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde 's all - seeing eye .

[She]105-mrs. lynde was sitting [there]348-there one afternoon in early June . The sun was coming in at the window warm and bright ; the orchard on [the slope below [the house]350-the house]349-the slope below the house was in a bridal flush of pinky - white bloom , hummed over by a myriad of bees . [Thomas Lynde]106-thomas lynde -- [a meek little man whom [Avonlea]2-avonlea people called " [Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde 's husband"--was[106-thomas lynde] sowing [his]106-thomas lynde late turnip seed on [the hill field beyond [the barn]353-the barn]352-the hill field beyond the barn]351-a meek little man whom avonlea people called " rachel lynde 's husband"--was sowing his late turnip seed on the hill field beyond the barn ; and [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew ought to have been sowing [his]107-matthew on [the big red brook field]354-the big red brook field away over by [Green Gables]107-matthew . [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde knew that [he]107-matthew ought because [she]105-mrs. lynde had heard [him]107-matthew tell [Peter Morrison]108-peter morrison the evening before in [[William J. Blair]109-william blair 's store]355-william j. blair 's store over at [Carmody]5-carmody that [he]107-matthew meant to sow [his]107-matthew turnip seed the next afternoon . [Peter]108-peter morrison had asked [him]107-matthew , of course , for [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew had never been known to volunteer information about anything in [his]107-matthew whole life .

And yet here was [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew , at half - past three on the afternoon of a busy day , placidly driving over [the hollow]342-the hollow and up [the hill]357-the hill ; moreover , [he]107-matthew wore a white collar and [his]107-matthew best suit of clothes , which was plain proof that [he]107-matthew was going out of [Avonlea]2-avonlea ; and [he]107-matthew had [the buggy]358-the buggy and the sorrel mare , which betokened that [he]107-matthew was going a considerable distance . Now , where was [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew going and why was [he]107-matthew going [there]348-there ?

Had it been [any other man in [Avonlea]2-avonlea]360-any other man in avonlea , [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde , deftly putting this and that together , might have given a pretty good guess as to both questions . But [Matthew]107-matthew so rarely went from [home]361-home that it must be something pressing and unusual which was taking [him]107-matthew ; [he]107-matthew was [the shyest man alive and hated to have to go among [strangers]363-strangers or to any place where [he]107-matthew might have to talk]362-the shyest man alive and hated to have to go among strangers or to any place where he might have to talk . [Matthew , dressed up with a white collar and driving in a buggy]364-matthew , dressed up with a white collar and driving in a buggy , was something that did n't happen often . [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde , ponder as [she]105-mrs. lynde might , could make nothing of it and [her]105-mrs. lynde afternoon 's enjoyment was spoiled .

" [I]365-the worthy woman 'll just step over to [Green Gables]107-matthew after tea and find out from [Marilla]110-marilla where [he]107-matthew 's gone and why , "[365-the worthy woman] [the worthy woman]365-the worthy woman finally concluded . " [He]107-matthew does n't generally go to [town]2009-town this time of year and [he]107-matthew _ never _ visits ; if [he]107-matthew 'd run out of turnip seed [he]107-matthew would n't dress up and take the buggy to go for more ; [he]107-matthew was n't driving fast enough to be going for [a doctor]2010-a doctor . Yet something must have happened since last night to start [him]107-matthew off . [I]365-the worthy woman 'm clean puzzled , that 's what , and [I]365-the worthy woman wo n't know a minute 's peace of mind or conscience until [I]365-the worthy woman know what has taken [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew out of [Avonlea]2-avonlea today . "[365-the worthy woman]

[Accordingly]366-accordingly after tea [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde set out ; [she]105-mrs. lynde had not far to go ; [the big , rambling , orchard - embowered house where [the Cuthberts]111-the cuthberts lived]367-the big , rambling , orchard - embowered house where the cuthberts lived was a scant quarter of a mile up the road from [[Lynde]105-mrs. lynde 's Hollow]328-lynde 's hollow . To be sure , [the long lane]369-the long lane made [it]369-the long lane a good deal further . [[Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew 's father]370-matthew cuthbert 's father , as shy and silent as [[his]370-matthew cuthbert 's father son]371-his son after [him]370-matthew cuthbert 's father , had got as far away as [he]370-matthew cuthbert 's father possibly could from [[his]370-matthew cuthbert 's father fellow men]372-his fellow men without actually retreating into [the woods]373-the woods when [he]370-matthew cuthbert 's father founded [[his]370-matthew cuthbert 's father homestead]374-his homestead . [Green Gables]107-matthew was built at the furthest edge of [[his]370-matthew cuthbert 's father cleared land]375-his cleared land and [there]348-there [it]107-matthew was to this day , barely visible from [the main road along which [all the other Avonlea houses]378-all the other avonlea houses were so sociably situated]377-the main road along which all the other avonlea houses were so sociably situated . [Mrs. Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde did not call living in such a place _ living _ at all .

" It 's just _ staying _ , that 's what , "[105-mrs. lynde] [she]105-mrs. lynde said as [she]105-mrs. lynde stepped along [the deep - rutted , grassy lane bordered with wild rose bushes]379-the deep - rutted , grassy lane bordered with wild rose bushes . " It 's no wonder [Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]110-marilla are both a little odd , living away back here by [themselves]2011-themselves . [Trees]112-trees are n't much company , though dear knows if they were there 'd be enough of [them]112-trees . [I]105-mrs. lynde 'd ruther look at [people]2012-people . To be sure , [they]2012-people seem contented enough ; but then , [I]105-mrs. lynde suppose , [they]2012-people 're used to it . [A body]2013-a body can get used to anything , even to being hanged , as [the Irishman]2014-the irishman said . "[105-mrs. lynde]

With this [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde stepped out of [the lane]380-the lane into [the backyard of [Green Gables]107-matthew]381-the backyard of green gables . Very green and neat and precise was [that yard]382-that yard , set about on one side with great patriarchal willows and the other with prim Lombardies . Not a stray stick nor stone was to be seen , for [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde would have seen it if there had been . Privately [she]105-mrs. lynde was of the opinion that [Marilla Cuthbert]113-marilla swept [that yard]382-that yard over as often as [she]113-marilla swept [[her]113-marilla house]384-her house . [One]385-one could have eaten a meal off the ground without over - brimming the proverbial peck of dirt .

[Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde rapped smartly at the kitchen door and stepped in when bidden to do so . [The kitchen at [Green Gables]107-matthew]386-the kitchen at green gables was [a cheerful apartment]387-a cheerful apartment -- or would have been cheerful if [it]386-the kitchen at green gables had not been so painfully clean as to give [it]386-the kitchen at green gables something of the appearance of [an unused parlor]388-an unused parlor . [Its]386-the kitchen at green gables windows looked east and west ; through [the west one]389-the west one , looking out on [the back yard]390-the back yard , came a flood of mellow June sunlight ; but the east one , whence [you]391-you got a glimpse of the bloom white cherry - trees in [the left orchard]392-the left orchard and nodding , slender birches down in [the hollow by [the brook]394-the brook]393-the hollow by the brook , was greened over by a tangle of vines . Here sat [Marilla Cuthbert]113-marilla , when [she]113-marilla sat at all , always slightly distrustful of sunshine , which seemed to [her]113-marilla too dancing and irresponsible a thing for a world which was meant to be taken seriously ; and here [she]113-marilla sat now , knitting , and the table behind [her]113-marilla was laid for supper .

[Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde , before [she]105-mrs. lynde had fairly closed the door , had taken a mental note of everything that was on that table . There were three plates laid , so that [Marilla]113-marilla must be expecting [some one [home]361-home with [Matthew]107-matthew to tea]395-some one home with matthew to tea ; but the dishes were everyday dishes and there was only crab - apple preserves and one kind of cake , so that the expected company could not be any particular company . Yet what of [Matthew]107-matthew 's white collar and the sorrel mare ? [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde was getting fairly dizzy with this unusual mystery about quiet , unmysterious [Green Gables]107-matthew .

" Good evening , [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde , "[113-marilla] [Marilla]113-marilla said briskly . " This is a real fine evening , is n't it ? Wo n't [you]105-mrs. lynde sit down ? How are all [[your]105-mrs. lynde folks]2015-your folks ? "[113-marilla]

Something that for lack of any other name might be called friendship existed and always had existed between [Marilla Cuthbert]113-marilla and [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde , in spite of -- or perhaps because of -- [their]397-their dissimilarity .

[Marilla]113-marilla was [a tall , thin woman , with angles and without curves]398-a tall , thin woman , with angles and without curves ; [her]113-marilla dark hair showed some gray streaks and was always twisted up in a hard little knot behind with two wire hairpins stuck aggressively through it . [She]113-marilla looked like [a woman of narrow experience and rigid conscience]399-a woman of narrow experience and rigid conscience , which [she]113-marilla was ; but there was a saving something about [her]113-marilla mouth which , if it had been ever so slightly developed , might have been considered indicative of a sense of humor .

" [We]2015-your folks 're all pretty well , "[105-mrs. lynde] said [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde . " [I]105-mrs. lynde was kind of afraid _ [you]105-mrs. lynde _ were n't , though , when [I]105-mrs. lynde saw [Matthew]107-matthew starting off today . [I]105-mrs. lynde thought maybe [he]107-matthew was going to [the doctor]2016-the doctor 's . "[105-mrs. lynde]

[Marilla]113-marilla 's lips twitched understandingly . [She]113-marilla had expected [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde up ; [she]113-marilla had known that the sight of [Matthew]107-matthew jaunting off so unaccountably would be too much for [[her]113-marilla neighbor]400-her neighbor 's curiosity .

" Oh , no , [I]113-marilla 'm quite well although [I]113-marilla had a bad headache yesterday , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said . " [Matthew]107-matthew went to [Bright River]6-bright river . [We]2017-we 're getting [a little boy from [an orphan asylum in [Nova Scotia]7-nova scotia]2019-an orphan asylum in nova scotia]2018-a little boy from an orphan asylum in nova scotia and [he]2018-a little boy from an orphan asylum in nova scotia 's coming on [the train]2020-the train tonight . "[113-marilla]

If [Marilla]113-marilla had said that [Matthew]107-matthew had gone to [Bright River]6-bright river to meet a kangaroo from [Australia]8-australia [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde could not have been more astonished . [She]105-mrs. lynde was actually stricken dumb for five seconds . It was unsupposable that [Marilla]113-marilla was making fun of [her]113-marilla , but [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde was almost forced to suppose it .

" Are [you]113-marilla in earnest , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[105-mrs. lynde] [she]105-mrs. lynde demanded when voice returned to [her]113-marilla .

" Yes , of course , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , as if getting [[boys]401-boys from [orphan asylums in [Nova Scotia]7-nova scotia]403-orphan asylums in nova scotia]402-boys from orphan asylums in nova scotia were part of the usual spring work on [any well - regulated [Avonlea farm]405-avonlea farm]404-any well - regulated avonlea farm instead of being an unheard of innovation .

[Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde felt that [she]105-mrs. lynde had received a severe mental jolt . [She]105-mrs. lynde thought in exclamation points . [A boy]406-a boy ! [Marilla]113-marilla and [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew of all people adopting [a boy]406-a boy ! From [an orphan asylum]408-an orphan asylum ! Well , [the world]409-the world was certainly turning upside down ! [She]113-marilla would be surprised at nothing after this ! Nothing !

" What on earth put such a notion into [your]113-marilla head ? "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla demanded disapprovingly .

This had been done without [her]113-marilla advice being asked , and must perforce be disapproved .

" Well , [we]2021-we 've been thinking about it for some time -- all winter in fact , "[113-marilla] returned [Marilla]113-marilla . " [Mrs. Alexander Spencer]114-mrs. spencer was up [here]2022-here one day before Christmas and [she]114-mrs. spencer said [she]114-mrs. spencer was going to get [a little girl from [the asylum]2024-the asylum]2023-a little girl from the asylum over in [Hopeton]9-hopeton in the spring . [[Her]114-mrs. spencer cousin]2025-her cousin lives [there]348-there and [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer has visited [here]2022-here and knows all about it . So [Matthew]107-matthew and [I]113-marilla have talked it over off and on ever since . [We]2021-we thought [we]2021-we 'd get [a boy]406-a boy . [Matthew]107-matthew is getting up in years , [you]2029-you know -- [he]107-matthew 's sixty -- and [he]107-matthew is n't so spry as [he]107-matthew once was . [His]107-matthew heart troubles [him]107-matthew a good deal . And [you]2029-you know how desperate hard it 's got to be to get [hired help]2030-hired help . There 's never [anybody]2031-anybody to be had but [those stupid , half - grown little French boys]2032-those stupid , half - grown little french boys ; and as soon as [you]2029-you do get one broke into [your]2029-you ways and taught something [he]406-a boy 's up and off to [the lobster canneries]2033-the lobster canneries or [the States]2034-the states . At first [Matthew]107-matthew suggested getting [a Home boy]2035-a home boy . But [I]113-marilla said ? no ' flat to that . ? [They]2035-a home boy may be all right -- [I'm]113-marilla not saying [they]2035-a home boy 're not -- but no [London]10-london street Arabs for [me]113-marilla , ' [I]113-marilla said . ? Give [me]113-marilla [a native born]2036-a native born at least . There 'll be a risk , no matter who [we]2037-we get . But [I]113-marilla 'll feel easier in [my]113-marilla mind and sleep sounder at nights if [we]2037-we get [a born Canadian]2038-a born canadian . ' So in the end [we]2037-we decided to ask [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer to pick [us]2037-we out one when [she]114-mrs. spencer went over to get [[her]114-mrs. spencer little girl]2039-her little girl . [We]2037-we heard last week [she]114-mrs. spencer was going , so [we]2037-we sent [her]114-mrs. spencer word by [[Richard Spencer]115-richard spencer 's folks at [Carmody]5-carmody]2040-richard spencer 's folks at carmody to bring [us]2037-we [a smart , likely boy of about ten or eleven]2041-a smart , likely boy of about ten or eleven . [We]2037-we decided that would be the best age -- old enough to be of some use in doing chores right off and young enough to be trained up proper . [We]2037-we mean to give [him]2041-a smart , likely boy of about ten or eleven a good home and schooling . [We]2037-we had a telegram from [Mrs. Alexander Spencer]114-mrs. spencer today -- [the mail - man]2042-the mail - man brought it from [the station]2043-the station -- saying [they]2044-they were coming on [the five - thirty train]2045-the five - thirty train tonight . So [Matthew]107-matthew went to [Bright River]6-bright river to meet [him]2041-a smart , likely boy of about ten or eleven . [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer will drop [him]2041-a smart , likely boy of about ten or eleven off [there]348-there . Of course [she]114-mrs. spencer goes on to [White Sands station]2047-white sands station [herself]114-mrs. spencer . "[113-marilla]

[Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde prided [herself]105-mrs. lynde on always speaking [her]105-mrs. lynde mind ; [she]105-mrs. lynde proceeded to speak it now , having adjusted [her]105-mrs. lynde mental attitude to this amazing piece of news .

" Well , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]113-marilla 'll just tell [you]113-marilla plain that [I]113-marilla think [you]113-marilla 're doing a mighty foolish thing -- a risky thing , that 's what . [You]113-marilla do n't know what [you]113-marilla 're getting . [You]113-marilla 're bringing [a strange child]2048-a strange child into [[your]113-marilla house]2049-your house and [home]361-home and [you]113-marilla do n't know a single thing about [him]2048-a strange child nor what [his]2048-a strange child disposition is like nor what sort of [parents]2051-parents [he]2048-a strange child had nor how [he]2048-a strange child 's likely to turn out . Why , it was only last week [I]113-marilla read in the paper how [a man]2052-a man and [[his]2052-a man wife]2053-his wife up [west of [the Island]11-the island]2054-west of the island took [a boy]406-a boy out of [an orphan asylum]408-an orphan asylum and [he]2052-a man set fire to [the house]350-the house at night -- set it _ on purpose _ , [Marilla]113-marilla -- and nearly burnt [them]406-a boy to a crisp in [their]406-a boy beds . And [I]113-marilla know another case where [an adopted boy]2058-an adopted boy used to suck the eggs -- [they]406-a boy could n't break [him]2058-an adopted boy of it . If [you]113-marilla had asked [my]113-marilla advice in the matter -- which [you]113-marilla did n't do , [Marilla]113-marilla -- [I'd]113-marilla have said for mercy 's sake not to think of such a thing , that 's what . "[113-marilla]

This Job 's comforting seemed neither to offend nor to alarm [Marilla]113-marilla . [She]113-marilla knitted steadily on .

" [I]113-marilla do n't deny there 's something in what [you]113-marilla say , [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde . [I]113-marilla 've had some qualms [myself]113-marilla . But [Matthew]107-matthew was terrible set on it . [I]113-marilla could see that , so [I]113-marilla gave in . It 's so seldom [Matthew]107-matthew sets [his]107-matthew mind on anything that when [he]107-matthew does [I]113-marilla always feel it 's [my]113-marilla duty to give in . And as for the risk , there 's risks in pretty near everything a body does in [this world]2059-this world . There 's risks in [[people]2012-people 's having [children]330-children of [their]2012-people own]2061-people 's having children of their own if it comes to that -- [they]2012-people do n't always turn out well . And then [Nova Scotia]7-nova scotia is right close to [the Island]11-the island . It is n't as if [we]2063-we were getting [him]107-matthew from [England]12-england or [the States]13-the states . [He]107-matthew ca n't be much different from [ourselves]2063-we . "[113-marilla]

" Well , [I]105-mrs. lynde hope it will turn out all right , "[105-mrs. lynde] said [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde in a tone that plainly indicated [her]105-mrs. lynde painful doubts . " Only do n't say [I]105-mrs. lynde did n't warn [you]105-mrs. lynde if [he]107-matthew burns [Green Gables]107-matthew down or puts strychnine in the well -- [I]105-mrs. lynde heard of a case over in [New Brunswick]14-new brunswick where [an orphan asylum child]2064-an orphan asylum child did that and [the whole family]2065-the whole family died in fearful agonies . Only , it was [a girl]2066-a girl in that instance . "[105-mrs. lynde]

" Well , [we]2063-we 're not getting [a girl]2066-a girl , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , as if poisoning wells were a purely feminine accomplishment and not to be dreaded in the case of [a boy]406-a boy . " [I]105-mrs. lynde 'd never dream of taking [a girl to bring up]2068-a girl to bring up . [I]105-mrs. lynde wonder at [Mrs. Alexander Spencer]114-mrs. spencer for doing it . But there , _ [she]114-mrs. spencer _ would n't shrink from adopting [a whole orphan asylum]2069-a whole orphan asylum if [she]114-mrs. spencer took it into [her]114-mrs. spencer head . "[105-mrs. lynde]

[Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde would have liked to stay until [Matthew]107-matthew came [home]361-home with [[his]107-matthew imported orphan]412-his imported orphan . But reflecting that it would be a good two hours at least before [his]107-matthew arrival [she]105-mrs. lynde concluded to go up [the road]413-the road to [Robert Bell 's]15-robert bell 's and tell the news . It would certainly make a sensation second to none , and [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde dearly loved to make a sensation . So [she]105-mrs. lynde took [herself]105-mrs. lynde away , somewhat to [Marilla]113-marilla 's relief , for [the latter]414-the latter felt [her]105-mrs. lynde doubts and fears reviving under the influence of [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde 's pessimism .

" Well , of all things that ever were or will be ! "[105-mrs. lynde] ejaculated [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde when [she]105-mrs. lynde was safely out in [the lane]380-the lane . " It does really seem as if [I]105-mrs. lynde must be dreaming . Well , [I]105-mrs. lynde 'm sorry for [that poor young one]2070-that poor young one and no mistake . [Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]113-marilla do n't know anything about [children]330-children and [they]2072-they 'll expect [him]2070-that poor young one to be wiser and steadier that [[his]2070-that poor young one own grandfather]2073-his own grandfather , if so be 's [he]2070-that poor young one ever had [a grandfather]2074-a grandfather , which is doubtful . It seems uncanny to think of [a child]2075-a child at [Green Gables]107-matthew somehow ; there 's never been one [there]348-there , for [Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]113-marilla were grown up when [the new house]2077-the new house was built -- if [they]2072-they ever _ were _ [children]330-children , which is hard to believe when [one]385-one looks at [them]2072-they . [I]105-mrs. lynde would n't be in [that orphan]2080-that orphan 's shoes for anything . [My]105-mrs. lynde , but [I]105-mrs. lynde pity [him]417-the child who was waiting patiently at the bright river station , that 's what . "[105-mrs. lynde]

So said [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde to [the wild rose bushes]416-the wild rose bushes out of the fulness of [her]105-mrs. lynde heart ; but if [she]105-mrs. lynde could have seen [the child who was waiting patiently at [the Bright River station]418-the bright river station]417-the child who was waiting patiently at the bright river station at that very moment [her]105-mrs. lynde pity would have been still deeper and more profound .

CHAPTER II . [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew is surprised

|MATTHEW [Cuthbert]107-matthew and the sorrel mare jogged comfortably over the eight miles to [Bright River]6-bright river . It was [a pretty road]419-a pretty road , running along between [snug farmsteads]420-snug farmsteads , with now and again a bit of balsamy fir wood to drive through or a hollow where wild plums hung out their filmy bloom . The air was sweet with the breath of [many apple orchards]421-many apple orchards and [the meadows]422-the meadows sloped away in the distance to horizon mists of pearl and purple ; while

" The little birds sang as if it were The one day of summer in all the year . "[423-women]

[Matthew]107-matthew enjoyed the drive after [his]107-matthew own fashion , except during the moments when [he]107-matthew met [women]423-women and had to nod to [them]423-women -- for in [Prince Edward island]16-prince edward island [you]424-you are supposed to nod to all and sundry [you]424-you meet on [the road]413-the road whether [you]424-you know [them]423-women or not .

[Matthew]107-matthew dreaded [all women]426-all women except [Marilla]113-marilla and [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde ; [he]107-matthew had an uncomfortable feeling that the mysterious creatures were secretly laughing at [him]107-matthew . [He]107-matthew may have been quite right in thinking so , for [he]107-matthew was [an odd - looking personage]427-an odd - looking personage , with an ungainly figure and long iron - gray hair that touched [his]107-matthew stooping shoulders , and a full , soft brown beard which [he]107-matthew had worn ever since [he]107-matthew was twenty . In fact , [he]107-matthew had looked at twenty very much as [he]107-matthew looked at sixty , lacking a little of the grayness .

When [he]107-matthew reached [Bright River]6-bright river there was no sign of [any train]428-any train ; [he]107-matthew thought [he]107-matthew was too early , so [he]107-matthew tied [his]107-matthew horse in [the yard of [the small Bright River hotel]430-the small bright river hotel]429-the yard of the small bright river hotel and went over to [the station house]431-the station house . [The long platform]432-the long platform was almost deserted ; [the only living creature in sight]433-the only living creature in sight being [a girl who was sitting on a pile of shingles at the extreme end]434-a girl who was sitting on a pile of shingles at the extreme end . [Matthew]107-matthew , barely noting that it _ was _ [a girl]2066-a girl , sidled past [her]434-a girl who was sitting on a pile of shingles at the extreme end as quickly as possible without looking at [her]434-a girl who was sitting on a pile of shingles at the extreme end . Had [he]107-matthew looked [he]107-matthew could hardly have failed to notice the tense rigidity and expectation of [her]434-a girl who was sitting on a pile of shingles at the extreme end attitude and expression . [She]434-a girl who was sitting on a pile of shingles at the extreme end was sitting there waiting for something or [somebody]436-somebody and , since sitting and waiting was the only thing to do just then , [she]434-a girl who was sitting on a pile of shingles at the extreme end sat and waited with all [her]434-a girl who was sitting on a pile of shingles at the extreme end might and main .

[Matthew]107-matthew encountered [the stationmaster]437-the stationmaster locking up [the ticket office]438-the ticket office preparatory to going [home]361-home for supper , and asked [him]437-the stationmaster if [the five - thirty train]2045-the five - thirty train would soon be along .

" [The five - thirty train]2045-the five - thirty train has been in and gone half an hour ago , "[441-that brisk official] answered [that brisk official]441-that brisk official . " But there was [a passenger]2082-a passenger dropped off for [you]107-matthew -- [a little girl]2083-a little girl . [She]2083-a little girl 's sitting out there on the shingles . [I]441-that brisk official asked [her]2083-a little girl to go into [the ladies ' waiting room]2084-the ladies ' waiting room , but [she]2083-a little girl informed [me]441-that brisk official gravely that [she]2083-a little girl preferred to stay outside . ? There was more scope for imagination , ' [she]2083-a little girl said . [She]2083-a little girl 's a case , [I]441-that brisk official should say . "[441-that brisk official]

" [I]107-matthew 'm not expecting [a girl]2066-a girl , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew blankly . " It 's [a boy [I]107-matthew 've come for]2086-a boy i 've come for . [He]2086-a boy i 've come for should be [here]2022-here . [Mrs. Alexander Spencer]114-mrs. spencer was to bring [him]2086-a boy i 've come for over from [Nova Scotia]7-nova scotia for [me]107-matthew . "[107-matthew]

[The stationmaster]437-the stationmaster whistled .

" Guess there 's some mistake , "[437-the stationmaster] [he]437-the stationmaster said . " [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer came off [the train]2020-the train with [that girl]2089-that girl and gave [her]2089-that girl into [my]437-the stationmaster charge . Said [you]107-matthew and [[your]107-matthew sister]2090-your sister were adopting [her]2089-that girl from [an orphan asylum]408-an orphan asylum and that [you]107-matthew would be along for [her]2089-that girl presently . That 's all [I]437-the stationmaster know about it -- and [I]437-the stationmaster have n't got [any more orphans]2092-any more orphans concealed hereabouts . "[437-the stationmaster]

" [I]107-matthew do n't understand , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew helplessly , wishing that [Marilla]113-marilla was at hand to cope with the situation .

" Well , [you]107-matthew 'd better question [the girl]2093-the girl , "[443-the station - master] said [the station - master]443-the station - master carelessly . " [I]443-the station - master dare say [she]2093-the girl 'll be able to explain -- [she]2093-the girl 's got a tongue of [her]2093-the girl own , that 's certain . Maybe [they]2094-they were out of [boys of the brand]2095-boys of the brand [you]107-matthew wanted . "[443-the station - master]

[He]107-matthew walked jauntily away , being hungry , and the unfortunate [Matthew]107-matthew was left to do that which was harder for [him]107-matthew than bearding a lion in [its den]444-its den -- walk up to [a girl]2066-a girl -- [a strange girl]446-a strange girl -- [an orphan girl]447-an orphan girl -- and demand of [her]2066-a girl why [she]2066-a girl was n't [a boy]406-a boy . [Matthew]107-matthew groaned in spirit as [he]107-matthew turned about and shuffled gently down [the platform]449-the platform towards [her]2066-a girl .

[She]2066-a girl had been watching [him]107-matthew ever since [he]107-matthew had passed [her]2066-a girl and [she]2066-a girl had [her]2066-a girl eyes on [him]107-matthew now . [Matthew]107-matthew was not looking at [her]2066-a girl and would not have seen what [she]2066-a girl was really like if [he]107-matthew had been , but [an ordinary observer]450-an ordinary observer would have seen this : [A child of about eleven , garbed in a very short , very tight , very ugly dress of yellowish - gray wincey]451-a child of about eleven , garbed in a very short , very tight , very ugly dress of yellowish - gray wincey . [She]2066-a girl wore a faded brown sailor hat and beneath the hat , extending down [her]2066-a girl back , were two braids of very thick , decidedly red hair . [Her]2066-a girl face was small , white and thin , also much freckled ; [her]2066-a girl mouth was large and so were [her]2066-a girl eyes , which looked green in some lights and moods and gray in others .

So far , [the ordinary observer]452-the ordinary observer ; [an extraordinary observer]453-an extraordinary observer might have seen that the chin was very pointed and pronounced ; that the big eyes were full of spirit and vivacity ; that the mouth was sweet - lipped and expressive ; that the forehead was broad and full ; in short , [[our]454-our discerning extraordinary observer]455-our discerning extraordinary observer might have concluded that [no commonplace soul]456-no commonplace soul inhabited the body of [this stray woman]457-this stray woman - child of whom shy [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew was so ludicrously afraid .

[Matthew]107-matthew , however , was spared the ordeal of speaking first , for as soon as [she]2066-a girl concluded that [he]107-matthew was coming to [her]2066-a girl [she]2066-a girl stood up , grasping with one thin brown hand the handle of a shabby , old - fashioned carpet - bag ; the other [she]2066-a girl held out to [him]107-matthew .

" [I]2066-a girl suppose [you]107-matthew are [Mr. Matthew Cuthbert of Green Gables]107-matthew ? "[2066-a girl] [she]2066-a girl said in a peculiarly clear , sweet voice . " [I]2066-a girl 'm very glad to see [you]107-matthew . [I]2066-a girl was beginning to be afraid [you]107-matthew were n't coming for [me]2066-a girl and [I]2066-a girl was imagining all the things that might have happened to prevent [you]107-matthew . [I]2066-a girl had made up [my]2066-a girl mind that if [you]107-matthew did n't come for [me]2066-a girl to - night [I]2066-a girl 'd go down [the track]2096-the track to that big wild cherry - tree at the bend , and climb up into [it]2097-it to stay all night . [I]2066-a girl would n't be a bit afraid , and it would be lovely to sleep in a wild cherry - tree all white with bloom in the moonshine , do n't [you]107-matthew think ? [You]107-matthew could imagine [you]107-matthew were dwelling in [marble halls]2098-marble halls , could n't [you]107-matthew ? And [I]2066-a girl was quite sure [you]107-matthew would come for [me]2066-a girl in the morning , if [you]107-matthew did n't to - night . "[2066-a girl]

[Matthew]107-matthew had taken the scrawny little hand awkwardly in [his]107-matthew ; then and there [he]107-matthew decided what to do . [He]107-matthew could not tell [this child]458-this child with the glowing eyes that there had been a mistake ; [he]107-matthew would take [her]458-this child [home]361-home and let [Marilla]113-marilla do that . [She]458-this child could n't be left at [Bright River]6-bright river anyhow , no matter what mistake had been made , so all questions and explanations might as well be deferred until [he]107-matthew was safely back at [Green Gables]107-matthew .

" [I]107-matthew 'm sorry [I]107-matthew was late , "[107-matthew] [he]107-matthew said shyly . " Come along . The horse is over in [the yard]2099-the yard . Give [me]107-matthew [your]460-the child bag . "[107-matthew]

" Oh , [I]460-the child can carry it , "[460-the child] [the child]460-the child responded cheerfully . " It is n't heavy . [I]460-the child 've got all [my]460-the child worldly goods in it , but it is n't heavy . And if it is n't carried in just a certain way the handle pulls out -- so [I]460-the child 'd better keep it because [I]460-the child know the exact knack of it . It 's an extremely old carpet - bag . Oh , [I]460-the child 'm very glad [you]460-the child 've come , even if it would have been nice to sleep in [a wild cherry - tree]2100-a wild cherry - tree . [We]2101-we 've got to drive a long piece , have n't [we]2101-we ? [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer said it was eight miles . [I]460-the child 'm glad because [I]460-the child love driving . Oh , it seems so wonderful that [I]460-the child 'm going to live with [you]460-the child and belong to [you]460-the child . [I]460-the child 've never belonged to [anybody]2031-anybody -- not really . But [the asylum]2024-the asylum was the worst . [I]460-the child 've only been in [it]2024-the asylum four months , but that was enough . [I]460-the child do n't suppose [you]460-the child ever were [an orphan]2104-an orphan in [an asylum]2105-an asylum , so [you]460-the child ca n't possibly understand what it is like . It 's worse than anything [you]460-the child could imagine . [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer said it was wicked of [me]460-the child to talk like that , but [I]460-the child did n't mean to be wicked . It 's so easy to be wicked without knowing it , is n't it ? [They]2106-they were good , [you]460-the child know -- [the asylum people]2107-the asylum people . But there is so little scope for the imagination in [an asylum]2105-an asylum -- only just in [the other orphans]2109-the other orphans . It was pretty interesting to imagine things about [them]2106-they -- to imagine that perhaps [the girl who sat next to [you]460-the child]2110-the girl who sat next to you was really [the daughter of [a belted earl]2112-a belted earl , who had been stolen away from [[her]2110-the girl who sat next to you parents]2113-her parents in [her]2110-the girl who sat next to you infancy by [a cruel nurse who died before [she]2110-the girl who sat next to you could confess]2114-a cruel nurse who died before she could confess . [I]460-the child used to lie awake at nights and imagine things like that , because [I]460-the child did n't have time in the day . [I]460-the child guess that 's why [I]460-the child 'm so thin -- [I]460-the child _ am _ dreadful thin , ai n't [I]460-the child ? There is n't a pick on [my]460-the child bones . [I]460-the child do love to imagine [I]460-the child 'm nice and plump , with dimples in [my]460-the child elbows]2111-the daughter of a belted earl , who had been stolen away from her parents in her infancy by a cruel nurse who died before she could confess . i used to lie awake at nights and imagine things like that , because i did n't have time in the day . i guess that 's why i 'm so thin -- i _ am _ dreadful thin , ai n't i ? there is n't a pick on my bones . i do love to imagine i 'm nice and plump , with dimples in my elbows . "[460-the child]

With [this [Matthew]107-matthew 's companion]461-this matthew 's companion stopped talking , partly because [she]461-this matthew 's companion was out of breath and partly because [they]462-they had reached the buggy . Not another word did [she]461-this matthew 's companion say until [they]462-they had left [the village]463-the village and were driving down [a steep little hill]464-a steep little hill , [the road]413-the road part of which had been cut so deeply into the soft soil , that [the banks]466-the banks , fringed with blooming wild cherry - trees and slim white birches , were several feet above [their]462-they heads .

[The child]460-the child put out [her]460-the child hand and broke off a branch of wild plum that brushed against the side of the buggy .

" Is n't that beautiful ? What did that tree , leaning out from the bank , all white and lacy , make [you]107-matthew think of ? "[460-the child] [she]460-the child asked .

" Well now , [I]107-matthew dunno , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew .

" Why , [a bride]2115-a bride , of course -- [a bride all in white with a lovely misty veil]2116-a bride all in white with a lovely misty veil . [The " Avenue]19-the " avenue , "[2093-the girl] so called by [the Newbridge people]482-the newbridge people , was a stretch of road four or five hundred yards long , completely arched over with huge , wide - spreading apple - trees , planted years ago by [an eccentric old farmer]483-an eccentric old farmer . Overhead was one long canopy of snowy fragrant bloom . Below the boughs the air was full of a purple twilight and far ahead a glimpse of painted sunset sky shone like a great rose window at the end of [a cathedral aisle]484-a cathedral aisle .

Its beauty seemed to strike [the child]460-the child dumb . [She]460-the child leaned back in the buggy , [her]460-the child thin hands clasped before [her]460-the child , [her]460-the child face lifted rapturously to the white splendor above . " [We]2194-we 're pretty near [home]361-home now . That 's [Green Gables]107-matthew over-- "[107-matthew]

" Oh , do n't tell [me]510-i , "[510-i] [she]510-i interrupted breathlessly , catching at [his]107-matthew partially raised arm and shutting [her]510-i eyes that [she]510-i might not see [his]107-matthew gesture . " Let [me]510-i guess . [I]510-i 'm sure [I]510-i 'll guess right . "[510-i]

[She]510-i opened [her]510-i eyes and looked about [her]510-i . [They]508-they were on [the crest of [a hill]493-a hill]492-the crest of a hill . The sun had set some time since , but the landscape was still clear in the mellow afterlight . To the west a dark church spire rose up against a marigold sky . Below was [a little valley]513-a little valley and beyond a long , gently - rising slope with [snug farmsteads scattered along [it]515-it]514-snug farmsteads scattered along it . From one to another [the child]460-the child 's eyes darted , eager and wistful . At last [they]508-they lingered on one away to the left , far back from [the road]413-the road , dimly white with blossoming trees in the twilight of [the surrounding woods]518-the surrounding woods . Over [it]515-it , in the stainless southwest sky , a great crystal - white star was shining like a lamp of guidance and promise .

" That 's it , is n't it ? "[510-i] [she]510-i said , pointing .

[Matthew]107-matthew slapped the reins on the sorrel 's back delightedly .

" Well now , [you]510-i 've guessed it ! But [I]510-i reckon [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer described it so 's [you]510-i could tell . "[510-i]

" No , [she]114-mrs. spencer didn't -- really [she]114-mrs. spencer did n't . All [she]114-mrs. spencer said might just as well have been about most of [those other places]2204-those other places . [I]510-i had n't any real idea what it looked like . But just as soon as [I]510-i saw it [I]510-i felt it was [home]361-home . Oh , it seems as if [I]510-i must be in a dream . Do [you]510-i know , [my]510-i arm must be black and blue from the elbow up , for [I]510-i 've pinched [myself]510-i so many times today . Every little while a horrible sickening feeling would come over [me]510-i and [I]510-i 'd be so afraid it was all a dream . Then [I]510-i 'd pinch [myself]510-i to see if it was real -- until suddenly [I]510-i remembered that even supposing it was only a dream [I]510-i 'd better go on dreaming as long as [I]510-i could ; so [I]510-i stopped pinching . But it _ is _ real and [we]2206-we 're nearly [home]361-home . "[510-i]

With a sigh of rapture [she]519-she relapsed into silence . [Matthew]107-matthew stirred uneasily . [He]107-matthew felt glad that it would be [Marilla]113-marilla and not [he]107-matthew who would have to tell this waif of [the world]409-the world that [the home [she]519-she longed for]521-the home she longed for was not to be [hers]519-she after all . [They]522-they drove over [Lynde 's Hollow]26-lynde 's hollow , where [it]523-it was already quite dark , but not so dark that [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde could not see [them]522-they from [her]105-mrs. lynde window vantage , and up [the hill]357-the hill and into [the long lane of [Green Gables]107-matthew]525-the long lane of green gables . By the time [they]522-they arrived at [the house]350-the house [Matthew]107-matthew was shrinking from the approaching revelation with an energy [he]107-matthew did not understand . It was not of [Marilla]113-marilla or [himself]107-matthew [he]107-matthew was thinking of the trouble this mistake was probably going to make for [them]522-they , but of [the child]460-the child 's disappointment . When [he]107-matthew thought of that rapt light being quenched in [her]460-the child eyes [he]107-matthew had an uncomfortable feeling that [he]107-matthew was going to assist at murdering something -- much the same feeling that came over [him]107-matthew when [he]107-matthew had to kill a lamb or calf or [any other innocent little creature]528-any other innocent little creature .

[The yard]2099-the yard was quite dark as [they]522-they turned into [it]2099-the yard and the poplar leaves were rustling silkily all round [it]2099-the yard .

" Listen to the trees talking in [their]522-they sleep , "[460-the child] [she]460-the child whispered , as [he]107-matthew lifted [her]460-the child to the ground . " What nice dreams [they]522-they must have ! "[460-the child]

Then , holding tightly to the carpet - bag which contained " all [her]460-the child worldly goods , "[460-the child] [she]460-the child followed [him]107-matthew into [the house]350-the house .

CHAPTER III . [Marilla Cuthbert]113-marilla is [Surprised

|MARILLA]531-surprised |marilla came briskly forward as [Matthew]107-matthew opened the door . But when [her]460-the child eyes fell on [the odd little figure in the stiff , ugly dress]532-the odd little figure in the stiff , ugly dress , with the long braids of red hair and the eager , luminous eyes , [she]460-the child stopped short in amazement .

" [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew , who 's that ? "[460-the child] [she]460-the child ejaculated . " Where is [the boy]2208-the boy ? "[460-the child]

" There was n't [any boy]2209-any boy , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew wretchedly . " There was only _ [her]460-the child _ . "[107-matthew]

[He]107-matthew nodded at [the child]460-the child , remembering that [he]107-matthew had never even asked [her]460-the child name .

" [No boy]2210-no boy ! But there _ must _ have been [a boy]406-a boy , "[113-marilla] insisted [Marilla]113-marilla . " [We]2212-we sent word to [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer to bring [a boy]406-a boy . "[113-marilla]

" Well , [she]460-the child did n't . [She]460-the child brought _ [her]460-the child _ . [I]460-the child asked [the station - master]443-the station - master . And [I]460-the child had to bring [her]460-the child [home]361-home . [She]460-the child could n't be left there , no matter where the mistake had come in . "[460-the child]

" Well , this is a pretty piece of business ! "[113-marilla] ejaculated [Marilla]113-marilla .

During this dialogue [the child]460-the child had remained silent , [her]460-the child eyes roving from one to the other , all the animation fading out of [her]460-the child face . Suddenly [she]460-the child seemed to grasp the full meaning of what had been said . Dropping [her]460-the child precious carpet - bag [she]460-the child sprang forward a step and clasped [her]460-the child hands .

" [You]460-the child do n't want [me]460-the child ! "[460-the child] [she]460-the child cried . " [You]460-the child do n't want [me]460-the child because [I]460-the child 'm not [a boy]406-a boy ! [I]460-the child might have expected it . [Nobody]2118-nobody ever did want [me]460-the child . [I]460-the child might have known it was all too beautiful to last . [I]460-the child might have known [nobody]2118-nobody really did want [me]460-the child . Oh , what shall [I]460-the child do ? [I]460-the child 'm going to burst into tears ! "[460-the child]

Burst into tears [she]460-the child did . Sitting down on a chair by the table , flinging [her]460-the child arms out upon it , and burying [her]460-the child face in them , [she]460-the child proceeded to cry stormily . [Marilla]113-marilla and [Matthew]107-matthew looked at [each other]535-each other deprecatingly across the stove . [Neither of [them]537-them]536-neither of them knew what to say or do . Finally [Marilla]113-marilla stepped lamely into the breach .

" Well , well , there 's no need to cry so about it . "[113-marilla]

" Yes , there _ is _ need ! "[460-the child] [The child]460-the child raised [her]460-the child head quickly , revealing a tear - stained face and trembling lips . " _ [You]460-the child _ would cry , too , if [you]460-the child were [an orphan]2104-an orphan and had come to [a place [you]460-the child thought was going to be [home]361-home]2220-a place you thought was going to be home and found that [they]2222-they did n't want [you]460-the child because [you]460-the child were n't [a boy]406-a boy . Oh , this is the most _ tragical _ thing that ever happened to [me]460-the child ! "[460-the child]

Something like a reluctant smile , rather rusty from long disuse , mellowed [Marilla]113-marilla 's grim expression .

" Well , do n't cry any more . [We]2224-we 're not going to turn [you]460-the child out - of - doors to - night . [You]460-the child 'll have to stay [here]2022-here until [we]2224-we investigate this affair . What 's [your]460-the child name ? "[540-the owner of that name]

[The child]460-the child hesitated for a moment .

" [I]460-the child do n't know what on earth [you]460-the child mean . If [Cordelia]123-cordelia is n't [your]460-the child name , what is ? "[460-the child]

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne , "[540-the owner of that name] reluctantly faltered forth [the owner of that name]540-the owner of that name , " but , oh , please do call [me]540-the owner of that name [Cordelia]123-cordelia . " Oh , [I]124-anne 'm not ashamed of it , "[124-anne] explained [Anne]124-anne , " only [I]124-anne like [Cordelia]123-cordelia better . " What difference does it make how it 's spelled ? "[113-marilla] asked [Marilla]113-marilla with another rusty smile as [she]113-marilla picked up the teapot .

"[113-marilla]

" Oh , yes , there was an abundance of [them]2229-no boys . " [She]541-i -- [she]541-i 's just referring to some conversation [we]2237-we had on [the road]413-the road , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew hastily . " [I]107-matthew 'm going out to put the mare in , [Marilla]113-marilla . Have tea ready when [I]107-matthew come back . "[107-matthew]

" Did [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer bring [anybody]2031-anybody over besides [you]107-matthew ? "[113-marilla] continued [Marilla]113-marilla when [Matthew]107-matthew had gone out .

" [She]114-mrs. spencer brought [Lily Jones]126-lily jones for [herself]114-mrs. spencer . " No . [We]2240-we want [a boy]406-a boy to help [Matthew]107-matthew on [the farm]2242-the farm . [A girl]2066-a girl would be of no use to [us]2240-we . Take off [your]107-matthew hat . [I]124-anne 'll lay it and [your]107-matthew bag on the hall table . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne took off [her]124-anne hat meekly . [Matthew]107-matthew came back presently and [they]542-they sat down to supper . But [Anne]124-anne could not eat . In vain [she]124-anne nibbled at the bread and butter and pecked at the crab - apple preserve out of the little scalloped glass dish by [her]124-anne plate . [She]124-anne did not really make any headway at all .

" [You]124-anne 're not eating anything , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla sharply , eying [her]124-anne as if it were a serious shortcoming . [Anne]124-anne sighed .

" [I]107-matthew ca n't . [I]107-matthew 'm in the depths of despair . Can [you]124-anne eat when [you]124-anne are in the depths of despair ? "[107-matthew]

" [I]113-marilla 've never been in the depths of despair , so [I]113-marilla ca n't say , "[113-marilla] responded [Marilla]113-marilla .

" Were n't [you]124-anne ? Well , did [you]124-anne ever try to _ imagine _ [you]124-anne were in the depths of despair ? "[107-matthew]

" No , [I]107-matthew did n't . "[107-matthew]

" Then [I]107-matthew do n't think [you]124-anne can understand what it 's like . It 's a very uncomfortable feeling indeed . When [you]124-anne try to eat a lump comes right up in [your]124-anne throat and [you]124-anne ca n't swallow anything , not even if it was a chocolate caramel . [I]107-matthew had one chocolate caramel once two years ago and it was simply delicious . [I]107-matthew 've often dreamed since then that [I]107-matthew had a lot of chocolate caramels , but [I]107-matthew always wake up just when [I]107-matthew 'm going to eat them . [I]107-matthew do hope [you]124-anne wo n't be offended because [I]107-matthew ca n't eat . Everything is extremely nice , but still [I]107-matthew can not eat . "[107-matthew]

" [I]107-matthew guess [she]124-anne 's tired , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , who had n't spoken since [his]107-matthew return from [the barn]353-the barn . " Best put [her]124-anne to bed , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[107-matthew]

[Marilla]113-marilla had been wondering where [Anne]124-anne should be put to bed . [She]113-marilla had prepared a couch in [the kitchen chamber]544-the kitchen chamber for [the desired and expected boy]545-the desired and expected boy . But , although [it]546-it was neat and clean , it did not seem quite the thing to put [a girl]2066-a girl [there]348-there somehow . But [the spare room]549-the spare room was out of the question for such a stray waif , so there remained only [the east gable room]550-the east gable room . [Marilla]113-marilla lighted a candle and told [Anne]124-anne to follow [her]113-marilla , which [Anne]124-anne spiritlessly did , taking [her]124-anne hat and carpet - bag from the hall table as [she]124-anne passed . [The hall]551-the hall was fearsomely clean ; [the little gable chamber in which [she]124-anne presently found [herself]124-anne]552-the little gable chamber in which she presently found herself seemed still cleaner .

[Marilla]113-marilla set the candle on a three - legged , three - cornered table and turned down the bedclothes .

" [I]113-marilla suppose [you]124-anne have a nightgown ? "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla questioned .

[Anne]124-anne nodded .

" Yes , [I]124-anne have two . [The matron of the asylum]2244-the matron of the asylum made them for [me]124-anne . [They]2245-they 're fearfully skimpy . There is never enough to go around in [an asylum]2105-an asylum , so things are always skimpy -- at least in [a poor asylum like ours]2247-a poor asylum like ours . [I]124-anne hate skimpy night - dresses . But [one]385-one can dream just as well in them as in lovely trailing ones , with frills around the neck , that 's one consolation . "[124-anne]

" Well , undress as quick as [you]124-anne can and go to bed . [I]553-i 'll come back in a few minutes for the candle . [I]553-i dare n't trust [you]124-anne to put it out [yourself]124-anne . [You]124-anne 'd likely set [the place]2249-the place on fire . "[553-i]

When [Marilla]113-marilla had gone [Anne]124-anne looked around [her]124-anne wistfully . The whitewashed walls were so painfully bare and staring that [she]124-anne thought they must ache over [their]553-i own bareness . The floor was bare , too , except for a round braided mat in the middle such as [Anne]124-anne had never seen before . In one corner was the bed , a high , old - fashioned one , with four dark , low - turned posts . In the other corner was the aforesaid three - corner table adorned with a fat , red velvet pin - cushion hard enough to turn the point of the most adventurous pin . Above it hung a little six - by - eight mirror . Midway between table and bed was the window , with an icy white muslin frill over it , and opposite [it]554-it was the wash - stand . [The whole apartment]555-the whole apartment was of a rigidity not to be described in words , but which sent a shiver to the very marrow of [Anne]124-anne 's bones . With a sob [she]124-anne hastily discarded [her]124-anne garments , put on the skimpy nightgown and sprang into bed where [she]124-anne burrowed face downward into the pillow and pulled the clothes over [her]124-anne head . When [Marilla]113-marilla came up for the light various skimpy articles of raiment scattered most untidily over the floor and a certain tempestuous appearance of [the bed]556-the bed were the only indications of any presence save [her]113-marilla own .

[She]113-marilla deliberately picked up [Anne]124-anne 's clothes , placed them neatly on a prim yellow chair , and then , taking up the candle , went over to the bed .

" Good night , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said , a little awkwardly , but not unkindly .

[Anne]124-anne 's white face and big eyes appeared over the bedclothes with a startling suddenness .

" How can [you]113-marilla call it a _ good _ night when [you]113-marilla know it must be the very worst night [I]113-marilla 've ever had ? "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said reproachfully .

Then [she]113-marilla dived down into invisibility again .

[Marilla]113-marilla went slowly down to [the kitchen]557-the kitchen and proceeded to wash the supper dishes . [Matthew]107-matthew was smoking -- a sure sign of perturbation of mind . [He]107-matthew seldom smoked , for [Marilla]113-marilla set [her]113-marilla face against it as a filthy habit ; but at certain times and seasons [he]107-matthew felt driven to it and [them]558-them [Marilla]113-marilla winked at the practice , realizing that [a mere man]559-a mere man must have some vent for [his]559-a mere man emotions .

" Well , this is a pretty kettle of fish , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said wrathfully . " This is what comes of sending word instead of going [ourselves]2250-ourselves . [[Richard Spencer]115-richard spencer 's folks]2251-richard spencer 's folks have twisted that message somehow . [One of [us]2250-ourselves]2252-one of us will have to drive over and see [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer tomorrow , that 's certain . [This girl]2253-this girl will have to be sent back to [the asylum]2024-the asylum . "[113-marilla]

" Yes , [I]107-matthew suppose so , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew reluctantly .

" [You]107-matthew _ suppose _ so ! Do n't [you]107-matthew know it ? "[113-marilla]

" Well now , [she]2253-this girl 's a real nice little thing , [Marilla]113-marilla . It 's kind of a pity to send [her]2253-this girl back when [she]2253-this girl 's so set on staying [here]2022-here . "[113-marilla]

" [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew , [you]107-matthew do n't mean to say [you]107-matthew think [we]2256-we ought to keep [her]2253-this girl ! "[113-marilla]

[Marilla]113-marilla 's astonishment could not have been greater if [Matthew]107-matthew had expressed a predilection for standing on [his]107-matthew head .

" Well , now , no , [I]107-matthew suppose not -- not exactly , "[107-matthew] stammered [Matthew]107-matthew , uncomfortably driven into a corner for [his]107-matthew precise meaning . " [I]107-matthew suppose -- [we]2256-we could hardly be expected to keep [her]2253-this girl . "[107-matthew]

" [I]113-marilla should say not . What good would [she]2253-this girl be to [us]2256-we ? "[113-marilla]

" [We]2256-we might be some good to [her]2253-this girl , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew suddenly and unexpectedly .

" [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew , [I]113-marilla believe [that child]2257-that child has bewitched [you]107-matthew ! [I]113-marilla can see as plain as plain that [you]107-matthew want to keep [her]2253-this girl . "[113-marilla]

" Well now , [she]2253-this girl 's a real interesting little thing , "[107-matthew] persisted [Matthew]107-matthew . " [You]107-matthew should have heard [her]2253-this girl talk coming from [the station]2043-the station . "[107-matthew]

" Oh , [she]2253-this girl can talk fast enough . [I]113-marilla saw that at once . It 's nothing in [her]2253-this girl favour , either .
