" Well now , it 's just as [you]113-marilla say , of course , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew rising and putting [his]107-matthew pipe away . " [I]107-matthew 'm going to bed . "[107-matthew]

To bed went [Matthew]107-matthew . And to bed , when [she]113-marilla had put [her]113-marilla dishes away , went [Marilla]113-marilla , frowning most resolutely . And up - [stairs]560-stairs , in [the east gable]561-the east gable , [a lonely , heart - hungry , friendless child]562-a lonely , heart - hungry , friendless child cried [herself]562-a lonely , heart - hungry , friendless child to sleep .

CHAPTER IV . Morning at [Green Gables]107-matthew

|IT was broad daylight when [Anne]124-anne awoke and sat up in bed , staring confusedly at the window through which a flood of cheery sunshine was pouring and outside of which something white and feathery waved across glimpses of blue sky .

For a moment [she]124-anne could not remember where [she]124-anne was . First came a delightful thrill , as something very pleasant ; then a horrible remembrance . This was [Green Gables]107-matthew and [they]563-they did n't want [her]124-anne because [she]124-anne was n't [a boy]406-a boy !

But it was morning and , yes , it was a cherry - tree in full bloom outside of [her]124-anne window . With a bound [she]124-anne was out of bed and across the floor . [She]124-anne pushed up the sash -- it went up stiffly and creakily , as if it had n't been opened for a long time , which was the case ; and it stuck so tight that nothing was needed to hold it up .

[Anne]124-anne dropped on [her]124-anne knees and gazed out into the June morning , [her]124-anne eyes glistening with delight . Oh , was n't [it]565-it beautiful ? Was n't [it]565-it [a lovely place]566-a lovely place ? Suppose [she]124-anne was n't really going to stay [here]2022-here ! [She]124-anne would imagine [she]124-anne was . There was scope for imagination [here]2022-here .

A huge cherry - tree grew outside , so close that its boughs tapped against [the house]350-the house , and it was so thick - set with blossoms that hardly a leaf was to be seen . On both sides of [the house]350-the house was [a big orchard , one of apple - trees and one of cherry - trees , also showered over with blossoms]571-a big orchard , one of apple - trees and one of cherry - trees , also showered over with blossoms ; and [their]571-a big orchard , one of apple - trees and one of cherry - trees , also showered over with blossoms grass was all sprinkled with dandelions . In [the garden below]572-the garden below were lilac - trees purple with flowers , and their dizzily sweet fragrance drifted up to the window on the morning wind .

Below [the garden]573-the garden [a green field lush with clover]574-a green field lush with clover sloped down to the hollow where [the brook]394-the brook ran and where scores of white birches grew , upspringing airily out of an undergrowth suggestive of delightful possibilities in ferns and mosses and woodsy things generally . Beyond [it]565-it was [a hill]493-a hill , green and feathery with spruce and fir ; there was a gap in [it]565-it where the gray gable end of [the little house]577-the little house [she]124-anne had seen from [the other side of [the Lake of Shining Waters]23-the lake of shining waters]578-the other side of the lake of shining waters was visible .

Off to the left were [the big barns]579-the big barns and beyond [them]579-the big barns , away down over [green , low - sloping fields]580-green , low - sloping fields , was a sparkling blue glimpse of [sea]581-sea .

[Anne]124-anne 's beauty - loving eyes lingered on it all , taking everything greedily in . [She]124-anne had looked on so many unlovely places in [her]124-anne life , [poor child]582-poor child ; but this was as lovely as anything [she]124-anne had ever dreamed .

[She]124-anne knelt there , lost to everything but the loveliness around [her]124-anne , until [she]124-anne was startled by a hand on [her]124-anne shoulder . [Marilla]113-marilla had come in unheard by [the small dreamer]583-the small dreamer .

" It 's time [you]460-the child were dressed , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said curtly .

[Marilla]113-marilla really did not know how to talk to [the child]460-the child , and [her]113-marilla uncomfortable ignorance made [her]113-marilla crisp and curt when [she]113-marilla did not mean to be .

[Anne]124-anne stood up and drew a long breath .

" Oh , is n't it wonderful ? "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said , waving [her]124-anne hand comprehensively at [the good world outside]585-the good world outside .

" It 's a big tree , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , " and it blooms great , but the fruit do n't amount to much never -- small and wormy . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , [I]124-anne do n't mean just the tree ; of course it 's lovely -- yes , it 's _ radiantly _ lovely -- it blooms as if it meant it -- but [I]124-anne meant everything , [the garden]573-the garden and [the orchard]2264-the orchard and [the brook]394-the brook and [the woods]373-the woods , the whole big dear world . Do n't [you]460-the child feel as if [you]460-the child just loved [the world]409-the world on a morning like this ? And [I]124-anne can hear [the brook]394-the brook laughing all the way up here . Have [you]460-the child ever noticed what cheerful things brooks are ? [They]394-the brook 're always laughing . Even in winter - time [I]124-anne 've heard them under the ice . [I]124-anne 'm so glad there 's [a brook near [Green Gables]107-matthew]2269-a brook near green gables . Perhaps [you]460-the child think it does n't make any difference to [me]124-anne when [you]460-the child 're not going to keep [me]124-anne , but it does . [I]124-anne shall always like to remember that there is a brook at [Green Gables]107-matthew even if [I]124-anne never see it again . If there was n't [a brook]2154-a brook [I]124-anne 'd be _ haunted _ by the uncomfortable feeling that there ought to be one . [I]124-anne 'm not in the depths of despair this morning . [I]124-anne never can be in the morning . Is n't it a splendid thing that there are mornings ? But [I]124-anne feel very sad . [I]124-anne 've just been imagining that it was really [me]124-anne [you]460-the child wanted after all and that [I]124-anne was to stay [here]2022-here for ever and ever . It was a great comfort while it lasted . But the worst of imagining things is that the time comes when [you]460-the child have to stop and that hurts . "[124-anne]

" [You]460-the child 'd better get dressed and come down - [stairs]560-stairs and never mind [your]460-the child imaginings , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla as soon as [she]113-marilla could get a word in edgewise . " Breakfast is waiting . Wash [your]460-the child face and comb [your]460-the child hair . Leave the window up and turn [your]460-the child bedclothes back over the foot of the bed . Be as smart as [you]460-the child can . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne could evidently be smart to some purpose for [she]124-anne was down - stairs in ten minutes ' time , with [her]124-anne clothes neatly on , [her]124-anne hair brushed and braided , [her]124-anne face washed , and a comfortable consciousness pervading [her]124-anne soul that [she]124-anne had fulfilled all [Marilla]113-marilla 's requirements . As a matter of fact , however , [she]124-anne had forgotten to turn back the bedclothes .

" [I]124-anne 'm pretty hungry this morning , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne announced as [she]124-anne slipped into the chair [Marilla]113-marilla placed for [her]124-anne . " [The world]409-the world does n't seem such [a howling wilderness]2274-a howling wilderness as it did last night . [I]124-anne 'm so glad it 's a sunshiny morning . But [I]124-anne like rainy mornings real well , too . All sorts of mornings are interesting , do n't [you]460-the child think ? [You]460-the child do n't know what 's going to happen through the day , and there 's so much scope for imagination . But [I]124-anne 'm glad it 's not rainy today because it 's easier to be cheerful and bear up under affliction on a sunshiny day . [I]124-anne feel that [I]124-anne have a good deal to bear up under . It 's all very well to read about sorrows and imagine [yourself]460-the child living through them heroically , but it 's not so nice when [you]460-the child really come to have them , is it ? "[124-anne]

" For pity 's sake hold [your]460-the child tongue , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " [You]460-the child talk entirely too much for [a little girl]2083-a little girl . "[113-marilla]

Thereupon [Anne]124-anne held [her]124-anne tongue so obediently and thoroughly that [her]124-anne continued silence made [Marilla]113-marilla rather nervous , as if in the presence of something not exactly natural . [Matthew]107-matthew also held [his]107-matthew tongue,--but this was natural,--so that the meal was a very silent one .

As it progressed [Anne]124-anne became more and more abstracted , eating mechanically , with [her]124-anne big eyes fixed unswervingly and unseeingly on the sky outside the window . This made [Marilla]113-marilla more nervous than ever ; [she]113-marilla had an uncomfortable feeling that while [this odd child]586-this odd child 's body might be there at the table [her]124-anne spirit was far away in [some remote airy cloudland]587-some remote airy cloudland , borne aloft on the wings of imagination . Who would want [such a child]588-such a child about [the place]2249-the place ?

Yet [Matthew]107-matthew wished to keep [her]124-anne , of all unaccountable things ! [Marilla]113-marilla felt that [he]107-matthew wanted it just as much this morning as [he]107-matthew had the night before , and that [he]107-matthew would go on wanting it . That was [Matthew]107-matthew 's way -- take a whim into [his]107-matthew head and cling to it with the most amazing silent persistency -- a persistency ten times more potent and effectual in its very silence than if [he]107-matthew had talked it out .

When the meal was ended [Anne]124-anne came out of [her]124-anne reverie and offered to wash the dishes .

" Can [you]124-anne wash dishes right ? "[113-marilla] asked [Marilla]113-marilla distrustfully .

" Pretty well . [I]124-anne 'm better at looking after [children]330-children , though . [I]124-anne 've had so much experience at that . It 's such a pity [you]124-anne have n't any here for [me]124-anne to look after . "[124-anne]

" [I]124-anne do n't feel as if [I]124-anne wanted [any more children]2277-any more children to look after than [I]124-anne 've got at present . _ [You]124-anne 're _ problem enough in all conscience . What 's to be done with [you]124-anne [I]124-anne do n't know . [Matthew]107-matthew is [a most ridiculous man]2278-a most ridiculous man . "[124-anne]

" [I]124-anne think [he]107-matthew 's lovely , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne reproachfully . " [He]107-matthew is so very sympathetic . [He]107-matthew did n't mind how much [I]124-anne talked -- [he]107-matthew seemed to like it . [I]124-anne felt that [he]107-matthew was a kindred spirit as soon as ever [I]124-anne saw [him]107-matthew . "[124-anne]

" [You]124-anne 're both queer enough , if that 's what [you]124-anne mean by [kindred spirits]2279-kindred spirits , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla with a sniff . " Yes , [you]124-anne may wash the dishes . Take plenty of hot water , and be sure [you]124-anne dry them well . [I]113-marilla 've got enough to attend to this morning for [I]113-marilla 'll have to drive over to [White Sands]27-white sands in the afternoon and see [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer . [You]124-anne 'll come with [me]113-marilla and [we]2280-we 'll settle what 's to be done with [you]124-anne . After [you]124-anne 've finished the dishes go up - [stairs]560-stairs and make [your]124-anne bed . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne washed the dishes deftly enough , as [Marilla]113-marilla who kept a sharp eye on the process , discerned . Later on [she]113-marilla made [her]113-marilla bed less successfully , for [she]113-marilla had never learned the art of wrestling with a feather tick . But is was done somehow and smoothed down ; and then [Marilla]113-marilla , to get rid of [her]113-marilla , told [her]113-marilla [she]113-marilla might go out - of - doors and amuse [herself]113-marilla until dinner time .

[Anne]124-anne flew to the door , face alight , eyes glowing . On the very threshold [she]124-anne stopped short , wheeled about , came back and sat down by the table , light and glow as effectually blotted out as if [some one]590-some one had clapped an extinguisher on [her]113-marilla .

" What 's the matter now ? "[113-marilla] demanded [Marilla]113-marilla .

" [I]124-anne do n't dare go out , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , in the tone of [a martyr relinquishing all earthly joys]591-a martyr relinquishing all earthly joys . " If [I]124-anne ca n't stay here there is no use in [[my]124-anne loving [Green Gables]107-matthew]2282-my loving green gables . And if [I]124-anne go out there and get acquainted with all those trees and flowers and [the orchard]2264-the orchard and [the brook]394-the brook [I]124-anne 'll not be able to help loving it . It 's hard enough now , so [I]124-anne wo n't make it any harder . [I]124-anne want to go out so much -- everything seems to be calling to [me]124-anne , ? [Anne]124-anne , [Anne]124-anne , come out to [us]2285-us . [Anne]124-anne , [Anne]124-anne , [we]2285-us want a playmate'--but it 's better not . There is no use in loving things if [you]2286-you have to be torn from them , is there ? And it 's so hard to keep from loving things , is n't it ? That was why [I]124-anne was so glad when [I]124-anne thought [I]124-anne was going to live [here]2022-here . [I]124-anne thought [I]124-anne 'd have so many things to love and nothing to hinder [me]124-anne . But that brief dream is over . [I]124-anne am resigned to [my]124-anne fate now , so [I]124-anne do n't think [I]124-anne 'll go out for fear [I]124-anne 'll get unresigned again . What is the name of that geranium on the window - sill , please ? "[124-anne]

" That 's the apple - scented geranium . "[591-a martyr relinquishing all earthly joys]

" Oh , [I]124-anne do n't mean that sort of a name . [I]124-anne mean just a name [you]124-anne gave it [yourself]124-anne . Did n't [you]124-anne give it a name ? May [I]124-anne give it one then ? May [I]124-anne call it -- let [me]124-anne see -- [Bonny]127-bonny would do -- may [I]124-anne call it [Bonny]127-bonny while [I]124-anne 'm [here]2022-here ? Oh , do let [me]124-anne ! "[124-anne]

" Goodness , [I]591-a martyr relinquishing all earthly joys do n't care . But where [on earth]2289-on earth is the sense of naming [a geranium]2290-a geranium ? "[591-a martyr relinquishing all earthly joys]

" Oh , [I]124-anne like things to have handles even if they are only geraniums . It makes [them]2290-a geranium seem more like [people]2012-people . How do [you]124-anne know but that it hurts [a geranium]2290-a geranium 's feelings just to be called [a geranium]2290-a geranium and nothing else ? [You]124-anne would n't like to be called nothing but [a woman]2294-a woman all the time . Yes , [I]124-anne shall call it [Bonny]127-bonny . [I]124-anne named that cherry - tree outside [[my]124-anne bedroom]2295-my bedroom window this morning . [I]124-anne called it [Snow Queen]128-queen 's because it was so white . Of course , it wo n't always be in blossom , but [one]385-one can imagine that it is , ca n't one ? "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla never in all [my]113-marilla life saw or heard anything to equal [her]113-marilla , "[113-marilla] muttered [Marilla]113-marilla , beating a retreat down to [the cellar]592-the cellar after potatoes . " [She]113-marilla is kind of interesting as [Matthew]107-matthew says . [I]113-marilla can feel already that [I]113-marilla 'm wondering what on earth [she]113-marilla 'll say next . [She]113-marilla 'll be casting a spell over [me]113-marilla , too . [She]113-marilla 's cast it over [Matthew]107-matthew . That look [he]107-matthew gave [me]113-marilla when [he]107-matthew went out said everything [he]107-matthew said or hinted last night over again . [I]113-marilla wish [he]107-matthew was like [other men]2297-other men and would talk things out . [A body]2013-a body could answer back then and argue [him]107-matthew into reason . But what 's to be done with a man who just _ looks ? _ "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne had relapsed into reverie , with [her]124-anne chin in [her]124-anne hands and [her]124-anne eyes on the sky , when [Marilla]113-marilla returned from [[her]113-marilla cellar]593-her cellar pilgrimage . There [Marilla]113-marilla left [her]124-anne until the early dinner was on the table .

" [I]113-marilla suppose [I]113-marilla can have the mare and buggy this afternoon , [Matthew]107-matthew ? "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla .

[Matthew]107-matthew nodded and looked wistfully at [Anne]124-anne . [Marilla]113-marilla intercepted the look and said grimly :

" [I]113-marilla 'm going to drive over to [White Sands]27-white sands and settle this thing . [I]113-marilla 'll take [Anne]124-anne with [me]113-marilla and [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer will probably make arrangements to send [her]124-anne back to [Nova Scotia]7-nova scotia at once . [I]113-marilla 'll set [your]107-matthew tea out for [you]107-matthew and [I]113-marilla 'll be [home]361-home in time to milk the cows . "[113-marilla]

Still [Matthew]107-matthew said nothing and [Marilla]113-marilla had a sense of having wasted words and breath . There is nothing more aggravating than a man who wo n't talk back -- unless it is a woman who wo n't .

[Matthew]107-matthew hitched the sorrel into the buggy in due time and [Marilla]113-marilla and [Anne]124-anne set off . [Matthew]107-matthew opened the yard gate for [them]594-them and as [they]594-them drove slowly through , [he]107-matthew said , to [nobody in particular]595-nobody in particular as it seemed :

" [Little Jerry Buote]125-jerry from [the Creek]29-the creek was [here]2022-here this morning , and [I]107-matthew told [him]125-jerry [I]107-matthew guessed [I]107-matthew 'd hire [him]125-jerry for the summer . "[107-matthew]

[Marilla]113-marilla made no reply , but [she]113-marilla hit the unlucky sorrel such a vicious clip with the whip that the fat mare , unused to such treatment , whizzed indignantly down [the lane]380-the lane at an alarming pace . [Marilla]113-marilla looked back once as [the buggy]358-the buggy bounced along and saw that aggravating [Matthew]107-matthew leaning over the gate , looking wistfully after [them]594-them .

CHAPTER V. [Anne]124-anne 's History

" DO [you]2301-you know , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne confidentially , " [I]124-anne 've made up [my]124-anne mind to enjoy [this drive]2172-this drive . It 's been [my]124-anne experience that [you]2301-you can nearly always enjoy things if [you]2301-you make up [your]2301-you mind firmly that [you]2301-you will . Of course , [you]2301-you must make it up _ firmly _ . [I]124-anne am not going to think about going back to [the asylum]2024-the asylum while [we]594-them 're having [our]594-them drive . [I]124-anne 'm just going to think about [the drive]2304-the drive . Oh , look , there 's one little early wild rose out ! Is n't it lovely ? Do n't [you]2301-you think it must be glad to be a rose ? Would n't it be nice if roses could talk ? [I]124-anne 'm sure [they]2305-they could tell [us]594-them such lovely things . And is n't pink the most bewitching color in [the world]409-the world ? [I]124-anne love it , but [I]124-anne ca n't wear it . [Redheaded people]2307-redheaded people ca n't wear pink , not even in imagination . Did [you]2301-you ever know of anybody whose hair was red when [she]2307-redheaded people was young , but got to be another color when [she]2307-redheaded people grew up ? "[124-anne]

" No , [I]113-marilla do n't know as [I]113-marilla ever did , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla mercilessly , " and [I]113-marilla should n't think it likely to happen in [your]2301-you case either . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne sighed .

" Well , that is another hope gone . ? [My]124-anne life is a perfect graveyard of buried hopes . ' That 's a sentence [I]124-anne read in a book once , and [I]124-anne say it over to comfort [myself]124-anne whenever [I]124-anne 'm disappointed in anything . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla do n't see where the comforting comes in [myself]113-marilla , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla .

" Why , because it sounds so nice and romantic , just as if [I]124-anne were [a heroine in a book]2308-a heroine in a book , [you]2301-you know . [I]124-anne am so fond of romantic things , and [a graveyard full of buried hopes]2309-a graveyard full of buried hopes is about as romantic a thing as one can imagine is n't it ? [I]124-anne 'm rather glad [I]124-anne have one . Are [we]2310-we going across [the Lake of [Shining Waters]25-shining waters]2236-the lake of shining waters today ? "[124-anne]

" [We]2310-we 're not going over [[Barry]118-mrs. barry 's pond]2176-barry 's pond , if that 's what [you]2301-you mean by [[your]2301-you Lake of [Shining Waters]25-shining waters]2313-your lake of shining waters . [We]2310-we 're going by [the shore road]2314-the shore road . "[124-anne]

" [Shore road]2315-shore road sounds nice , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne dreamily . " Is it as nice as it sounds ? Just when [you]2301-you said ? shore road ' [I]124-anne saw it in a picture in [my]124-anne mind , as quick as that ! And [White Sands]27-white sands is a pretty name , too ; but [I]124-anne do n't like it as well as [Avonlea]2-avonlea . [Avonlea]2-avonlea is a lovely name . It just sounds like music . How far is it to [White Sands]27-white sands ? "[124-anne]

" It 's five miles ; and as [you]2301-you 're evidently bent on talking [you]2301-you might as well talk to some purpose by telling [me]124-anne what [you]2301-you know about [yourself]2301-you . "[124-anne]

" Oh , what [I]124-anne _ know _ about [myself]124-anne is n't really worth telling , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne eagerly . " If [you]2301-you 'll only let [me]124-anne tell [you]2301-you what [I]124-anne _ imagine _ about [myself]124-anne [you]2301-you 'll think it ever so much more interesting . "[124-anne]

" No , [I]124-anne do n't want any of [your]2301-you imaginings . Just [you]2301-you stick to bald facts . Begin at the beginning . Where were [you]2301-you born and how old are [you]2301-you ? "[124-anne]

" [I]124-anne was eleven last March , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , resigning [herself]124-anne to bald facts with a little sigh . " And [I]124-anne was born in [Bolingbroke]31-bolingbroke , [Nova Scotia]7-nova scotia . [[My]124-anne father]2316-my father 's name was [Walter Shirley]129-walter shirley , and [he]2316-my father was [a teacher in [the Bolingbroke High School]32-the bolingbroke high school]2317-a teacher in the bolingbroke high school . [[My]124-anne mother]2318-my mother 's name was [Bertha Shirley]130-bertha shirley . Are n't [Walter]129-walter shirley and [Bertha]130-bertha shirley lovely names ? [I]124-anne 'm so glad [[my]124-anne parents]2319-my parents had nice names . It would be a real disgrace to have [a father]2320-a father named -- well , say [Jedediah]131-jedediah , would n't it ? "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla guess it does n't matter what [a person]2165-a person 's name is as long as [he]2165-a person behaves [himself]2165-a person , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , feeling [herself]113-marilla called upon to inculcate a good and useful moral .

" Well , [I]124-anne do n't know . "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne looked thoughtful . " [I]124-anne read in a book once that a rose by any other name would smell as sweet , but [I]124-anne 've never been able to believe it . [I]124-anne do n't believe a rose _ would _ be as nice if it was called a thistle or a skunk cabbage . [I]124-anne suppose [[my]124-anne father]2316-my father could have been [a good man]2323-a good man even if [he]2316-my father had been called [Jedediah]131-jedediah ; but [I]124-anne 'm sure it would have been a cross . Well , [[my]124-anne mother]2318-my mother was [a teacher in [the High school]2326-the high school]2325-a teacher in the high school , too , but when [she]2318-my mother married [father]2327-father [she]2318-my mother gave up teaching , of course . [A husband]2328-a husband was enough responsibility . [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas said that [they]2329-they were [a pair of babies]2330-a pair of babies and as poor as church mice . [They]2329-they went to live in [a weeny - teeny little yellow house in [Bolingbroke]31-bolingbroke]2331-a weeny - teeny little yellow house in bolingbroke . [I]124-anne 've never seen [that house]2180-that house , but [I]124-anne 've imagined [it]2180-that house thousands of times . [I]124-anne think [it]2180-that house must have had honeysuckle over the parlor window and lilacs in [the front yard]2333-the front yard and lilies of [the valley]2334-the valley just inside the gate . Yes , and muslin curtains in all the windows . Muslin curtains give [a house]2335-a house such an air . [I]124-anne was born in [that house]2180-that house . [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas said [I]124-anne was [the homeliest baby [she]132-mrs. thomas ever saw]2337-the homeliest baby she ever saw , [I]124-anne was so scrawny and tiny and nothing but eyes , but [that mother]2338-that mother thought [I]124-anne was perfectly beautiful . [I]124-anne should think [a mother]2339-a mother would be a better judge than [a poor woman who came in to scrub]2340-a poor woman who came in to scrub , would n't [you]2341-you ? [I]124-anne 'm glad [she]132-mrs. thomas was satisfied with [me]124-anne anyhow , [I]124-anne would feel so sad if [I]124-anne thought [I]124-anne was a disappointment to [her]132-mrs. thomas -- because [she]132-mrs. thomas did n't live very long after that , [you]2341-you see . [She]132-mrs. thomas died of fever when [I]124-anne was just three months old . [I]124-anne do wish [she]132-mrs. thomas 'd lived long enough for [me]124-anne to remember calling [[her]132-mrs. thomas mother]2342-her mother . [I]124-anne think it would be so sweet to say ? [mother]2343-mother , ' do n't [you]2343-mother ? And [father]2327-father died four days afterwards from fever too . That left [me]124-anne [an orphan]2104-an orphan and [folks]2346-folks were at [their]2346-folks wits ' end , so [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas said , what to do with [me]124-anne . [You]2341-you see , [nobody]2118-nobody wanted [me]124-anne even then . It seems to be [my]124-anne fate . [Father]133-father and [mother]2343-mother had both come from places far away and it was well known [they]2349-they had n't [any relatives]2350-any relatives living . Finally [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas said [she]132-mrs. thomas 'd take [me]124-anne , though [she]132-mrs. thomas was poor and had [a drunken husband]2351-a drunken husband . [She]132-mrs. thomas brought [me]124-anne up by hand . Do [you]2341-you know if there is anything in being brought up by hand that ought to make [people who are brought up]2352-people who are brought up that way better than [other people]2168-other people ? Because whenever [I]124-anne was naughty [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas would ask [me]124-anne how [I]124-anne could be such [a bad girl]2354-a bad girl when [she]132-mrs. thomas had brought [me]124-anne up by hand -- reproachful - like .[124-anne]

" [Mr.]2355-mr. and [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas moved away from [Bolingbroke]31-bolingbroke to [Marysville]33-marysville , and [I]124-anne lived with [them]2356-them until [I]124-anne was eight years old . [I]124-anne helped look after [[the Thomas]132-mrs. thomas children]2357-the thomas children -- there were [four of [them]2357-the thomas children younger than [me]124-anne]2358-four of them younger than me -- and [I]124-anne can tell [you]2359-you [they]2357-the thomas children took a lot of looking after . Then [Mr. Thomas]134-mr. thomas was killed falling under [a train]2360-a train and [[his]134-mr. thomas mother]2361-his mother offered to take [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas and [the children]2362-the children , but [she]2361-his mother did n't want [me]124-anne . [It]2366-a little clearing among the stumps was [a very lonesome place]2367-a very lonesome place . [I]124-anne 'm sure [I]124-anne could never have lived [there]348-there if [I]124-anne had n't had an imagination . [Mr. Hammond]136-mr. hammond worked [a little sawmill up there]2369-a little sawmill up there , and [Mrs. Hammond]135-mrs. hammond had [eight children]2370-eight children . [She]135-mrs. hammond had [twins]2371-twins three times . [I]124-anne like [babies]2372-babies in moderation , but twins three times in succession is _ too much _ . [I]124-anne told [Mrs. Hammond]135-mrs. hammond so firmly , when [the last pair]2373-the last pair came . " [I]124-anne lived up river with [Mrs. Hammond]135-mrs. hammond over two years , and then [Mr. Hammond]136-mr. hammond died and [Mrs. Hammond]135-mrs. hammond broke up [housekeeping]2374-housekeeping . [Anne]124-anne finished up with another sigh , of relief this time . Evidently [she]124-anne did not like talking about [her]124-anne experiences in [a world that had not wanted [her]124-anne]598-a world that had not wanted her .

" Did [you]124-anne ever go to [school]2382-school ? "[113-marilla] demanded [Marilla]113-marilla , turning the sorrel mare down [the shore road]2314-the shore road .

" Not a great deal . [I]113-marilla went a little the last year [I]113-marilla stayed with [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas . When [I]113-marilla went up [river]2383-river [we]2384-we were so far from [a school]2385-a school that [I]113-marilla could n't walk [it]2383-river in winter and there was a vacation in summer , so [I]113-marilla could only go in the spring and fall . But of course [I]113-marilla went while [I]113-marilla was at [the asylum]2024-the asylum . [I]113-marilla can read pretty well and [I]113-marilla know ever so many pieces of poetry off by [heart--?The Battle of Hohenlinden]137-heart--?the battle of hohenlinden ' and ? "[113-marilla]

" Were [those women]2389-those women -- [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas and [Mrs. Hammond]135-mrs. hammond -- good to [you]124-anne ? "[113-marilla] asked [Marilla]113-marilla , looking at [Anne]124-anne out of the corner of [her]113-marilla eye .

" O - o - o - h , "[124-anne] faltered [Anne]124-anne . [Her]124-anne sensitive little face suddenly flushed scarlet and embarrassment sat on [her]124-anne brow . " Oh , [they]2389-those women _ meant _ to be -- [I]124-anne know [they]2389-those women meant to be just as good and kind as possible . [They]2012-people had a good deal to worry [them]2012-people , [you]2391-you know . But [I]124-anne feel sure [they]2012-people meant to be good to [me]124-anne . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla asked no more questions . [Anne]124-anne gave [herself]124-anne up to a silent rapture over [the shore road]2314-the shore road and [Marilla]113-marilla guided the sorrel abstractedly while [she]113-marilla pondered deeply . Pity was suddenly stirring in [her]113-marilla heart for [the child]460-the child . What a starved , unloved life [she]113-marilla had had -- a life of drudgery and poverty and neglect ; for [Marilla]113-marilla was shrewd enough to read between the lines of [Anne]124-anne 's history and divine the truth . No wonder [she]113-marilla had been so delighted at the prospect of [a real home]2175-a real home . It was a pity [she]113-marilla had to be sent back . What if [she]113-marilla , [Marilla]113-marilla , should indulge [Matthew]107-matthew 's unaccountable whim and let [her]113-marilla stay ? [He]107-matthew was set on it ; and [the child]460-the child seemed a nice , teachable little thing .

" [She]460-the child 's got too much to say , "[113-marilla] thought [Marilla]113-marilla , " but [she]460-the child might be trained out of that . And there 's nothing rude or slangy in what [she]460-the child does say . [She]460-the child 's ladylike . It 's likely [[her]460-the child people]2394-her people were [nice folks]2395-nice folks . "[113-marilla]

[The shore road]2314-the shore road was " woodsy and wild and lonesome . "[460-the child] On the right hand , scrub firs , [their]605-their spirits quite unbroken by long years of tussle with the gulf winds , grew thickly . On the left were the steep red sandstone cliffs , so near the track in places that [a mare of less steadiness than the sorrel]606-a mare of less steadiness than the sorrel might have tried the nerves of [the people behind [her]113-marilla]607-the people behind her . Down at the base of [the cliffs]608-the cliffs were heaps of surf - worn rocks or little sandy coves inlaid with pebbles as with ocean jewels ; beyond lay [the sea]609-the sea , shimmering and blue , and over it soared the gulls , their pinions flashing silvery in the sunlight .

" Is n't [the sea]609-the sea wonderful ? "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , rousing from a long , wide - eyed silence . " Once , when [I]124-anne lived in [Marysville]33-marysville , [Mr. Thomas]134-mr. thomas hired [an express wagon]2397-an express wagon and took [us]2398-us all to spend the day at [the shore ten miles away]2399-the shore ten miles away . [I]124-anne enjoyed every moment of that day , even if [I]124-anne had to look after [the children]2362-the children all the time . [I]124-anne lived it over in happy dreams for years . But [this shore]2401-this shore is nicer than [the Marysville shore]2402-the marysville shore . Are n't those gulls splendid ? Would [you]2403-you like to be [a gull]2404-a gull ? [I]124-anne think [I]124-anne would -- that is , if [I]124-anne could n't be [a human girl]2405-a human girl . Do n't [you]2403-you think it would be nice to wake up at sunrise and swoop down over [the water]499-the water and away out over that lovely blue all day ; and then at night to fly back to one 's nest ? Oh , [I]124-anne can just imagine [myself]124-anne doing it . [What big house is that just ahead , please]2407-what big house is that just ahead , please ? "[124-anne]

" That 's [the White Sands Hotel]2408-the white sands hotel . [Mr. Kirke]139-mr. kirke runs [it]2408-the white sands hotel , but the season has n't begun yet . " [I]124-anne was afraid it might be [[Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer 's place]2412-mrs. spencer 's place , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne mournfully . " [I]124-anne do n't want to get [there]348-there . Somehow , it will seem like the end of everything . "[124-anne]

CHAPTER VI . [Marilla]113-marilla Makes Up [Her]113-marilla Mind

|GET [there]348-there [they]611-they did , however , in due season . [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer lived in [a big yellow house at [White Sands Cove]39-white sands cove]612-a big yellow house at white sands cove , and [she]114-mrs. spencer came to the door with surprise and welcome mingled on [her]114-mrs. spencer benevolent face .

" [I]124-anne 'm as well as can be expected , thank [you]2414-dear , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne smilelessly . A blight seemed to have descended on [her]124-anne .

" [I]113-marilla suppose [we]2417-we 'll stay a little while to rest the mare , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , " but [I]113-marilla promised [Matthew]107-matthew [I]113-marilla 'd be [home]361-home early . [Marilla]113-marilla did not look as if [she]113-marilla thought [Providence]143-providence had much to do with the matter . [Here]2022-here was an unexpectedly good chance to get [this unwelcome orphan]615-this unwelcome orphan off [her]113-marilla hands , and [she]113-marilla did not even feel grateful for it .

[She]113-marilla knew [Mrs. Peter Blewett]142-mrs. blewett only by sight as [a small , shrewish - faced woman without an ounce of superfluous flesh on [her]142-mrs. blewett bones]616-a small , shrewish - faced woman without an ounce of superfluous flesh on her bones . " [A terrible worker]2433-a terrible worker and [driver]2434-driver , "[142-mrs. blewett] [Mrs. Peter]142-mrs. blewett was said to be ; and [discharged servant girls]617-discharged servant girls told fearsome tales of [her]142-mrs. blewett temper and stinginess , and [[her]142-mrs. blewett family of [pert , quarrelsome children]619-pert , quarrelsome children]618-her family of pert , quarrelsome children . [Marilla]113-marilla felt a qualm of conscience at the thought of handing [Anne]124-anne over to [her]113-marilla tender mercies .

" Well , [I]113-marilla 'll go in and [we]2435-we 'll talk the matter over , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said .

" And if there is n't [Mrs. Peter]142-mrs. blewett coming up [the lane]380-the lane this blessed minute ! "[114-mrs. spencer] exclaimed [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer , bustling [[her]114-mrs. spencer guests]620-her guests through [the hall]551-the hall into [the parlor]622-the parlor , where a deadly chill struck on [them]620-her guests as if the air had been strained so long through dark green , closely drawn blinds that it had lost every particle of warmth it had ever possessed . " That is real lucky , for [we]2435-we can settle the matter right away . Take the armchair , [Miss Cuthbert]113-marilla . [Anne]124-anne , [you]124-anne sit here on the ottoman and do n't wiggle . [I]114-mrs. spencer forgot to tell [Flora Jane]141-flora jane to take the buns out of the oven . "[114-mrs. spencer]

[Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer whisked away , after pulling up the blinds . [Anne]124-anne sitting mutely on the ottoman , with [her]124-anne hands clasped tightly in [her]124-anne lap , stared at [Mrs Blewett]142-mrs. blewett as one fascinated . Was [she]124-anne to be given into the keeping of [this sharp - faced , sharp - eyed woman]623-this sharp - faced , sharp - eyed woman ? [She]124-anne felt a lump coming up in [her]124-anne throat and [her]124-anne eyes smarted painfully . [She]124-anne was beginning to be afraid [she]124-anne could n't keep the tears back when [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer returned , flushed and beaming , quite capable of taking any and every difficulty , physical , mental or spiritual , into consideration and settling it out of hand .

" It seems there 's been a mistake about [this little girl]2438-this little girl , [Mrs. Blewett]142-mrs. blewett , "[114-mrs. spencer] [she]114-mrs. spencer said . " [I]114-mrs. spencer was under the impression that [Mr.]2439-mr. and [Miss Cuthbert]113-marilla wanted [a little girl]2083-a little girl to adopt . [I]114-mrs. spencer was certainly told so . But it seems it was [a boy]406-a boy [they]2442-they wanted . "[114-mrs. spencer]

[Mrs. Blewett]142-mrs. blewett darted [her]142-mrs. blewett eyes over [Anne]124-anne from head to foot .

" How old are [you]124-anne and what 's [your]124-anne name ? "[142-mrs. blewett] [she]142-mrs. blewett demanded .

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne , "[624-the shrinking child] faltered [the shrinking child]624-the shrinking child , not daring to make any stipulations regarding the spelling thereof , " and [I]624-the shrinking child 'm eleven years old . "[624-the shrinking child]

" [Humph]144-humph ! [You]124-anne do n't look as if there was much to [you]124-anne . But [you]124-anne 're wiry . [I]460-the child do n't know but the wiry ones are the best after all . [The baby]2444-the baby 's awful fractious , and [I]460-the child 'm clean worn out attending to [him]2444-the baby . If [you]124-anne like [I]460-the child can take [her]624-the shrinking child right [home]361-home now . "[460-the child]

[Marilla]113-marilla looked at [Anne]124-anne and softened at sight of [the child]460-the child 's pale face with its look of mute misery -- the misery of [a helpless little creature who finds itself once more caught in the trap from which it had escaped]626-a helpless little creature who finds itself once more caught in the trap from which it had escaped . [Marilla]113-marilla felt an uncomfortable conviction that , if [she]113-marilla denied the appeal of that look , it would haunt [her]113-marilla to [her]113-marilla dying day . More - over , [she]113-marilla did not fancy [Mrs. Blewett]142-mrs. blewett . To hand [a sensitive , " highstrung "[627-a sensitive , " highstrung " child] child]627-a sensitive , " highstrung " child over to [such a woman]628-such a woman ! No , [she]113-marilla could not take the responsibility of doing that !

" Well , [I]113-marilla do n't know , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said slowly . " [I]113-marilla did n't say that [Matthew]107-matthew and [I]113-marilla had absolutely decided that [we]2446-we would n't keep [her]460-the child . "[113-marilla]

" [I]142-mrs. blewett suppose it 'll have to , "[142-mrs. blewett] said [Mrs. Blewett]142-mrs. blewett ungraciously .

During [Marilla]113-marilla 's speech a sunrise had been dawning on [Anne]124-anne 's face . First the look of despair faded out ; then came a faint flush of hope ; [her]124-anne eyes grew deep and bright as morning stars . [The child]460-the child was quite transfigured ; and , a moment later , when [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer and [Mrs. Blewett]142-mrs. blewett went out in quest of a recipe [the latter]414-the latter had come to borrow [she]124-anne sprang up and flew across [the room]631-the room to [Marilla]113-marilla .

" Oh , [Miss Cuthbert]113-marilla , did [you]113-marilla really say that perhaps [you]113-marilla would let [me]124-anne stay at [Green Gables]107-matthew ? "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said , in a breathless whisper , as if speaking aloud might shatter the glorious possibility . " Did [you]113-marilla really say it ? Or did [I]124-anne only imagine that [you]113-marilla did ? "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla think [you]124-anne 'd better learn to control that imagination of [yours]124-anne , [Anne]124-anne , if [you]124-anne ca n't distinguish between what is real and what is n't , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla crossly . " Yes , [you]124-anne did hear [me]113-marilla say just that and no more . It is n't decided yet and perhaps [we]2448-we will conclude to let [Mrs. Blewett]142-mrs. blewett take [you]124-anne after all . [She]142-mrs. blewett certainly needs [you]124-anne much more than [I]113-marilla do . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne 'd rather go back to [the asylum]2024-the asylum than go to live with [her]142-mrs. blewett , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne passionately . " [She]142-mrs. blewett looks exactly like a -- like a gimlet . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla smothered a smile under the conviction that [Anne]124-anne must be reproved for such a speech .

" [A little girl like [you]124-anne]2450-a little girl like you should be ashamed of talking so about [a lady]2451-a lady and [a stranger]2452-a stranger , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said severely . " Go back and sit down quietly and hold [your]124-anne tongue and behave as [a good girl]2443-a good girl should . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne 'll try to do and be anything [you]124-anne want [me]124-anne , if [you]124-anne 'll only keep [me]124-anne , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , returning meekly to [her]124-anne ottoman .

When [they]632-they arrived back at [Green Gables]107-matthew that evening [Matthew]107-matthew met [them]632-they in [the lane]380-the lane . [Marilla]113-marilla from afar had noted [him]107-matthew prowling along [it]380-the lane and guessed [his]107-matthew motive . [She]113-marilla was prepared for the relief [she]113-marilla read in [his]107-matthew face when [he]107-matthew saw that [she]113-marilla had at least brought back [Anne]124-anne back with [her]113-marilla . But [she]113-marilla said nothing , to [him]107-matthew , relative to the affair , until [they]632-they were both out in [the yard behind [the barn]353-the barn]634-the yard behind the barn milking the cows . Then [she]113-marilla briefly told [him]107-matthew [Anne]124-anne 's history and the result of the interview with [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer .

" [I]107-matthew would n't give a dog [I]107-matthew liked to [that Blewett woman]2454-that blewett woman , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew with unusual vim .

" [I]113-marilla do n't fancy [her]2454-that blewett woman style [myself]113-marilla , "[113-marilla] admitted [Marilla]113-marilla , " but it 's that or keeping [her]2454-that blewett woman [ourselves]632-they , [Matthew]107-matthew . And since [you]107-matthew seem to want [her]2454-that blewett woman , [I]113-marilla suppose [I]113-marilla 'm willing -- or have to be . [I]113-marilla 've been thinking over the idea until [I]113-marilla 've got kind of used to it . It seems a sort of duty . [I]113-marilla 've never brought up [a child]2075-a child , especially [a girl]2066-a girl , and [I]113-marilla dare say [I]113-marilla 'll make a terrible mess of it . But [I]113-marilla 'll do [my]113-marilla best . So far as [I]113-marilla 'm concerned , [Matthew]107-matthew , [she]2454-that blewett woman may stay . "[113-marilla]

[Matthew]107-matthew 's shy face was a glow of delight .

" Well now , [I]107-matthew reckoned [you]113-marilla 'd come to see it in that light , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[107-matthew] [he]107-matthew said . " [She]2454-that blewett woman 's such an interesting little thing . "[107-matthew]

" It 'd be more to the point if [you]107-matthew could say [she]2454-that blewett woman was a useful little thing , "[113-marilla] retorted [Marilla]113-marilla , " but [I]113-marilla 'll make it [my]113-marilla business to see [she]2454-that blewett woman 's trained to be that . And mind , [Matthew]107-matthew , [you]107-matthew 're not to go interfering with [my]113-marilla methods . Perhaps [an old maid]2457-an old maid does n't know much about bringing up [a child]2075-a child , but [I]113-marilla guess [she]2454-that blewett woman knows more than [an old bachelor]2459-an old bachelor . So [you]107-matthew just leave [me]113-marilla to manage [her]2454-that blewett woman . When [I]113-marilla fail it 'll be time enough to put [your]107-matthew oar in . "[113-marilla]

" There , there , [Marilla]113-marilla , [you]113-marilla can have [your]113-marilla own way , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew reassuringly . " Only be as good and kind to [her]2454-that blewett woman as [you]113-marilla can without spoiling [her]2454-that blewett woman . [I]107-matthew kind of think [she]2454-that blewett woman 's one of the sort [you]113-marilla can do anything with if [you]113-marilla only get [her]2454-that blewett woman to love [you]113-marilla . "[107-matthew]

[Marilla]113-marilla sniffed , to express [her]113-marilla contempt for [Matthew]107-matthew 's opinions concerning anything feminine , and walked off to [the dairy]636-the dairy with the pails .

" [I]113-marilla wo n't tell [her]2454-that blewett woman tonight that [she]2454-that blewett woman can stay , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla reflected , as [she]113-marilla strained the milk into the creamers . " [She]2454-that blewett woman 'd be so excited that [she]2454-that blewett woman would n't sleep a wink . [Marilla Cuthbert]113-marilla , [you]113-marilla 're fairly in for it . Did [you]113-marilla ever suppose [you]113-marilla 'd see the day when [you]113-marilla 'd be adopting [an orphan girl]447-an orphan girl ? It 's surprising enough ; but not so surprising as that [Matthew]107-matthew should be at the bottom of it , [him]107-matthew that always seemed to have such a mortal dread of [little girls]472-little girls . Anyhow , [we]2462-we 've decided on the experiment and goodness only knows what will come of it . "[113-marilla]

CHAPTER VII . [Anne]124-anne Says [Her]124-anne Prayers

|WHEN [Marilla]113-marilla took [Anne]124-anne up to bed that night [she]113-marilla said stiffly :

" Now , [Anne]124-anne , [I]113-marilla noticed last night that [you]124-anne threw [your]124-anne clothes all about the floor when [you]124-anne took them off . That is a very untidy habit , and [I]113-marilla ca n't allow it at all . As soon as [you]124-anne take off any article of clothing fold it neatly and place it on the chair . [I]113-marilla have n't any use at all for [little girls who are n't neat]2463-little girls who are n't neat . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne was so harrowed up in [my]124-anne mind last night that [I]124-anne did n't think about [my]124-anne clothes at all , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne . " [I]124-anne 'll fold them nicely tonight . [They]2464-they always made [us]2465-us do that at [the asylum]2024-the asylum . Half the time , though , [I]124-anne 'd forget , [I]124-anne 'd be in such a hurry to get into bed nice and quiet and imagine things . "[124-anne]

" [You]124-anne 'll have to remember a little better if [you]124-anne stay [here]2022-here , "[113-marilla] admonished [Marilla]113-marilla . " There , that looks something like . Say [your]124-anne prayers now and get into bed . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne never say any prayers , "[124-anne] announced [Anne]124-anne .

[Marilla]113-marilla looked horrified astonishment .

" Why , [Anne]124-anne , what do [you]124-anne mean ? Were [you]124-anne never taught to say [your]124-anne prayers ? [God]145-god always wants [little girls]472-little girls to say [their]472-little girls prayers . Do n't [you]124-anne know who [God]145-god is , [Anne]124-anne ? "[113-marilla]

" ? [God]145-god is a spirit , infinite , eternal and unchangeable , in [His]145-god being , wisdom , power , holiness , justice , goodness , and truth , ' "[124-anne] responded [Anne]124-anne promptly and glibly .

[Marilla]113-marilla looked rather relieved .

" So [you]124-anne do know something then , thank goodness ! [You]124-anne 're not quite [a heathen]2469-a heathen . Where did [you]124-anne learn that ? "[113-marilla]

" Oh , at [the asylum Sunday - school]2470-the asylum sunday - school . [They]2470-the asylum sunday - school made [us]2471-we learn the whole catechism . [I]113-marilla liked it pretty well . There 's something splendid about some of the words . ? Infinite , eternal and unchangeable . ' Is n't that grand ? It has such a roll to it -- just like a big organ playing . [You]124-anne could n't quite call it poetry , [I]113-marilla suppose , but it sounds a lot like it , does n't it ? "[113-marilla]

" [We]2471-we 're not talking about poetry , [Anne]124-anne -- [we]2471-we are talking about saying [your]124-anne prayers . Do n't [you]124-anne know it 's a terrible wicked thing not to say [your]124-anne prayers every night ? [I]113-marilla 'm afraid [you]124-anne are [a very bad little girl]2472-a very bad little girl . "[113-marilla]

" [You]124-anne 'd find it easier to be bad than good if [you]124-anne had red hair , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne reproachfully . " [People who have n't red hair]2473-people who have n't red hair do n't know what trouble is . [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas told [me]124-anne that [God]145-god made [my]124-anne hair red _ on purpose _ , and [I]124-anne 've never cared about [Him]145-god since . And anyhow [I]124-anne 'd always be too tired at night to bother saying prayers . [People who have to look after [twins]2371-twins]2474-people who have to look after twins ca n't be expected to say [their]2474-people who have to look after twins prayers . Now , do [you]124-anne honestly think [they]2474-people who have to look after twins can ? "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla decided that [Anne]124-anne 's religious training must be begun at once . Plainly there was no time to be lost .

" [You]124-anne must say [your]124-anne prayers while [you]124-anne are under [my]113-marilla roof , [Anne]124-anne . "[113-marilla]

" Why , of course , if [you]113-marilla want [me]124-anne to , "[124-anne] assented [Anne]124-anne cheerfully . " [I]124-anne 'd do anything to oblige [you]113-marilla . But [you]113-marilla 'll have to tell [me]124-anne what to say for this once . After [I]124-anne get into bed [I]124-anne 'll imagine out a real nice prayer to say always . [I]124-anne believe that it will be quite interesting , now that [I]124-anne come to think of it . "[124-anne]

" [You]124-anne must kneel down , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla in embarrassment .

[Anne]124-anne knelt at [Marilla]113-marilla 's knee and looked up gravely .

" Why must [people]2012-people kneel down to pray ? If [I]124-anne really wanted to pray [I]124-anne 'll tell [you]113-marilla what [I]124-anne 'd do . [I]124-anne 'd go out into [a great big field]2477-a great big field all alone or into [the deep , deep , woods]2478-the deep , deep , woods , and [I]124-anne 'd look up into the sky -- up -- up -- up -- into that lovely blue sky that looks as if there was no end to [its]2479-its blueness . And then [I]124-anne 'd just _ feel _ a prayer . Well , [I]124-anne 'm ready . What am [I]124-anne to say ? "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla felt more embarrassed than ever . [She]113-marilla had intended to teach [Anne]124-anne the childish classic , " Now [I]113-marilla lay [me]113-marilla down to sleep . "[113-marilla] But [she]113-marilla had , as [I]0-i have told [you]637-you , the glimmerings of a sense of humor -- which is simply another name for a sense of fitness of things ; and it suddenly occurred to [her]113-marilla that that simple little prayer , sacred to white - robed childhood lisping at motherly knees , was entirely unsuited to [this freckled witch of [a girl who knew and cared nothing about [God]145-god 's love]639-a girl who knew and cared nothing about god 's love , since [she]113-marilla had never had it translated to [her]113-marilla through the medium of human love]638-this freckled witch of a girl who knew and cared nothing about god 's love , since she had never had it translated to her through the medium of human love .

" [You]124-anne 're old enough to pray for [yourself]124-anne , [Anne]124-anne , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said finally . " Just thank [God]145-god for [your]124-anne blessings and ask [Him]145-god humbly for the things [you]124-anne want . "[113-marilla]

" Well , [I]124-anne 'll do [my]124-anne best , "[124-anne] promised [Anne]124-anne , burying [her]124-anne face in [Marilla]113-marilla 's lap . " [Gracious heavenly Father]2480-gracious heavenly father -- that 's the way [the ministers]2481-the ministers say it in [church]2482-church , so [I]124-anne suppose it 's all right in private prayer , is n't it ? "[124-anne] [she]124-anne interjected , lifting [her]124-anne head for a moment .

" [Gracious heavenly Father]133-father , [I]640-i thank [Thee]133-father for the White Way of Delight and [the Lake of [Shining Waters]25-shining waters]2236-the lake of shining waters and [Bonny]127-bonny and [the Snow Queen]2484-the snow queen . [I]640-i 'm really extremely grateful for [them]2485-them . And that 's all the blessings [I]640-i can think of just now to thank [Thee]133-father for . As for the things [I]640-i want , they 're so numerous that it would take a great deal of time to name [them]2485-them all so [I]640-i will only mention the two most important . Please let [me]640-i stay at [Green Gables]107-matthew ; and please let [me]640-i be good - looking when [I]640-i grow up . [I]640-i remain , "[640-i] [Yours]640-i respectfully , [Anne Shirley]124-anne .

" There , did [I]124-anne do all right ? "[124-anne] [she]124-anne asked eagerly , getting up . " [I]124-anne could have made it much more flowery if [I]124-anne 'd had a little more time to think it over . "[124-anne]

[Poor [Marilla]113-marilla]641-poor marilla was only preserved from complete collapse by remembering that it was not irreverence , but simply spiritual ignorance on the part of [Anne]124-anne that was responsible for this extraordinary petition . [She]113-marilla tucked [the child]460-the child up in bed , mentally vowing that [she]113-marilla should be taught a prayer the very next day , and was leaving [the room]631-the room with the light when [Anne]124-anne called [her]113-marilla back .

" [I]113-marilla 've just thought of it now . [I]113-marilla should have said , ? Amen ' in place of ? [yours]640-i respectfully , ' should n't [I?--the]2486-i?--the way [the ministers]2481-the ministers do . [I]113-marilla 'd forgotten it , but [I]113-marilla felt a prayer should be finished off in some way , so [I]113-marilla put in the other . Do [you]124-anne suppose it will make any difference ? "[113-marilla]

" [I]113-marilla -- [I]113-marilla do n't suppose it will , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " Go to sleep now like [a good child]2488-a good child . Good night . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne can only say good night tonight with a clear conscience , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , cuddling luxuriously down among [her]124-anne pillows .

[Marilla]113-marilla retreated to [the kitchen]557-the kitchen , set the candle firmly on the table , and glared at [Matthew]107-matthew .

" [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew , it 's about time [somebody]436-somebody adopted [that child]2257-that child and taught [her]2257-that child something . [She]2257-that child 's next door to [a perfect heathen]2491-a perfect heathen . Will [you]107-matthew believe that [she]2257-that child never said a prayer in [her]2257-that child life till tonight ? [I]645-i 'll send [her]2257-that child to [the manse]2492-the manse tomorrow and borrow the Peep of the Day series , that 's what [I]645-i 'll do . And [she]2257-that child shall go to [Sunday - school]2493-sunday - school just as soon as [I]645-i can get some suitable clothes made for [her]2257-that child . [I]645-i foresee that [I]645-i shall have [my]645-i hands full . Well , well , [we]2494-we ca n't get through [this world]2059-this world without [our]2494-we share of trouble . [I]645-i 've had a pretty easy life of it so far , but [my]645-i time has come at last and [I]645-i suppose [I]645-i 'll just have to make the best of it . "[645-i]

CHAPTER VIII . [Anne]124-anne 's Bringing - up Is Begun

|FOR reasons best known to [herself]645-i , [Marilla]113-marilla did not tell [Anne]124-anne that [she]113-marilla was to stay at [Green Gables]107-matthew until the next afternoon . During the forenoon [she]113-marilla kept [the child]460-the child busy with various tasks and watched over [her]460-the child with a keen eye while [she]113-marilla did them . By noon [she]113-marilla had concluded that [Anne]124-anne was smart and obedient , willing to work and quick to learn ; [her]124-anne most serious shortcoming seemed to be a tendency to fall into daydreams in the middle of a task and forget all about it until such time as [she]124-anne was sharply recalled to [earth]647-earth by a reprimand or a catastrophe .

When [Anne]124-anne had finished washing the dinner dishes [she]124-anne suddenly confronted [Marilla]113-marilla with the air and expression of one desperately determined to learn the worst . [Her]124-anne thin little body trembled from head to foot ; [her]124-anne face flushed and [her]124-anne eyes dilated until they were almost black ; [she]124-anne clasped [her]124-anne hands tightly and said in an imploring voice :

" Oh , please , [Miss Cuthbert]113-marilla , wo n't [you]113-marilla tell [me]124-anne if [you]113-marilla are going to send [me]124-anne away or not ? [I]124-anne 've tried to be patient all the morning , but [I]124-anne really feel that [I]124-anne can not bear not knowing any longer . It 's a dreadful feeling . Please tell [me]124-anne . "[124-anne]

" [You]124-anne have n't scalded the dishcloth in clean hot water as [I]113-marilla told [you]124-anne to do , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla immovably . " Just go and do it before [you]124-anne ask any more questions , [Anne]124-anne . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne went and attended to the dishcloth . Then [she]124-anne returned to [Marilla]113-marilla and fastened imploring eyes of [the latter]414-the latter 's face . " Well , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , unable to find any excuse for deferring [her]113-marilla explanation longer , " [I]113-marilla suppose [I]113-marilla might as well tell [you]124-anne . [Matthew]107-matthew and [I]113-marilla have decided to keep [you]124-anne -- that is , if [you]124-anne will try to be [a good little girl]2496-a good little girl and show [yourself]124-anne grateful . Why , [child]2497-child , whatever is the matter ? "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne 'm crying , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne in a tone of bewilderment . " [I]124-anne ca n't think why . [I]124-anne 'm glad as glad can be . Oh , _ glad _ does n't seem the right word at all . [I]124-anne was glad about the White Way and the cherry blossoms -- but this ! Oh , it 's something more than glad . [I]124-anne 'm so happy . [I]124-anne 'll try to be so good . It will be uphill work , [I]124-anne expect , for [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas often told [me]124-anne [I]124-anne was desperately wicked . However , [I]124-anne 'll do [my]124-anne very best . But can [you]113-marilla tell [me]124-anne why [I]124-anne 'm crying ? "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla suppose it 's because [you]124-anne 're all excited and worked up , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla disapprovingly . " Sit down on that chair and try to calm [yourself]124-anne . [I]113-marilla 'm afraid [you]124-anne both cry and laugh far too easily . Yes , [you]124-anne can stay [here]2022-here and [we]2499-we will try to do right by [you]124-anne . [You]124-anne must go to [school]2382-school ; but it 's only a fortnight till vacation so it is n't worth while for [you]124-anne to start before it opens again in September . "[113-marilla]

" What am [I]124-anne to call [you]113-marilla ? "[124-anne] asked [Anne]124-anne . " Shall [I]124-anne always say [Miss Cuthbert]113-marilla ? Can [I]124-anne call [you]113-marilla [Aunt Marilla]110-marilla ? "[124-anne]

" No ; [you]113-marilla 'll call [me]124-anne just plain [Marilla]110-marilla . [I]124-anne 'm not used to being called [Miss Cuthbert]113-marilla and it would make [me]124-anne nervous . "[124-anne]

" It sounds awfully disrespectful to just say [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] protested [Anne]124-anne .

" [I]124-anne guess there 'll be nothing disrespectful in it if [you]113-marilla 're careful to speak respectfully . [Everybody]2130-everybody , young and old , in [Avonlea]2-avonlea calls [me]124-anne [Marilla]113-marilla except [the minister]2502-the minister . [He]2502-the minister says [Miss Cuthbert]113-marilla -- when [he]2502-the minister thinks of it . "[124-anne]

" [I]124-anne 'd love to call [you]113-marilla [Aunt Marilla]110-marilla , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne wistfully . " [I]124-anne 've never had [an aunt or any relation at all]2503-an aunt or any relation at all -- not even [a grandmother]2504-a grandmother . It would make [me]124-anne feel as if [I]124-anne really belonged to [you]113-marilla . Ca n't [I]124-anne call [you]113-marilla [Aunt Marilla]110-marilla ? "[124-anne]

" No . [I]124-anne 'm not [[your]113-marilla aunt]2505-your aunt and [I]124-anne do n't believe in calling [people]2012-people names that do n't belong to [them]2012-people . "[124-anne]

" But [we]2507-us could imagine [you]113-marilla were [[my]124-anne aunt]2508-my aunt . "[124-anne]

" [I]110-marilla could n't , "[110-marilla] said [Marilla]110-marilla grimly .

" Do [you]113-marilla never imagine things different from what they really are ? "[124-anne] asked [Anne]124-anne wide - eyed .

" No . "[124-anne]

" Oh ! "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne drew a long breath . " Oh , [Miss]2509-miss -- [Marilla]110-marilla , how much [you]110-marilla miss ! "[124-anne]

" [I]110-marilla do n't believe in imagining things different from what they really are , "[110-marilla] retorted [Marilla]110-marilla . " When [the Lord]2510-the lord puts [us]2507-us in certain circumstances [He]2510-the lord does n't mean for [us]2507-us to imagine [them]2012-people away . And that reminds [me]110-marilla . Go into [the sitting room]2511-the sitting room , [Anne]124-anne -- be sure [your]124-anne feet are clean and do n't let any flies in -- and bring [me]110-marilla out the illustrated card that 's on the mantelpiece . [The Lord]2510-the lord 's Prayer is on it and [you]124-anne 'll devote [your]124-anne spare time this afternoon to learning it off by heart . There 's to be no more of such praying as [I]110-marilla heard last night . "[110-marilla]

" [I]124-anne suppose [I]124-anne was very awkward , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne apologetically , " but then , [you]110-marilla see , [I]124-anne 'd never had any practice . [You]110-marilla could n't really expect [a person]2165-a person to pray very well the first time [she]2165-a person tried , could [you]110-marilla ? [I]124-anne thought out a splendid prayer after [I]124-anne went to bed , just as [I]124-anne promised [you]110-marilla [I]124-anne would . It was nearly as long as [a minister]2514-a minister 's and so poetical . But would [you]110-marilla believe it ? [I]124-anne could n't remember one word when [I]124-anne woke up this morning . And [I]124-anne 'm afraid [I]124-anne 'll never be able to think out another one as good . Somehow , things never are so good when they 're thought out a second time . Have [you]110-marilla ever noticed that ? "[124-anne]

" Here is something for [you]124-anne to notice , [Anne]124-anne . When [I]124-anne tell [you]124-anne to do a thing [I]124-anne want [you]124-anne to obey [me]124-anne at once and not stand stock - still and discourse about it . Just [you]124-anne go and do as [I]124-anne bid [you]124-anne . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne promptly departed for [the sitting - room]649-the sitting - room across [the hall]551-the hall ; [she]124-anne failed to return ; after waiting ten minutes [Marilla]110-marilla laid down [her]110-marilla knitting and marched after [her]124-anne with a grim expression . [She]110-marilla found [Anne]124-anne standing motionless before a picture hanging on the wall between the two windows , with [her]124-anne eyes a - star with dreams . The white and green light strained through apple trees and clustering vines outside fell over [the rapt little figure]651-the rapt little figure with a half - unearthly radiance .

" [Anne]124-anne , whatever are [you]124-anne thinking of ? "[110-marilla] demanded [Marilla]110-marilla sharply .

[Anne]124-anne came back to earth with a start .

" That , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said , pointing to the picture -- a rather vivid chromo entitled , " Christ Blessing Little Children"--"and[0-i] [I]0-i was just imagining [I]0-i was [one of [them]653-them]652-one of them -- that [I]0-i was [the little girl in the blue dress]654-the little girl in the blue dress , standing off by [herself]654-the little girl in the blue dress in the corner as if [she]654-the little girl in the blue dress did n't belong to [anybody]2031-anybody , like [me]0-i . [She]654-the little girl in the blue dress looks lonely and sad , do n't [you]656-you think ? [I]0-i guess [she]654-the little girl in the blue dress had n't [any father]657-any father or [mother]2343-mother of [her]654-the little girl in the blue dress own . But [she]654-the little girl in the blue dress wanted to be blessed , too , so [she]654-the little girl in the blue dress just crept shyly up on the outside of [the crowd]659-the crowd , hoping [nobody]2118-nobody would notice [her]654-the little girl in the blue dress -- except [Him]661-him . [She]654-the little girl in the blue dress was afraid [He]661-him might n't notice [her]654-the little girl in the blue dress . But it 's likely [He]661-him did , do n't [you]656-you think ? " [Anne]124-anne , "[110-marilla] said [Marilla]110-marilla , wondering why [she]110-marilla had not broken into this speech long before , " [you]124-anne should n't talk that way . It 's irreverent -- positively irreverent . "[110-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne 's eyes marveled .

" Why , [I]0-i felt just as reverent as could be . [I]0-i 'm sure [I]0-i did n't mean to be irreverent . "[0-i]

" Well [I]110-marilla do n't suppose [you]124-anne did -- but it does n't sound right to talk so familiarly about such things . [Anne]124-anne set the card up against the jugful of apple blossoms [she]124-anne had brought in to decorate the dinner - table -- [Marilla]110-marilla had eyed that decoration askance , but had said nothing -- propped [her]110-marilla chin on [her]110-marilla hands , and fell to studying it intently for several silent minutes .

" [I]110-marilla like this , "[110-marilla] [she]110-marilla announced at length . " It 's beautiful . [Marilla]113-marilla was as fond of morals as [the Duchess in [Wonderland]40-wonderland]664-the duchess in wonderland , and was firmly convinced that one should be tacked on to every remark made to [a child who was being brought up]665-a child who was being brought up .

But [Anne]124-anne waved the moral inconsequently aside and seized only on the delightful possibilities before it .

"[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla think it 's just as well there was n't , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla drily . " [I]113-marilla do n't approve of such goings - on . " [Anne]124-anne , did [you]124-anne hear [me]113-marilla tell [you]124-anne to go to [[your]124-anne room]2558-your room ? "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne sighed , retreated to the east gable , and sat down in a chair by the window .

" [There]348-there -- [I]113-marilla know this prayer . [I]113-marilla learned that last sentence coming [upstairs]2564-upstairs . Now [I]113-marilla 'm going to imagine things into [this room]2565-this room so that they 'll always stay imagined . The floor is covered with a white velvet carpet with pink roses all over it and there are pink silk curtains at the windows . The walls are hung with gold and silver brocade tapestry . The furniture is mahogany . [I]113-marilla never saw any mahogany , but it does sound _ so _ luxurious . This is a couch all heaped with gorgeous silken cushions , pink and blue and crimson and gold , and [I]113-marilla am reclining gracefully on it . [I]113-marilla am tall and regal , clad in a gown of trailing white lace , with a pearl cross on [my]113-marilla breast and pearls in [my]113-marilla hair . [My]113-marilla hair is of midnight darkness and [my]113-marilla skin is a clear ivory pallor . [My]113-marilla name is [the Lady Cordelia Fitzgerald]123-cordelia . [She]124-anne danced up to the little looking - glass and peered into it . [Her]124-anne pointed freckled face and solemn gray eyes peered back at [her]124-anne .

" [Dear Snow Queen]128-queen 's , good afternoon . And good afternoon dear birches down in [the hollow]342-the hollow .
