CHAPTER IX . [Mrs. Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde Is Properly Horrified

|ANNE had been a fortnight at [Green Gables]107-matthew before [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde arrived to inspect [her]105-mrs. lynde . [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde , to do [her]105-mrs. lynde justice , was not to blame for this . A severe and unseasonable attack of grippe had confined [that good lady]666-that good lady to [[her]666-that good lady house]384-her house ever since the occasion of [her]666-that good lady last visit to [Green Gables]107-matthew . [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde was not often sick and had a well - defined contempt for [people who were]668-people who were ; but grippe , [she]105-mrs. lynde asserted , was like no other illness on [earth]647-earth and could only be interpreted as one of the special visitations of [Providence]143-providence . As soon as [[her]105-mrs. lynde doctor]670-her doctor allowed [her]105-mrs. lynde to put [her]105-mrs. lynde foot out - of - doors [she]105-mrs. lynde hurried up to [Green Gables]107-matthew , bursting with curiosity to see [Matthew]107-matthew and [[Marilla]113-marilla 's orphan]671-marilla 's orphan , concerning whom all sorts of stories and suppositions had gone abroad in [Avonlea]2-avonlea .

[Anne]124-anne had made good use of every waking moment of that fortnight . Already [she]124-anne was acquainted with every tree and shrub about [the place]2249-the place . [She]124-anne had discovered that [a lane]673-a lane opened out below [the apple orchard]674-the apple orchard and ran up through [a belt of woodland]675-a belt of woodland ; and [she]124-anne had explored [it]673-a lane to [its]673-a lane furthest end in all [its]673-a lane delicious vagaries of brook and [bridge]676-bridge , fir coppice and wild cherry arch , corners thick with fern , and branching byways of maple and mountain ash .

[She]124-anne had made [friends]677-friends with the spring down in [the hollow]342-the hollow -- that wonderful deep , clear icy - cold spring ; [it]679-it was set about with smooth red sandstones and rimmed in by great palm - like clumps of water fern ; and beyond [it]679-it was [a log bridge over [the brook]394-the brook]680-a log bridge over the brook .

[That bridge]682-that bridge led [Anne]124-anne 's dancing feet up over [a wooded hill beyond]683-a wooded hill beyond , where perpetual twilight reigned under the straight , thick - growing firs and spruces ; the only flowers there were myriads of delicate " June bells , "[124-anne] those shyest and sweetest of woodland blooms , and a few pale , aerial starflowers , like the spirits of last year 's blossoms . Gossamers glimmered like threads of silver among the trees and the fir boughs and tassels seemed to utter friendly speech .

All these raptured voyages of exploration were made in the odd half hours which [she]124-anne was allowed for play , and [Anne]124-anne talked [Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]113-marilla half - deaf over [her]124-anne discoveries . Not that [Matthew]107-matthew complained , to be sure ; [he]107-matthew listened to it all with a wordless smile of enjoyment on [his]107-matthew face ; [Marilla]113-marilla permitted the " chatter "[107-matthew] until [she]113-marilla found [herself]113-marilla becoming too interested in it , whereupon [she]113-marilla always promptly quenched [Anne]124-anne by a curt command to hold [her]113-marilla tongue .

[Anne]124-anne was out in [the orchard]2264-the orchard when [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde came , wandering at [her]105-mrs. lynde own sweet will through the lush , tremulous grasses splashed with ruddy evening sunshine ; so that [good lady]685-good lady had an excellent chance to talk [her]105-mrs. lynde illness fully over , describing every ache and pulse beat with such evident enjoyment that [Marilla]113-marilla thought even grippe must bring its compensations . When details were exhausted [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde introduced the real reason of [her]105-mrs. lynde call .

" [I]105-mrs. lynde 've been hearing some surprising things about [you]113-marilla and [Matthew]107-matthew . "[105-mrs. lynde]

" [I]113-marilla do n't suppose [you]105-mrs. lynde are any more surprised than [I]113-marilla am [myself]113-marilla , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " [I]113-marilla 'm getting over [my]113-marilla surprise now . "[113-marilla]

" It was too bad there was such a mistake , "[105-mrs. lynde] said [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde sympathetically . " Could n't [you]113-marilla have sent [her]685-good lady back ? "[105-mrs. lynde]

" [I]113-marilla suppose [we]2576-we could , but [we]2576-we decided not to . [Matthew]107-matthew took a fancy to [her]685-good lady . And [I]113-marilla must say [I]113-marilla like [her]685-good lady [myself]113-marilla -- although [I]113-marilla admit [she]685-good lady has [her]685-good lady faults . [The house]350-the house seems a different place already . [She]685-good lady 's a real bright little thing . "[113-marilla]

[Marilla]113-marilla said more than [she]113-marilla had intended to say when [she]113-marilla began , for [she]113-marilla read disapproval in [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde 's expression .

" It 's a great responsibility [you]113-marilla 've taken on [yourself]113-marilla , "[686-that lady] said [that lady]686-that lady gloomily , " especially when [you]113-marilla 've never had any experience with [children]330-children . [You]113-marilla do n't know much about [her]685-good lady or [her]685-good lady real disposition , [I]686-that lady suppose , and there 's no guessing how [a child like that]2579-a child like that will turn out . But [I]686-that lady do n't want to discourage [you]113-marilla [I]686-that lady 'm sure , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[686-that lady]

" [I]113-marilla 'm not feeling discouraged , "[113-marilla] was [Marilla]113-marilla 's dry response , " when [I]113-marilla make up [my]113-marilla mind to do a thing it stays made up . [I]113-marilla suppose [you]113-marilla 'd like to see [Anne]124-anne . [I]113-marilla 'll call [her]124-anne in . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne came running in presently , [her]124-anne face sparkling with the delight of [her]124-anne orchard rovings ; but , abashed at finding the delight [herself]124-anne in the unexpected presence of [a stranger]2452-a stranger , [she]124-anne halted confusedly inside the door . [She]124-anne certainly was [an odd - looking little creature in the short tight wincey dress [she]124-anne had worn from [the asylum]2024-the asylum]688-an odd - looking little creature in the short tight wincey dress she had worn from the asylum , below which [her]124-anne thin legs seemed ungracefully long . [Her]124-anne freckles were more numerous and obtrusive than ever ; the wind had ruffled [her]124-anne hatless hair into over - brilliant disorder ; it had never looked redder than at that moment .

" Well , [they]2580-they did n't pick [you]105-mrs. lynde for [your]105-mrs. lynde looks , that 's sure and certain , "[105-mrs. lynde] was [Mrs. Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde 's emphatic comment . [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde was one of [those delightful and popular people who pride [themselves]690-those delightful and popular people who pride themselves on speaking their mind without fear or favor on speaking [their]690-those delightful and popular people who pride themselves on speaking their mind without fear or favor mind without fear or favor]690-those delightful and popular people who pride themselves on speaking their mind without fear or favor . " [She]124-anne 's terrible skinny and homely , [Marilla]113-marilla . Come here , [child]2497-child , and let [me]105-mrs. lynde have a look at [you]2497-child . [Lawful]2582-lawful heart , did [any one]2583-any one ever see such freckles ? And hair as red as carrots ! Come here , [child]2497-child , [I]105-mrs. lynde say . "[105-mrs. lynde]

[Anne]124-anne " came [there]348-there , "[124-anne] but not exactly as [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde expected . With one bound [she]124-anne crossed the [kitchen]691-kitchen floor and stood before [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde , [her]124-anne face scarlet with anger , [her]124-anne lips quivering , and [her]124-anne whole slender form trembling from head to foot .

" [I]124-anne hate [you]105-mrs. lynde , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne cried in a choked voice , stamping [her]124-anne foot on the floor . " [I]124-anne hate [you]105-mrs. lynde -- [I]124-anne hate [you]105-mrs. lynde -- [I]124-anne hate [you--]105-mrs. lynde "[124-anne] a louder stamp with each assertion of hatred . " How dare [you]105-mrs. lynde call [me]124-anne skinny and ugly ? How dare [you]105-mrs. lynde say [I]124-anne 'm freckled and redheaded ? [You]105-mrs. lynde are [a rude , impolite , unfeeling woman]2586-a rude , impolite , unfeeling woman ! "[124-anne]

" [Anne]124-anne ! "[113-marilla] exclaimed [Marilla]113-marilla in consternation .

But [Anne]124-anne continued to face [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde undauntedly , head up , eyes blazing , hands clenched , passionate indignation exhaling from [her]124-anne like an atmosphere .

" How dare [you]105-mrs. lynde say such things about [me]124-anne ? "[124-anne] [she]124-anne repeated vehemently . " How would [you]105-mrs. lynde like to have such things said about [you]105-mrs. lynde ? How would [you]105-mrs. lynde like to be told that [you]105-mrs. lynde are fat and clumsy and probably had n't a spark of imagination in [you]105-mrs. lynde ? [I]124-anne do n't care if [I]124-anne do hurt [your]105-mrs. lynde feelings by saying so ! [I]124-anne hope [I]124-anne hurt [them]2587-them . [You]105-mrs. lynde have hurt [mine]124-anne worse than [they]2587-them were ever hurt before even by [[Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas ' intoxicated husband]2588-mrs. thomas ' intoxicated husband . And [I]124-anne 'll _ never _ forgive [you]105-mrs. lynde for it , never , never ! "[124-anne]

[Stamp]150-stamp ! [Stamp]150-stamp !

" Did [anybody]2031-anybody ever see such a temper ! "[105-mrs. lynde] exclaimed the horrified [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde .

" [Anne]124-anne go to [[your]124-anne room]2558-your room and stay [there]348-there until [I]113-marilla come up , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , recovering [her]113-marilla powers of speech with difficulty .

[Anne]124-anne , bursting into tears , rushed to [the hall]551-the hall door , slammed it until the tins on the porch wall outside rattled in sympathy , and fled through [the hall]551-the hall and up the stairs like a whirlwind . A subdued slam above told that the door of [the east gable]561-the east gable had been shut with equal vehemence .

" Well , [I]105-mrs. lynde do n't envy [you]113-marilla [your]113-marilla job bringing _ that _ up , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[105-mrs. lynde] said [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde with unspeakable solemnity .

[Marilla]113-marilla opened [her]113-marilla lips to say [she]113-marilla knew not what of apology or deprecation . What [she]113-marilla did say was a surprise to [herself]113-marilla then and ever afterwards .

" [You]105-mrs. lynde should n't have twitted [her]105-mrs. lynde about [her]105-mrs. lynde looks , [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde . "[113-marilla]

" [Marilla Cuthbert]113-marilla , [you]105-mrs. lynde do n't mean to say that [you]105-mrs. lynde are upholding [her]105-mrs. lynde in such a terrible display of temper as [we]2592-we 've just seen ? "[105-mrs. lynde] demanded [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde indignantly .

" No , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla slowly , " [I]113-marilla 'm not trying to excuse [her]105-mrs. lynde . [She]105-mrs. lynde 's been very naughty and [I]113-marilla 'll have to give [her]105-mrs. lynde a talking to about it . But [we]2592-we must make allowances for [her]105-mrs. lynde . [She]105-mrs. lynde 's never been taught what is right . And [you]105-mrs. lynde _ were _ too hard on [her]105-mrs. lynde , [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde . "[113-marilla]

[Marilla]113-marilla could not help tacking on that last sentence , although [she]113-marilla was again surprised at [herself]113-marilla for doing it . [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde got up with an air of offended dignity .

" Well , [I]105-mrs. lynde see that [I]105-mrs. lynde 'll have to be very careful what [I]105-mrs. lynde say after this , [Marilla]113-marilla , since the fine feelings of [orphans]2149-orphans , brought from goodness knows where , have to be considered before anything else . Oh , no , [I]105-mrs. lynde 'm not vexed -- don't worry [yourself]113-marilla . [I]105-mrs. lynde 'm too sorry for [you]113-marilla to leave any room for anger in [my]105-mrs. lynde mind . [You]113-marilla 'll have [your]113-marilla own troubles with [that child]2257-that child . But if [you]113-marilla 'll take [my]105-mrs. lynde advice -- which [I]105-mrs. lynde suppose [you]113-marilla wo n't do , although [I]105-mrs. lynde 've brought up [ten children]2595-ten children and buried two -- [you'll]113-marilla do that ? talking to ' [you]113-marilla mention with a fair - sized birch switch . [I]105-mrs. lynde should think _ that _ would be the most effective language for [that kind of a child]2596-that kind of a child . [Her]2257-that child temper matches [her]2257-that child hair [I]105-mrs. lynde guess . Well , good evening , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]105-mrs. lynde hope [you]113-marilla 'll come down to see [me]105-mrs. lynde often as usual . But [you]113-marilla ca n't expect [me]105-mrs. lynde to visit here again in a hurry , if [I]105-mrs. lynde 'm liable to be flown at and insulted in such a fashion . It 's something new in _ [my]105-mrs. lynde _ experience . "[105-mrs. lynde]

[Whereat Mrs. Rachel]151-whereat mrs. rachel swept out and away -- if [a fat woman who always waddled _]695-a fat woman who always waddled _ could _ be said to sweep away -- and [Marilla]113-marilla with a very solemn face betook [herself]113-marilla to the east gable .

On the way [upstairs]2564-upstairs [she]113-marilla pondered uneasily as to what [she]113-marilla ought to do . [She]113-marilla felt no little dismay over the scene that had just been enacted . How unfortunate that [Anne]124-anne should have displayed such temper before [Mrs. Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , of [all people]697-all people ! Then [Marilla]113-marilla suddenly became aware of an uncomfortable and rebuking consciousness that [she]113-marilla felt more humiliation over this than sorrow over the discovery of such a serious defect in [Anne]124-anne 's disposition . And how was [she]113-marilla to punish [her]124-anne ? The amiable suggestion of the birch switch -- to the efficiency of which [all of [[Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde 's own children]699-mrs. rachel 's own children]698-all of mrs. rachel 's own children could have borne smarting testimony -- did not appeal to [Marilla]113-marilla . [She]113-marilla did not believe [she]113-marilla could whip [a child]2075-a child . No , some other method of punishment must be found to bring [Anne]124-anne to a proper realization of the enormity of [her]124-anne offense .

[Marilla]113-marilla found [Anne]124-anne face downward on [her]124-anne bed , crying bitterly , quite oblivious of muddy boots on a clean counterpane .

" [Anne]124-anne , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said not ungently .

No answer .

" [Anne]124-anne , "[124-anne] with greater severity , " get off that bed this minute and listen to what [I]124-anne have to say to [you]124-anne . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne squirmed off the bed and sat rigidly on a chair beside it , [her]124-anne face swollen and tear - stained and [her]124-anne eyes fixed stubbornly on the floor .

" This is a nice way for [you]124-anne to behave . [Anne]124-anne ! Are n't [you]124-anne ashamed of [yourself]124-anne ? "[124-anne]

" [She]2597-she had n't any right to call [me]124-anne ugly and redheaded , "[124-anne] retorted [Anne]124-anne , evasive and defiant .

" [You]124-anne had n't any right to fly into such a fury and talk the way [you]124-anne did to [her]2597-she , [Anne]124-anne . [I]124-anne was ashamed of [you]124-anne -- thoroughly ashamed of [you]124-anne . [I]124-anne wanted [you]124-anne to behave nicely to [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , and instead of that [you]124-anne have disgraced [me]124-anne . [I]124-anne 'm sure [I]124-anne do n't know why [you]124-anne should lose [your]124-anne temper like that just because [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde said [you]124-anne were red - haired and homely . [You]124-anne say it [yourself]124-anne often enough . "[124-anne]

" Oh , but there 's such a difference between saying a thing [yourself]124-anne and hearing [other people]2168-other people say it , "[124-anne] wailed [Anne]124-anne . " [You]124-anne may know a thing is so , but [you]124-anne ca n't help hoping [other people]2168-other people do n't quite think it is . [I]124-anne suppose [you]124-anne think [I]124-anne have an awful temper , but [I]124-anne could n't help it . When [she]105-mrs. lynde said those things something just rose right up in [me]124-anne and choked [me]124-anne . [I]124-anne _ had _ to fly out at [her]105-mrs. lynde . "[124-anne]

" Well , [you]124-anne made a fine exhibition of [yourself]124-anne [I]701-a very small child must say . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde will have a nice story to tell about [you]124-anne everywhere -- and [she]105-mrs. lynde 'll tell it , too . It was a dreadful thing for [you]124-anne to lose [your]124-anne temper like that , [Anne]124-anne . "[701-a very small child]

" Just imagine how [you]124-anne would feel if [somebody]436-somebody told [you]124-anne to [your]124-anne face that [you]124-anne were skinny and ugly , "[124-anne] pleaded [Anne]124-anne tearfully .

An old remembrance suddenly rose up before [Marilla]113-marilla . [She]113-marilla had been [a very small child]701-a very small child when [she]113-marilla had heard [one aunt]702-one aunt say of [her]113-marilla to another , " What a pity [she]113-marilla is such a dark , homely little thing . "[113-marilla] [Marilla]113-marilla was every day of fifty before the sting had gone out of that memory .

" [I]702-one aunt do n't say that [I]702-one aunt think [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde was exactly right in saying what [she]105-mrs. lynde did to [you]124-anne , [Anne]124-anne , "[702-one aunt] [she]702-one aunt admitted in a softer tone . " [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde is too outspoken . But that is no excuse for such behavior on [your]124-anne part . [She]105-mrs. lynde was [a stranger]2452-a stranger and [an elderly person]2602-an elderly person and [[my]702-one aunt visitor]2603-my visitor -- all three very good reasons why [you]124-anne should have been respectful to [her]105-mrs. lynde . [You]124-anne were rude and saucy and"--Marilla[702-one aunt] had a saving inspiration of [punishment--"you]2604-punishment--"you must go to [her]105-mrs. lynde and tell [her]105-mrs. lynde [you]124-anne are very sorry for [your]124-anne bad temper and ask [her]105-mrs. lynde to forgive [you]124-anne . "[702-one aunt]

" [I]124-anne can never do that , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne determinedly and darkly . " [You]124-anne can punish [me]124-anne in any way [you]124-anne like , [Marilla]113-marilla . [You]124-anne can shut [me]124-anne up in [a dark , damp dungeon inhabited by snakes and toads]2605-a dark , damp dungeon inhabited by snakes and toads and feed [me]124-anne only on bread and water and [I]124-anne shall not complain . But [I]124-anne can not ask [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde to forgive [me]124-anne . "[124-anne]

" [We]2606-we 're not in the habit of shutting [people]2012-people up in [dark damp dungeons]2608-dark damp dungeons , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla drily , " especially as [they]2012-people 're rather scarce in [Avonlea]2-avonlea . But apologize to [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde [you]124-anne must and shall and [you]124-anne 'll stay here in [[your]124-anne room]2558-your room until [you]124-anne can tell [me]113-marilla [you]124-anne 're willing to do it . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne shall have to stay [here]2022-here forever then , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne mournfully , " because [I]124-anne ca n't tell [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde [I]124-anne 'm sorry [I]124-anne said those things to [her]105-mrs. lynde . How can [I]124-anne ? [I]124-anne 'm _ not _ sorry . [I]124-anne 'm sorry [I]124-anne 've vexed [you]124-anne ; but [I]124-anne 'm _ glad _ [I]124-anne told [her]105-mrs. lynde just what [I]124-anne did . It was a great satisfaction . [I]124-anne ca n't say [I]124-anne 'm sorry when [I]124-anne 'm not , can [I]124-anne ? [I]124-anne ca n't even _ imagine _ [I]124-anne 'm sorry . "[124-anne]

" Perhaps [your]124-anne imagination will be in better working order by the morning , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , rising to depart . " [You]124-anne 'll have the night to think over [your]124-anne conduct in and come to a better frame of mind . [You]124-anne said [you]124-anne would try to be [a very good girl]2611-a very good girl if [we]2612-we kept [you]124-anne at [Green Gables]107-matthew , but [I]113-marilla must say it has n't seemed very much like it this evening . "[113-marilla]

Leaving [this Parthian shaft]703-this parthian shaft to rankle in [Anne]124-anne 's stormy bosom , [Marilla]113-marilla descended to [the kitchen]557-the kitchen , grievously troubled in mind and vexed in soul . [She]113-marilla was as angry with [herself]113-marilla as with [Anne]124-anne , because , whenever [she]113-marilla recalled [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde 's dumbfounded countenance [her]113-marilla lips twitched with amusement and [she]113-marilla felt a most reprehensible desire to laugh .

CHAPTER X. [Anne]124-anne 's Apology

|MARILLA said nothing to [Matthew]107-matthew about the affair that evening ; but when [Anne]124-anne proved still refractory the next morning an explanation had to be made to account for [her]124-anne absence from the breakfast table . [Marilla]113-marilla told [Matthew]107-matthew the whole story , taking pains to impress [him]107-matthew with a due sense of the enormity of [Anne]124-anne 's behavior .

" It 's a good thing [Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde got a calling down ; [she]105-mrs. lynde 's [a meddlesome old gossip]2613-a meddlesome old gossip , "[107-matthew] was [Matthew]107-matthew 's consolatory rejoinder .

" [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew , [I]107-matthew 'm astonished at [you]107-matthew . [You]107-matthew know that [Anne]124-anne 's behavior was dreadful , and yet [you]107-matthew take [her]124-anne part ! [I]107-matthew suppose [you]107-matthew 'll be saying next thing that [she]124-anne ought n't to be punished at all ! "[107-matthew]

" Well now -- no -- not exactly , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew uneasily . " [I]107-matthew reckon [she]124-anne ought to be punished a little . But do n't be too hard on [her]124-anne , [Marilla]113-marilla . Recollect [she]124-anne has n't ever had [anyone]2614-anyone to teach [her]124-anne right . [You're]113-marilla -- [you're]113-marilla going to give [her]124-anne something to eat , are n't [you]113-marilla ? "[107-matthew]

" When did [you]107-matthew ever hear of [me]113-marilla starving [people]2012-people into good behavior ? "[113-marilla] demanded [Marilla]113-marilla indignantly . " [She]124-anne 'll have [her]124-anne meals regular , and [I]113-marilla 'll carry them up to [her]124-anne [myself]113-marilla . But [she]124-anne 'll stay up [there]348-there until [she]124-anne 's willing to apologize to [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , and that 's final , [Matthew]107-matthew . "[113-marilla]

Breakfast , dinner , and supper were very silent meals -- for [Anne]124-anne still remained obdurate . After each meal [Marilla]113-marilla carried a well - filled tray to [the east gable]561-the east gable and brought it down later on not noticeably depleted . [Matthew]107-matthew eyed [its]561-the east gable last descent with a troubled eye . Had [Anne]124-anne eaten anything at all ?

When [Marilla]113-marilla went out that evening to bring the cows from [the back pasture]706-the back pasture , [Matthew]107-matthew , who had been hanging about [the barns]707-the barns and watching , slipped into [the house]350-the house with the air of [a burglar]709-a burglar and crept [upstairs]2564-upstairs . As a general thing [Matthew]107-matthew gravitated between [the kitchen]557-the kitchen and [the little bedroom off [the hall]551-the hall where [he]107-matthew slept]712-the little bedroom off the hall where he slept ; once in a while [he]107-matthew ventured uncomfortably into [the parlor]622-the parlor or sitting room when [the minister]2502-the minister came to tea . But [he]107-matthew had never been [upstairs]2564-upstairs in [[his]107-matthew own house]717-his own house since the spring [he]107-matthew helped [Marilla]113-marilla paper [the spare bedroom]718-the spare bedroom , and that was four years ago .

[He]107-matthew tiptoed along [the hall]551-the hall and stood for several minutes outside the door of [the east gable]561-the east gable before [he]107-matthew summoned courage to tap on it with [his]107-matthew fingers and then open the door to peep in .

[Anne]124-anne was sitting on the yellow chair by the window gazing mournfully out into [the garden]573-the garden . Very small and unhappy [she]124-anne looked , and [Matthew]107-matthew 's heart smote [him]107-matthew . [He]107-matthew softly closed the door and tiptoed over to [her]124-anne .

" [Anne]124-anne , "[107-matthew] [he]107-matthew whispered , as if afraid of being overheard , " how are [you]124-anne making it , [Anne]124-anne ? "[107-matthew]

[Anne]124-anne smiled wanly .

" Pretty well . [I]124-anne imagine a good deal , and that helps to pass the time . Of course , it 's rather lonesome . But then , [I]124-anne may as well get used to that . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne smiled again , bravely facing the long years of solitary imprisonment before [her]124-anne .

[Matthew]107-matthew recollected that [he]107-matthew must say what [he]107-matthew had come to say without loss of time , lest [Marilla]113-marilla return prematurely . " Well now , [Anne]124-anne , do n't [you]124-anne think [you]124-anne 'd better do it and have it over with ? "[107-matthew] [he]107-matthew whispered . " It 'll have to be done sooner or later , [you]124-anne know , for [Marilla]113-marilla 's [a dreadful deter - mined woman]2617-a dreadful deter - mined woman -- dreadful determined , [Anne]124-anne . Do it right off , [I]107-matthew say , and have it over . "[107-matthew]

" Do [you]107-matthew mean apologize to [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde ? "[107-matthew]

" Yes -- apologize -- that 's the very word , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew eagerly . " Just smooth it over so to speak . That 's what [I]107-matthew was trying to get at . "[107-matthew]

" [I]124-anne suppose [I]124-anne could do it to oblige [you]107-matthew , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne thoughtfully . " It would be true enough to say [I]124-anne am sorry , because [I]124-anne _ am _ sorry now . [I]124-anne was n't a bit sorry last night . [I]124-anne was mad clear through , and [I]124-anne stayed mad all night . [I]124-anne know [I]124-anne did because [I]124-anne woke up three times and [I]124-anne was just furious every time . But this morning it was over . [I]124-anne was n't in a temper anymore -- and it left a dreadful sort of goneness , too . [I]124-anne felt so ashamed of [myself]124-anne . But [I]124-anne just could n't think of going and telling [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde so . It would be so humiliating . [I]124-anne made up [my]124-anne mind [I]124-anne 'd stay shut up [here]2022-here forever rather than do that . But still -- [I'd]124-anne do anything for [you]124-anne -- if [you]124-anne really want [me]124-anne to-- "[124-anne]

" Well now , of course [I]113-marilla do . It 's terrible lonesome [downstairs]2619-downstairs without [you]124-anne . Just go and smooth things over -- that 's [a good girl]2443-a good girl . "[113-marilla]

" Very well , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne resignedly . " [I]124-anne 'll tell [Marilla]113-marilla as soon as [she]113-marilla comes in [I]124-anne 've repented . "[124-anne]

" That 's right -- that 's right , [Anne]124-anne . But do n't tell [Marilla]113-marilla [I]113-marilla said anything about it . [She]113-marilla might think [I]113-marilla was putting [my]113-marilla oar in and [I]113-marilla promised not to do that . "[113-marilla]

" Wild horses wo n't drag the secret from [me]124-anne , "[124-anne] promised [Anne]124-anne solemnly . " How would wild horses drag a secret from [a person]2165-a person anyhow ? "[124-anne]

But [Matthew]107-matthew was gone , scared at [his]107-matthew own success . [He]107-matthew fled hastily to [the remotest corner of [the horse pasture]723-the horse pasture]722-the remotest corner of the horse pasture lest [Marilla]113-marilla should suspect what [he]107-matthew had been up to . [Marilla]113-marilla [herself]113-marilla , upon [her]113-marilla return to [the house]350-the house , was agreeably surprised to hear a plaintive voice calling , " [Marilla]113-marilla "[113-marilla] over the banisters .

" Well ? "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said , going into [the hall]551-the hall .

" [I]113-marilla 'm sorry [I]113-marilla lost [my]113-marilla temper and said rude things , and [I]113-marilla 'm willing to go and tell [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde so . "[113-marilla]

" Very well . "[113-marilla] [Marilla]113-marilla 's crispness gave no sign of [her]113-marilla relief . [She]113-marilla had been wondering what under the canopy [she]113-marilla should do if [Anne]124-anne did not give in . " [I]113-marilla 'll take [you]113-marilla down after milking . "[113-marilla]

Accordingly , after milking , behold [Marilla]113-marilla and [Anne]124-anne walking down [the lane]380-the lane , [the former erect and triumphant]727-the former erect and triumphant , [the latter]414-the latter drooping and dejected . But halfway down [Anne]124-anne 's dejection vanished as if by enchantment . [She]124-anne lifted [her]124-anne head and stepped lightly along , [her]124-anne eyes fixed on the sunset sky and an air of subdued exhilaration about [her]124-anne . [Marilla]113-marilla beheld the change disapprovingly . This was no meek penitent such as it behooved [her]113-marilla to take into the presence of [the offended Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde .

" What are [you]124-anne thinking of , [Anne]124-anne ? "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla asked sharply .

" [I]124-anne 'm imagining out what [I]124-anne must say to [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , "[124-anne] answered [Anne]124-anne dreamily .

This was satisfactory -- or should have been so . But [Marilla]113-marilla could not rid [herself]113-marilla of the notion that something in [her]113-marilla scheme of punishment was going askew . [Anne]124-anne had no business to look so rapt and radiant .

[Rapt and radiant Anne]729-rapt and radiant anne continued until [they]729-rapt and radiant anne were in the very presence of [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , who was sitting knitting by [her]105-mrs. lynde kitchen window . Then the radiance vanished . Mournful penitence appeared on every feature . Before a word was spoken [Anne]124-anne suddenly went down on [her]124-anne knees before [the astonished Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde and held out [her]124-anne hands beseechingly .

" Oh , [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , [I]124-anne am so extremely sorry , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said with a quiver in [her]124-anne voice . " [I]124-anne could never express all [my]124-anne sorrow , no , not if [I]124-anne used up a whole dictionary . [You]105-mrs. lynde must just imagine it . [I]124-anne behaved terribly to [you]105-mrs. lynde -- and [I]124-anne 've disgraced [the dear friends]2622-the dear friends , [Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]113-marilla , who have let [me]124-anne stay at [Green Gables]107-matthew although [I]124-anne 'm not [a boy]406-a boy . [I]124-anne 'm [a dreadfully wicked and ungrateful girl]2624-a dreadfully wicked and ungrateful girl , and [I]124-anne deserve to be punished and cast out by [respectable people]2625-respectable people forever . It was very wicked of [me]124-anne to fly into a temper because [you]105-mrs. lynde told [me]124-anne the truth . It _ was _ the truth ; every word [you]105-mrs. lynde said was true . [My]124-anne hair is red and [I]124-anne 'm freckled and skinny and ugly . What [I]124-anne said to [you]105-mrs. lynde was true , too , but [I]124-anne should n't have said it . Oh , [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , please , please , forgive [me]124-anne . If [you]105-mrs. lynde refuse it will be a lifelong sorrow on [a poor little orphan girl]2626-a poor little orphan girl , would [you]105-mrs. lynde , even if [she]2626-a poor little orphan girl had a dreadful temper ? Oh , [I]124-anne am sure [you]105-mrs. lynde would n't . Please say [you]105-mrs. lynde forgive [me]124-anne , [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne clasped [her]124-anne hands together , bowed [her]124-anne head , and waited for the word of judgment .

There was no mistaking [her]124-anne sincerity -- it breathed in every tone of [her]124-anne voice . Both [Marilla]113-marilla and [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde recognized its unmistakable ring . But [the former under]730-the former under - stood in dismay that [Anne]124-anne was actually enjoying [her]124-anne valley of humiliation -- was reveling in the thoroughness of [her]124-anne abasement . Where was the wholesome punishment upon which [she]124-anne , [Marilla]113-marilla , had plumed [herself]124-anne ? [Anne]124-anne had turned it into a species of positive pleasure .

[Good Mrs. Lynde]152-good mrs. lynde , not being overburdened with perception , did not see this . [She]152-good mrs. lynde only perceived that [Anne]124-anne had made a very thorough apology and all resentment vanished from [her]124-anne kindly , if somewhat officious , heart .

" There , there , get up , [child]2497-child , "[152-good mrs. lynde] [she]152-good mrs. lynde said heartily . " Of course [I]152-good mrs. lynde forgive [you]2497-child . [I]152-good mrs. lynde guess [I]152-good mrs. lynde was a little too hard on [you]2497-child , anyway . But [I]152-good mrs. lynde 'm such [an outspoken person]2628-an outspoken person . [You]2497-child just must n't mind [me]152-good mrs. lynde , that 's what . It ca n't be denied [your]2497-child hair is terrible red ; but [I]152-good mrs. lynde knew [a girl]2066-a girl once -- went to school with [her]2066-a girl , in fact -- whose hair was every mite as red as [yours]2497-child when [she]2066-a girl was young , but when [she]2066-a girl grew up it darkened to a real handsome auburn . [I]152-good mrs. lynde would n't be a mite surprised if [yours]2497-child did , too -- not a mite . "[152-good mrs. lynde]

" Oh , [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde ! "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne drew a long breath as [she]124-anne rose to [her]124-anne feet . " [You]2497-child have given [me]124-anne a hope . [I]124-anne shall always feel that [you]2497-child are [a benefactor]2630-a benefactor . Oh , [I]124-anne could endure anything if [I]124-anne only thought [my]124-anne hair would be a handsome auburn when [I]124-anne grew up . It would be so much easier to be good if [one]385-one 's hair was a handsome auburn , do n't [you]2497-child think ? And now may [I]124-anne go out into [[your]2497-child garden]2632-your garden and sit on that bench under the apple - trees while [you]2497-child and [Marilla]113-marilla are talking ? There is so much more scope for imagination out there . "[124-anne]

" Laws , yes , run along , [child]2497-child . And [you]2497-child can pick a bouquet of them white June lilies over in the corner if [you]2497-child like . "[152-good mrs. lynde]

As the door closed behind [Anne Mrs. Lynde]153-anne got briskly up to light a lamp .

" [She]2634-she 's a real odd little thing . Take this chair , [Marilla]113-marilla ; it 's easier than the one [you]2497-child 've got ; [I]124-anne just keep that for [the hired boy]2635-the hired boy to sit on . Yes , [she]2634-she certainly is [an odd child]2636-an odd child , but there is something kind of taking about [her]2634-she after all . [I]124-anne do n't feel so surprised at [you]2497-child and [Matthew]107-matthew keeping [her]2634-she as [I]124-anne did -- nor so sorry for [you]2497-child , either . [She]2634-she may turn out all right . Of course , [she]2634-she has a queer way of expressing [herself]2634-she -- a little too -- well , too kind of forcible , [you]2497-child know ; but [she]2634-she 'll likely get over that now that [she]2634-she 's come to live among [civilized folks]2637-civilized folks . And then , [her]2634-she temper 's pretty quick , [I]124-anne guess ; but there 's one comfort , [a child that has a quick temper]2638-a child that has a quick temper , just blaze up and cool down , ai n't never likely to be sly or deceitful . Preserve [me]124-anne from [a sly child]2639-a sly child , that 's what . On the whole , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne kind of like [her]2634-she . "[124-anne]

When [Marilla]113-marilla went [home]361-home [Anne]153-anne came out of the fragrant twilight of [the orchard]2264-the orchard with a sheaf of white narcissi in [her]153-anne hands .

" [I]153-anne apologized pretty well , did n't [I]153-anne ? "[153-anne] [she]153-anne said proudly as [they]733-they went down [the lane]380-the lane . " [I]153-anne thought since [I]153-anne had to do it [I]153-anne might as well do it thoroughly . "[153-anne]

" [You]153-anne did it thoroughly , all right enough , "[113-marilla] was [Marilla]113-marilla 's comment . [Marilla]113-marilla was dismayed at finding [herself]113-marilla inclined to laugh over the recollection . [She]113-marilla had also an uneasy feeling that [she]113-marilla ought to scold [Anne]153-anne for apologizing so well ; but then , that was ridiculous ! [She]113-marilla compromised with [her]113-marilla conscience by saying severely :

" [I]113-marilla hope [you]153-anne wo n't have occasion to make many more such apologies . [I]113-marilla hope [you]153-anne 'll try to control [your]153-anne temper now , [Anne]153-anne . "[113-marilla]

" That would n't be so hard if [people]2012-people would n't twit [me]153-anne about [my]153-anne looks , "[153-anne] said [Anne]153-anne with a sigh . " [I]153-anne do n't get cross about other things ; but [I]153-anne 'm _ so _ tired of being twitted about [my]153-anne hair and it just makes [me]153-anne boil right over . Do [you]153-anne suppose [my]153-anne hair will really be a handsome auburn when [I]153-anne grow up ? "[153-anne]

" [You]153-anne should n't think so much about [your]153-anne looks , [Anne]153-anne . [I]113-marilla 'm afraid [you]153-anne are [a very vain little girl]2641-a very vain little girl . "[113-marilla]

" How can [I]153-anne be vain when [I]153-anne know [I]153-anne 'm homely ? "[153-anne] protested [Anne]153-anne . " [I]153-anne love pretty things ; and [I]153-anne hate to look in the glass and see something that is n't pretty . It makes [me]153-anne feel so sorrowful -- just as [I]153-anne feel when [I]153-anne look at any ugly thing . [I]153-anne pity it because it is n't beautiful . "[153-anne]

" Handsome is as handsome does , "[113-marilla] quoted [Marilla]113-marilla . " [I]153-anne 've had that said to [me]153-anne before , but [I]153-anne have [my]153-anne doubts about it , "[153-anne] remarked [skeptical Anne]153-anne , sniffing at [her]153-anne narcissi . " Oh , are n't these flowers sweet ! It was lovely of [Mrs. Lynde]153-anne to give [them]2642-them to [me]153-anne . [I]153-anne have no hard feelings against [Mrs. Lynde]153-anne now . It gives [you]2643-you a lovely , comfortable feeling to apologize and be forgiven , does n't it ? Are n't the stars bright tonight ? If [you]2643-you could live in a star , which one would [you]2643-you pick ? [I]153-anne 'd like [that lovely clear big one away over there above [that dark hill]2645-that dark hill]2644-that lovely clear big one away over there above that dark hill . "[153-anne]

" [Anne]153-anne , do hold [your]153-anne tongue , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , thoroughly worn out trying to follow the gyrations of [Anne]153-anne 's thoughts .

[Anne]153-anne said no more until [they]735-they turned into [[their]735-they own lane]736-their own lane . A little gypsy wind came down [it]736-their own lane to meet [them]735-they , laden with the spicy perfume of young dew - wet ferns . Far up in the shadows a cheerful light gleamed out through the trees from [the kitchen]557-the kitchen at [Green Gables]107-matthew . [Anne]153-anne suddenly came close to [Marilla]113-marilla and slipped [her]153-anne hand into [the older woman]738-the older woman 's hard palm .

" It 's lovely to be going [home]361-home and know it 's [home]361-home , "[153-anne] [she]153-anne said . " [I]153-anne love [Green Gables]107-matthew already , and [I]153-anne never loved any place before . [No place]2648-no place ever seemed like [home]361-home . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]153-anne 'm so happy . [I]153-anne could pray right now and not find it a bit hard . "[153-anne]

Something warm and pleasant welled up in [Marilla]113-marilla 's heart at touch of that thin little hand in [her]113-marilla own -- a throb of the maternity [she]113-marilla had missed , perhaps . Its very unaccustomedness and sweetness disturbed [her]113-marilla . [She]153-anne hastened to restore [her]153-anne sensations to their normal calm by inculcating a moral .

" If [you]153-anne 'll be [a good girl]2443-a good girl [you]153-anne 'll always be happy , [Anne]153-anne . And [you]153-anne should never find it hard to say [your]153-anne prayers . "[113-marilla]

" Saying one 's prayers is n't exactly the same thing as praying , "[153-anne] said [Anne]153-anne meditatively . " But [I]153-anne 'm going to imagine that [I]153-anne 'm the wind that is blowing up there in those tree tops . When [I]153-anne get tired of the trees [I]153-anne 'll imagine [I]153-anne 'm gently waving down here in the ferns -- and then [I]153-anne 'll fly over to [[Mrs. Lynde]153-anne 's garden]2651-mrs. lynde 's garden and set the flowers dancing -- and then [I]153-anne 'll go with one great swoop over [the clover field]2652-the clover field -- and then [I]153-anne 'll blow over [the Lake of [Shining Waters]25-shining waters]2236-the lake of shining waters and ripple it all up into little sparkling waves . Oh , there 's so much scope for imagination in a wind ! So [I]153-anne 'll not talk any more just now , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[153-anne]

" Thanks be to goodness for that , "[113-marilla] breathed [Marilla]113-marilla in devout relief .

CHAPTER XI . [Anne]153-anne 's Impressions of [Sunday - School]2493-sunday - school

" WELL , how do [you]153-anne like them ? "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla .

[Anne]153-anne was standing in [the gable room]740-the gable room , looking solemnly at three new dresses spread out on the bed . One was of snuffy colored gingham which [Marilla]113-marilla had been tempted to buy from [a peddler]741-a peddler the preceding summer because it looked so serviceable ; one was of black - and - white checkered sateen which [she]113-marilla had picked up at a bargain counter in the winter ; and one was a stiff print of an ugly blue shade which [she]113-marilla had purchased that week at [a Carmody store]742-a carmody store .

[She]113-marilla had made them up [herself]113-marilla , and they were all made alike -- plain skirts fulled tightly to plain waists , with sleeves as plain as waist and skirt and tight as sleeves could be .

" [I]153-anne 'll imagine that [I]153-anne like them , "[153-anne] said [Anne]153-anne soberly .

" [I]113-marilla do n't want [you]153-anne to imagine it , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , offended . " Oh , [I]113-marilla can see [you]153-anne do n't like the dresses ! What is the matter with them ? Are n't they neat and clean and new ? "[113-marilla]

" Yes . "[153-anne]

" Then why do n't [you]113-marilla like [them]2654-they're ? "[113-marilla]

" [They're]2654-they're -- [they're]2654-they're not -- pretty , "[153-anne] said [Anne]153-anne reluctantly .

" Pretty ! "[113-marilla] [Marilla]113-marilla sniffed . " [I]113-marilla did n't trouble [my]113-marilla head about getting pretty dresses for [you]153-anne . [I]113-marilla do n't believe in pampering vanity , [Anne]153-anne , [I]113-marilla 'll tell [you]153-anne that right off . Those dresses are good , sensible , serviceable dresses , without any frills or furbelows about them , and they 're all [you]153-anne 'll get this summer . The brown gingham and the blue print will do [you]153-anne for school when [you]153-anne begin to go . The sateen is for [church]2482-church and [Sunday school]2656-sunday school . [I]113-marilla 'll expect [you]153-anne to keep them neat and clean and not to tear them . [I]113-marilla should think [you]153-anne 'd be grateful to get most anything after those skimpy wincey things [you]153-anne 've been wearing . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , [I]153-anne _ am _ grateful , "[153-anne] protested [Anne]153-anne . " But [I]153-anne 'd be ever so much gratefuller if -- if [you]153-anne 'd made just one of them with puffed sleeves . Puffed sleeves are so fashionable now . It would give [me]153-anne such a thrill , [Marilla]113-marilla , just to wear a dress with puffed sleeves . "[153-anne]

" Well , [you]153-anne 'll have to do without [your]153-anne thrill . [I]113-marilla had n't any material to waste on puffed sleeves . [I]113-marilla think they are ridiculous - looking things anyhow . [I]113-marilla prefer the plain , sensible ones . "[113-marilla]

" But [I]153-anne 'd rather look ridiculous when [everybody else]2657-everybody else does than plain and sensible all by [myself]153-anne , "[153-anne] persisted [Anne]153-anne mournfully .

" Trust [you]153-anne for that ! Well , hang those dresses carefully up in [[your]153-anne closet]2658-your closet , and then sit down and learn the Sunday school lesson . [I]113-marilla got a quarterly from [Mr. Bell]154-mr. bell for [you]153-anne and [you]153-anne 'll go to [Sunday school]2656-sunday school tomorrow , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , disappearing [downstairs]2619-downstairs in high dudgeon .

[Anne]153-anne clasped [her]153-anne hands and looked at the dresses .

" [I]153-anne did hope there would be a white one with puffed sleeves , "[153-anne] [she]153-anne whispered disconsolately . " [I]153-anne prayed for one , but [I]153-anne did n't much expect it on that account . [I]153-anne did n't suppose [God]145-god would have time to bother about [a little orphan girl]2660-a little orphan girl 's dress . [I]153-anne knew [I]153-anne 'd just have to depend on [Marilla]113-marilla for it . Well , fortunately [I]153-anne can imagine that one of them is of snow - white muslin with lovely lace frills and three - puffed sleeves . "[153-anne]

The next morning warnings of a sick headache prevented [Marilla]113-marilla from going to [Sunday - school]2493-sunday - school with [Anne]153-anne .

" [You]153-anne 'll have to go down and call for [Mrs. Lynde]153-anne , [Anne]153-anne , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said . " [She]153-anne 'll see that [you]153-anne get into the right class . Now , mind [you]153-anne behave [yourself]153-anne properly . Stay to preaching afterwards and ask [Mrs. Lynde]153-anne to show [you]153-anne [[our]2661-our pew]2662-our pew . Here 's a cent for collection . Do n't stare at [people]2012-people and do n't fidget . [I]113-marilla shall expect [you]153-anne to tell [me]113-marilla the text when [you]153-anne come [home]361-home . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]153-anne started off irreproachable , arrayed in the stiff black - and - white sateen , which , while decent as regards length and certainly not open to the charge of skimpiness , contrived to emphasize every corner and angle of [her]153-anne thin figure . [Her]153-anne hat was a little , flat , glossy , new sailor , the extreme plainness of which had likewise much disappointed [Anne]153-anne , who had permitted [herself]153-anne secret visions of ribbon and flowers . The latter , however , were supplied before [Anne]153-anne reached [the main road]745-the main road , for being confronted halfway down [the lane]380-the lane with a golden frenzy of wind - stirred buttercups and a glory of wild roses , [Anne]153-anne promptly and liberally garlanded [her]153-anne hat with a heavy wreath of them . Whatever [other people]2168-other people might have thought of the result it satisfied [Anne]153-anne , and [she]153-anne tripped gaily down [the road]413-the road , holding [her]153-anne ruddy head with its decoration of pink and yellow very proudly .

When [she]153-anne had reached [[Mrs. Lynde]153-anne 's house]749-mrs. lynde 's house [she]153-anne found [that lady]686-that lady gone . Nothing daunted , [Anne]153-anne proceeded onward to [the church]751-the church alone . In [the porch]752-the porch [she]153-anne found [a crowd of [little girls]472-little girls , all more or less gaily attired in whites and blues and pinks , and all staring with curious eyes at [this stranger in [their]753-a crowd of little girls , all more or less gaily attired in whites and blues and pinks , and all staring with curious eyes at this stranger in their midst , with her extraordinary head adornment midst]755-this stranger in their midst , with [her]755-this stranger in their midst extraordinary head adornment]753-a crowd of little girls , all more or less gaily attired in whites and blues and pinks , and all staring with curious eyes at this stranger in their midst , with her extraordinary head adornment . [Avonlea little girls]756-avonlea little girls had already heard queer stories about [Anne]153-anne . [Mrs. Lynde]153-anne said [she]153-anne had an awful temper ; [Jerry Buote]125-jerry , [the hired boy at [Green Gables]107-matthew]757-the hired boy at green gables , said [she]153-anne talked all the time to [herself]153-anne or to the trees and flowers like [a crazy girl]758-a crazy girl . [They]756-avonlea little girls looked at [her]153-anne and whispered to each other behind [[their]756-avonlea little girls quarterlies]759-their quarterlies . [Nobody]2118-nobody made any friendly advances , then or later on when the opening exercises were over and [Anne]153-anne found [herself]153-anne in [[Miss Rogerson]155-miss rogerson 's class]761-miss rogerson 's class .

[Miss Rogerson]155-miss rogerson was [a middle - aged lady who had taught [a Sunday - school class]763-a sunday - school class for twenty years]762-a middle - aged lady who had taught a sunday - school class for twenty years . [Her]155-miss rogerson method of teaching was to ask the printed questions from the quarterly and look sternly over its edge at [the particular little girl [she]155-miss rogerson thought ought to answer the question]764-the particular little girl she thought ought to answer the question . [She]155-miss rogerson looked very often at [Anne]153-anne , and [Anne]153-anne , thanks to [Marilla]113-marilla 's drilling , answered promptly ; but it may be questioned if [she]153-anne understood very much about either question or answer .

[She]153-anne did not think [she]153-anne liked [Miss Rogerson]155-miss rogerson , and [she]153-anne felt very miserable ; [every other little girl in the class]765-every other little girl in the class had puffed sleeves . [Anne]153-anne felt that life was really not worth living without puffed sleeves .

" Well , how did [you]153-anne like [Sunday school]2656-sunday school ? "[113-marilla] [Marilla]113-marilla wanted to know when [Anne]153-anne came [home]361-home . [Her]153-anne wreath having faded , [Anne]153-anne had discarded it in [the lane]380-the lane , so [Marilla]113-marilla was spared the knowledge of that for a time .

" [I]113-marilla did n't like it a bit . It was horrid . "[113-marilla]

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne ! "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla rebukingly .

[Anne]124-anne sat down on the rocker with a long sigh , kissed one of [Bonny]127-bonny 's leaves , and waved [her]124-anne hand to a blossoming fuchsia .

" [They]2666-they might have been lonesome while [I]124-anne was away , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne explained . " And now about [the Sunday school]2667-the sunday school . [I]124-anne behaved well , just as [you]113-marilla told [me]124-anne . [Mrs. Lynde]153-anne was gone , but [I]124-anne went right on [myself]124-anne . [I]124-anne went into [the church]751-the church , with [a lot of [other little girls]2670-other little girls]2669-a lot of other little girls , and [I]124-anne sat in the corner of a pew by the window while the opening exercises went on . [Mr. Bell]154-mr. bell made an awfully long prayer . [I]124-anne would have been dreadfully tired before [he]154-mr. bell got through if [I]124-anne had n't been sitting by that window . But it looked right out on [the Lake of Shining Waters]23-the lake of shining waters , so [I]124-anne just gazed at that and imagined all sorts of splendid things . "[124-anne]

" [You]113-marilla should n't have done anything of the sort . [You]113-marilla should have listened to [Mr. Bell]154-mr. bell . "[124-anne]

" But [he]154-mr. bell was n't talking to [me]153-anne , "[153-anne] protested [Anne]153-anne . " [He]154-mr. bell was talking to [God]145-god and [he]154-mr. bell did n't seem to be very much inter - ested in it , either . " Not out loud , [I]113-marilla hope , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla anxiously .

" Oh , no , just under [my]124-anne breath . "[124-anne]

" [You]124-anne should n't have been thinking about [your]124-anne sleeves in [Sunday school]2656-sunday school . [You]124-anne should have been attending to the lesson . [I]124-anne hope [you]124-anne knew it . "[124-anne]

" Oh , yes ; and [I]124-anne answered a lot of questions . [Miss Rogerson]155-miss rogerson asked ever so many . [I]124-anne do n't think it was fair for [her]155-miss rogerson to do all the asking . [I]124-anne told [her]155-miss rogerson [I]124-anne did n't , but [I]124-anne could recite , ? [The Dog]2679-the dog at [[His]2679-the dog Master]2680-his master 's Grave ' if [she]155-miss rogerson liked . That 's in the Third Royal Reader . It is n't a really truly religious piece of poetry , but it 's so sad and melancholy that it might as well be . [She]155-miss rogerson said it would n't do and [she]155-miss rogerson told [me]124-anne to learn the nineteenth paraphrase for next Sunday . [I]124-anne read it over in [church]2482-church afterwards and it 's splendid . There are two lines in particular that just thrill [me]124-anne .[124-anne]

" ? Quick as the slaughtered squadrons fell In [Midian]156-midian 's evil day . '[124-anne]

" [I]124-anne do n't know what ? squadrons ' means nor ? Midian , ' either , but it sounds _ so _ tragical . [I]124-anne can hardly wait until next Sunday to recite it . [I]124-anne 'll practice it all the week . After [Sunday school]2656-sunday school [I]124-anne asked [Miss Rogerson]155-miss rogerson -- because [Mrs. Lynde]153-anne was too far away -- to show [me]124-anne [[your]155-miss rogerson pew]2683-your pew . [I]124-anne sat just as still as [I]124-anne could and the text was Revelations , third chapter , second and third verses . It was a very long text . If [I]124-anne was [a minister]2514-a minister [I]124-anne 'd pick the short , snappy ones . The sermon was awfully long , too . [I]124-anne suppose [the minister]2502-the minister had to match it to the text . [I]124-anne did n't think [he]2502-the minister was a bit interesting . The trouble with [him]2502-the minister seems to be that [he]2502-the minister has n't enough imagination . [I]124-anne did n't listen to [him]2502-the minister very much . [I]124-anne just let [my]124-anne thoughts run and [I]124-anne thought of the most surprising things . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla felt helplessly that all this should be sternly reproved , but [she]113-marilla was hampered by the undeniable fact that some of the things [Anne]153-anne had said , especially about [the minister]2502-the minister 's sermons and [Mr. Bell]154-mr. bell 's prayers , were what [she]113-marilla [herself]113-marilla had really thought deep down in [her]113-marilla heart for years , but had never given expression to . It almost seemed to [her]113-marilla that those secret , unuttered , critical thoughts had suddenly taken visible and accusing shape and form in the person of [this outspoken morsel of neglected humanity]769-this outspoken morsel of neglected humanity .

CHAPTER XII . A Solemn Vow and Promise

|IT was not until the next Friday that [Marilla]113-marilla heard the story of the flower - wreathed hat . [She]113-marilla came [home]361-home from [Mrs. Lynde]153-anne 's and called [Anne]153-anne to account .

" [Anne]153-anne , [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde says [you]153-anne went to [church]2482-church last Sunday with [your]153-anne hat rigged out ridiculous with roses and buttercups . What on earth put [you]153-anne up to such a caper ? A pretty - looking object [you]153-anne must have been ! "[769-this outspoken morsel of neglected humanity]

" Oh . [I]153-anne know pink and yellow are n't becoming to [me]153-anne , "[153-anne] began [Anne]153-anne .

" Becoming fiddlesticks ! It was putting flowers on [your]153-anne hat at all , no matter what color they were , that was ridiculous . [You]153-anne are [the most aggravating child]2687-the most aggravating child ! "[769-this outspoken morsel of neglected humanity]

" [I]153-anne do n't see why it 's any more ridiculous to wear flowers on [your]153-anne hat than on [your]153-anne dress , "[153-anne] protested [Anne]153-anne . " Lots of [little girls]472-little girls there had bouquets pinned on [their]472-little girls dresses . What 's the difference ? "[153-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla was not to be drawn from the safe concrete into dubious paths of the abstract .

" Do n't answer [me]769-this outspoken morsel of neglected humanity back like that , [Anne]153-anne . It was very silly of [you]153-anne to do such a thing . Never let [me]769-this outspoken morsel of neglected humanity catch [you]153-anne at such a trick again . [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde says [she]105-mrs. lynde thought [she]105-mrs. lynde would sink through the floor when [she]105-mrs. lynde saw [you]153-anne come in all rigged out like that . [She]105-mrs. lynde could n't get near enough to tell [you]153-anne to take [them]2689-them off till it was too late . [She]105-mrs. lynde says [people]2012-people talked about it something dreadful . Of course [they]2012-people would think [I]769-this outspoken morsel of neglected humanity had no better sense than to let [you]153-anne go decked out like that . "[769-this outspoken morsel of neglected humanity]

" Oh , [I]153-anne 'm so sorry , "[153-anne] said [Anne]153-anne , tears welling into [her]153-anne eyes . " [I]153-anne never thought [you]153-anne 'd mind . The roses and buttercups were so sweet and pretty [I]153-anne thought they 'd look lovely on [my]153-anne hat . [Lots of [the little girls]2692-the little girls]2691-lots of the little girls had artificial flowers on [their]2691-lots of the little girls hats . [I]153-anne 'm afraid [I]153-anne 'm going to be a dreadful trial to [you]153-anne . Maybe [you]153-anne 'd better send [me]153-anne back to [the asylum]2024-the asylum . That would be terrible ; [I]153-anne do n't think [I]153-anne could endure it ; most likely [I]153-anne would go into consumption ; [I]153-anne 'm so thin as it is , [you]153-anne see . But that would be better than being a trial to [you]153-anne . "[153-anne]

" Nonsense , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , vexed at [herself]113-marilla for having made [the child]460-the child cry . " [I]113-marilla do n't want to send [you]153-anne back to [the asylum]2024-the asylum , [I]113-marilla 'm sure . All [I]113-marilla want is that [you]153-anne should behave like [other little girls]2670-other little girls and not make [yourself]153-anne ridiculous . Do n't cry any more . [I]113-marilla 've got some news for [you]153-anne . [Diana Barry]120-diana came [home]361-home this afternoon . [I]113-marilla 'm going up to see if [I]113-marilla can borrow a skirt pattern from [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry , and if [you]153-anne like [you]153-anne can come with [me]113-marilla and get acquainted with [Diana]120-diana . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]153-anne rose to [her]153-anne feet , with clasped hands , the tears still glistening on [her]153-anne cheeks ; the dish towel [she]153-anne had been hemming slipped unheeded to the floor .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]153-anne 'm frightened -- now that it has come [I]153-anne 'm actually frightened . What if [she]120-diana should n't like [me]153-anne ! It would be the most tragical disappointment of [my]153-anne life . "[153-anne]

" Now , do n't get into a fluster . And [I]153-anne do wish [you]153-anne would n't use such long words . It sounds so funny in [a little girl]2083-a little girl . [I]153-anne guess [Diana]120-diana ? ll like [you]153-anne well enough . It 's [[her]120-diana mother]2342-her mother [you]153-anne 've got to reckon with . If [she]120-diana does n't like [you]153-anne it wo n't matter how much [Diana]120-diana does . If [she]120-diana has heard about [your]153-anne outburst to [Mrs. Lynde]153-anne and going to [church]2482-church with buttercups round [your]153-anne hat [I]153-anne do n't know what [she]120-diana 'll think of [you]153-anne . [You]153-anne must be polite and well behaved , and do n't make any of [your]153-anne startling speeches . For pity 's sake , if [the child]460-the child is n't actually trembling ! "[153-anne]

[Anne]153-anne _ was _ trembling . [Her]153-anne face was pale and tense .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [you]113-marilla 'd be excited , too , if [you]113-marilla were going to meet [a little girl [you]113-marilla hoped to be [[your]113-marilla bosom friend]2702-your bosom friend and whose mother might n't like [you]113-marilla , "[153-anne] [she]153-anne said as [she]153-anne hastened to get [her]153-anne hat]2701-a little girl you hoped to be your bosom friend and whose mother might n't like you , " she said as she hastened to get her hat .

[They]772-they went over to [Orchard Slope]24-orchard slope by [the short cut across [the brook]394-the brook]773-the short cut across the brook and up [the firry hill grove]775-the firry hill grove . [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry came to the [kitchen]691-kitchen door in answer to [Marilla]113-marilla 's knock . [She]118-mrs. barry was [a tall black - eyed , black - haired woman , with a very resolute mouth]777-a tall black - eyed , black - haired woman , with a very resolute mouth . [She]118-mrs. barry had the reputation of being very strict with [[her]118-mrs. barry children]2375-her children .

" How do [you]113-marilla do , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[118-mrs. barry] [she]118-mrs. barry said cordially . " Come in . And this is [the little girl [you]113-marilla have adopted]2703-the little girl you have adopted , [I]118-mrs. barry suppose ? "[118-mrs. barry]

" Yes , this is [Anne Shirley]124-anne , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla .

" Spelled with an E , "[124-anne] gasped [Anne]124-anne , who , tremulous and excited as [she]124-anne was , was determined there should be no misunderstanding on that important point .

[Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry , not hearing or not comprehending , merely shook hands and said kindly :

" How are [you]113-marilla ? "[118-mrs. barry]

" [I]124-anne am well in body although considerable rumpled up in spirit , thank [you]118-mrs. barry [ma'am]2704-ma'am , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne gravely . Then aside to [Marilla]113-marilla in an audible whisper , " There was n't anything startling in that , was there , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[113-marilla]

[Diana]120-diana was sitting on the sofa , reading a book which [she]120-diana dropped when [the callers]779-the callers entered . [She]120-diana was [a very pretty little girl]2530-a very pretty little girl , with [[her]120-diana mother]2342-her mother 's black eyes and hair , and rosy cheeks , and the merry expression which was [her]120-diana inheritance from [[her]120-diana father]782-her father .

" This is [[my]118-mrs. barry little girl]2705-my little girl [Diana]120-diana , "[118-mrs. barry] said [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry . " [Diana]120-diana , [you]120-diana might take [Anne]124-anne out into [the garden]573-the garden and show [her]124-anne [your]120-diana flowers . It will be better for [you]120-diana than straining [your]120-diana eyes over that book . [She]124-anne reads entirely too much-- "[118-mrs. barry] this to [Marilla]113-marilla as [the little girls]2692-the little girls went out--"and [I]118-mrs. barry ca n't prevent [her]113-marilla , for [[her]113-marilla father]782-her father aids and abets [her]113-marilla . [She]113-marilla 's always poring over a book . [I]118-mrs. barry 'm glad [she]113-marilla has the prospect of [a playmate]2708-a playmate -- perhaps it will take [her]113-marilla more out - of - doors . "[118-mrs. barry]

Outside in [the garden]573-the garden , which was full of mellow sunset light streaming through the dark old firs to the west of [it]573-the garden , stood [Anne]124-anne and [Diana]120-diana , gazing bashfully at [each other]535-each other over a clump of gorgeous tiger lilies .

[The Barry garden]786-the barry garden was a bowery wilderness of flowers which would have delighted [Anne]124-anne 's heart at any time less fraught with destiny . [It]786-the barry garden was encircled by huge old willows and tall firs , beneath which flourished flowers that loved the shade . Prim , right - angled paths neatly bordered with clamshells , intersected [it]786-the barry garden like moist red ribbons and in the beds between old - fashioned flowers ran riot . There were rosy bleeding - hearts and great splendid crimson peonies ; white , fragrant narcissi and thorny , sweet Scotch roses ; pink and blue and white columbines and lilac - tinted Bouncing Bets ; clumps of southernwood and ribbon grass and mint ; purple Adam - and - Eve , daffodils , and masses of sweet clover white with its delicate , fragrant , feathery sprays ; scarlet lightning that shot its fiery lances over prim white musk - flowers ; [a garden]787-a garden [it]786-the barry garden was where sunshine lingered and bees hummed , and winds , beguiled into loitering , purred and rustled .

" Oh , [Diana]120-diana , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne at last , clasping [her]124-anne hands and speaking almost in a whisper , " oh , do [you]120-diana think [you]120-diana can like [me]124-anne a little -- enough to be [[my]124-anne bosom friend]2571-my bosom friend ? "[124-anne]

[Diana]120-diana laughed . [Diana]120-diana always laughed before [she]120-diana spoke .

" Why , [I]120-diana guess so , "[120-diana] [she]120-diana said frankly . " [I]120-diana 'm awfully glad [you]120-diana 've come to live at [Green Gables]107-matthew . It will be jolly to have [somebody]436-somebody to play with . There is n't [any other girl who lives near enough to play with]2711-any other girl who lives near enough to play with , and [I]120-diana 've [no sisters big enough]2712-no sisters big enough . "[120-diana]

" Will [you]120-diana swear to be [[my]124-anne friend]2713-my friend forever and ever ? "[124-anne] demanded [Anne]124-anne eagerly .

[Diana]120-diana looked shocked .

" Why it 's dreadfully wicked to swear , "[120-diana] [she]120-diana said rebukingly .

" Oh no , not [my]120-diana kind of swearing . There are two kinds , [you]120-diana know . "[120-diana]

" [I]120-diana never heard of but one kind , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana doubtfully .

" There really is another . Oh , it is n't wicked at all . It just means vowing and promising solemnly . "[120-diana]

" Well , [I]120-diana do n't mind doing that , "[120-diana] agreed [Diana]120-diana , relieved . " How do [you]120-diana do it ? "[120-diana]

" [We]2714-we must join hands -- so , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne gravely . " It ought to be over running water . [We]2714-we 'll just imagine [this path]2715-this path is running water . [I]124-anne 'll repeat the oath first . [I]124-anne solemnly swear to be faithful to [[my]124-anne bosom friend]2571-my bosom friend , [Diana Barry]120-diana , as long as the sun and moon shall endure . Now [you]120-diana say it and put [my]124-anne name in . "[124-anne]

[Diana]120-diana repeated the " oath "[120-diana] with a laugh fore and aft . Then [she]120-diana said :

" [You]120-diana 're [a queer girl]2717-a queer girl , [Anne]124-anne . [I]120-diana heard before that [you]120-diana were queer . But [I]120-diana believe [I]120-diana 'm going to like [you]120-diana real well . "[120-diana]

When [Marilla]113-marilla and [Anne]124-anne went [home]361-home [Diana]120-diana went with [them]789-them as far as [the log bridge]790-the log bridge . [The two little girls]791-the two little girls walked with [their]791-the two little girls arms about [each other]535-each other . At [the brook]394-the brook [they]791-the two little girls parted with many promises to spend the next afternoon together .

" Well , did [you]120-diana find [Diana]120-diana a kindred spirit ? "[113-marilla] asked [Marilla]113-marilla as [they]791-the two little girls went up through [the garden of Green Gables]794-the garden of green gables .

" Oh yes , "[124-anne] sighed [Anne]124-anne , blissfully unconscious of any sarcasm on [Marilla]113-marilla 's part . " Oh [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne 'm [the happiest girl on [Prince Edward Island]16-prince edward island]2718-the happiest girl on prince edward island this very moment . [I]124-anne assure [you]113-marilla [I]124-anne 'll say [my]124-anne prayers with a right good - will tonight . [Diana]120-diana and [I]124-anne are going to build [a playhouse in [Mr. William Bell]154-mr. bell 's [birch grove]2720-birch grove]2719-a playhouse in mr. william bell 's birch grove tomorrow . Can [I]124-anne have those broken pieces of china that are out in the woodshed ? [Diana]120-diana 's birthday is in February and [mine]124-anne is in March . Do n't [you]113-marilla think that is a very strange coincidence ? [Diana]120-diana is going to lend [me]124-anne a book to read . [She]120-diana says it 's perfectly splendid and tremendously exciting . [She]120-diana 's going to show [me]124-anne a place back in [the woods]373-the woods where rice lilies grow . Do n't [you]113-marilla think [Diana]120-diana has got very soulful eyes ? [I]124-anne wish [I]124-anne had soulful eyes . [Diana]120-diana is going to teach [me]124-anne to sing a song called ? [Nelly]2722-nelly in [the Hazel Dell]43-the hazel dell . ' [She]120-diana 's going to give [me]124-anne a picture to put up in [[my]124-anne room]2723-my room ; it 's a perfectly beautiful picture , [she]120-diana says -- [a lovely lady in a pale blue silk dress]2724-a lovely lady in a pale blue silk dress . [A sewing - machine agent]2725-a sewing - machine agent gave it to [her]120-diana . [I]124-anne wish [I]124-anne had something to give [Diana]120-diana . [I]124-anne 'm an inch taller than [Diana]120-diana , but [she]120-diana is ever so much fatter ; [she]120-diana says [she]120-diana 'd like to be thin because it 's so much more graceful , but [I]124-anne 'm afraid [she]120-diana only said it to soothe [my]124-anne feelings . [We]2726-we 're going to [the shore]2727-the shore some day to gather shells . [We]2726-we have agreed to call the spring down by the log bridge [the Dryad 's Bubble]2728-the dryad 's bubble . Is n't that a perfectly elegant name ? [I]124-anne read a story once about a spring called that . [A dryad]2729-a dryad is sort of [a grown - up fairy]2730-a grown - up fairy , [I]124-anne think . "[124-anne]

" Well , all [I]113-marilla hope is [you]124-anne wo n't talk [Diana]120-diana to death , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " But remember this in all [your]124-anne planning , [Anne]124-anne . [You]124-anne 're not going to play all the time nor most of it . [You]124-anne 'll have [your]124-anne work to do and it 'll have to be done first . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne 's cup of happiness was full , and [Matthew]107-matthew caused it to overflow . [He]107-matthew had just got [home]361-home from a trip to [the store at [Carmody]5-carmody]796-the store at carmody , and [he]107-matthew sheepishly produced a small parcel from [his]107-matthew pocket and handed it to [Anne]124-anne , with a deprecatory look at [Marilla]113-marilla .

" [I]107-matthew heard [you]124-anne say [you]124-anne liked chocolate sweeties , so [I]107-matthew got [you]124-anne some , "[107-matthew] [he]107-matthew said .

" Humph , "[113-marilla] sniffed [Marilla]113-marilla . " It 'll ruin [her]113-marilla teeth and stomach . There , there , [child]2497-child , do n't look so dismal . [You]2497-child can eat those , since [Matthew]107-matthew has gone and got them . [He]107-matthew 'd better have brought [you]2497-child peppermints . They 're wholesomer . Do n't sicken [yourself]2497-child eating all them at once now . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , no , indeed , [I]124-anne wo n't , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne eagerly . " [I]124-anne 'll just eat one tonight , [Marilla]113-marilla . And [I]124-anne can give [Diana]120-diana half of them , ca n't [I]124-anne ? The other half will taste twice as sweet to [me]124-anne if [I]124-anne give some to [her]120-diana . It 's delightful to think [I]124-anne have something to give [her]120-diana . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla will say it for [the child]460-the child , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla when [Anne]124-anne had gone to [[her]124-anne gable]797-her gable , " [she]460-the child is n't stingy . [I]113-marilla 'm glad , for of all faults [I]113-marilla detest stinginess in [a child]2075-a child . Dear [me]113-marilla , it 's only three weeks since [she]120-diana came , and it seems as if [she]120-diana 'd been [here]2022-here always . [I]113-marilla ca n't imagine [the place]2249-the place without [her]120-diana . Now , do n't be looking [I]113-marilla told - [you]2736-you - so , [Matthew]107-matthew . That 's bad enough in [a woman]2294-a woman , but it is n't to be endured in [a man]2052-a man .
