"[113-marilla]

CHAPTER XIII . The Delights of [Anticipation]157-anticipation

" IT 'S time [Anne]124-anne was in to do [her]124-anne sewing , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , glancing at the clock and then out into the yellow August afternoon where everything drowsed in the heat . " [She]124-anne stayed playing with [Diana]120-diana more than half an hour more ? n [I]113-marilla gave [her]124-anne leave to ; and now [she]124-anne 's perched out there on the woodpile talking to [Matthew]107-matthew , nineteen to the dozen , when [she]124-anne knows perfectly well [she]124-anne ought to be at [her]124-anne work . And of course [he]107-matthew 's listening to [her]124-anne like [a perfect ninny]2740-a perfect ninny . [I]113-marilla never saw such [an infatuated man]2741-an infatuated man . The more [she]124-anne talks and the odder the things [she]124-anne says , the more [he]107-matthew 's delighted evidently . [Anne Shirley]124-anne , [you]124-anne come right in here this minute , do [you]124-anne hear [me]113-marilla ! "[113-marilla]

A series of staccato taps on the west window brought [Anne]124-anne flying in from [the yard]2099-the yard , eyes shining , cheeks faintly flushed with pink , unbraided hair streaming behind [her]124-anne in a torrent of brightness .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne exclaimed breathlessly , " there 's going to be a Sunday - school picnic next week -- in [[Mr. Harmon Andrews]158-mr. harmon andrews 's field]2742-mr. harmon andrews 's field , right near [the lake of [Shining Waters]25-shining waters]2236-the lake of shining waters . And [Mrs. Superintendent Bell]159-mrs. superintendent bell and [Mrs. Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde are going to make ice cream -- think of it , [Marilla--_ice]160-marilla--_ice cream ! _ And , oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , can [I]124-anne go to it ? "[124-anne]

" Just look at the clock , if [you]124-anne please , [Anne]124-anne . What time did [I]113-marilla tell [you]124-anne to come in ? "[113-marilla]

" Two o'clock -- but is n't it splendid about the picnic , [Marilla]113-marilla ? Please can [I]124-anne go ? Oh , [I]124-anne 've never been to a picnic -- [I've]124-anne dreamed of picnics , but [I]124-anne 've never-- "[124-anne]

" Yes , [I]113-marilla told [you]124-anne to come at two o'clock . And it 's a quarter to three . [I]113-marilla 'd like to know why [you]124-anne did n't obey [me]113-marilla , [Anne]124-anne . "[113-marilla]

" Why , [I]124-anne meant to , [Marilla]113-marilla , as much as could be . But [you]124-anne have no idea how fascinating [Idlewild]45-idlewild is . And then , of course , [I]124-anne had to tell [Matthew]107-matthew about the picnic . [Matthew]107-matthew is such [a sympathetic listener]2744-a sympathetic listener . Please can [I]124-anne go ? "[124-anne]

" [You]124-anne 'll have to learn to resist the fascination of Idle - whatever - [you]124-anne - call - it . When [I]113-marilla tell [you]124-anne to come in at a certain time [I]113-marilla mean that time and not half an hour later . And [you]124-anne need n't stop to discourse with [sympathetic listeners]2745-sympathetic listeners on [your]124-anne way , either . As for the picnic , of course [you]124-anne can go . [You]124-anne 're [a Sunday - school scholar]2746-a sunday - school scholar , and it 's not likely [I]113-marilla 'd refuse to let [you]124-anne go when [all the other little girls]2678-all the other little girls are going . "[113-marilla]

" But -- but , "[124-anne] faltered [Anne]124-anne , " [Diana]120-diana says that [everybody]2130-everybody must take a basket of things to eat . [I]124-anne ca n't cook , as [you]124-anne know , [Marilla]113-marilla , and -- and -- [I]124-anne do n't mind going to a picnic without puffed sleeves so much , but [I]124-anne 'd feel terribly humiliated if [I]124-anne had to go without a basket . It 's been preying on [my]124-anne mind ever since [Diana]120-diana told [me]124-anne . "[124-anne]

" Well , it need n't prey any longer . [I]124-anne 'll bake [you]124-anne a basket . "[124-anne]

" Oh , [you]124-anne dear good [Marilla]113-marilla . Oh , [you]124-anne are so kind to [me]124-anne . Oh , [I]124-anne 'm so much obliged to [you]124-anne . "[124-anne]

Getting through with [her]124-anne " ohs "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne cast [herself]124-anne into [Marilla]113-marilla 's arms and rapturously kissed [her]113-marilla sallow cheek . It was the first time in [her]124-anne whole life that childish lips had voluntarily touched [Marilla]113-marilla 's face . Again that sudden sensation of startling sweetness thrilled [her]124-anne . [She]124-anne was secretly vastly pleased at [Anne]124-anne 's impulsive caress , which was probably the reason why [she]124-anne said brusquely :

" There , there , never mind [your]124-anne kissing nonsense . [I]124-anne 'd sooner see [you]124-anne doing strictly as [you]124-anne 're told . As for cooking , [I]124-anne mean to begin giving [you]124-anne lessons in that some of these days . But [you]124-anne 're so featherbrained , [Anne]124-anne , [I]124-anne 've been waiting to see if [you]124-anne 'd sober down a little and learn to be steady before [I]124-anne begin . [You]124-anne 've got to keep [your]124-anne wits about [you]124-anne in cooking and not stop in the middle of things to let [your]124-anne thoughts rove all over creation . Now , get out [your]124-anne patchwork and have [your]124-anne square done before teatime . "[124-anne]

" [I]124-anne do _ not _ like patchwork , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne dolefully , hunting out [her]124-anne workbasket and sitting down before a little heap of red and white diamonds with a sigh . " [I]124-anne think some kinds of sewing would be nice ; but there 's no scope for imagination in patchwork . It 's just one little seam after another and [you]124-anne never seem to be getting anywhere . But of course [I]124-anne 'd rather be [Anne of Green Gables]124-anne sewing patchwork than [Anne]124-anne of any other place with nothing to do but play . [I]124-anne wish time went as quick sewing patches as it does when [I]124-anne 'm playing with [Diana]120-diana , though . Oh , [we]2749-we do have such elegant times , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]124-anne have to furnish most of the imagination , but [I]124-anne 'm well able to do that . [Diana]120-diana is simply perfect in every other way . [You]124-anne know that little piece of land across [the brook]394-the brook that runs up between [[our]2749-we farm and [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry 's]2751-our farm and mr. barry 's . It belongs to [Mr. William Bell]154-mr. bell , and right in the corner there is a little ring of white birch trees -- [the most romantic spot]2752-the most romantic spot , [Marilla]110-marilla . [Diana]120-diana and [I]124-anne have [[our]2749-we playhouse]2753-our playhouse there . [We]2749-we call it [Idlewild]45-idlewild . Is n't that a poetical name ? [I]124-anne assure [you]124-anne it took [me]124-anne some time to think it out . [I]124-anne stayed awake nearly a whole night before [I]124-anne invented it . Then , just as [I]124-anne was dropping off to sleep , it came like an inspiration . [Diana]120-diana was _ enraptured _ when [she]120-diana heard it . [We]2749-we have got [[our]2749-we house]2754-our house fixed up elegantly . [You]124-anne must come and see it , [Marilla]113-marilla -- won't [you]124-anne ? [We]2749-we have great big stones , all covered with moss , for seats , and boards from tree to tree for shelves . And [we]2749-we have all [our]2749-we dishes on them . Of course , they 're all broken but it 's the easiest thing in [the world]409-the world to imagine that they are whole . There 's a piece of a plate with a spray of red and yellow ivy on it that is especially beautiful . [We]2749-we keep it in [the parlor]622-the parlor and [we]2749-we have the fairy glass there , too . The fairy glass is as lovely as a dream . [Diana]120-diana found it out in [the woods behind [[their]2749-we chicken house]2758-their chicken house]2757-the woods behind their chicken house . It 's all full of rainbows -- just little young rainbows that have n't grown big yet -- and [[Diana]120-diana 's mother]2759-diana 's mother told [her]120-diana it was broken off a hanging lamp [they]2749-we once had . But it 's nice to imagine [the fairies]2760-the fairies lost it one night when [they]2760-the fairies had a ball , so [we]2749-we call it the fairy glass . [Matthew]107-matthew is going to make [us]2749-we a table . Oh , [we]2749-we have named [that little round pool over in [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry 's field Willowmere]2761-that little round pool over in mr. barry 's field willowmere . [I]124-anne got that name out of the book [Diana]120-diana lent [me]124-anne . That was a thrilling book , [Marilla]113-marilla . [The heroine]2762-the heroine had [five lovers]2763-five lovers . [I]124-anne 'd be satisfied with one , would n't [you]2764-you ? [She]2762-the heroine was very handsome and [she]2762-the heroine went through great tribulations . [She]2762-the heroine could faint as easy as anything . [I]124-anne 'd love to be able to faint , would n't [you]2764-you , [Marilla]113-marilla ? It 's so romantic . But [I]124-anne 'm really very healthy for all [I]124-anne 'm so thin . [I]124-anne believe [I]124-anne 'm getting fatter , though . Do n't [you]2764-you think [I]124-anne am ? [I]124-anne look at [my]124-anne elbows every morning when [I]124-anne get up to see if any dimples are coming . [Diana]120-diana is having a new dress made with elbow sleeves . [She]120-diana is going to wear it to the picnic . Oh , [I]124-anne do hope it will be fine next Wednesday . [I]124-anne do n't feel that [I]124-anne could endure the disappointment if anything happened to prevent [me]124-anne from getting to the picnic . [I]124-anne suppose [I]124-anne 'd live through it , but [I]124-anne 'm certain it would be a lifelong sorrow . It would n't matter if [I]124-anne got to [a hundred picnics]2765-a hundred picnics in after years ; [they]2765-a hundred picnics would n't make up for missing this one . [They]2765-a hundred picnics 're going to have boats on [the Lake of Shining Waters]23-the lake of shining waters -- and ice cream , as [I]124-anne told [you]124-anne . [I]124-anne have never tasted ice cream . [Diana]120-diana tried to explain what it was like , but [I]124-anne guess ice cream is one of those things that are beyond imagination . "[124-anne]

" [Anne]124-anne , [you]124-anne have talked even on for ten minutes by the clock , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " Now , just for curiosity 's sake , see if [you]124-anne can hold [your]124-anne tongue for the same length of time . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne held [her]124-anne tongue as desired . But for the rest of the week [she]124-anne talked picnic and thought picnic and dreamed picnic . On Saturday it rained and [she]124-anne worked [herself]124-anne up into such a frantic state lest it should keep on raining until and over Wednesday that [Marilla]113-marilla made [her]124-anne sew an extra patchwork square by way of steadying [her]124-anne nerves .

On Sunday [Anne]124-anne confided to [Marilla]113-marilla on the way [home]361-home from [church]2482-church that [she]124-anne grew actually cold all over with excitement when [the minister]2502-the minister announced the picnic from the pulpit .

" Such a thrill as went up and down [my]2502-the minister back , [Marilla]113-marilla ! [I]2502-the minister do n't think [I]2502-the minister 'd ever really believed until then that there was honestly going to be a picnic . [I]2502-the minister could n't help fearing [I]2502-the minister 'd only imagined it . But when [a minister]2514-a minister says a thing in the pulpit [you]2767-you just have to believe it . "[2502-the minister]

" [You]124-anne set [your]124-anne heart too much on things , [Anne]124-anne , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , with a sigh . " [I]113-marilla 'm afraid there 'll be a great many disappointments in store for [you]124-anne through life . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , looking forward to things is half the pleasure of them , "[124-anne] exclaimed [Anne]124-anne . " [You]2767-you may n't get the things [themselves]2767-you ; but nothing can prevent [you]2767-you from having the fun of looking forward to them . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says , ? Blessed are [they]2767-you who expect nothing for [they]2767-you shall not be disappointed . ' But [I]124-anne think it would be worse to expect nothing than to be disappointed . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla wore [her]113-marilla amethyst brooch to [church]2482-church that day as usual . [Marilla]113-marilla always wore [her]113-marilla amethyst brooch to [church]2482-church . [She]113-marilla would have thought it rather sacrilegious to leave it off -- as bad as forgetting [her]113-marilla Bible or [her]113-marilla collection dime . That amethyst brooch was [Marilla]113-marilla 's most treasured possession . [A seafaring uncle]804-a seafaring uncle had given it to [[her]113-marilla mother]2342-her mother who in turn had bequeathed it to [Marilla]113-marilla . It was an old - fashioned oval , containing a braid of [[her]113-marilla mother]2342-her mother 's hair , surrounded by a border of very fine amethysts . [Marilla]113-marilla knew too little about precious stones to realize how fine the amethysts actually were ; but [she]113-marilla thought them very beautiful and was always pleasantly conscious of their violet shimmer at [her]113-marilla throat , above [her]113-marilla good brown satin dress , even although [she]113-marilla could not see it .

[Anne]124-anne had been smitten with delighted admiration when [she]124-anne first saw that brooch .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , it 's a perfectly elegant brooch . [I]124-anne do n't know how [you]113-marilla can pay attention to the sermon or the prayers when [you]113-marilla have it on . [I]124-anne could n't , [I]124-anne know . [I]124-anne think amethysts are just sweet . They are what [I]124-anne used to think diamonds were like . Long ago , before [I]124-anne had ever seen a diamond , [I]124-anne read about them and [I]124-anne tried to imagine what they would be like . [I]124-anne thought they would be lovely glimmering purple stones . When [I]124-anne saw a real diamond in [a lady]2451-a lady 's ring one day [I]124-anne was so disappointed [I]124-anne cried . Of course , it was very lovely but it was n't [my]124-anne idea of a diamond . Will [you]113-marilla let [me]124-anne hold the brooch for one minute , [Marilla]113-marilla ? Do [you]113-marilla think amethysts can be the souls of [good violets]2769-good violets ? "[124-anne]

CHAPTER XIV . [Anne]124-anne 's Confession

|ON the Monday evening before the picnic [Marilla]113-marilla came down from [[her]113-marilla room]807-her room with a troubled face .

" [Anne]124-anne , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said to that small personage , who was shelling peas by the spotless table and singing , " [Nelly of the Hazel Dell]163-elaine "[113-marilla] with a vigor and expression that did credit to [Diana]120-diana 's teaching , " did [you]124-anne see anything of [my]113-marilla amethyst brooch ? [I]113-marilla thought [I]113-marilla stuck it in [my]113-marilla pincushion when [I]113-marilla came [home]361-home from [church]2482-church yesterday evening , but [I]113-marilla ca n't find it anywhere . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne -- [I]124-anne saw it this afternoon when [you]113-marilla were away at [the Aid Society]2772-the aid society , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , a little slowly . " [I]124-anne was passing [your]113-marilla door when [I]124-anne saw it on the cushion , so [I]124-anne went in to look at it . "[124-anne]

" Did [you]124-anne touch it ? "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla sternly .

" [Y]113-marilla - e - e - s , "[124-anne] admitted [Anne]124-anne , " [I]124-anne took it up and [I]124-anne pinned it on [my]124-anne breast just to see how it would look . "[124-anne]

" [You]113-marilla had no business to do anything of the sort . It 's very wrong in [a little girl]2083-a little girl to meddle . [You]113-marilla should n't have gone into [[my]113-marilla room]2723-my room in the first place and [you]113-marilla should n't have touched a brooch that did n't belong to [you]113-marilla in the second . Where did [you]124-anne put it ? "[113-marilla]

" Oh , [I]124-anne put it back on [the bureau]2775-the bureau . [I]124-anne had n't it on a minute . Truly , [I]124-anne did n't mean to meddle , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]124-anne did n't think about [its]2775-the bureau being wrong to go in and try on the brooch ; but [I]124-anne see now that it was and [I]124-anne 'll never do it again . That 's one good thing about [me]124-anne . [I]124-anne never do the same naughty thing twice . "[124-anne]

" [You]113-marilla did n't put it back , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " That brooch is n't anywhere on [the bureau]2775-the bureau . [You]113-marilla 've taken it out or something , [Anne]124-anne . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne did put it back , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne quickly -- pertly , [Marilla]113-marilla thought . " [I]113-marilla do n't just remember whether [I]113-marilla stuck it on the pincushion or laid it in the china tray . But [I]113-marilla 'm perfectly certain [I]113-marilla put it back . "[113-marilla]

" [I]113-marilla 'll go and have another look , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , determining to be just . " If [you]113-marilla put that brooch back it 's there still . If it is n't [I]113-marilla 'll know [you]113-marilla did n't , that 's all ! "[113-marilla]

[Marilla]113-marilla went to [[her]113-marilla room]807-her room and made a thorough search , not only over [the bureau]2775-the bureau but in every other place [she]113-marilla thought the brooch might possibly be . It was not to be found and [she]113-marilla returned to [the kitchen]557-the kitchen .

" [Anne]124-anne , the brooch is gone . By [your]124-anne own admission [you]124-anne were [the last person to handle it]2777-the last person to handle it . Now , what have [you]124-anne done with it ? Tell [me]113-marilla the truth at once . Did [you]124-anne take it out and lose it ? "[113-marilla]

" No , [I]124-anne did n't , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne solemnly , meeting [Marilla]113-marilla 's angry gaze squarely . " [I]124-anne never took the brooch out of [[your]124-anne room]2558-your room and that is the truth , if [I]124-anne was to be led to [the block]2779-the block for it -- although [I]124-anne 'm not very certain what a block is . So there , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne 's " so there "[124-anne] was only intended to emphasize [her]124-anne assertion , but [Marilla]113-marilla took it as a display of defiance .

" [I]113-marilla believe [you]124-anne are telling [me]113-marilla a falsehood , [Anne]124-anne , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said sharply . " [I]113-marilla know [you]124-anne are . [There]348-there now , do n't say anything more unless [you]124-anne are prepared to tell the whole truth . Go to [[your]124-anne room]2558-your room and stay there until [you]124-anne are ready to confess . "[113-marilla]

" Will [I]124-anne take the peas with [me]124-anne ? "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne meekly .

" No , [I]113-marilla 'll finish shelling them [myself]113-marilla . Do as [I]113-marilla bid [you]124-anne . "[113-marilla]

When [Anne]124-anne had gone [Marilla]113-marilla went about [her]113-marilla evening tasks in a very disturbed state of mind . [She]113-marilla was worried about [her]113-marilla valuable brooch . What if [Anne]124-anne had lost it ? And how wicked of [the child]460-the child to deny having taken it , when [anybody]2031-anybody could see [she]460-the child must have ! With such an innocent face , too !

" [I]113-marilla do n't know what [I]113-marilla would n't sooner have had happen , "[113-marilla] thought [Marilla]113-marilla , as [she]113-marilla nervously shelled the peas . " Of course , [I]113-marilla do n't suppose [she]124-anne meant to steal it or anything like that . [She]124-anne 's just taken it to play with or help along that imagination of [hers]124-anne . [She]124-anne must have taken it , that 's clear , for there has n't been a soul in [that room]2782-that room since [she]124-anne was in [it]2782-that room , by [her]124-anne own story , until [I]113-marilla went up tonight . And the brooch is gone , there 's nothing surer . [I]113-marilla suppose [she]124-anne has lost it and is afraid to own up for fear [she]124-anne 'll be punished . It 's a dreadful thing to think [she]124-anne tells falsehoods . It 's a far worse thing than [her]124-anne fit of temper . It 's a fearful responsibility to have [a child]2075-a child in [[your]2784-your house]2049-your house [you]2784-your ca n't trust . Slyness and untruthfulness -- that 's what [she]124-anne has displayed . [I]113-marilla declare [I]113-marilla feel worse about that than about the brooch . If [she]124-anne 'd only have told the truth about it [I]113-marilla would n't mind so much . "[113-marilla]

[Marilla]113-marilla went to [[her]113-marilla room]807-her room at intervals all through the evening and searched for the brooch , without finding it . A bedtime visit to [the east gable]561-the east gable produced no result . [Anne]124-anne persisted in denying that [she]124-anne knew anything about the brooch but [Marilla]113-marilla was only the more firmly convinced that [she]124-anne did .

[She]113-marilla told [Matthew]107-matthew the story the next morning . [Matthew]107-matthew was confounded and puzzled ; [he]107-matthew could not so quickly lose faith in [Anne]124-anne but [he]107-matthew had to admit that circumstances were against [her]124-anne .

" [You]107-matthew 're sure it has n't fell down behind [the bureau]2775-the bureau ? "[107-matthew] was the only suggestion [he]107-matthew could offer .

" [I]113-marilla 've moved [the bureau]2775-the bureau and [I]113-marilla 've taken out the drawers and [I]113-marilla 've looked in every crack and cranny "[113-marilla] was [Marilla]113-marilla 's positive answer . " The brooch is gone and [that child]2257-that child has taken it and lied about it . That 's the plain , ugly truth , [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew , and [we]2789-we might as well look it in the face . "[113-marilla]

" Well now , what are [you]113-marilla going to do about it ? "[107-matthew] [Matthew]107-matthew asked forlornly , feeling secretly thankful that [Marilla]113-marilla and not [he]107-matthew had to deal with the situation . [He]107-matthew felt no desire to put [his]107-matthew oar in this time .

" [She]2257-that child 'll stay in [[her]2257-that child room]807-her room until [she]2257-that child confesses , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla grimly , remembering the success of this method in the former case . " Then [we]2789-we 'll see . Perhaps [we]2789-we 'll be able to find the brooch if [she]2257-that child 'll only tell where [she]2257-that child took it ; but in any case [she]2257-that child 'll have to be severely punished , [Matthew]107-matthew . "[113-marilla]

" Well now , [you]113-marilla 'll have to punish [her]2257-that child , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , reaching for [his]107-matthew hat . " [I]107-matthew 've nothing to do with it , remember . [You]113-marilla warned [me]107-matthew off [yourself]113-marilla . "[107-matthew]

[Marilla]113-marilla felt deserted by [everyone]815-everyone . [She]113-marilla could not even go to [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde for advice . [She]113-marilla went up to [the east gable]561-the east gable with a very serious face and left it with a face more serious still . [Anne]124-anne steadfastly refused to confess . [She]124-anne persisted in asserting that [she]124-anne had not taken the brooch . [The child]460-the child had evidently been crying and [Marilla]113-marilla felt a pang of pity which [she]113-marilla sternly repressed . By night [she]113-marilla was , as [she]113-marilla expressed it , " beat out . "[113-marilla]

" [You]124-anne 'll stay in [this room]2565-this room until [you]124-anne confess , [Anne]124-anne . [You]124-anne can make up [your]124-anne mind to that , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said firmly .

" But the picnic is tomorrow , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] cried [Anne]124-anne . " [You]113-marilla wo n't keep [me]124-anne from going to that , will [you]113-marilla ? [You]113-marilla 'll just let [me]124-anne out for the afternoon , wo n't [you]113-marilla ? Then [I]124-anne 'll stay [here]2022-here as long as [you]113-marilla like _ afterwards _ cheerfully . But [I]124-anne _ must _ go to the picnic . "[124-anne]

" [You]113-marilla 'll not go to picnics nor anywhere else until [you]113-marilla 've confessed , [Anne]124-anne . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] gasped [Anne]124-anne .

But [Marilla]113-marilla had gone out and shut the door .

Wednesday morning dawned as bright and fair as if expressly made to order for the picnic . Birds sang around [Green Gables]107-matthew ; the Madonna lilies in [the garden]573-the garden sent out whiffs of perfume that entered in on viewless winds at every door and window , and wandered through [halls]819-halls and [rooms]820-rooms like spirits of benediction . The birches in [the hollow]342-the hollow waved joyful hands as if watching for [Anne]124-anne 's usual morning greeting from the east gable . But [Anne]124-anne was not at [her]124-anne window . When [Marilla]113-marilla took [her]113-marilla breakfast up to [her]113-marilla [she]113-marilla found [the child]460-the child sitting primly on [her]113-marilla bed , pale and resolute , with tight - shut lips and gleaming eyes .

" [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]460-the child 'm ready to confess . "[460-the child]

" Ah ! "[113-marilla] [Marilla]113-marilla laid down [her]113-marilla tray . Once again [her]113-marilla method had succeeded ; but [her]113-marilla success was very bitter to [her]113-marilla . " Let [me]460-the child hear what [you]113-marilla have to say then , [Anne]124-anne . "[460-the child]

" [I]124-anne took the amethyst brooch , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , as if repeating a lesson [she]124-anne had learned . " [I]124-anne took it just as [you]113-marilla said . [I]124-anne did n't mean to take it when [I]124-anne went in . But it did look so beautiful , [Marilla]113-marilla , when [I]124-anne pinned it on [my]124-anne breast that [I]124-anne was overcome by an irresistible temptation . [I]124-anne imagined how perfectly thrilling it would be to take it to [Idlewild]45-idlewild and play [I]124-anne was [the Lady Cordelia Fitzgerald]123-cordelia . It would be so much easier to imagine [I]124-anne was [the Lady Cordelia]123-cordelia if [I]124-anne had a real amethyst brooch on . [Diana]120-diana and [I]124-anne make necklaces of roseberries but what are roseberries compared to amethysts ? So [I]124-anne took the brooch . [I]124-anne thought [I]124-anne could put it back before [you]113-marilla came [home]361-home . [I]124-anne went all the way around by [the road]413-the road to lengthen out the time . When [I]124-anne was going over the bridge across [the Lake of Shining Waters]23-the lake of shining waters [I]124-anne took the brooch off to have another look at it . Oh , how it did shine in the sunlight ! And then , when [I]124-anne was leaning over [the bridge]500-the bridge , it just slipped through [my]124-anne fingers -- so -- and went down -- down -- down , all purply - sparkling , and sank forevermore beneath [the Lake of [Shining Waters]25-shining waters]2236-the lake of shining waters . And that 's the best [I]124-anne can do at confessing , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla felt hot anger surge up into [her]113-marilla heart again . [This child]458-this child had taken and lost [her]458-this child treasured amethyst brooch and now sat there calmly reciting the details thereof without the least apparent compunction or repentance .

" [Anne]124-anne , this is terrible , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said , trying to speak calmly . " [You]458-this child are [the very wickedest girl [I]113-marilla ever heard of]2797-the very wickedest girl i ever heard of . "[113-marilla]

" Yes , [I]124-anne suppose [I]124-anne am , "[124-anne] agreed [Anne]124-anne tranquilly . " And [I]124-anne know [I]124-anne 'll have to be punished . It 'll be [your]458-this child duty to punish [me]124-anne , [Marilla]113-marilla . Wo n't [you]458-this child please get it over right off because [I]124-anne 'd like to go to the picnic with nothing on [my]124-anne mind . "[124-anne]

" Picnic , indeed ! [You]458-this child 'll go to [no picnic]2798-no picnic today , [Anne Shirley]124-anne . That shall be [your]458-this child punishment . And it is n't half severe enough either for what [you]458-this child 've done ! "[113-marilla]

" Not go to the picnic ! "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne sprang to [her]124-anne feet and clutched [Marilla]113-marilla 's hand . " But [you]458-this child _ promised _ [me]124-anne [I]124-anne might ! Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne must go to the picnic . That was why [I]124-anne confessed . Punish [me]124-anne any way [you]458-this child like but that . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , please , please , let [me]124-anne go to the picnic . Think of the ice cream ! For anything [you]458-this child know [I]124-anne may never have a chance to taste ice cream again . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla disengaged [Anne]124-anne 's clinging hands stonily .

" [You]124-anne need n't plead , [Anne]124-anne . [You]124-anne are not going to the picnic and that 's final . No , not a word . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne realized that [Marilla]113-marilla was not to be moved . [She]124-anne clasped [her]124-anne hands together , gave a piercing shriek , and then flung [herself]113-marilla face downward on the bed , crying and writhing in an utter abandonment of disappointment and despair .

" For [the land]2799-the land 's sake ! "[113-marilla] gasped [Marilla]113-marilla , hastening from [the room]631-the room . " [I]113-marilla believe [the child]460-the child is crazy . [No child]2801-no child in [her]460-the child senses would behave as [she]460-the child does . If [she]460-the child is n't [she]460-the child 's utterly bad . Oh dear , [I]113-marilla 'm afraid [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde was right from the first . But [I]113-marilla 've put [my]113-marilla hand to the plow and [I]113-marilla wo n't look back . "[113-marilla]

That was a dismal morning . [Marilla]113-marilla worked fiercely and scrubbed [the porch]752-the porch floor and the dairy shelves when [she]113-marilla could find nothing else to do . Neither the shelves nor [the porch]752-the porch needed it -- but [Marilla]113-marilla did . Then [she]113-marilla went out and raked [the yard]2099-the yard .

When dinner was ready [she]113-marilla went to the stairs and called [Anne]124-anne . A tear - stained face appeared , looking tragically over the banisters .

" Come down to [your]124-anne dinner , [Anne]124-anne . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne do n't want any dinner , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , sobbingly . " [I]124-anne could n't eat anything . [My]124-anne heart is broken . [You]113-marilla 'll feel remorse of conscience someday , [I]124-anne expect , for breaking it , [Marilla]113-marilla , but [I]124-anne forgive [you]113-marilla . Remember when the time comes that [I]124-anne forgive [you]113-marilla . But please do n't ask [me]124-anne to eat anything , especially boiled pork and greens . Boiled pork and greens are so unromantic when [one]385-one is in affliction . "[124-anne]

Exasperated , [Marilla]113-marilla returned to [the kitchen]557-the kitchen and poured out [her]113-marilla tale of woe to [Matthew]107-matthew , who , between [his]107-matthew sense of justice and [his]107-matthew unlawful sympathy with [Anne]124-anne , was [a miserable man]829-a miserable man .

" Well now , [she]124-anne should n't have taken the brooch , [Marilla]113-marilla , or told stories about it , "[107-matthew] [he]107-matthew admitted , mournfully surveying [his]107-matthew plateful of unromantic pork and greens as if [he]107-matthew , like [Anne]124-anne , thought it a food unsuited to crises of feeling , " but [she]124-anne 's such a little thing -- such an interesting little thing . Do n't [you]113-marilla think it 's pretty rough not to let [her]124-anne go to the picnic when [she]124-anne 's so set on it ? "[107-matthew]

" [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew , [I]107-matthew 'm amazed at [you]107-matthew . [I]107-matthew think [I]107-matthew 've let [her]124-anne off entirely too easy . And [she]124-anne does n't appear to realize how wicked [she]124-anne 's been at all -- that 's what worries [me]107-matthew most . If [she]124-anne 'd really felt sorry it would n't be so bad . And [you]107-matthew do n't seem to realize it , neither ; [you]107-matthew 're making excuses for [her]124-anne all the time to [yourself]107-matthew -- [I]107-matthew can see that . "[107-matthew]

" Well now , [she]124-anne 's such a little thing , "[107-matthew] feebly reiterated [Matthew]107-matthew . " And there should be allowances made , [Marilla]113-marilla . [You]113-marilla know [she]124-anne 's never had any bringing up . "[107-matthew]

" Well , [she]124-anne 's having it now "[113-marilla] retorted [Marilla]113-marilla .

The retort silenced [Matthew]107-matthew if it did not convince [him]107-matthew . That dinner was a very dismal meal . The only cheerful thing about it was [Jerry Buote]125-jerry , [the hired boy]2635-the hired boy , and [Marilla]113-marilla resented [his]125-jerry cheerfulness as a personal insult .

When [her]113-marilla dishes were washed and [her]113-marilla bread sponge set and [her]113-marilla hens fed [Marilla]113-marilla remembered that [she]113-marilla had noticed a small rent in [her]113-marilla best black lace shawl when [she]113-marilla had taken it off on Monday afternoon on returning from [the Ladies ' Aid]831-the ladies ' aid .

[She]113-marilla would go and mend it . The shawl was in a box in [her]113-marilla trunk . As [Marilla]113-marilla lifted it out , the sunlight , falling through the vines that clustered thickly about the window , struck upon something caught in the shawl -- something that glittered and sparkled in facets of violet light . [Marilla]113-marilla snatched at it with a gasp . It was the amethyst brooch , hanging to a thread of the lace by its catch !

" Dear life and heart , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla blankly , " what does this mean ? Here 's [my]113-marilla brooch safe and sound that [I]113-marilla thought was at the bottom of [[Barry]120-diana 's pond]2176-barry 's pond . Whatever did [that girl]2089-that girl mean by saying [she]2089-that girl took it and lost it ? [I]113-marilla declare [I]113-marilla believe [Green Gables]107-matthew is bewitched . [I]113-marilla remember now that when [I]113-marilla took off [my]113-marilla shawl Monday afternoon [I]113-marilla laid it on the bureau for a minute . [I]113-marilla suppose the brooch got caught in it somehow . Well ! "[113-marilla]

[Marilla]113-marilla betook [herself]113-marilla to the east gable , brooch in hand . [Anne]124-anne had cried [herself]124-anne out and was sitting dejectedly by the window .

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla solemnly , " [I]113-marilla 've just found [my]113-marilla brooch hanging to [my]113-marilla black lace shawl . Now [I]113-marilla want to know what that rigmarole [you]124-anne told [me]113-marilla this morning meant . "[113-marilla]

" Why , [you]124-anne said [you]124-anne 'd keep [me]124-anne here until [I]124-anne confessed , "[124-anne] returned [Anne]124-anne wearily , " and so [I]124-anne decided to confess because [I]124-anne was bound to get to the picnic . [I]124-anne thought out a confession last night after [I]124-anne went to bed and made it as interesting as [I]124-anne could . And [I]124-anne said it over and over so that [I]124-anne would n't forget it . But [you]124-anne would n't let [me]124-anne go to the picnic after all , so all [my]124-anne trouble was wasted . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla had to laugh in spite of [herself]113-marilla . But [her]113-marilla conscience pricked [her]113-marilla .

" [Anne]124-anne , [you]124-anne do beat all ! But [I]113-marilla was wrong -- [I]113-marilla see that now . [I]113-marilla should n't have doubted [your]124-anne word when [I]113-marilla 'd never known [you]124-anne to tell a story . Of course , it was n't right for [you]124-anne to confess to a thing [you]124-anne had n't done -- it was very wrong to do so . But [I]113-marilla drove [you]124-anne to it . So if [you]124-anne 'll forgive [me]113-marilla , [Anne]124-anne , [I]113-marilla 'll forgive [you]124-anne and [we]2805-we 'll start square again . And now get [yourself]124-anne ready for the picnic . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne flew up like a rocket .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , is n't it too late ? "[113-marilla]

" No , it 's only two o'clock . [They]2806-they wo n't be more than well gathered yet and it 'll be an hour before [they]2806-they have tea . Wash [your]124-anne face and comb [your]124-anne hair and put on [your]124-anne gingham . [I]113-marilla 'll fill a basket for [you]124-anne . There 's plenty of stuff baked in [the house]350-the house . And [I]113-marilla 'll get [Jerry]125-jerry to hitch up the sorrel and drive [you]124-anne down to [the picnic ground]2808-the picnic ground . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] exclaimed [Anne]124-anne , flying to the washstand . " Five minutes ago [I]124-anne was so miserable [I]124-anne was wishing [I]124-anne 'd never been born and now [I]124-anne would n't change places with [an angel]2809-an angel ! "[124-anne]

That night [a thoroughly happy , completely tired - out [Anne]124-anne]832-a thoroughly happy , completely tired - out anne returned to [Green Gables]107-matthew in a state of beatification impossible to describe .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]113-marilla 've had a perfectly scrumptious time . Scrumptious is a new word [I]113-marilla learned today . [I]113-marilla heard [Mary Alice Bell]164-alice bell use it . Is n't it very expressive ? Everything was lovely . [We]2810-we had a splendid tea and then [Mr. Harmon Andrews]158-mr. harmon andrews took [us]2810-we all for a row on [the Lake of [Shining Waters]25-shining waters]2236-the lake of shining waters -- six of [us]2810-we at a time . And [Jane Andrews]121-jane nearly fell overboard . [She]121-jane was leaning out to pick water lilies and if [Mr. Andrews]158-mr. harmon andrews had n't caught [her]121-jane by [her]121-jane sash just in the nick of time [she]121-jane 'd fallen in and prob'ly been drowned . [I]113-marilla wish it had been [me]113-marilla . It would have been such a romantic experience to have been nearly drowned . It would be such a thrilling tale to tell . And [we]2810-we had the ice cream . Words fail [me]113-marilla to describe that ice cream . [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]113-marilla assure [you]113-marilla it was sublime . "[113-marilla]

That evening [Marilla]113-marilla told the whole story to [Matthew]107-matthew over [her]113-marilla stocking basket .

" [I]113-marilla 'm willing to own up that [I]113-marilla made a mistake , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla concluded candidly , " but [I]113-marilla 've learned a lesson . [I]113-marilla have to laugh when [I]113-marilla think of [Anne]124-anne 's ? confession , ' although [I]113-marilla suppose [I]113-marilla should n't for it really was a falsehood . But it does n't seem as bad as the other would have been , somehow , and anyhow [I]113-marilla 'm responsible for it . [That child]2257-that child is hard to understand in some respects . But [I]113-marilla believe [she]2257-that child 'll turn out all right yet . And there 's one thing certain , [no house]2813-no house will ever be dull that [she]2257-that child 's in . "[113-marilla]

CHAPTER XV . A Tempest in [the School Teapot]833-the school teapot

" WHAT a splendid day ! "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , drawing a long breath . " Is n't it good just to be alive on a day like this ? [I]124-anne pity [the people who are n't born yet for missing it]2814-the people who are n't born yet for missing it . [They]2814-the people who are n't born yet for missing it may have good days , of course , but [they]2814-the people who are n't born yet for missing it can never have this one . And it 's splendider still to have such a lovely way to go to [school]2382-school by , is n't it ? "[124-anne]

" It 's a lot nicer than going round by [the road]413-the road ; that is so dusty and hot , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana practically , peeping into [her]120-diana dinner basket and mentally calculating if the three juicy , toothsome , raspberry tarts reposing there were divided among [ten girls]834-ten girls how many bites [each girl]835-each girl would have .

[The little girls of [Avonlea school]2-avonlea]836-the little girls of avonlea school always pooled [their]836-the little girls of avonlea school lunches , and to eat three raspberry tarts all alone or even to share them only with [one]385-one 's best chum would have forever and ever branded as " awful mean "[838-the girl who did it] [the girl who did it]838-the girl who did it . And yet , when the tarts were divided among [ten girls]834-ten girls [you]840-you just got enough to tantalize [you]840-you .

The way [Anne]124-anne and [Diana]120-diana went to [school]2382-school _ was _ a pretty one . [Anne]124-anne thought those walks to and from [school]2382-school with [Diana]120-diana could n't be improved upon even by imagination . Going around by [the main road]745-the main road would have been so unromantic ; but to go by [Lover 's Lane]47-lover 's lane and [Willowmere]48-willowmere and [Violet Vale]147-violet vale and [the Birch Path]844-the birch path was romantic , if ever anything was .

[Lover 's Lane]47-lover 's lane opened out below [the orchard]2264-the orchard at [Green Gables]107-matthew and stretched far up into [the woods]373-the woods to [the end of [the Cuthbert farm]848-the cuthbert farm]847-the end of the cuthbert farm . It was the way by which the cows were taken to [the back pasture]706-the back pasture and the wood hauled [home]361-home in winter . [Anne]124-anne had named [it]47-lover 's lane [Lover 's Lane]47-lover 's lane before [she]124-anne had been a month at [Green Gables]107-matthew .

" Not that [lovers]2817-lovers ever really walk [there]348-there , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne explained to [Marilla]113-marilla , " but [Diana]120-diana and [I]124-anne are reading a perfectly magnificent book and there 's [a Lover 's Lane]2819-a lover 's lane in [it]348-there . So [we]2820-we want to have one , too . And it 's a very pretty name , do n't [you]113-marilla think ? So romantic ! [We]2820-we ca n't imagine [the lovers]2821-the lovers into it , [you]113-marilla know . [I]124-anne like [that lane]2822-that lane because [you]113-marilla can think out loud there without [people]2012-people calling [you]113-marilla crazy . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne , starting out alone in the morning , went down [Lover 's Lane]47-lover 's lane as far as [the brook]394-the brook . Here [Diana]120-diana met [her]124-anne , and [the two little girls]791-the two little girls went on up [the lane]380-the lane under the leafy arch of maples--"maples are such sociable trees , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne ; " [they]791-the two little girls 're always rustling and whispering to you"--until[791-the two little girls] [they]791-the two little girls came to [a rustic bridge]854-a rustic bridge . Then [they]791-the two little girls left [the lane]380-the lane and walked through [[Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry 's back field]856-mr. barry 's back field and past [Willowmere]48-willowmere . Beyond [Willowmere]48-willowmere came [Violet Vale]147-violet vale -- a little green dimple in the shadow of [[Mr. Andrew Bell]165-mr. bell 's big woods]857-mr. andrew bell 's big woods . " Of course there are no violets there now , "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne told [Marilla]113-marilla , " but [Diana]120-diana says there are millions of them in spring . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , ca n't [you]113-marilla just imagine [you]113-marilla see them ? It actually takes away [my]124-anne breath . [I]124-anne named [it]147-violet vale [Violet Vale]147-violet vale . [Diana]120-diana says [she]120-diana never saw the beat of [me]124-anne for hitting on fancy names for [places]2824-places . It 's nice to be clever at something , is n't it ? But [Diana]120-diana named [the Birch Path]844-the birch path . [She]120-diana wanted to , so [I]124-anne let [her]120-diana ; but [I]124-anne 'm sure [I]124-anne could have found something more poetical than plain Birch Path . [Anybody]2031-anybody can think of a name like that . But [the Birch Path]844-the birch path is one of [the prettiest places in [the world]409-the world]2828-the prettiest places in the world , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[124-anne]

[It]858-it was . [Other people besides [Anne]124-anne]859-other people besides anne thought so when [they]859-other people besides anne stumbled on [it]858-it . [It]858-it was a little narrow , twisting path , winding down over [a long hill straight through [Mr. Bell]165-mr. bell 's woods]860-a long hill straight through mr. bell 's woods , where the light came down sifted through so many emerald screens that it was as flawless as the heart of a diamond . [It]858-it was fringed in all [its]858-it length with slim young birches , white stemmed and lissom boughed ; ferns and starflowers and wild lilies - of - [the - valley]861-the - valley and scarlet tufts of pigeonberries grew thickly along [it]858-it ; and always there was a delightful spiciness in the air and music of bird calls and the murmur and laugh of wood winds in the trees overhead . Now and then [you]862-you might see a rabbit skipping across [the road]413-the road if [you]862-you were quiet -- which , with [Anne]124-anne and [Diana]120-diana , happened about once in a blue moon . Down in [the valley]2334-the valley the path came out to [the main road]745-the main road and then it was just up [the spruce hill]866-the spruce hill to [the school]867-the school .

[The Avonlea school]868-the avonlea school was [a whitewashed building]869-a whitewashed building , low in the eaves and wide in the windows , furnished inside with comfortable substantial old - fashioned desks that opened and shut , and were carved all over their lids with the initials and hieroglyphics of [three generations of school children]870-three generations of school children . [The schoolhouse]871-the schoolhouse was set back from [the road]413-the road and behind [it]871-the schoolhouse was a dusky fir wood and [a brook]2154-a brook where [all the children]874-all the children put [their]874-all the children bottles of milk in the morning to keep cool and sweet until dinner hour .

[Marilla]113-marilla had seen [Anne]124-anne start off to [school]2382-school on the first day of September with many secret misgivings . [Anne]124-anne was such [an odd girl]876-an odd girl . How would [she]124-anne get on with [the other children]877-the other children ? And how on earth would [she]124-anne ever manage to hold [her]124-anne tongue during school hours ?

Things went better than [Marilla]113-marilla feared , however . [Anne]124-anne came [home]361-home that evening in high spirits .

" [I]124-anne think [I]124-anne 'm going to like [school]2382-school [here]2022-here , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne announced . " [I]124-anne do n't think much of [the master]2832-the master , through . [He]2832-the master 's all the time curling [his]2832-the master mustache and making eyes at [Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews . [Prissy]166-prissy andrews is grown up , [you]2833-you know . [She]166-prissy andrews 's sixteen and [she]166-prissy andrews 's studying for the entrance examination into [Queen 's Academy at [Charlottetown]18-charlottetown]50-queen 's academy at charlottetown next year . [Tillie Boulter]167-tillie boulter says [the master]2832-the master is _ dead gone _ on [her]166-prissy andrews . [She]166-prissy andrews 's got a beautiful complexion and curly brown hair and [she]166-prissy andrews does it up so elegantly . [She]166-prissy andrews sits in the long seat at the back and [he]2832-the master sits there , too , most of the time -- to explain [her]166-prissy andrews lessons , [he]2832-the master says . But [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis says [she]168-ruby gillis saw [him]2832-the master writing something on [her]168-ruby gillis slate and when [Prissy]166-prissy andrews read it [she]168-ruby gillis blushed as red as a beet and giggled ; and [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis says [she]168-ruby gillis does n't believe it had anything to do with the lesson . "[124-anne]

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne , do n't let [me]113-marilla hear [you]124-anne talking about [[your]124-anne teacher]2835-your teacher in that way again , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla sharply . " [You]124-anne do n't go to [school]2382-school to criticize [the master]2832-the master . [I]113-marilla guess [he]2832-the master can teach _ [you]124-anne _ something , and it 's [your]124-anne business to learn . And [I]113-marilla want [you]124-anne to understand right off that [you]124-anne are not to come [home]361-home telling tales about [him]2832-the master . That is something [I]113-marilla wo n't encourage . [I]113-marilla hope [you]124-anne were [a good girl]2443-a good girl . "[113-marilla]

" Indeed [I]124-anne was , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne comfortably . " It was n't so hard as [you]124-anne might imagine , either . [I]124-anne sit with [Diana]120-diana . [Our]2840-we seat is right by the window and [we]2840-we can look down to [the Lake of [Shining Waters]25-shining waters]2236-the lake of shining waters . There are [a lot of [nice girls]2843-nice girls in [school]2382-school]2842-a lot of nice girls in school and [we]2840-we had scrumptious fun playing at dinnertime . It 's so nice to have a lot of [little girls]472-little girls to play with . But of course [I]124-anne like [Diana]120-diana best and always will . [I]124-anne _ adore _ [Diana]120-diana . [I]124-anne 'm dreadfully far behind the others . [They]2842-a lot of nice girls in school 're all in the fifth book and [I]124-anne 'm only in the fourth . [I]124-anne feel that it 's kind of a disgrace . But there 's not one of [them]2842-a lot of nice girls in school has such an imagination as [I]124-anne have and [I]124-anne soon found that out . [We]2840-we had reading and geography and Canadian history and dictation today . [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips said [my]124-anne spelling was disgraceful and [he]169-mr. phillips held up [my]124-anne slate so that [everybody]2130-everybody could see it , all marked over . [I]124-anne felt so mortified , [Marilla]113-marilla ; [he]169-mr. phillips might have been politer to [a stranger]2452-a stranger , [I]124-anne think . [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis gave [me]124-anne an apple and [Sophia Sloane]170-sophia sloane lent [me]124-anne a lovely pink card with ? May [I]124-anne see [you]113-marilla [home]361-home ? ' on it . [I]124-anne 'm to give it back to [her]170-sophia sloane tomorrow . And [Tillie Boulter]167-tillie boulter let [me]124-anne wear [her]167-tillie boulter bead ring all the afternoon . Can [I]124-anne have some of those pearl beads off the old pincushion in the garret to make [myself]124-anne a ring ? And oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [Jane Andrews]121-jane told [me]124-anne that [Minnie MacPherson]171-minnie macpherson told [her]171-minnie macpherson that [she]171-minnie macpherson heard [Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews tell [Sara Gillis]172-sara gillis that [I]124-anne had a very pretty nose . [Marilla]113-marilla , that is the first compliment [I]124-anne have ever had in [my]124-anne life and [you]113-marilla ca n't imagine what a strange feeling it gave [me]124-anne . [Marilla]113-marilla , have [I]124-anne really a pretty nose ? [I]124-anne know [you]113-marilla 'll tell [me]124-anne the truth . "[124-anne]

" [Your]124-anne nose is well enough , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla shortly . Secretly [she]113-marilla thought [Anne]124-anne 's nose was a remarkable pretty one ; but [she]113-marilla had no intention of telling [her]124-anne so .

That was three weeks ago and all had gone smoothly so far . And now , this crisp September morning , [Anne]124-anne and [Diana]120-diana were tripping blithely down [the Birch Path]844-the birch path , [two of [the happiest little girls in [Avonlea]2-avonlea]881-the happiest little girls in avonlea]880-two of the happiest little girls in avonlea .

" [I]120-diana guess [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert will be in [school]2382-school today , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana . " [He]140-gilbert 's been visiting [[his]140-gilbert cousins]2850-his cousins over in [New Brunswick]14-new brunswick all summer and [he]140-gilbert only came [home]361-home Saturday night . [He]140-gilbert 's _ aw'fly _ handsome , [Anne]124-anne . And [he]140-gilbert teases [the girls]2852-the girls something terrible . [He]140-gilbert just torments [our]2852-the girls lives out . "[120-diana]

[Diana]120-diana 's voice indicated that [she]120-diana rather liked having [her]120-diana life tormented out than not .

" [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert ? "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne . " Is n't [his]140-gilbert name that 's written up on the porch wall with [Julia Bell]122-julia bell 's and a big ? Take Notice ' over them ? "[124-anne]

" Yes , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana , tossing [her]120-diana head , " but [I]120-diana 'm sure [he]140-gilbert does n't like [Julia Bell]122-julia bell so very much . [I]120-diana 've heard [him]140-gilbert say [he]140-gilbert studied the multiplication table by [her]122-julia bell freckles . "[120-diana]

" Oh , do n't speak about freckles to [me]124-anne , "[124-anne] implored [Anne]124-anne . " It is n't delicate when [I]124-anne 've got so many . But [I]124-anne do think that writing take - notices up on the wall about [the boys]2853-the boys and [girls]2854-girls is the silliest ever . [I]124-anne should just like to see [anybody]2031-anybody dare to write [my]124-anne name up with [a boy]406-a boy 's . Not , of course , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne hastened to add , " that [anybody]2031-anybody would . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne sighed . [She]124-anne did n't want [her]124-anne name written up . But it was a little humiliating to know that there was no danger of it .

" Nonsense , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana , whose black eyes and glossy tresses had played such havoc with the hearts of [[Avonlea]2-avonlea schoolboys]882-avonlea schoolboys that [her]120-diana name figured on the porch walls in half a dozen take - notices . " It 's only meant as a joke . And do n't [you]124-anne be too sure [your]124-anne name wo n't ever be written up . [Charlie Sloane]173-charlie sloane is _ dead gone _ on [you]124-anne . [He]173-charlie sloane told [[his]173-charlie sloane mother]2361-his mother -- [[his]173-charlie sloane _ mother]2859-his _ mother _ , mind [you]124-anne -- that [you]124-anne were [the smartest girl in [school]2382-school]2860-the smartest girl in school . That 's better than being good looking . "[120-diana]

" No , it is n't , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , feminine to the core . " [I]124-anne 'd rather be pretty than clever . And [I]124-anne hate [Charlie Sloane]173-charlie sloane , [I]124-anne ca n't bear [a boy with goggle eyes]2862-a boy with goggle eyes . " [You]124-anne 'll have [Gilbert]140-gilbert in [your]124-anne class after this , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana , " and [he]140-gilbert 's used to being [head of [[his]140-gilbert class]2866-his class]2865-head of his class , [I]120-diana can tell [you]124-anne . [He]140-gilbert 's only in the fourth book although [he]140-gilbert 's nearly fourteen . " [I]124-anne 'm glad , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne quickly . " [Those Pye girls]2872-those pye girls are [cheats]2873-cheats all round , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana indignantly , as [they]883-they climbed the fence of [the main road]745-the main road . " [Gertie Pye]176-gertie pye actually went and put [her]176-gertie pye milk bottle in [my]120-diana place in [the brook]394-the brook yesterday . Did [you]169-mr. phillips ever ? When [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips was in the back of [the room]631-the room hearing [Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews 's Latin , [Diana]120-diana whispered to [Anne]124-anne , " That 's [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert sitting right across the aisle from [you]124-anne , [Anne]124-anne . Just look at [him]140-gilbert and see if [you]124-anne do n't think [he]140-gilbert 's handsome . "[120-diana]

[Anne]124-anne looked accordingly . [She]124-anne had a good chance to do so , for the said [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert was absorbed in stealthily pinning the long yellow braid of [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis , who sat in front of [him]140-gilbert , to the back of [her]168-ruby gillis seat . [He]140-gilbert was [a tall boy , with curly brown hair , roguish hazel eyes , and a mouth twisted into a teasing smile]886-a tall boy , with curly brown hair , roguish hazel eyes , and a mouth twisted into a teasing smile . [Presently Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis started up to take a sum to [the master]2832-the master ; [she]168-ruby gillis fell back into [her]168-ruby gillis seat with a little shriek , believing that [her]168-ruby gillis hair was pulled out by the roots . [Everybody]2130-everybody looked at [her]168-ruby gillis and [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips glared so sternly that [Ruby]168-ruby gillis began to cry . [Gilbert]140-gilbert had whisked the pin out of sight and was studying [his]140-gilbert history with the soberest face in [the world]409-the world ; but when the commotion subsided [he]140-gilbert looked at [Anne]124-anne and winked with inexpressible drollery .

" [I]124-anne think [your]120-diana [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert _ is _ handsome , "[124-anne] confided [Anne]124-anne to [Diana]120-diana , " but [I]124-anne think [he]140-gilbert 's very bold . It is n't good manners to wink at [a strange girl]446-a strange girl . "[124-anne]

But it was not until the afternoon that things really began to happen .

[Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips was back in the corner explaining a problem in algebra to [Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews and [the rest of [the scholars]891-the scholars]890-the rest of the scholars were doing pretty much as [they]890-the rest of the scholars pleased eating green apples , whispering , drawing pictures on [their]890-the rest of the scholars slates , and driving crickets harnessed to strings , up and down [aisle]892-aisle . [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert was trying to make [Anne Shirley]124-anne look at [him]140-gilbert and failing utterly , because [Anne]124-anne was at that moment totally oblivious not only to the very existence of [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert , but of [every other scholar in [Avonlea]2-avonlea school itself]893-every other scholar in avonlea school itself . With [her]124-anne chin propped on [her]124-anne hands and [her]124-anne eyes fixed on the blue glimpse of [the Lake of [Shining Waters]25-shining waters]2236-the lake of shining waters that the west window afforded , [she]124-anne was far away in a gorgeous dreamland hearing and seeing nothing save [her]124-anne own wonderful visions .

[Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert was n't used to putting [himself]140-gilbert out to make [a girl]2066-a girl look at [him]140-gilbert and meeting with failure . [She]2066-a girl _ should _ look at [him]140-gilbert , [that red - haired Shirley girl with the little pointed chin and the big eyes that were n't like the eyes of [any other girl in [Avonlea]2-avonlea school]897-any other girl in avonlea school]896-that red - haired shirley girl with the little pointed chin and the big eyes that were n't like the eyes of any other girl in avonlea school .

[Gilbert]140-gilbert reached across [the aisle]898-the aisle , picked up the end of [Anne]124-anne 's long red braid , held it out at arm 's length and said in a piercing whisper :

" [Carrots]177-carrots ! [Carrots]177-carrots ! "[140-gilbert]

Then [Anne]124-anne looked at [him]140-gilbert with a vengeance !

[She]124-anne did more than look . [She]124-anne sprang to [her]124-anne feet , [her]124-anne bright fancies fallen into cureless ruin . [She]124-anne flashed one indignant glance at [Gilbert]140-gilbert from eyes whose angry sparkle was swiftly quenched in equally angry tears .

" [You]140-gilbert mean , [hateful boy]2876-hateful boy ! "[124-anne] [she]124-anne exclaimed passionately . " How dare [you]140-gilbert ! "[124-anne]

And then -- thwack ! [Anne]124-anne had brought [her]124-anne slate down on [Gilbert]140-gilbert 's head and cracked it -- slate not head -- clear across .

[Avonlea school]2-avonlea always enjoyed a scene . This was an especially enjoyable one . [Everybody]2130-everybody said " Oh "[2130-everybody] in horrified delight . [Diana]120-diana gasped . [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis , who was inclined to be hysterical , began to cry . [Tommy Sloane]178-tommy sloane let [his]178-tommy sloane team of crickets escape [him]178-tommy sloane altogether while [he]178-tommy sloane stared open - mouthed at the tableau .

[Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips stalked down [the aisle]898-the aisle and laid [his]169-mr. phillips hand heavily on [Anne]124-anne 's shoulder .

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne , what does this mean ? "[169-mr. phillips] [he]169-mr. phillips said angrily . [Anne]124-anne returned no answer . [It]901-it was asking too much of flesh and blood to expect [her]124-anne to tell before [the whole school]902-the whole school that [she]124-anne had been called " carrots . "[903-gilbert] [Gilbert]903-gilbert it was who spoke up stoutly .

" It was [my]903-gilbert fault [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips . [I]903-gilbert teased [her]124-anne . "[903-gilbert]

[Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips paid no heed to [Gilbert]140-gilbert .

" [I]169-mr. phillips am sorry to see [a pupil of mine displaying such a temper and such a vindictive spirit]2877-a pupil of mine displaying such a temper and such a vindictive spirit , "[169-mr. phillips] [he]169-mr. phillips said in a solemn tone , as if the mere fact of being [a pupil of [his]169-mr. phillips]904-a pupil of his ought to root out all evil passions from the hearts of [small imperfect mortals]905-small imperfect mortals . " [Anne]124-anne , go and stand on the platform in front of the blackboard for the rest of the afternoon . "[169-mr. phillips]

[Anne]124-anne would have infinitely preferred a whipping to this punishment under which [her]124-anne sensitive spirit quivered as from a whiplash . With a white , set face [she]124-anne obeyed . [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips took a chalk crayon and wrote on the blackboard above [her]124-anne head .

" [Ann Shirley]124-anne has a very bad temper . [Ann Shirley]124-anne must learn to control [her]124-anne temper , "[169-mr. phillips] and then read it out loud so that even [the primer class , who could n't read writing]906-the primer class , who could n't read writing , should understand it .

[Anne]124-anne stood there the rest of the afternoon with that legend above [her]124-anne . [She]124-anne did not cry or hang [her]124-anne head . Anger was still too hot in [her]124-anne heart for that and it sustained [her]124-anne amid all [her]124-anne agony of humiliation . With resentful eyes and passion - red cheeks [she]124-anne confronted alike [Diana]120-diana 's sympathetic gaze and [Charlie Sloane]173-charlie sloane 's indignant nods and [Josie Pye]175-josie pye 's malicious smiles . As for [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert , [she]124-anne would not even look at [him]140-gilbert . [She]124-anne would _ never _ look at [him]140-gilbert again ! [She]124-anne would never speak to [him]140-gilbert ! !

When [school]2382-school was dismissed [Anne]124-anne marched out with [her]124-anne red head held high . [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert tried to intercept [her]124-anne at [the porch]752-the porch door .

" [I]140-gilbert 'm awfully sorry [I]140-gilbert made fun of [your]124-anne hair , [Anne]124-anne , "[140-gilbert] [he]140-gilbert whispered contritely . " Honest [I]140-gilbert am . Do n't be mad for keeps , now . "[140-gilbert]

[Anne]124-anne swept by disdainfully , without look or sign of hearing . " Oh how could [you]124-anne , [Anne]124-anne ? "[120-diana] breathed [Diana]120-diana as [they]909-they went down [the road]413-the road half reproachfully , half admiringly . [Diana]120-diana felt that _ [she]120-diana _ could never have resisted [Gilbert]140-gilbert 's plea .

" [I]124-anne shall never forgive [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne firmly . " And [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips spelled [my]124-anne name without an e , too . The iron has entered into [my]124-anne soul , [Diana]120-diana . "[124-anne]

[Diana]120-diana had n't the least idea what [Anne]124-anne meant but [she]120-diana understood it was something terrible .

" [You]120-diana must n't mind [Gilbert]140-gilbert making fun of [your]120-diana hair , "[120-diana] [she]120-diana said soothingly . " Why , [he]140-gilbert makes fun of all [the girls]2852-the girls . [He]140-gilbert laughs at [mine]124-anne because it 's so black . [He]140-gilbert 's called [me]120-diana a crow a dozen times ; and [I]120-diana never heard [him]140-gilbert apologize for anything before , either . "[120-diana]

" There 's a great deal of difference between being called a crow and being called carrots , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne with dignity . " [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert has hurt [my]124-anne feelings _ excruciatingly _ , [Diana]120-diana . "[124-anne]

It is possible the matter might have blown over without more excruciation if nothing else had happened . But when things begin to happen [they]911-they are apt to keep on .

[[Avonlea]2-avonlea [scholars]913-scholars]912-avonlea scholars often spent noon hour picking gum in [[Mr. Bell]165-mr. bell 's spruce grove]914-mr. bell 's spruce grove over [the hill]357-the hill and across [[his]165-mr. bell big pasture field]916-his big pasture field . From there [they]913-scholars could keep an eye on [[Eben Wright]179-eben wright 's house]917-eben wright 's house , where [the master]2832-the master boarded . When [they]913-scholars saw [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips emerging therefrom [they]913-scholars ran for [the schoolhouse]871-the schoolhouse ; but the distance being about three times longer than [[Mr. Wright]180-mr. wright 's lane]920-mr. wright 's lane [they]913-scholars were very apt to arrive [there]348-there , breathless and gasping , some three minutes too late .

On the following day [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips was seized with one of [his]169-mr. phillips spasmodic fits of reform and announced before going [home]361-home to dinner , that [he]169-mr. phillips should expect to find [all the scholars]923-all the scholars in [their]923-all the scholars seats when [he]169-mr. phillips returned . [Anyone who came in late]924-anyone who came in late would be punished .

[All the boys]925-all the boys and [some of [the girls]2852-the girls]926-some of the girls went to [[Mr. Bell]165-mr. bell 's spruce grove]914-mr. bell 's spruce grove as usual , fully intending to stay only long enough to " pick a chew . "[2852-the girls] But [spruce groves]929-spruce groves are seductive and yellow nuts of gum beguiling ; [they]929-spruce groves picked and loitered and strayed ; and as usual the first thing that recalled [them]929-spruce groves to a sense of the flight of time was [Jimmy Glover]181-jimmy glover shouting from the top of a patriarchal old spruce " [Master]2879-master 's coming . "[181-jimmy glover]

[The girls who were on the ground]930-the girls who were on the ground , started first and managed to reach [the schoolhouse]871-the schoolhouse in time but without a second to spare . [The boys , who had to wriggle hastily down from the trees]932-the boys , who had to wriggle hastily down from the trees , were later ; and [Anne]124-anne , who had not been picking gum at all but was wandering happily in the far end of [the grove]933-the grove , waist deep among the bracken , singing softly to [herself]124-anne , with a wreath of rice lilies on [her]124-anne hair as if [she]124-anne were some wild divinity of the shadowy places , was latest of all . [Anne]124-anne could run like a deer , however ; run [she]124-anne did with the impish result that [she]124-anne overtook [the boys at the door]934-the boys at the door and was swept into [the schoolhouse]871-the schoolhouse among [them]934-the boys at the door just as [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips was in the act of hanging up [his]169-mr. phillips hat .

[Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips 's brief reforming energy was over ; [he]169-mr. phillips did n't want the bother of punishing [a dozen pupils]936-a dozen pupils ; but it was necessary to do something to save [his]169-mr. phillips word , so [he]169-mr. phillips looked about for [a scapegoat]937-a scapegoat and found it in [Anne]124-anne , who had dropped into [her]124-anne seat , gasping for breath , with a forgotten lily wreath hanging askew over one ear and giving [her]124-anne a particularly rakish and disheveled appearance .

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne , since [you]124-anne seem to be so fond of [the boys]2853-the boys ' company [we]2881-we shall indulge [your]124-anne taste for it this afternoon , "[169-mr. phillips] [he]169-mr. phillips said sarcastically . " Take those flowers out of [your]124-anne hair and sit with [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert . "[169-mr. phillips]

[The other boys]938-the other boys snickered . [Diana]120-diana , turning pale with pity , plucked the wreath from [Anne]124-anne 's hair and squeezed [her]124-anne hand . [Anne]124-anne stared at [the master]2832-the master as if turned to stone .

" Did [you]124-anne hear what [I]169-mr. phillips said , [Anne]124-anne ? "[169-mr. phillips] queried [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips sternly .

" Yes , [sir]2882-sir , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne slowly " but [I]874-all the children did n't suppose [you]2882-sir really meant it . "[874-all the children]

" [I]874-all the children assure [you]2882-sir [I]874-all the children did"--still[874-all the children] with the sarcastic inflection which [all the children]874-all the children , and [Anne]124-anne especially , hated . It flicked on the raw . " Obey [me]874-all the children at once . "[874-all the children]

For a moment [Anne]124-anne looked as if [she]124-anne meant to disobey . Then , realizing that there was no help for it , [she]124-anne rose haughtily , stepped across [the aisle]898-the aisle , sat down beside [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert , and buried [her]124-anne face in [her]124-anne arms on the desk . [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis , who got a glimpse of it as it went down , told [the others going [home]361-home from [school]2382-school]942-the others going home from school that [she]168-ruby gillis 'd " acksually never seen anything like it -- it was so white , with awful little red spots in it . "[168-ruby gillis]

To [Anne]124-anne , this was as the end of all things . It was bad enough to be singled out for punishment from among [a dozen equally guilty ones]945-a dozen equally guilty ones ; it was worse still to be sent to sit with [a boy]406-a boy , but that [that boy]947-that boy should be [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert was heaping insult on injury to a degree utterly unbearable . [Anne]124-anne felt that [she]124-anne could not bear it and it would be of no use to try . [Her]124-anne whole being seethed with shame and anger and humiliation .

At first [the other scholars]948-the other scholars looked and whispered and giggled and nudged . But as [Anne]124-anne never lifted [her]124-anne head and as [Gilbert]140-gilbert worked fractions as if [his]140-gilbert whole soul was absorbed in [them]949-them and [them]949-them only , [they]949-them soon returned to [their]949-them own tasks and [Anne]124-anne was forgotten . When [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips called [the history class]950-the history class out [Anne]124-anne should have gone , but [Anne]124-anne did not move , and [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips , who had been writing some verses " To [Priscilla]166-prissy andrews "[169-mr. phillips] before [he]169-mr. phillips called [the class]951-the class , was thinking about an obstinate rhyme still and never missed [her]124-anne . Once , when [nobody]2118-nobody was looking , [Gilbert]140-gilbert took from [his]140-gilbert desk a little pink candy heart with a gold motto on it , " [You]124-anne are sweet , "[140-gilbert] and slipped it under the curve of [Anne]124-anne 's arm . [Whereupon Anne]124-anne arose , took the pink heart gingerly between the tips of [her]124-anne fingers , dropped it on the floor , ground it to powder beneath [her]124-anne heel , and resumed [her]124-anne position without deigning to bestow a glance on [Gilbert]140-gilbert .

When school went out [Anne]124-anne marched to [her]124-anne desk , ostentatiously took out everything therein , books and writing tablet , pen and ink , testament and arithmetic , and piled them neatly on [her]124-anne cracked slate .

" What are [you]124-anne taking all those things [home]361-home for , [Anne]124-anne ? "[120-diana] [Diana]120-diana wanted to know , as soon as [they]953-they were out on [the road]413-the road . [She]120-diana had not dared to ask the question before .

" [I]124-anne 'd do almost anything in [the world]409-the world for [you]120-diana , [Diana]120-diana , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne sadly . " Just think of all the fun [you]124-anne will miss , "[120-diana] mourned [Diana]120-diana . " [We]2889-we are going to build [the loveliest new house down by [the brook]394-the brook]2890-the loveliest new house down by the brook ; and [we]2889-we 'll be playing ball next week and [you]124-anne 've never played ball , [Anne]124-anne . Nothing moved [Anne]124-anne in the least . [Her]124-anne mind was made up . [She]124-anne would not go to [school]2382-school to [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips again ; [she]124-anne told [Marilla]113-marilla so when [she]124-anne got [home]361-home .

" Nonsense , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla .

" It is n't nonsense at all , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , gazing at [Marilla]113-marilla with solemn , reproachful eyes . " Do n't [you]113-marilla understand , [Marilla]113-marilla ? [I]124-anne 've been insulted . "[124-anne]

" [Insulted fiddlesticks]2893-insulted fiddlesticks ! [You]124-anne 'll go to [school]2382-school tomorrow as usual . "[124-anne]

" Oh , no . "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne shook [her]124-anne head gently . " [I]124-anne 'm not going back , [Marilla]113-marilla . [Marilla]113-marilla saw something remarkably like unyielding stubbornness looking out of [Anne]124-anne 's small face . [She]113-marilla understood that [she]113-marilla would have trouble in overcoming it ; but [she]113-marilla re - solved wisely to say nothing more just then . " [I]113-marilla 'll run down and see [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde about it this evening , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla thought . " There 's no use reasoning with [Anne]124-anne now . [She]124-anne 's too worked up and [I]113-marilla 've an idea [she]124-anne can be awful stubborn if [she]124-anne takes the notion . [I]113-marilla 'll just talk it over with [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde . [She]124-anne 's sent [ten children]2595-ten children to [school]2382-school and [she]124-anne ought to know something about it . [She]124-anne 'll have heard the whole story , too , by this time . "[113-marilla]

[Marilla]113-marilla found [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde knitting quilts as industriously and cheerfully as usual .

" [I]113-marilla suppose [you]105-mrs. lynde know what [I]113-marilla 've come about , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said , a little shamefacedly .

[Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde nodded .

" About [Anne]124-anne 's fuss in [school]2382-school , [I]105-mrs. lynde reckon , "[105-mrs. lynde] [she]105-mrs. lynde said . " [Tillie Boulter]167-tillie boulter was in on [her]167-tillie boulter way [home]361-home from [school]2382-school and told [me]105-mrs. lynde about it . "[105-mrs. lynde]

" [I]113-marilla do n't know what to do with [her]167-tillie boulter , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " [She]167-tillie boulter declares [she]167-tillie boulter wo n't go back to [school]2382-school . [I]113-marilla never saw [a child]2075-a child so worked up . [I]113-marilla 've been expecting trouble ever since [she]167-tillie boulter started to [school]2382-school . [I]113-marilla knew things were going too smooth to last . [She]167-tillie boulter 's so high strung . What would [you]105-mrs. lynde advise , [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde ? "[113-marilla]

" Well , since [you]113-marilla 've asked [my]105-mrs. lynde advice , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[105-mrs. lynde] said [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde amiably -- [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde dearly loved to be asked for advice--"I'd just humor [her]167-tillie boulter a little at first , that 's what [I]105-mrs. lynde 'd do . It 's [my]105-mrs. lynde belief that [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips was in the wrong . Of course , it does n't do to say so to [the children]2362-the children , [you]113-marilla know . And of course [he]169-mr. phillips did right to punish [her]167-tillie boulter yesterday for giving way to temper . But today it was different . [The others who were late]2906-the others who were late should have been punished as well as [Anne]124-anne , that 's what . And [I]105-mrs. lynde do n't believe in making [the girls]2852-the girls sit with [the boys]2853-the boys for punishment . It is n't modest . [Tillie Boulter]167-tillie boulter was real indignant . [She]167-tillie boulter took [Anne]124-anne 's part right through and said [all the scholars]923-all the scholars did too . [Anne]124-anne seems real popular among [them]923-all the scholars , somehow . [I]105-mrs. lynde never thought [she]167-tillie boulter 'd take with [them]923-all the scholars so well . "[105-mrs. lynde]

" Then [you]113-marilla really think [I]113-marilla 'd better let [her]124-anne stay [home]361-home , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla in amazement .

" Yes . That is [I]105-mrs. lynde would n't say [school]2382-school to [her]124-anne again until [she]124-anne said it [herself]124-anne . Depend upon it , [Marilla]113-marilla , [she]124-anne 'll cool off in a week or so and be ready enough to go back of [her]124-anne own accord , that 's what , while , if [you]2912-you were to make [her]124-anne go back right off , [dear]2414-dear knows what freak or tantrum [she]124-anne 'd take next and make more trouble than ever . The less fuss made the better , in [my]105-mrs. lynde opinion . [She]124-anne wo n't miss much by not going to [school]2382-school , as far as _ that _ goes . [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips is n't any good at all as [a teacher]2915-a teacher .
