The order [he]169-mr. phillips keeps is scandalous , that 's what , and [he]169-mr. phillips neglects [the young fry]2916-the young fry and puts all [his]169-mr. phillips time on [those big scholars [he]169-mr. phillips 's getting ready for [Queen]128-queen 's 's]2917-those big scholars he 's getting ready for queen 's . [He]169-mr. phillips 'd never have got [the school]867-the school for another year if [[his]169-mr. phillips uncle]2919-his uncle had n't been [a trustee--_the _ trustee]2920-a trustee--_the _ trustee , for [he]169-mr. phillips just leads the other two around by the nose , that 's what . [I]105-mrs. lynde declare , [I]105-mrs. lynde do n't know what education in [this Island]2921-this island is coming to . "[105-mrs. lynde]

[Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde shook [her]105-mrs. lynde head , as much as to say if [she]105-mrs. lynde were only at the head of [the educational system of [the Province]958-the province]957-the educational system of the province things would be much better managed .

[Marilla]113-marilla took [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde 's advice and not another word was said to [Anne]124-anne about going back to [school]2382-school . [She]113-marilla learned [her]113-marilla lessons at [home]361-home , did [her]113-marilla chores , and played with [Diana]120-diana in the chilly purple autumn twilights ; but when [she]113-marilla met [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert on [the road]413-the road or encountered [him]140-gilbert in [Sunday school]2656-sunday school [she]113-marilla passed [him]140-gilbert by with an icy contempt that was no whit thawed by [his]140-gilbert evident desire to appease [her]113-marilla . Even [Diana]120-diana 's efforts as [a peacemaker]963-a peacemaker were of no avail . [Anne]124-anne had evidently made up [her]124-anne mind to hate [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert to the end of life .

As much as [she]124-anne hated [Gilbert]140-gilbert , however , did [she]124-anne love [Diana]120-diana , with all the love of [her]124-anne passionate little heart , equally intense in its likes and dislikes . One evening [Marilla]113-marilla , coming in from [the orchard]2264-the orchard with a basket of apples , found [Anne]124-anne sitting along by the east window in the twilight , crying bitterly .

" Whatever 's the matter now , [Anne]124-anne ? "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla asked .

" It 's about [Diana]120-diana , "[124-anne] sobbed [Anne]124-anne luxuriously . " [I]124-anne love [Diana]120-diana so , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]124-anne can not ever live without [her]120-diana . But [I]124-anne know very well when [we]2922-we grow up that [Diana]120-diana will get married and go away and leave [me]124-anne . And oh , what shall [I]124-anne do ? [I]124-anne hate [[her]120-diana husband]2923-her husband -- [I]124-anne just hate [him]2923-her husband furiously . [I]124-anne 've been imagining it all out -- the wedding and everything -- [Diana]120-diana dressed in snowy garments , with a veil , and looking as beautiful and regal as [a queen]2924-a queen ; and [me]124-anne the bridesmaid , with a lovely dress too , and puffed sleeves , but with a breaking heart hid beneath [my]124-anne smiling face . And then bidding [Diana]120-diana goodbye - e - e-- "[124-anne] Here [Anne]124-anne broke down entirely and wept with increasing bitterness .

[Marilla]113-marilla turned quickly away to hide [her]113-marilla twitching face ; but it was no use ; [she]113-marilla collapsed on the nearest chair and burst into such a hearty and unusual peal of laughter that [Matthew]107-matthew , crossing [the yard outside]965-the yard outside , halted in amazement . When had [he]107-matthew heard [Marilla]113-marilla laugh like that before ?

" Well , [Anne Shirley]124-anne , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla as soon as [she]113-marilla could speak , " if [you]124-anne must borrow trouble , for pity 's sake borrow it handier [home]361-home . [I]113-marilla should think [you]124-anne had an imagination , sure enough . "[113-marilla]

CHAPTER XVI . [Diana]120-diana Is Invited to Tea with Tragic Results

OCTOBER was a beautiful month at [Green Gables]107-matthew , when the birches in [the hollow]342-the hollow turned as golden as sunshine and the maples behind [the orchard]2264-the orchard were royal crimson and the wild cherry trees along [the lane]380-the lane put on the loveliest shades of dark red and bronzy green , while [the fields]969-the fields sunned themselves in aftermaths .

[Anne]124-anne reveled in the world of color about [her]124-anne .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne exclaimed one Saturday morning , coming dancing in with [her]124-anne arms full of gorgeous boughs , " [I]124-anne 'm so glad [I]124-anne live in [a world where there are Octobers]2926-a world where there are octobers . It would be terrible if [we]2927-we just skipped from September to November , would n't it ? Look at these maple branches . Do n't they give [you]124-anne a thrill -- several thrills ? [I]124-anne 'm going to decorate [[my]124-anne room]2723-my room with them . "[124-anne]

" Messy things , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , whose aesthetic sense was not noticeably developed . " [You]124-anne clutter up [[your]124-anne room]2558-your room entirely too much with out - of - doors stuff , [Anne]124-anne . [Bedrooms]2930-bedrooms were made to sleep in . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , and dream in too , [Marilla]113-marilla . And [you]124-anne know [one]385-one can dream so much better in [a room where there are pretty things]2932-a room where there are pretty things . [I]124-anne 'm going to put these boughs in the old blue jug and set them on [my]124-anne table . "[124-anne]

" Mind [you]124-anne do n't drop leaves all over the stairs then . [I]113-marilla 'm going on a meeting of [the Aid Society]2772-the aid society at [Carmody]5-carmody this afternoon , [Anne]124-anne , and [I]113-marilla wo n't likely be [home]361-home before dark . [You]124-anne 'll have to get [Matthew]107-matthew and [Jerry]125-jerry [their]2935-their supper , so mind [you]124-anne do n't forget to put the tea to draw until [you]124-anne sit down at the table as [you]124-anne did last time . "[113-marilla]

" It was dreadful of [me]124-anne to forget , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne apologetically , " but that was the afternoon [I]124-anne was trying to think of a name for [Violet Vale]147-violet vale and it crowded other things out . [Matthew]107-matthew was so good . [He]107-matthew never scolded a bit . [He]107-matthew put the tea down [himself]107-matthew and said [we]2936-we could wait awhile as well as not . And [I]124-anne told [him]107-matthew a lovely fairy story while [we]2936-we were waiting , so [he]107-matthew did n't find the time long at all . It was a beautiful fairy story , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]124-anne forgot the end of it , so [I]124-anne made up an end for it [myself]124-anne and [Matthew]107-matthew said [he]107-matthew could n't tell where the join came in . "[124-anne]

" [Matthew]107-matthew would think it all right , [Anne]124-anne , if [you]124-anne took a notion to get up and have dinner in the middle of the night . But [you]124-anne keep [your]124-anne wits about [you]124-anne this time . And -- [I]113-marilla do n't really know if [I]113-marilla 'm doing right -- it may make [you]124-anne more addlepated than ever -- but [you]124-anne can ask [Diana]120-diana to come over and spend the afternoon with [you]124-anne and have tea [here]2022-here . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla ! "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne clasped [her]124-anne hands . " How perfectly lovely ! [You]124-anne _ are _ able to imagine things after all or else [you]124-anne 'd never have understood how [I]124-anne 've longed for that very thing . It will seem so nice and grown - uppish . No fear of [my]124-anne forgetting to put the tea to draw when [I]124-anne have company . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , can [I]124-anne use the rosebud spray tea set ? "[124-anne]

" No , indeed ! The rosebud tea set ! Well , what next ? [You]113-marilla know [I]113-marilla never use that except for [the minister]2502-the minister or [the Aids]2939-the aids . [You]113-marilla 'll put down the old brown tea set . But [you]113-marilla can open the little yellow crock of cherry preserves . It 's time it was being used anyhow -- [I]113-marilla believe it 's beginning to work . And [you]113-marilla can cut some fruit cake and have some of the cookies and snaps . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne can just imagine [myself]124-anne sitting down at the head of the table and pouring out the tea , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , shutting [her]124-anne eyes ecstatically . " And asking [Diana]120-diana if [she]120-diana takes sugar ! [I]124-anne know [she]120-diana does n't but of course [I]124-anne 'll ask [her]120-diana just as if [I]124-anne did n't know . And then pressing [her]120-diana to take another piece of fruit cake and another helping of preserves . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , it 's a wonderful sensation just to think of it . Can [I]124-anne take [her]120-diana into [the spare room]549-the spare room to lay off [her]120-diana hat when [she]120-diana comes ? And then into [the parlor]622-the parlor to sit ? "[124-anne]

" No . [The sitting room]2511-the sitting room will do for [you]113-marilla and [[your]113-marilla company]2943-your company . But there 's a bottle half full of raspberry cordial that was left over from [the church]751-the church social the other night . It 's on the second shelf of [the sitting - room closet]2945-the sitting - room closet and [you]113-marilla and [Diana]120-diana can have it if [you]113-marilla like , and a cooky to eat with it along in the afternoon , for [I]113-marilla daresay [Matthew]107-matthew ? ll be late coming in to tea since [he]107-matthew 's hauling potatoes to [the vessel]2946-the vessel . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne flew down to [the hollow]342-the hollow , past [the Dryad 's Bubble]2728-the dryad 's bubble and up [the spruce path]972-the spruce path to [Orchard Slope]24-orchard slope , to ask [Diana]120-diana to tea . As a result just after [Marilla]113-marilla had driven off to [Carmody]5-carmody , [Diana]120-diana came over , dressed in _ [her]120-diana _ second - best dress and looking exactly as it is proper to look when asked out to tea . At other times [she]120-diana was wo nt to run into [the kitchen]557-the kitchen without knocking ; but now [she]120-diana knocked primly at the front door . And when [Anne]124-anne , dressed in [her]124-anne second best , as primly opened it , [both little girls]974-both little girls shook hands as gravely as if [they]974-both little girls had never met before . This unnatural solemnity lasted until after [Diana]120-diana had been taken to [the east gable]561-the east gable to lay off [her]120-diana hat and then had sat for ten minutes in [the sitting room]2511-the sitting room , toes in position .

" How is [[your]120-diana mother]2947-your mother ? "[124-anne] inquired [Anne]124-anne politely , just as if [she]124-anne had not seen [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry picking apples that morning in excellent health and spirits .

" [She]2947-your mother is very well , thank [you]120-diana . [I]120-diana suppose [Mr. Cuthbert]107-matthew is hauling potatoes to the _ lily sands _ this afternoon , is [he]107-matthew ? "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana , who had ridden down to [Mr. Harmon Andrews]158-mr. harmon andrews 's that morning in [[Matthew]107-matthew 's cart]977-matthew 's cart .

" Yes . [Our]2948-we potato crop is very good this year . [I]124-anne hope [[your]120-diana father]2949-your father 's crop is good too . "[124-anne]

" It is fairly good , thank [you]120-diana . Have [you]120-diana picked many of [your]120-diana apples yet ? "[124-anne]

" Oh , ever so many , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne forgetting to be dignified and jumping up quickly . " Let 's go out to [the orchard]2264-the orchard and get some of the Red Sweetings , [Diana]120-diana . [Marilla]113-marilla says [we]2948-we can have all that are left on the tree . [Marilla]113-marilla is [a very generous woman]2951-a very generous woman . [She]113-marilla said [we]2948-we could have fruit cake and cherry preserves for tea . But it is n't good manners to tell [[your]120-diana company]2943-your company what [you]120-diana are going to give [them]2943-your company to eat , so [I]124-anne wo n't tell [you]120-diana what [she]113-marilla said [we]2948-we could have to drink . Only it begins with an R and a C and it 's bright red color . [I]124-anne love bright red drinks , do n't [you]120-diana ? They taste twice as good as any other color . "[124-anne]

[The orchard]2264-the orchard , with [its]2264-the orchard great sweeping boughs that bent to the ground with fruit , proved so delightful that [the little girls]2692-the little girls spent most of the afternoon in [it]2264-the orchard , sitting in a grassy corner where the frost had spared the green and the mellow autumn sunshine lingered warmly , eating apples and talking as hard as [they]2692-the little girls could . [Diana]120-diana had much to tell [Anne]124-anne of what went on in [school]2382-school . [She]120-diana had to sit with [Gertie Pye]176-gertie pye and [she]120-diana hated it ; [Gertie]176-gertie pye squeaked [her]176-gertie pye pencil all the time and it just made [her]120-diana -- [Diana's]184-diana's -- blood run cold ; [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis had charmed all [her]168-ruby gillis warts away , true 's [you]981-you live , with a magic pebble that [old Mary Joe]185-young mary joe from [the Creek]29-the creek gave [her]168-ruby gillis . [You]981-you had to rub the warts with the pebble and then throw it away over [your]981-you left shoulder at the time of the new moon and the warts would all go . [Charlie Sloane]173-charlie sloane 's name was written up with [Em White]186-em white 's on the porch wall and [Em White]186-em white was _ awful mad _ about it ; [Sam Boulter]187-sam boulter had " sassed "[169-mr. phillips] [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips in class and [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips whipped [him]169-mr. phillips and [[Sam]187-sam boulter 's father]982-sam 's father came down to [the school]867-the school and dared [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips to lay a hand on [one of [[his]169-mr. phillips children]985-his children]984-one of his children again ; and [Mattie Andrews]107-matthew had a new red hood and a blue crossover with tassels on it and the airs [she]986-she put on about it were perfectly sickening ; and [Lizzie Wright]189-lizzie wright did n't speak to [Mamie Wilson]190-mamie wilson because [[Mamie Wilson]190-mamie wilson 's grown - up sister]987-mamie wilson 's grown - up sister had cut out [[Lizzie Wright]189-lizzie wright 's grown - up sister]988-lizzie wright 's grown - up sister with [[her]189-lizzie wright beau]989-her beau ; and [everybody]2130-everybody missed [Anne]124-anne so and wished [she]124-anne 's come to [school]2382-school again ; and [Gilbert Blythe--]140-gilbert

But [Anne]124-anne did n't want to hear about [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert . [She]124-anne jumped up hurriedly and said suppose [they]992-they go in and have some raspberry cordial .

[Anne]124-anne looked on the second shelf of [the room]631-the room pantry but there was no bottle of raspberry cordial there . [Search]191-search revealed it away back on the top shelf . [Anne]124-anne put it on a tray and set it on the table with a tumbler .

" Now , please help [yourself]120-diana , [Diana]120-diana , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said politely . " [I]124-anne do n't believe [I]124-anne 'll have any just now . [I]124-anne do n't feel as if [I]124-anne wanted any after all those apples . "[124-anne]

[Diana]120-diana poured [herself]120-diana out a tumblerful , looked at its bright - red hue admiringly , and then sipped it daintily .

" That 's awfully nice raspberry cordial , [Anne]124-anne , "[120-diana] [she]120-diana said . " [I]120-diana did n't know raspberry cordial was so nice . "[120-diana]

" [I]120-diana 'm real glad [you]120-diana like it . Take as much as [you]120-diana want . [I]120-diana 'm going to run out and stir the fire up . There are so many responsibilities on [a person]2165-a person 's mind when [they]2165-a person 're keeping [house]2954-house , is n't [there]348-there ? "[120-diana]

When [Anne]124-anne came back from [the kitchen]557-the kitchen [Diana]120-diana was drinking [her]120-diana second glassful of cordial ; and , being entreated thereto by [Anne]124-anne , [she]120-diana offered no particular objection to the drinking of a third . The tumblerfuls were generous ones and the raspberry cordial was certainly very nice .

" The nicest [I]120-diana ever drank , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana . " It 's ever so much nicer than [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde 's , although [she]105-mrs. lynde brags of [hers]105-mrs. lynde so much . It does n't taste a bit like [hers]105-mrs. lynde . "[120-diana]

" [I]124-anne should think [Marilla]113-marilla 's raspberry cordial would prob'ly be much nicer than [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde 's , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne loyally . " [Marilla]113-marilla is [a famous cook]2956-a famous cook . [She]113-marilla is trying to teach [me]124-anne to cook but [I]124-anne assure [you]120-diana , [Diana]120-diana , it is uphill work . There 's so little scope for imagination in cookery . [You]120-diana just have to go by rules . The last time [I]124-anne made a cake [I]124-anne forgot to put the flour in . [I]124-anne was thinking the loveliest story about [you]120-diana and [me]124-anne , [Diana]120-diana . [I]124-anne thought [you]120-diana were desperately ill with smallpox and [everybody]2130-everybody deserted [you]120-diana , but [I]124-anne went boldly to [your]120-diana bedside and nursed [you]120-diana back to life ; and then [I]124-anne took the smallpox and died and [I]124-anne was buried under those poplar trees in [the graveyard]2958-the graveyard and [you]120-diana planted a rosebush by [my]124-anne grave and watered it with [your]120-diana tears ; and [you]120-diana never , never forgot [the friend of [your]120-diana youth who sacrificed [her]2959-the friend of your youth who sacrificed her life for you life for [you]120-diana]2959-the friend of your youth who sacrificed her life for you . Oh , it was such a pathetic tale , [Diana]120-diana . The tears just rained down over [my]124-anne cheeks while [I]124-anne mixed the cake . But [I]124-anne forgot the flour and the cake was a dismal failure . Flour is so essential to cakes , [you]120-diana know . [Marilla]113-marilla was very cross and [I]124-anne do n't wonder . [I]124-anne 'm a great trial to [her]113-marilla . [She]113-marilla was terribly mortified about the pudding sauce last week . [We]2960-we had a plum pudding for dinner on Tuesday and there was half the pudding and a pitcherful of sauce left over . [Marilla]113-marilla said there was enough for another dinner and told [me]124-anne to set it on the pantry shelf and cover it . [I]124-anne meant to cover it just as much as could be , [Diana]120-diana , but when [I]124-anne carried it in [I]124-anne was imagining [I]124-anne was [a nun]2961-a nun -- of course [I]124-anne 'm [a Protestant]2962-a protestant but [I]124-anne imagined [I]124-anne was [a Catholic]2963-a catholic -- taking the veil to bury a broken heart in cloistered seclusion ; and [I]124-anne forgot all about covering the pudding sauce . [I]124-anne thought of it next morning and ran to [the pantry]2964-the pantry . [Diana]120-diana , fancy if [you]120-diana can [my]124-anne extreme horror at finding [a mouse drowned in that pudding sauce]2965-a mouse drowned in that pudding sauce ! [I]124-anne lifted the mouse out with a spoon and threw it out in [the yard]2099-the yard and then [I]124-anne washed the spoon in three waters . [Marilla]113-marilla was out milking and [I]124-anne fully intended to ask [her]113-marilla when [she]113-marilla came in if [I]124-anne 'd give the sauce to the pigs ; but when [she]113-marilla did come in [I]124-anne was imagining that [I]124-anne was a frost fairy going through [the woods]373-the woods turning the trees red and yellow , whichever [they]2968-they wanted to be , so [I]124-anne never thought about the pudding sauce again and [Marilla]113-marilla sent [me]124-anne out to pick apples . Well , [Mr.]2969-mr. and [Mrs. Chester Ross]192-mrs. chester ross from [Spencervale]52-spencervale came [here]2022-here that morning . [You]2971-you know [they]2968-they are [very stylish people]2972-very stylish people , especially [Mrs. Chester Ross]192-mrs. chester ross . When [Marilla]113-marilla called [me]124-anne in dinner was all ready and [everybody]2130-everybody was at the table . [I]124-anne tried to be as polite and dignified as [I]124-anne could be , for [I]124-anne wanted [Mrs. Chester Ross]192-mrs. chester ross to think [I]124-anne was [a ladylike little girl]2974-a ladylike little girl even if [I]124-anne was n't pretty . Everything went right until [I]124-anne saw [Marilla]113-marilla coming with the plum pudding in one hand and the pitcher of pudding sauce _ warmed up _ , in the other . [Diana]120-diana , that was a terrible moment . [I]124-anne remembered everything and [I]124-anne just stood up in [my]124-anne place and shrieked out ? [Marilla]113-marilla , [you]113-marilla must n't use that pudding sauce . There was a mouse drowned in it . [I]124-anne forgot to tell [you]113-marilla before . ' Oh , [Diana]120-diana , [I]124-anne shall never forget that awful moment if [I]124-anne live to be a hundred . [Mrs. Chester Ross]192-mrs. chester ross just _ looked _ at [me]124-anne and [I]124-anne thought [I]124-anne would sink through the floor with mortification . [She]192-mrs. chester ross is such [a perfect housekeeper]2975-a perfect housekeeper and fancy what [she]192-mrs. chester ross must have thought of [us]2976-us . [Marilla]113-marilla turned red as fire but [she]113-marilla never said a word -- then . [She]113-marilla just carried that sauce and pudding out and brought in some strawberry preserves . [She]113-marilla even offered [me]124-anne some , but [I]124-anne could n't swallow a mouthful . It was like heaping coals of fire on [my]124-anne head . After [Mrs. Chester Ross]192-mrs. chester ross went away , [Marilla]113-marilla gave [me]124-anne a dreadful scolding . Why , [Diana]120-diana , what is the matter ? "[124-anne]

[Diana]120-diana had stood up very unsteadily ; then [she]120-diana sat down again , putting [her]120-diana hands to [her]120-diana head .

" I'm -- [I'm]120-diana awful sick , "[120-diana] [she]120-diana said , a little thickly . " [I]120-diana -- [I]120-diana -- must go right [home]361-home . "[120-diana]

" Oh , [you]120-diana must n't dream of going [home]361-home without [your]120-diana tea , "[124-anne] cried [Anne]124-anne in distress . " [I]124-anne 'll get it right off -- [I'll]124-anne go and put the tea down this very minute . "[124-anne]

" [I]120-diana must go [home]361-home , "[120-diana] repeated [Diana]120-diana , stupidly but determinedly .

" Let [me]124-anne get [you]120-diana a lunch anyhow , "[124-anne] implored [Anne]124-anne . " Let [me]124-anne give [you]120-diana a bit of fruit cake and some of the cherry preserves . Lie down on the sofa for a little while and [you]120-diana 'll be better . Where do [you]120-diana feel bad ? "[124-anne]

" [I]120-diana must go [home]361-home , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana , and that was all [she]120-diana would say . In vain [Anne]124-anne pleaded .

" [I]124-anne never heard of [company]2262-company going [home]361-home without tea , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne mourned . " Oh , [Diana]120-diana , do [you]120-diana suppose that it 's possible [you]120-diana 're really taking the smallpox ? If [you]120-diana are [I]124-anne 'll go and nurse [you]120-diana , [you]120-diana can depend on that . [I]124-anne 'll never forsake [you]120-diana . But [I]124-anne do wish [you]120-diana 'd stay till after tea . Where do [you]120-diana feel bad ? "[124-anne]

" [I]120-diana 'm awful dizzy , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana .

And indeed , [she]120-diana walked very dizzily . [Anne]124-anne , with tears of disappointment in [her]124-anne eyes , got [Diana]120-diana 's hat and went with [her]120-diana as far as [the Barry yard]995-the barry yard fence . Then [she]124-anne wept all the way back to [Green Gables]107-matthew , where [she]124-anne sorrowfully put the remainder of the raspberry cordial back into the pantry and got tea ready for [Matthew]107-matthew and [Jerry]125-jerry , with all the zest gone out of the performance .

The next day was Sunday and as the rain poured down in torrents from dawn till dusk [Anne]124-anne did not stir abroad from [Green Gables]107-matthew . Monday afternoon [Marilla]113-marilla sent [her]124-anne down to [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde 's on an errand . In a very short space of time [Anne]124-anne came flying back up [the lane]380-the lane with tears rolling down [her]124-anne cheeks . Into [the kitchen]557-the kitchen [she]124-anne dashed and flung [herself]124-anne face downward on the sofa in an agony .

" Whatever has gone wrong now , [Anne]124-anne ? "[113-marilla] queried [Marilla]113-marilla in doubt and dismay . " [I]113-marilla do hope [you]124-anne have n't gone and been saucy to [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde again . "[113-marilla]

No answer from [Anne]124-anne save more tears and stormier sobs !

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne , when [I]113-marilla ask [you]124-anne a question [I]113-marilla want to be answered . Sit right up this very minute and tell [me]113-marilla what [you]124-anne are crying about . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne sat up , tragedy personified .

" [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde was up to see [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry today and [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry was in an awful state , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne wailed . " [She]105-mrs. lynde says that [I]124-anne set [Diana]120-diana _ drunk _ Saturday and sent [her]120-diana [home]361-home in a disgraceful condition . And [she]105-mrs. lynde says [I]124-anne must be [a thoroughly bad , wicked little girl]2984-a thoroughly bad , wicked little girl and [she]105-mrs. lynde 's never , never going to let [Diana]120-diana play with [me]124-anne again . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne 'm just overcome with woe . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla stared in blank amazement .

" Set [Diana]120-diana drunk ! "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said when [she]113-marilla found [her]113-marilla voice . " [Anne]124-anne are [you]124-anne or [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry crazy ? What on earth did [you]124-anne give [her]120-diana ? "[113-marilla]

" Not a thing but raspberry cordial , "[124-anne] sobbed [Anne]124-anne . " [I]124-anne never thought raspberry cordial would set [people]2012-people drunk , [Marilla]113-marilla -- not even if [they]2012-people drank three big tumblerfuls as [Diana]120-diana did . Oh , it sounds so -- so -- like [[Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas 's husband]2986-mrs. thomas 's husband ! But [I]124-anne did n't mean to set [her]120-diana drunk . "[124-anne]

" Drunk fiddlesticks ! "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , marching to [the sitting room pantry]998-the sitting room pantry . There on the shelf was a bottle which [she]113-marilla at once recognized as one containing some of [her]113-marilla three - year - old homemade currant wine for which [she]113-marilla was celebrated in [Avonlea]2-avonlea , although certain of the stricter sort , [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry among [them]999-them , disapproved strongly of it . And at the same time [Marilla]113-marilla recollected that [she]113-marilla had put the bottle of raspberry cordial down in [the cellar]592-the cellar instead of in [the pantry]2964-the pantry as [she]113-marilla had told [Anne]124-anne .

[She]113-marilla went back to [the kitchen]557-the kitchen with the wine bottle in [her]113-marilla hand . [Her]113-marilla face was twitching in spite of [herself]113-marilla .

" [Anne]124-anne , [you]124-anne certainly have a genius for getting into trouble . [You]124-anne went and gave [Diana]120-diana currant wine instead of raspberry cordial . Did n't [you]124-anne know the difference [yourself]124-anne ? "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne never tasted it , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne . " [I]124-anne thought it was the cordial . [I]124-anne meant to be so -- so -- hospitable . [Diana]120-diana got awfully sick and had to go [home]361-home . [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry told [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde [she]118-mrs. barry was simply dead drunk . [She]118-mrs. barry just laughed silly - like when [[her]118-mrs. barry mother]2342-her mother asked [her]118-mrs. barry what was the matter and went to sleep and slept for hours . [[Her]118-mrs. barry mother]2342-her mother smelled [her]118-mrs. barry breath and knew [she]118-mrs. barry was drunk . [She]118-mrs. barry had a fearful headache all day yesterday . [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry is so indignant . [She]118-mrs. barry will never believe but what [I]124-anne did it on purpose . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla should think [she]118-mrs. barry would better punish [Diana]120-diana for being so greedy as to drink three glassfuls of anything , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla shortly . " Why , three of those big glasses would have made [her]118-mrs. barry sick even if it had only been cordial . Well , this story will be a nice handle for [those folks who are so down on [me]113-marilla for making currant wine]2990-those folks who are so down on me for making currant wine , although [I]113-marilla have n't made any for three years ever since [I]113-marilla found out that [the minister]2502-the minister did n't approve . [I]113-marilla just kept that bottle for sickness . There , there , [child]2497-child , do n't cry . [I]113-marilla ca n't see as [you]2497-child were to blame although [I]113-marilla 'm sorry it happened so . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne must cry , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne . " [My]124-anne heart is broken . The stars in [their]2993-their courses fight against [me]124-anne , [Marilla]113-marilla . [Diana]120-diana and [I]124-anne are parted forever . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne little dreamed of this when first [we]2994-we swore [our]2994-we vows of friendship . "[124-anne]

" Do n't be foolish , [Anne]124-anne . [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry will think better of it when [she]118-mrs. barry finds [you]124-anne 're not to blame . [I]113-marilla suppose [she]118-mrs. barry thinks [you]124-anne 've done it for a silly joke or something of that sort . [You]124-anne 'd best go up this evening and tell [her]118-mrs. barry how it was . "[113-marilla]

" [My]124-anne courage fails [me]124-anne at the thought of facing [[Diana]120-diana 's injured mother]2995-diana 's injured mother , "[124-anne] sighed [Anne]124-anne . " [I]124-anne wish [you]124-anne 'd go , [Marilla]113-marilla . [You]124-anne 're so much more dignified than [I]124-anne am . Likely [she]118-mrs. barry 'd listen to [you]124-anne quicker than to [me]124-anne . "[124-anne]

" Well , [I]113-marilla will , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , reflecting that it would probably be the wiser course . " Do n't cry any more , [Anne]124-anne . It will be all right . "[113-marilla]

[Marilla]113-marilla had changed [her]113-marilla mind about it being all right by the time [she]113-marilla got back from [Orchard Slope]24-orchard slope . [Anne]124-anne was watching for [her]113-marilla coming and flew to [the porch]752-the porch door to meet [her]113-marilla .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne know by [your]113-marilla face that it 's been no use , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said sorrowfully . " [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry wo n't forgive [me]124-anne ? "[124-anne]

" [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry indeed ! "[113-marilla] snapped [Marilla]113-marilla . " Of [all the unreasonable women]2996-all the unreasonable women [I]113-marilla ever saw [she]118-mrs. barry 's the worst . [I]113-marilla told [her]118-mrs. barry it was all a mistake and [you]113-marilla were n't to blame , but [she]118-mrs. barry just simply did n't believe [me]113-marilla . And [she]118-mrs. barry rubbed it well in about [my]113-marilla currant wine and how [I]113-marilla 'd always said it could n't have the least effect on [anybody]2031-anybody . [I]113-marilla just told [her]118-mrs. barry plainly that currant wine was n't meant to be drunk three tumblerfuls at a time and that if [a child]2075-a child [I]113-marilla had to do with was so greedy [I]113-marilla 'd sober [her]2075-a child up with a right good spanking . "[113-marilla]

[Marilla]113-marilla whisked into [the kitchen]557-the kitchen , grievously disturbed , leaving [a very much distracted little soul in [the porch]752-the porch behind [her]113-marilla]1005-a very much distracted little soul in the porch behind her . [Presently Anne]124-anne stepped out bareheaded into the chill autumn dusk ; very determinedly and steadily [she]1007-she took [her]1007-she way down through [the sere clover field]1008-the sere clover field over [the log bridge]790-the log bridge and up through [the spruce grove]1010-the spruce grove , lighted by a pale little moon hanging low over [the western woods]1011-the western woods . [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry , coming to the door in answer to a timid knock , found [a white - lipped eager - eyed suppliant on the doorstep]1012-a white - lipped eager - eyed suppliant on the doorstep .

[Her]118-mrs. barry face hardened . [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry was [a woman of strong prejudices and dislikes]1013-a woman of strong prejudices and dislikes , and [her]118-mrs. barry anger was of the cold , sullen sort which is always hardest to overcome . To do [her]118-mrs. barry justice , [she]118-mrs. barry really believed [Anne]124-anne had made [Diana]120-diana drunk out of sheer malice prepense , and [she]118-mrs. barry was honestly anxious to preserve [[her]118-mrs. barry little daughter]1014-her little daughter from the contamination of further intimacy with [such a child]588-such a child .

" What do [you]118-mrs. barry want ? "[118-mrs. barry] [she]118-mrs. barry said stiffly .

[Anne]124-anne clasped [her]124-anne hands .

" Oh , [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry , please forgive [me]118-mrs. barry . [I]118-mrs. barry did not mean to -- to -- intoxicate [Diana]120-diana . How could [I]118-mrs. barry ? Just imagine if [you]118-mrs. barry were [a poor little orphan girl]2626-a poor little orphan girl that [kind people]3000-kind people had adopted and [you]118-mrs. barry had just [one bosom friend in all [the world]409-the world]3001-one bosom friend in all the world . Do [you]118-mrs. barry think [you]118-mrs. barry would intoxicate [her]120-diana on purpose ? [I]118-mrs. barry thought it was only raspberry cordial . [I]118-mrs. barry was firmly convinced it was raspberry cordial . Oh , please do n't say that [you]118-mrs. barry wo n't let [Diana]120-diana play with [me]118-mrs. barry any more . If [you]118-mrs. barry do [you]118-mrs. barry will cover [my]118-mrs. barry life with a dark cloud of woe . "[118-mrs. barry]

This speech which would have softened [good Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde 's heart in a twinkling , had no effect on [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry except to irritate [her]118-mrs. barry still more . [She]118-mrs. barry was suspicious of [Anne]124-anne 's big words and dramatic gestures and imagined that [the child]460-the child was making fun of [her]124-anne . So [she]118-mrs. barry said , coldly and cruelly :

" [I]118-mrs. barry do n't think [you]460-the child are [a fit little girl]3003-a fit little girl for [Diana]120-diana to associate with . [You]460-the child 'd better go [home]361-home and behave [yourself]460-the child . "[118-mrs. barry]

[Anne]124-anne 's lips quivered .

" Wo n't [you]460-the child let [me]118-mrs. barry see [Diana]120-diana just once to say farewell ? "[118-mrs. barry] [she]118-mrs. barry implored .

" [Diana]120-diana has gone over to [Carmody]5-carmody with [[her]120-diana father]782-her father , "[118-mrs. barry] said [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry , going in and shutting the door .

[Anne]124-anne went back to [Green Gables]107-matthew calm with despair .

" [My]124-anne last hope is gone , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne told [Marilla]113-marilla . " [I]124-anne went up and saw [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry [myself]124-anne and [she]118-mrs. barry treated [me]124-anne very insultingly . [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne do _ not _ think [she]118-mrs. barry is [a well - bred woman]3006-a well - bred woman . There is nothing more to do except to pray and [I]124-anne have n't much hope that that 'll do much good because , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne do not believe that [God]145-god [Himself]145-god can do very much with [such an obstinate person as [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry]3007-such an obstinate person as mrs. barry . "[124-anne]

" [Anne]124-anne , [you]124-anne should n't say such things "[113-marilla] rebuked [Marilla]113-marilla , striving to overcome that unholy tendency to laughter which [she]113-marilla was dismayed to find growing upon [her]113-marilla . And indeed , when [she]113-marilla told the whole story to [Matthew]107-matthew that night , [she]113-marilla did laugh heartily over [Anne]124-anne 's tribulations .

But when [she]113-marilla slipped into [the east gable]561-the east gable before going to bed and found that [Anne]124-anne had cried [herself]124-anne to sleep an unaccustomed softness crept into [her]124-anne face .

" [Poor little soul]3008-poor little soul , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla murmured , lifting a loose curl of hair from [the child]460-the child 's tear - stained face . Then [she]113-marilla bent down and kissed the flushed cheek on the pillow .

CHAPTER XVII . A New Interest in Life

THE next afternoon [Anne]124-anne , bending over [her]124-anne patchwork at the kitchen window , happened to glance out and beheld [Diana]120-diana down by [the Dryad]193-the dryad 's Bubble beckoning mysteriously . In a trice [Anne]124-anne was out of [the house]350-the house and flying down to [the hollow]342-the hollow , astonishment and hope struggling in [her]124-anne expressive eyes . But the hope faded when [she]124-anne saw [Diana]120-diana 's dejected countenance .

" [[Your]120-diana mother]2947-your mother has n't relented ? "[124-anne] [she]124-anne gasped .

[Diana]120-diana shook [her]120-diana head mournfully .

" No ; and oh , [Anne]124-anne , [she]2947-your mother says [I]120-diana 'm never to play with [you]124-anne again . [I]120-diana 've cried and cried and [I]120-diana told [her]2947-your mother it was n't [your]124-anne fault , but it was n't any use . [I]120-diana had ever such a time coaxing [her]2947-your mother to let [me]120-diana come down and say good - bye to [you]124-anne . [She]2947-your mother said [I]120-diana was only to stay ten minutes and [she]2947-your mother 's timing [me]120-diana by the clock . "[120-diana]

" Ten minutes is n't very long to say an eternal farewell in , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne tearfully . " Oh , [Diana]120-diana , will [you]120-diana promise faithfully never to forget [me]124-anne , [the friend of [your]120-diana youth]3010-the friend of your youth , no matter what [dearer friends]3011-dearer friends may caress [thee]120-diana ? "[124-anne]

" Indeed [I]120-diana will , "[120-diana] sobbed [Diana]120-diana , " and [I]120-diana 'll never have [another bosom friend]3012-another bosom friend -- [I]120-diana do n't want to have . [I]120-diana could n't love [anybody]2031-anybody as [I]120-diana love [you]120-diana . "[120-diana]

" Oh , [Diana]120-diana , "[124-anne] cried [Anne]124-anne , clasping [her]124-anne hands , " do [you]120-diana _ love _ [me]124-anne ? "[124-anne]

" Why , of course [I]120-diana do . Did n't [you]120-diana know that ? "[120-diana]

" No . "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne drew a long breath . " [I]124-anne thought [you]120-diana _ liked _ [me]124-anne of course but [I]124-anne never hoped [you]120-diana _ loved _ [me]124-anne . Why , [Diana]120-diana , [I]124-anne did n't think [anybody]2031-anybody could love [me]124-anne . [Nobody]2118-nobody ever has loved [me]124-anne since [I]124-anne can remember . Oh , this is wonderful ! It 's a ray of light which will forever shine on the darkness of a path severed from [thee]120-diana , [Diana]120-diana . Oh , just say it once again . "[124-anne]

" [I]120-diana love [you]124-anne devotedly , [Anne]124-anne , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana stanchly , " and [I]120-diana always will , [you]124-anne may be sure of that . "[120-diana]

" And [I]124-anne will always love [thee]120-diana , [Diana]120-diana , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , solemnly extending [her]124-anne hand . " In the years to come [thy]120-diana memory will shine like a star over [my]124-anne lonely life , as that last story [we]3016-we read together says . [Diana]120-diana , wilt [thou]120-diana give [me]124-anne a lock of [thy]120-diana jet - black tresses in parting to treasure forevermore ? "[124-anne]

" Have [you]124-anne got anything to cut it with ? "[120-diana] queried [Diana]120-diana , wiping away the tears which [Anne]124-anne 's affecting accents had caused to flow afresh , and returning to practicalities .

" Yes . [I]124-anne 've got [my]124-anne patchwork scissors in [my]124-anne apron pocket fortunately , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne . [She]124-anne solemnly clipped one of [Diana]120-diana 's curls . " Fare [thee]120-diana well , [[my]124-anne beloved friend]3017-my beloved friend . Henceforth [we]3018-we must be as [strangers]363-strangers though living side by side . But [my]124-anne heart will ever be faithful to [thee]120-diana . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne stood and watched [Diana]120-diana out of sight , mournfully waving [her]124-anne hand to [the latter]414-the latter whenever [she]120-diana turned to look back . Then [she]124-anne returned to [the house]350-the house , not a little consoled for the time being by this romantic parting .

" It is all over , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne informed [Marilla]113-marilla . " [I]124-anne shall never have [another friend]3020-another friend . [I]124-anne 'm really worse off than ever before , for [I]124-anne have n't [Katie Maurice]146-katie maurice and [Violetta]147-violet vale now . And even if [I]124-anne had it would n't be the same . Somehow , [little dream girls]3021-little dream girls are not satisfying after [a real friend]3022-a real friend . [Diana]120-diana and [I]124-anne had such an affecting farewell down by the spring . It will be sacred in [my]124-anne memory forever . [I]124-anne used the most pathetic language [I]124-anne could think of and said ? [thou]3023-thou ' and ? [thee]3023-thou . ' ? [Thou]3023-thou ' and ? [thee]3023-thou ' seem so much more romantic than ? [you]3023-thou . ' [Diana]120-diana gave [me]124-anne a lock of [her]120-diana hair and [I]124-anne 'm going to sew it up in a little bag and wear it around [my]124-anne neck all [my]124-anne life . Please see that it is buried with [me]124-anne , for [I]124-anne do n't believe [I]124-anne 'll live very long . Perhaps when [she]120-diana sees [me]124-anne lying cold and dead before [her]120-diana [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry may feel remorse for what [she]120-diana has done and will let [Diana]120-diana come to [my]124-anne funeral . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla do n't think there is much fear of [your]124-anne dying of grief as long as [you]124-anne can talk , [Anne]124-anne , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla unsympathetically .

The following Monday [Anne]124-anne surprised [Marilla]113-marilla by coming down from [[her]124-anne room]807-her room with [her]124-anne basket of books on [her]124-anne arm and hip and [her]124-anne lips primmed up into a line of determination .

" [I]124-anne 'm going back to [school]2382-school , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne announced . " That is all there is left in life for [me]124-anne , now that [[my]124-anne friend]2713-my friend has been ruthlessly torn from [me]124-anne . In [school]2382-school [I]124-anne can look at [her]2713-my friend and muse over days departed . "[124-anne]

" [You]124-anne 'd better muse over [your]124-anne lessons and sums , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , concealing [her]113-marilla delight at this development of the situation . " If [you]124-anne 're going back to [school]2382-school [I]113-marilla hope [we]3028-we 'll hear no more of breaking slates over [people]2012-people 's heads and such carryings on . Behave [yourself]124-anne and do just what [[your]124-anne teacher]2835-your teacher tells [you]124-anne . "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne 'll try to be [a model pupil]3031-a model pupil , "[124-anne] agreed [Anne]124-anne dolefully . " There wo n't be much fun in it , [I]124-anne expect . [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips said [Minnie Andrews]194-minnie andrews was [a model pupil]3031-a model pupil and there is n't a spark of imagination or life in [her]194-minnie andrews . [She]194-minnie andrews is just dull and poky and never seems to have a good time . But [I]124-anne feel so depressed that perhaps it will come easy to [me]124-anne now . [I]124-anne 'm going round by [the road]413-the road . [I]124-anne could n't bear to go by [the Birch Path]844-the birch path all alone . [I]124-anne should weep bitter tears if [I]124-anne did . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne was welcomed back to [school]2382-school with open arms . [Her]124-anne imagination had been sorely missed in games , [her]124-anne voice in the singing and [her]124-anne dramatic ability in the perusal aloud of books at dinner hour . [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis smuggled three blue plums over to [her]124-anne during testament reading ; [Ella May MacPherson]171-minnie macpherson gave [her]124-anne an enormous yellow pansy cut from the covers of a floral catalogue -- a species of desk decoration much prized in [Avonlea school]2-avonlea . [Sophia Sloane]170-sophia sloane offered to teach [her]124-anne a perfectly elegant new pattern of knit lace , so nice for trimming aprons . [Katie Boulter]195-katie boulter gave [her]124-anne a perfume bottle to keep slate water in , and [Julia Bell]122-julia bell copied carefully on a piece of pale pink paper scalloped on the edges the following effusion :

When twilight drops [her]1025-her curtain down And pins it with a star Remember that [you]1026-you have [a friend]1027-a friend Though [she]1027-a friend may wander far .

" It 's so nice to be appreciated , "[124-anne] sighed [Anne]124-anne rapturously to [Marilla]113-marilla that night .

[The girls]2852-the girls were not the only scholars who " appreciated "[124-anne] [her]124-anne . When [Anne]124-anne went to [her]124-anne seat after dinner hour -- [she]124-anne had been told by [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips to sit with [the model Minnie Andrews]194-minnie andrews -- [she]124-anne found on [her]124-anne desk a big luscious " strawberry apple . "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne caught it up all ready to take a bite when [she]124-anne remembered that [the only place in [Avonlea]2-avonlea where strawberry apples grew]1029-the only place in avonlea where strawberry apples grew was in [the old Blythe orchard on]1030-the old blythe orchard on [the other side of [the Lake of Shining Waters]23-the lake of shining waters]578-the other side of the lake of shining waters . [Anne]124-anne dropped the apple as if it were a red - hot coal and ostentatiously wiped [her]124-anne fingers on [her]124-anne handkerchief . The apple lay untouched on [her]124-anne desk until the next morning , when [little Timothy Andrews]196-little timothy andrews , who swept [the school]867-the school and kindled the fire , annexed it as one of [his]196-little timothy andrews perquisites . [Charlie Sloane]173-charlie sloane 's slate pencil , gorgeously bedizened with striped red and yellow paper , costing two cents where ordinary pencils cost only one , which [he]173-charlie sloane sent up to [her]124-anne after dinner hour , met with a more favorable reception . [Anne]124-anne was graciously pleased to accept it and rewarded [the donor]1033-the donor with a smile which exalted [that infatuated youth]1034-that infatuated youth straightway into the seventh heaven of delight and caused [him]173-charlie sloane to make such fearful errors in [his]173-charlie sloane dictation that [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips kept [him]173-charlie sloane in after [school]2382-school to rewrite it .

But as ,

[The Caesar]197-the caesar 's pageant shorn of [Brutus]198-brutus ' bust Did but of [[Rome]199-rome 's best son]1036-rome 's best son remind [her]124-anne more ,

so the marked absence of any tribute or recognition from [Diana Barry]120-diana who was sitting with [Gertie Pye]176-gertie pye embittered [Anne]124-anne 's little triumph .

" [Diana]120-diana might just have smiled at [me]124-anne once , [I]124-anne think , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne mourned to [Marilla]113-marilla that night . But the next morning a note most fearfully and wonderfully twisted and folded , and a small parcel were passed across to [Anne]124-anne .

[Dear Anne]124-anne ( ran [the former )]1037-the former )

[Mother]2343-mother says [I]0-i 'm not to play with [you]124-anne or talk to [you]124-anne even in [school]2382-school . It is n't [my]0-i fault and do n't be cross at [me]0-i , because [I]0-i love [you]124-anne as much as ever . [I]0-i miss [you]124-anne awfully to tell all [my]0-i secrets to and [I]0-i do n't like [Gertie Pye]176-gertie pye one bit . [I]0-i made [you]124-anne one of the new bookmarkers out of red tissue paper . They are awfully fashionable now and [only three girls in school]1040-only three girls in school know how to make them . When [you]124-anne look at it remember

[[Your]124-anne true friend]1041-your true friend

[Diana Barry]120-diana .

[Anne]124-anne read the note , kissed the bookmark , and dispatched a prompt reply back to the other side of [the school]867-the school .

[[My]0-i own darling]1043-my own darling Diana:--

Of course [I]0-i am not cross at [you]124-anne because [you]124-anne have to obey [[your]124-anne mother]2947-your mother . [Our]1045-them spirits can commune . [I]0-i shall keep [your]124-anne lovely present forever . [Minnie Andrews]194-minnie andrews is [a very nice little girl]2524-a very nice little girl -- although [she]194-minnie andrews has no imagination -- but after having been [[Diana]120-diana 's busum friend]1047-diana 's busum friend [I]0-i can not be [Minnie]194-minnie andrews 's . Please excuse mistakes because [my]0-i spelling is n't very good yet , although much improoved .

[Yours]124-anne until death [us]1045-them do part

[Anne]124-anne or [Cordelia Shirley]201-cordelia shirley .

P.S. [I]0-i shall sleep with [your]124-anne letter under [my]0-i pillow tonight . A. _ or _ C.S.

[Marilla]113-marilla pessimistically expected more trouble since [Anne]124-anne had again begun to go to [school]2382-school . But none developed . Perhaps [Anne]124-anne caught something of the " model "[124-anne] spirit from [Minnie Andrews]194-minnie andrews ; at least [she]124-anne got on very well with [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips thenceforth . [She]124-anne flung [herself]124-anne into [her]124-anne studies heart and soul , determined not to be outdone in any class by [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert . The rivalry between [them]1045-them was soon apparent ; it was entirely good natured on [Gilbert]140-gilbert 's side ; but it is much to be feared that the same thing can not be said of [Anne]124-anne , who had certainly an unpraiseworthy tenacity for holding grudges . [She]124-anne was as intense in [her]124-anne hatreds as in [her]124-anne loves . [She]124-anne would not stoop to admit that [she]124-anne meant to rival [Gilbert]140-gilbert in schoolwork , because that would have been to acknowledge [his]140-gilbert existence which [Anne]124-anne persistently ignored ; but the rivalry was there and honors fluctuated between [them]1045-them . Now [Gilbert]140-gilbert was [head of the spelling class]1049-head of the spelling class ; now [Anne]124-anne , with a toss of [her]124-anne long red braids , spelled [him]140-gilbert down . One morning [Gilbert]140-gilbert had all [his]140-gilbert sums done correctly and had [his]140-gilbert name written on the blackboard on the roll of honor ; the next morning [Anne]124-anne , having wrestled wildly with decimals the entire evening before , would be first . One awful day [they]1045-them were ties and [their]1045-them names were written up together . It was almost as bad as a take - notice and [Anne]124-anne 's mortification was as evident as [Gilbert]140-gilbert 's satisfaction . When the written examinations at the end of each month were held the suspense was terrible . The first month [Gilbert]140-gilbert came out three marks ahead . [The second Anne]1050-the second anne beat [him]140-gilbert by five . But [her]124-anne triumph was marred by the fact that [Gilbert]140-gilbert congratulated [her]124-anne heartily before [the whole school]902-the whole school . It would have been ever so much sweeter to [her]124-anne if [he]140-gilbert had felt the sting of [his]140-gilbert defeat .

[Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips might not be [a very good teacher]1052-a very good teacher ; but [a pupil so inflexibly determined on learning as [Anne]124-anne was]1053-a pupil so inflexibly determined on learning as anne was could hardly escape making progress under [any kind of teacher]1054-any kind of teacher . By the end of the term [Anne]124-anne and [Gilbert]140-gilbert were both promoted into [the fifth class]1055-the fifth class and allowed to begin studying the elements of " the branches"--by[202-waterloo] which Latin , geometry , French , and algebra were meant . In geometry [Anne]124-anne met [her]124-anne [Waterloo]202-waterloo .

" It 's perfectly awful stuff , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne groaned . " [I]124-anne 'm sure [I]124-anne 'll never be able to make head or tail of it . There is no scope for imagination in it at all . [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips says [I]124-anne 'm the worst dunce [he]169-mr. phillips ever saw at it . And [Gil]174-gil -- [I]124-anne mean some of the others are so smart at it . It is extremely mortifying , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[124-anne]

" Even [Diana]120-diana gets along better than [I]202-waterloo do . But [I]202-waterloo do n't mind being beaten by [Diana]120-diana . Even although [we]3035-we meet as [strangers]363-strangers now [I]202-waterloo still love [her]120-diana with an _ inextinguishable _ love . It makes [me]202-waterloo very sad at times to think about [her]120-diana . But really , [Marilla]113-marilla , one ca n't stay sad very long in such an interesting world , can one ? "[202-waterloo]

CHAPTER XVIII . [Anne]124-anne to the Rescue

ALL things great are wound up with all things little . At first glance it might not seem that the decision of [a certain Canadian Premier]1056-a certain canadian premier to include [Prince Edward Island]16-prince edward island in a political tour could have much or anything to do with the fortunes of [little Anne Shirley]124-anne at [Green Gables]107-matthew . But it had .

It was a January [the Premier]1057-the premier came , to address [[his]1057-the premier loyal supporters]1058-his loyal supporters and such of [his]1057-the premier nonsupporters as chose to be present at the monster mass meeting held in [Charlottetown]18-charlottetown . [Most of [the [Avonlea]2-avonlea people]1060-the avonlea people]1059-most of the avonlea people were on [Premier]203-premier 's side of politics ; hence on the night of the meeting nearly [all the men]1061-all the men and [a goodly proportion of [the women]1063-the women]1062-a goodly proportion of the women had gone to [town]2009-town thirty miles away . [Mrs. Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde had gone too . [Mrs. Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde was [a red - hot politician]1065-a red - hot politician and could n't have believed that the political rally could be carried through without [her]105-mrs. lynde , although [she]105-mrs. lynde was on the opposite side of politics . So [she]105-mrs. lynde went to [town]2009-town and took [[her]105-mrs. lynde husband]2923-her husband -- [Thomas]132-mrs. thomas would be useful in looking after the horse -- and [Marilla Cuthbert]113-marilla with [her]105-mrs. lynde . [Marilla]113-marilla had a sneaking interest in politics [herself]113-marilla , and as [she]113-marilla thought it might be [her]113-marilla only chance to see [a real live Premier]1068-a real live premier , [she]113-marilla promptly took it , leaving [Anne]124-anne and [Matthew]107-matthew to keep [house]2954-house until [her]113-marilla return the following day .

Hence , while [Marilla]113-marilla and [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde were enjoying [themselves]1070-themselves hugely at the mass meeting , [Anne]124-anne and [Matthew]107-matthew had [the cheerful kitchen at [Green Gables]107-matthew all to [themselves]1070-themselves]1071-the cheerful kitchen at green gables all to themselves . A bright fire was glowing in the old - fashioned Waterloo stove and blue - white frost crystals were shining on the windowpanes . [Matthew]107-matthew nodded over a _ Farmers ' Advocate _ on the sofa and [Anne]124-anne at the table studied [her]124-anne lessons with grim determination , despite sundry wistful glances at the clock shelf , where lay a new book that [Jane Andrews]121-jane had lent [her]124-anne that day . [Jane]121-jane had assured [her]124-anne that it was warranted to produce any number of thrills , or words to that effect , and [Anne]124-anne 's fingers tingled to reach out for it . But that would mean [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert 's triumph on the morrow . [Anne]124-anne turned [her]124-anne back on the clock shelf and tried to imagine it was n't [there]348-there .

" [Matthew]107-matthew , did [you]107-matthew ever study geometry when [you]107-matthew went to [school]2382-school ? "[124-anne]

" Well now , no , [I]107-matthew did n't , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , coming out of [his]107-matthew doze with a start .

" [I]124-anne wish [you]107-matthew had , "[124-anne] sighed [Anne]124-anne , " because then [you]107-matthew 'd be able to sympathize with [me]124-anne . [You]107-matthew ca n't sympathize properly if [you]107-matthew 've never studied it . It is casting a cloud over [my]124-anne whole life . [I]124-anne 'm such a dunce at it , [Matthew]107-matthew . "[124-anne]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew dunno , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew soothingly . " [I]107-matthew guess [you]124-anne 're all right at anything . [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips told [me]107-matthew last week in [[Blair]109-william blair 's store at [Carmody]5-carmody]3038-blair 's store at carmody that [you]124-anne was [the smartest scholar in school]3039-the smartest scholar in school and was making rapid progress . ? Rapid progress ' was [his]169-mr. phillips very words . There 's them as runs down [Teddy Phillips]204-teddy phillips and says [he]169-mr. phillips ai n't much of [a teacher]2915-a teacher , but [I]107-matthew guess [he]169-mr. phillips 's all right . "[107-matthew]

[Matthew]107-matthew would have thought anyone who praised [Anne]124-anne was " all right . "[107-matthew]

" [I]124-anne 'm sure [I]124-anne 'd get on better with geometry if only [he]169-mr. phillips would n't change the letters , "[124-anne] complained [Anne]124-anne . " [I]124-anne learn the proposition off by heart and then [he]169-mr. phillips draws it on the blackboard and puts different letters from what are in the book and [I]124-anne get all mixed up . [I]124-anne do n't think [a teacher]2915-a teacher should take such a mean advantage , do [you]124-anne ? [We]3042-we 're studying agriculture now and [I]124-anne 've found out at last what makes the roads red . It 's a great comfort . [I]124-anne wonder how [Marilla]113-marilla and [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde are enjoying [themselves]3043-themselves . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says [Canada]54-canada is going to the dogs the way things are being run at [Ottawa]55-ottawa and that it 's an awful warning to [the electors]3044-the electors . [She]105-mrs. lynde says if [women]423-women were allowed to vote [we]3042-we would soon see a blessed change . What way do [you]107-matthew vote , [Matthew]107-matthew ? "[124-anne]

" Conservative , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew promptly . To vote Conservative was part of [Matthew]107-matthew 's religion .

" Then [I]124-anne 'm Conservative too , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne decidedly . " [I]124-anne 'm glad because [Gil]174-gil -- because [some of [the boys in school]3047-the boys in school]3046-some of the boys in school are [Grits]205-grits . [I]124-anne guess [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips is a Grit too because [[Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews 's father]3048-prissy andrews 's father is [one]385-one , and [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis says that when [a man]2052-a man is courting [he]2052-a man always has to agree with [[the girl]2093-the girl 's mother]3052-the girl 's mother in religion and [[her]2093-the girl father]782-her father in politics . Is that true , [Matthew]107-matthew ? "[124-anne]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew dunno , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew .

" Did [you]107-matthew ever go courting , [Matthew]107-matthew ? "[124-anne]

" Well now , no , [I]107-matthew dunno 's [I]107-matthew ever did , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , who had certainly never thought of such a thing in [his]107-matthew whole existence .

[Anne]124-anne reflected with [her]124-anne chin in [her]124-anne hands .

" It must be rather interesting , do n't [you]107-matthew think , [Matthew]107-matthew ? [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis says when [she]168-ruby gillis grows up [she]168-ruby gillis 's going to have ever so many beaus on the string and have [them]3054-them all crazy about [her]168-ruby gillis ; but [I]124-anne think that would be too exciting . [I]124-anne 'd rather have just one in [his]107-matthew right mind . But [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis knows a great deal about such matters because [she]168-ruby gillis has [so many big sisters]3055-so many big sisters , and [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says [the Gillis girls]3056-the gillis girls have gone off like hot cakes . [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips goes up to see [Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews nearly every evening . [He]169-mr. phillips says it is to help [her]166-prissy andrews with [her]166-prissy andrews lessons but [Miranda Sloane]206-miranda sloane is studying for [Queen]128-queen 's 's too , and [I]124-anne should think [she]166-prissy andrews needed help a lot more than [Prissy]166-prissy andrews because [she]166-prissy andrews 's ever so much stupider , but [he]169-mr. phillips never goes to help [her]166-prissy andrews in the evenings at all . There are a great many things in [this world]2059-this world that [I]124-anne ca n't understand very well , [Matthew]107-matthew . "[124-anne]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew dunno as [I]107-matthew comprehend them all [myself]107-matthew , "[107-matthew] acknowledged [Matthew]107-matthew .

" Well , [I]124-anne suppose [I]124-anne must finish up [my]124-anne lessons . [I]124-anne wo n't allow [myself]124-anne to open that new book [Jane]121-jane lent [me]124-anne until [I]124-anne 'm through . But it 's a terrible temptation , [Matthew]107-matthew . Even when [I]124-anne turn [my]124-anne back on it [I]124-anne can see it there just as plain . [Jane]121-jane said [she]121-jane cried [herself]121-jane sick over it . [I]124-anne love a book that makes [me]124-anne cry . But [I]124-anne think [I]124-anne 'll carry that book into [the sitting room]2511-the sitting room and lock it in the jam closet and give [you]107-matthew the key . And [you]107-matthew must _ not _ give it to [me]124-anne , [Matthew]107-matthew , until [my]124-anne lessons are done , not even if [I]124-anne implore [you]107-matthew on [my]124-anne bended knees . It 's all very well to say resist temptation , but it 's ever so much easier to resist it if [you]107-matthew ca n't get the key . And then shall [I]124-anne run down [the cellar]592-the cellar and get some russets , [Matthew]107-matthew ? Would n't [you]107-matthew like some russets ? "[124-anne]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew dunno but what [I]107-matthew would , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , who never ate russets but knew [Anne]124-anne 's weakness for [them]1073-them .

Just as [Anne]124-anne emerged triumphantly from [the cellar]592-the cellar with [her]124-anne plateful of russets came the sound of flying footsteps on the icy board walk outside and the next moment the kitchen door was flung open and in rushed [Diana Barry]120-diana , white faced and breathless , with a shawl wrapped hastily around [her]120-diana head . [Anne]124-anne promptly let go of [her]124-anne candle and plate in [her]124-anne surprise , and plate , candle , and apples crashed together down the cellar ladder and were found at the bottom embedded in melted grease , the next day , by [Marilla]113-marilla , who gathered [them]1075-them up and thanked mercy [the house]350-the house had n't been set on fire .

" Whatever is the matter , [Diana]120-diana ? "[124-anne] cried [Anne]124-anne . " Has [[your]120-diana mother]2947-your mother relented at last ? "[124-anne]

" Oh , [Anne]124-anne , do come quick , "[120-diana] implored [Diana]120-diana nervously . " [Minnie May]3061-minnie may is awful sick -- [she]3061-minnie may 's got croup . [Young Mary Joe]185-young mary joe says -- and [Father]2327-father and [Mother]207-mother are away to [town]2009-town and there 's [nobody]2118-nobody to go for [the doctor]2016-the doctor . [Minnie May]3066-minnie may is awful bad and [Young Mary Joe]185-young mary joe does n't know what to do -- and oh , [Anne]124-anne , [I]120-diana 'm so scared ! "[120-diana]

[Matthew]107-matthew , without a word , reached out for cap and coat , slipped past [Diana]120-diana and away into the darkness of [the yard]2099-the yard .

" [He]107-matthew 's gone to harness the sorrel mare to go to [Carmody]5-carmody for [the doctor]2016-the doctor , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , who was hurrying on hood and jacket . " [I]124-anne know it as well as if [he]107-matthew 'd said so . [Matthew]107-matthew and [I]124-anne are such kindred spirits [I]124-anne can read [his]107-matthew thoughts without words at all . "[124-anne]

" [I]120-diana do n't believe [he]107-matthew 'll find [the doctor]2016-the doctor at [Carmody]5-carmody , "[120-diana] sobbed [Diana]120-diana . " [I]120-diana know that [Dr. Blair]208-dr. blair went to [town]2009-town and [I]120-diana guess [Dr. Spencer]209-dr. spencer would go too . [Young Mary Joe]185-young mary joe never saw [anybody with croup]3070-anybody with croup and [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde is away . Oh , [Anne]124-anne ! "[120-diana]

" Do n't cry , [Di]120-diana , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne cheerily . " [I]124-anne know exactly what to do for [croup]3071-croup . [You]120-diana forget that [Mrs. Hammond]135-mrs. hammond had [twins]2371-twins three times . When [you]120-diana look after three pairs of [twins]2371-twins [you]120-diana naturally get a lot of experience . [They]3074-they all had croup regularly . Just wait till [I]124-anne get the ipecac bottle -- [you]120-diana may n't have any at [[your]120-diana house]2049-your house . Come on now . "[124-anne]

[The two little girls]791-the two little girls hastened out hand in hand and hurried through [[Lover]210-lover 's Lane]1079-lover 's lane and across [the crusted field beyond]1080-the crusted field beyond , for the snow was too deep to go by the shorter wood way . [Anne]124-anne , although sincerely sorry for [Minnie May]1081-minnie may , was far from being insensible to the romance of the situation and to the sweetness of once more sharing that romance with [a kindred spirit]1082-a kindred spirit .

The night was clear and frosty , all ebony of shadow and silver of snowy slope ; big stars were shining over [the silent fields]1083-the silent fields ; here and there the dark pointed firs stood up with snow powdering their branches and the wind whistling through them . [Anne]124-anne thought it was truly delightful to go skimming through all this mystery and loveliness with [[your]1084-your bosom friend who had been so long estranged]1085-your bosom friend who had been so long estranged .

[Minnie May]1086-minnie may , aged three , was really very sick . [She]1086-minnie may lay on the kitchen sofa feverish and restless , while [her]1086-minnie may hoarse breathing could be heard all over [the house]350-the house . [Young Mary Joe]185-young mary joe , [a buxom , broad - faced French girl from [the creek]1089-the creek , whom [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry had engaged to stay with [the children]2362-the children during [her]1086-minnie may absence]1088-a buxom , broad - faced french girl from the creek , whom mrs. barry had engaged to stay with the children during her absence , was helpless and bewildered , quite incapable of thinking what to do , or doing it if [she]185-young mary joe thought of it .

[Anne]124-anne went to work with skill and promptness .

" [Minnie May]3076-minnie may has croup all right ; [she]3076-minnie may 's pretty bad , but [I]124-anne 've seen [them]3077-them worse . First [we]3078-we must have lots of hot water . [I]124-anne declare , [Diana]120-diana , there is n't more than a cupful in the kettle ! There , [I]124-anne 've filled it up , and , [Mary Joe]185-young mary joe , [you]120-diana may put some wood in the stove . [I]124-anne do n't want to hurt [your]120-diana feelings but it seems to [me]124-anne [you]120-diana might have thought of this before if [you]120-diana 'd any imagination . Now , [I]124-anne 'll undress [Minnie May]3079-minnie may and put [her]3079-minnie may to bed and [you]120-diana try to find some soft flannel cloths , [Diana]120-diana . [I]124-anne 'm going to give [her]3079-minnie may a dose of ipecac first of all . "[124-anne]

[Minnie May]1091-minnie may did not take kindly to the ipecac but [Anne]124-anne had not brought up [three pairs of twins]1092-three pairs of twins for nothing . Down that ipecac went , not only once , but many times during the long , anxious night when [the two little girls]791-the two little girls worked patiently over the suffering [Minnie May]1094-minnie may , and [Young Mary Joe]185-young mary joe , honestly anxious to do all [she]1091-minnie may could , kept up a roaring fire and heated more water than would have been needed for [a hospital of [croupy babies]1096-croupy babies]1095-a hospital of croupy babies .

It was three o'clock when [Matthew]107-matthew came with [a doctor]2010-a doctor , for [he]107-matthew had been obliged to go all the way to [Spencervale]52-spencervale for one . But the pressing need for assistance was past . [Minnie May]1098-minnie may was much better and was sleeping soundly .

" [I]124-anne was awfully near giving up in despair , "[124-anne] explained [Anne]124-anne . " [She]3079-minnie may got worse and worse until [she]3079-minnie may was sicker than ever [the Hammond twins]3080-the hammond twins were , even the last pair . [I]124-anne actually thought [she]3079-minnie may was going to choke to death . [I]124-anne gave [her]3079-minnie may every drop of ipecac in that bottle and when the last dose went down [I]124-anne said to [myself]124-anne -- not to [Diana]120-diana or [Young Mary Joe]185-young mary joe , because [I]124-anne did n't want to worry [them]3080-the hammond twins any more than [they]3080-the hammond twins were worried , but [I]124-anne had to say it to [myself]124-anne just to relieve [my]124-anne feelings--?This is the last lingering hope and [I]124-anne fear , tis a vain one . ' But in about three minutes [she]3079-minnie may coughed up the phlegm and began to get better right away . [You]2016-the doctor must just imagine [my]124-anne relief , [doctor]3081-doctor , because [I]124-anne ca n't express it in words . [You]2016-the doctor know there are some things that can not be expressed in words . "[124-anne]

" Yes , [I]2016-the doctor know , "[2016-the doctor] nodded [the doctor]2016-the doctor . [He]2016-the doctor looked at [Anne]124-anne as if [he]2016-the doctor were thinking some things about [her]124-anne that could n't be expressed in words . Later on , however , [he]2016-the doctor expressed them to [Mr.]1100-mr. and [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry .

" [That little redheaded girl [they]3083-they have over at [Cuthbert]113-marilla 's]3082-that little redheaded girl they have over at cuthbert 's is as smart as [they]3083-they make ? [em]3084-em . [I]2016-the doctor tell [you]2016-the doctor [she]3082-that little redheaded girl they have over at cuthbert 's saved [that baby]3085-that baby 's life , for it would have been too late by the time [I]2016-the doctor got [there]348-there . [She]3082-that little redheaded girl they have over at cuthbert 's seems to have a skill and presence of mind perfectly wonderful in [a child of [her]3082-that little redheaded girl they have over at cuthbert 's age]3087-a child of her age . [I]2016-the doctor never saw anything like the eyes of [her]3082-that little redheaded girl they have over at cuthbert 's when [she]3082-that little redheaded girl they have over at cuthbert 's was explaining the case to [me]2016-the doctor . "[2016-the doctor]

[Anne]124-anne had gone [home]361-home in the wonderful , white - frosted winter morning , heavy eyed from loss of sleep , but still talking unweariedly to [Matthew]107-matthew as [they]1102-they crossed [the long white field]1103-the long white field and walked under [the glittering fairy arch of the Lover 's Lane maples]1104-the glittering fairy arch of the lover 's lane maples .

" Oh , [Matthew]107-matthew , is n't it a wonderful morning ? [The world]409-the world looks like something [God]145-god had just imagined for [His]145-god own pleasure , does n't it ? Those trees look as if [I]2016-the doctor could blow them away with a breath -- pouf ! [I]2016-the doctor 'm so glad [I]2016-the doctor live in [a world where there are white frosts]3089-a world where there are white frosts , are n't [you]107-matthew ? And [I]2016-the doctor 'm so glad [Mrs. Hammond]135-mrs. hammond had [three pairs of twins]1092-three pairs of twins after all . If [she]135-mrs. hammond had n't [I]2016-the doctor might n't have known what to do for [Minnie]194-minnie andrews May. [I]2016-the doctor 'm real sorry [I]2016-the doctor was ever cross with [Mrs. Hammond]135-mrs. hammond for having twins . But , oh , [Matthew]107-matthew , [I]2016-the doctor 'm so sleepy . [I]2016-the doctor ca n't go to [school]2382-school . [I]2016-the doctor just know [I]2016-the doctor could n't keep [my]2016-the doctor eyes open and [I]2016-the doctor 'd be so stupid . But [I]2016-the doctor hate to stay [home]361-home , for [Gil]174-gil -- [some of [the others]3094-the others]3093-some of the others will get [head of the class]3095-head of the class , and it 's so hard to get up again -- although of course the harder it is the more satisfaction [you]107-matthew have when [you]107-matthew do get up , have n't [you]107-matthew ? "[2016-the doctor]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew guess [you]124-anne 'll manage all right , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , looking at [Anne]124-anne 's white little face and the dark shadows under [her]124-anne eyes . " [You]124-anne just go right to bed and have a good sleep . [I]107-matthew 'll do all the chores . "[107-matthew]

[Anne]124-anne accordingly went to bed and slept so long and soundly that it was well on in the white and rosy winter afternoon when [she]124-anne awoke and descended to [the kitchen]557-the kitchen where [Marilla]113-marilla , who had arrived [home]361-home in the meantime , was sitting knitting .

" Oh , did [you]124-anne see [the Premier]203-premier ? "[124-anne] exclaimed [Anne]124-anne at once . " What did [he]203-premier look like [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[124-anne]

" Well , [he]203-premier never got to be [Premier]203-premier on account of [his]203-premier looks , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " Such a nose as [that man]2886-that man had ! But [he]203-premier can speak . [I]113-marilla was proud of being [a Conservative]3097-a conservative . [Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , of course , being [a Liberal]3098-a liberal , had no use for [him]203-premier . [Your]124-anne dinner is in the oven , [Anne]124-anne , and [you]124-anne can get [yourself]124-anne some blue plum preserve out of the pantry . [I]113-marilla guess [you]124-anne 're hungry . [Matthew]107-matthew has been telling [me]113-marilla about last night . [I]113-marilla must say it was fortunate [you]124-anne knew what to do . [I]113-marilla would n't have had any idea [myself]113-marilla , for [I]113-marilla never saw a case of croup . There now , never mind talking till [you]124-anne 've had [your]124-anne dinner . [I]113-marilla can tell by the look of [you]124-anne that [you]124-anne 're just full up with speeches , but [they]3099-they 'll keep . "[113-marilla]

[Marilla]113-marilla had something to tell [Anne]124-anne , but [she]113-marilla did not tell it just then for [she]113-marilla knew if [she]113-marilla did [Anne]124-anne 's consequent excitement would lift [her]124-anne clear out of the region of such material matters as appetite or dinner . Not until [Anne]124-anne had finished [her]124-anne saucer of blue plums did [Marilla]113-marilla say :

" [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry was [here]2022-here this afternoon , [Anne]124-anne . [She]118-mrs. barry wanted to see [you]124-anne , but [I]113-marilla would n't wake [you]124-anne up . [She]118-mrs. barry says [you]124-anne saved [Minnie May]3101-minnie may 's life , and [she]118-mrs. barry is very sorry [she]118-mrs. barry acted as [she]118-mrs. barry did in that affair of the currant wine . [She]118-mrs. barry says [she]118-mrs. barry knows now [you]124-anne did n't mean to set [Diana]120-diana drunk , and [she]118-mrs. barry hopes [you]124-anne 'll forgive [her]118-mrs. barry and be good friends with [Diana]120-diana again . [You]124-anne 're to go over this evening if [you]124-anne like for [Diana]120-diana ca n't stir outside the door on account of a bad cold [she]120-diana caught last night . Now , [Anne Shirley]124-anne , for pity 's sake do n't fly up into the air . "[113-marilla]

The warning seemed not unnecessary , so uplifted and aerial was [Anne]124-anne 's expression and attitude as [she]124-anne sprang to [her]124-anne feet , [her]124-anne face irradiated with the flame of [her]124-anne spirit .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , can [I]124-anne go right now -- without washing [my]124-anne dishes ? [I]124-anne 'll wash them when [I]124-anne come back , but [I]124-anne can not tie [myself]124-anne down to anything so unromantic as dishwashing at this thrilling moment . "[124-anne]

" Yes , yes , run along , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla indulgently . " [Anne Shirley]124-anne -- are [you]124-anne crazy ? Come back this instant and put something on [you]124-anne . [I]113-marilla might as well call to the wind . [She]124-anne 's gone without a cap or wrap . Look at [her]124-anne tearing through [the orchard]2264-the orchard with [her]124-anne hair streaming . It 'll be a mercy if [she]124-anne does n't catch [her]124-anne death of cold . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne came dancing [home]361-home in the purple winter twilight across [the snowy places]1108-the snowy places .
