Afar in [the southwest]1109-the southwest was the great shimmering , pearl - like sparkle of an evening star in a sky that was pale golden and ethereal rose over gleaming white spaces and [dark glens of spruce]1110-dark glens of spruce . The tinkles of sleigh bells among [the snowy hills]1111-the snowy hills came like elfin chimes through the frosty air , but [their]1112-i music was not sweeter than the song in [Anne]124-anne 's heart and on [her]124-anne lips .

" [You]124-anne see before [you]124-anne [a perfectly happy person]3103-a perfectly happy person , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne announced . " [I]124-anne 'm perfectly happy -- yes , in spite of [my]124-anne red hair . Just at present [I]124-anne have a soul above red hair . [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry kissed [me]124-anne and cried and said [she]118-mrs. barry was so sorry and [she]118-mrs. barry could never repay [me]124-anne . [I]124-anne felt fearfully embarrassed , [Marilla]113-marilla , but [I]124-anne just said as politely as [I]124-anne could , ? [I]124-anne have no hard feelings for [you]124-anne , [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry . [I]124-anne assure [you]124-anne once for all that [I]124-anne did not mean to intoxicate [Diana]120-diana and henceforth [I]124-anne shall cover the past with the mantle of oblivion . ' That was a pretty dignified way of speaking was n't it , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[124-anne]

" [I]1112-i felt that [I]1112-i was heaping coals of fire on [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry 's head . And [Diana]120-diana and [I]1112-i had a lovely afternoon . [Diana]120-diana showed [me]1112-i a new fancy crochet stitch [[her]120-diana aunt]2526-her aunt over at [Carmody]5-carmody taught [her]120-diana . [Not a soul in [Avonlea]2-avonlea]3105-not a soul in avonlea knows it but [us]3106-we , and [we]3106-we pledged a solemn vow never to reveal it to [anyone else]3107-anyone else . [Diana]120-diana gave [me]1112-i a beautiful card with a wreath of roses on it and a verse of poetry : "[1112-i]

" If [you]1112-i love [me]124-anne as [I]124-anne love [you]1112-i Nothing but death can part [us]3106-we two . "[124-anne]

" And that is true , [Marilla]113-marilla . [We]3106-we 're going to ask [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips to let [us]3106-we sit together in [school]2382-school again , and [Gertie Pye]176-gertie pye can go with [Minnie Andrews]194-minnie andrews . [We]3106-we had an elegant tea . [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry had the very best china set out , [Marilla]113-marilla , just as if [I]1112-i was [real company]3109-real company . [I]1112-i ca n't tell [you]1112-i what a thrill it gave [me]1112-i . [Nobody]2118-nobody ever used [their]2118-nobody very best china on [my]1112-i account before . And [we]3106-we had fruit cake and pound cake and doughnuts and two kinds of preserves , [Marilla]113-marilla . And [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry asked [me]1112-i if [I]1112-i took tea and said ? Pa , why do n't [you]1112-i pass the biscuits to [Anne]124-anne ? ' It must be lovely to be grown up , [Marilla]113-marilla , when just being treated as if [you]113-marilla were is so nice . "[1112-i]

" [I]113-marilla do n't know about that , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , with a brief sigh .

" Well , anyway , when [I]124-anne am grown up , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne decidedly , " [I]124-anne 'm always going to talk to [little girls]472-little girls as if [they]472-little girls were too , and [I]124-anne 'll never laugh when [they]472-little girls use big words . [I]124-anne know from sorrowful experience how that hurts [one]385-one 's feelings . After tea [Diana]120-diana and [I]124-anne made taffy . The taffy was n't very good , [I]124-anne suppose because neither [Diana]120-diana nor [I]124-anne had ever made any before . [Diana]120-diana left [me]124-anne to stir it while [she]120-diana buttered the plates and [I]124-anne forgot and let it burn ; and then when [we]3113-we set it out on the platform to cool the cat walked over one plate and that had to be thrown away . But the making of it was splendid fun . Then when [I]124-anne came [home]361-home [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry asked [me]124-anne to come over as often as [I]124-anne could and [Diana]120-diana stood at the window and threw kisses to [me]124-anne all the way down to [[Lover]210-lover 's Lane]1079-lover 's lane . [I]124-anne assure [you]3116-you , [Marilla]113-marilla , that [I]124-anne feel like praying tonight and [I]124-anne 'm going to think out a special brand - new prayer in honor of the occasion . "[124-anne]

CHAPTER XIX . [A Concert a Catastrophe and a Confession]1113-a concert a catastrophe and a confession

" [MARILLA]113-marilla , can [I]124-anne go over to see [Diana]120-diana just for a minute ? "[124-anne] asked [Anne]124-anne , running breathlessly down from [the east gable]561-the east gable one February evening .

" [I]113-marilla do n't see what [you]113-marilla want to be traipsing about after dark for , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla shortly . " [You]113-marilla and [Diana]120-diana walked [home]361-home from [school]2382-school together and then stood down there in the snow for half an hour more , [your]113-marilla tongues going the whole blessed time , clickety - clack . So [I]113-marilla do n't think [you]113-marilla 're very badly off to see [her]120-diana again . "[113-marilla]

" But [she]120-diana wants to see [me]124-anne , "[124-anne] pleaded [Anne]124-anne . " [She]120-diana has something very important to tell [me]124-anne . "[124-anne]

" How do [you]124-anne know [she]120-diana has ? "[113-marilla]

" Because [she]120-diana just signaled to [me]124-anne from [her]120-diana window . [We]3119-we have arranged a way to signal with [our]3119-we candles and cardboard . [We]3119-we set the candle on the window sill and make flashes by passing the cardboard back and forth . So many flashes mean a certain thing . It was [my]124-anne idea , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla 'll warrant [you]113-marilla it was , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla emphatically . " And the next thing [you]113-marilla 'll be setting fire to the curtains with [your]113-marilla signaling nonsense . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , [we]3119-we 're very careful , [Marilla]113-marilla . And it 's so interesting . Two flashes mean , ? Are [you]113-marilla there ? ' Three mean ? yes ' and four ? no . ' Five mean , ? Come over as soon as possible , because [I]124-anne have something important to reveal . ' [Diana]120-diana has just signaled five flashes , and [I]124-anne 'm really suffering to know what it is . "[124-anne]

" Well , [you]113-marilla need n't suffer any longer , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla sarcastically . " [You]113-marilla can go , but [you]113-marilla 're to be back [here]2022-here in just ten minutes , remember that . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne did remember it and was back in the stipulated time , although probably [no mortal]1115-no mortal will ever know just what it cost [her]124-anne to confine the discussion of [Diana]120-diana 's important communication within the limits of ten minutes . But at least [she]124-anne had made good use of them .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , what do [you]113-marilla think ? [You]113-marilla know tomorrow is [Diana]120-diana 's birthday . Well , [[her]120-diana mother]2342-her mother told [her]120-diana [she]120-diana could ask [me]124-anne to go [home]361-home with [her]120-diana from [school]2382-school and stay all night with [her]120-diana . And [[her]120-diana cousins]3124-her cousins are coming over from [Newbridge]20-newbridge in [a big pung sleigh]3125-a big pung sleigh to go to the Debating Club concert at [the hall]551-the hall tomorrow night . And [they]3124-her cousins are going to take [Diana]120-diana and [me]124-anne to the concert -- if [you]113-marilla 'll let [me]124-anne go , that is . [You]113-marilla will , wo n't [you]113-marilla , [Marilla]113-marilla ? Oh , [I]124-anne feel so excited . "[124-anne]

" [You]113-marilla can calm down then , because [you]113-marilla 're not going . [You]113-marilla 're better at [home]361-home in [your]113-marilla own bed , and as for that club concert , it 's all nonsense , and [little girls]472-little girls should not be allowed to go out to such places at all . "[124-anne]

" [I]124-anne 'm sure [the Debating Club]3129-the debating club is a most respectable affair , "[124-anne] pleaded [Anne]124-anne .

" [I]124-anne 'm not saying it is n't . But [you]113-marilla 're not going to begin gadding about to concerts and staying out all hours of the night . Pretty doings for [children]330-children . [I]124-anne 'm surprised at [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry 's letting [Diana]120-diana go . "[124-anne]

" But it 's such a very special occasion , "[124-anne] mourned [Anne]124-anne , on the verge of tears . " [Diana]120-diana has only one birthday in a year . It is n't as if birthdays were common things , [Marilla]113-marilla . [Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews is going to recite ? Curfew Must Not Ring Tonight . ' That is such a good moral piece , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne 'm sure it would do [me]124-anne lots of good to hear it . And [the choir]3131-the choir are going to sing four lovely pathetic songs that are pretty near as good as hymns . And oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [the minister]2502-the minister is going to take part ; yes , indeed , [he]2502-the minister is ; [he]2502-the minister 's going to give an address . That will be just about the same thing as a sermon . Please , may n't [I]124-anne go , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[124-anne]

" [You]113-marilla heard what [I]124-anne said , [Anne]124-anne , did n't [you]113-marilla ? Take off [your]113-marilla boots now and go to bed . It 's past eight . "[124-anne]

" There 's just one more thing , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , with the air of producing the last shot in [her]124-anne locker . " [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry told [Diana]120-diana that [we]3133-we might sleep in the spare - room bed . Think of the honor of [your]113-marilla little [Anne]124-anne being put in [the spare - room bed]3134-the spare - room bed . "[124-anne]

" It 's an honor [you]113-marilla 'll have to get along without . Go to bed , [Anne]124-anne , and do n't let [me]124-anne hear another word out of [you]113-marilla . "[124-anne]

When [Anne]124-anne , with tears rolling over [her]124-anne cheeks , had gone sorrowfully [upstairs]2564-upstairs , [Matthew]107-matthew , who had been apparently sound asleep on [the lounge]1117-the lounge during the whole dialogue , opened [his]107-matthew eyes and said decidedly :

" Well now , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]107-matthew think [you]113-marilla ought to let [Anne]124-anne go . "[107-matthew]

" [I]113-marilla do n't then , "[113-marilla] retorted [Marilla]113-marilla . " Who 's bringing [this child]458-this child up , [Matthew]107-matthew , [you]107-matthew or [me]113-marilla ? "[113-marilla]

" Well now , [you]113-marilla , "[107-matthew] admitted [Matthew]107-matthew .

" Do n't interfere then . "[107-matthew]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew ai n't interfering . It ai n't interfering to have [your]107-matthew own opinion . And [my]107-matthew opinion is that [you]107-matthew ought to let [Anne]124-anne go . "[107-matthew]

" [You]107-matthew 'd think [I]113-marilla ought to let [Anne]124-anne go to the moon if [she]124-anne took the notion , [I]113-marilla 've no doubt "[113-marilla] was [Marilla]113-marilla 's amiable rejoinder . " [I]113-marilla might have let [her]124-anne spend the night with [Diana]120-diana , if that was all . But [I]113-marilla do n't approve of this concert plan . [She]124-anne 'd go there and catch cold like as not , and have [her]124-anne head filled up with nonsense and excitement . It would unsettle [her]124-anne for a week . [I]113-marilla understand [that child]2257-that child 's disposition and what 's good for it better than [you]107-matthew , [Matthew]107-matthew . "[113-marilla]

" [I]107-matthew think [you]113-marilla ought to let [Anne]124-anne go , "[107-matthew] repeated [Matthew]107-matthew firmly . Argument was not [his]107-matthew strong point , but holding fast to [his]107-matthew opinion certainly was . [Marilla]113-marilla gave a gasp of helplessness and took refuge in silence . The next morning , when [Anne]124-anne was washing the breakfast dishes in [the pantry]2964-the pantry , [Matthew]107-matthew paused on [his]107-matthew way out to [the barn]353-the barn to say to [Marilla]113-marilla again :

" [I]107-matthew think [you]113-marilla ought to let [Anne]124-anne go , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[107-matthew]

For a moment [Marilla]113-marilla looked things not lawful to be uttered . Then [she]113-marilla yielded to the inevitable and said tartly :

" Very well , [she]124-anne can go , since nothing else ? ll please [you]107-matthew . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne flew out of [the pantry]2964-the pantry , dripping dishcloth in hand .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [Marilla]113-marilla , say those blessed words again . "[107-matthew]

" [I]107-matthew guess once is enough to say them . This is [Matthew]107-matthew 's doings and [I]107-matthew wash [my]107-matthew hands of it . If [you]113-marilla catch pneumonia sleeping in a strange bed or coming out of [that hot hall]3137-that hot hall in the middle of the night , do n't blame [me]107-matthew , blame [Matthew]107-matthew . [Anne Shirley]124-anne , [you]113-marilla 're dripping greasy water all over the floor . [I]107-matthew never saw [such a careless child]3138-such a careless child . "[107-matthew]

" Oh , [I]124-anne know [I]124-anne 'm a great trial to [you]107-matthew , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne repentantly . " [I]124-anne make so many mistakes . But then just think of all the mistakes [I]124-anne do n't make , although [I]124-anne might . [I]124-anne 'll get some sand and scrub up the spots before [I]124-anne go to [school]2382-school . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [my]124-anne heart was just set on going to that concert . [I]124-anne never was to a concert in [my]124-anne life , and when [the other girls]3140-the other girls talk about [them]3140-the other girls in [school]2382-school [I]124-anne feel so out of it . [You]113-marilla did n't know just how [I]124-anne felt about it , but [you]113-marilla see [Matthew]107-matthew did . [Matthew]107-matthew understands [me]124-anne , and it 's so nice to be understood , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne was too excited to do [herself]124-anne justice as to lessons that morning in [school]2382-school . [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert spelled [her]124-anne down in class and left [her]124-anne clear out of sight in mental arithmetic . [Anne]124-anne 's consequent humiliation was less than it might have been , however , in view of the concert and the spare - room bed . [She]124-anne and [Diana]120-diana talked so constantly about it all day that with [a stricter teacher]1122-a stricter teacher than [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips dire disgrace must inevitably have been [their]1123-they portion .

[Anne]124-anne felt that [she]124-anne could not have borne it if [she]124-anne had not been going to the concert , for nothing else was discussed that day in [school]2382-school . [The Avonlea Debating Club]56-the avonlea debating club , which met fortnightly all winter , had had several smaller free entertainments ; but this was to be a big affair , admission ten cents , in aid of [the library]1125-the library . [The Avonlea young people]1126-the avonlea young people had been practicing for weeks , and [all the scholars]923-all the scholars were especially interested in it by reason of [older brothers]1128-older brothers and [sisters who were going to take part]1129-sisters who were going to take part . [Everybody in school over nine years of age]1130-everybody in school over nine years of age expected to go , except [Carrie Sloane]211-carrie sloane , whose father shared [Marilla]113-marilla 's opinions about [small girls]1131-small girls going out to [night concerts]1132-night concerts . [Carrie Sloane]211-carrie sloane cried into [her]211-carrie sloane grammar all the afternoon and felt that life was not worth living .

For [Anne]124-anne the real excitement began with the dismissal of [school]2382-school and increased therefrom in crescendo until it reached to a crash of positive ecstasy in the concert itself . [They]1123-they had a " perfectly elegant tea ; "[1123-they] and then came the delicious occupation of dressing in [[Diana]120-diana 's little room [upstairs]2564-upstairs]1134-diana 's little room upstairs . [Diana]120-diana did [Anne]124-anne 's front hair in the new pompadour style and [Anne]124-anne tied [Diana]120-diana 's bows with the especial knack [she]124-anne possessed ; and [they]1123-they experimented with at least half a dozen different ways of arranging [their]1123-they back hair . At last [they]1123-they were ready , cheeks scarlet and eyes glowing with excitement .

True , [Anne]124-anne could not help a little pang when [she]124-anne contrasted [her]124-anne plain black tam and shapeless , tight - sleeved , homemade gray - cloth coat with [Diana]120-diana 's jaunty fur cap and smart little jacket . But [she]124-anne remembered in time that [she]124-anne had an imagination and could use it .

Then [[Diana]120-diana 's cousins]1136-diana 's cousins , [the Murrays from [Newbridge]20-newbridge]1137-the murrays from newbridge , came ; [they]1136-diana 's cousins all crowded into the big pung sleigh , among straw and furry robes . [Anne]124-anne reveled in the drive to [the hall]551-the hall , slipping along over [the satin - smooth roads]1139-the satin - smooth roads with the snow crisping under the runners . There was a magnificent sunset , and [the snowy hills]1111-the snowy hills and [deep - blue water of [the St. Lawrence Gulf]57-the st. lawrence gulf]1141-deep - blue water of the st. lawrence gulf seemed to rim in the splendor like a huge bowl of pearl and sapphire brimmed with wine and fire . Tinkles of sleigh bells and distant laughter , that seemed like the mirth of [wood elves]1142-wood elves , came from every quarter .

" Oh , [Diana]120-diana , "[124-anne] breathed [Anne]124-anne , squeezing [Diana]120-diana 's mittened hand under the fur robe , " is n't it all like a beautiful dream ? Do [I]124-anne really look the same as usual ? [I]124-anne feel so different that it seems to [me]124-anne it must show in [my]124-anne looks . "[124-anne]

" [You]124-anne look awfully nice , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana , who having just received a compliment from [one of [[her]120-diana cousins]3124-her cousins]1143-one of her cousins , felt that [she]120-diana ought to pass it on . " [You]124-anne 've got the loveliest color . "[120-diana]

The program that night was a series of " thrills "[120-diana] for at least [one listener in the audience]1145-one listener in the audience , and , as [Anne]124-anne assured [Diana]120-diana , every succeeding thrill was thrillier than the last . When [Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews , attired in a new pink - silk waist with a string of pearls about [her]166-prissy andrews smooth white throat and real carnations in [her]166-prissy andrews hair -- rumor whispered that [the master]2832-the master had sent all the way to [town]2009-town for [them]1148-them for her--"climbed the slimy ladder , dark without one ray of light , "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne shivered in luxurious sympathy ; when [the choir]3131-the choir sang " Far Above the Gentle Daisies "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne gazed at the ceiling as if [it]1150-it were frescoed with angels ; when [Sam Sloane]212-sam sloane proceeded to explain and illustrate " How [Sockery]213-sockery Set a Hen "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne laughed until [people sitting near]1151-people sitting near [her]124-anne laughed too , more out of sympathy with [her]124-anne than with amusement at a selection that was rather threadbare even in [Avonlea]2-avonlea ; and when [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips gave [Mark Antony]214-mark antony 's oration over the dead body of [Caesar]197-the caesar in the most heart - stirring tones -- looking at [Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews at the end of every sentence -- [Anne]124-anne felt that [she]124-anne could rise and mutiny on the spot if but [one Roman citizen]1152-one roman citizen led the way .

Only one number on the program failed to interest [her]124-anne . When [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert recited " Bingen on the Rhine "[140-gilbert] [Anne]124-anne picked up [Rhoda Murray]215-rhoda murray 's library book and read it until [he]140-gilbert had finished , when [she]124-anne sat rigidly stiff and motionless while [Diana]120-diana clapped [her]120-diana hands until they tingled .

It was eleven when [they]1153-they got [home]361-home , sated with dissipation , but with the exceeding sweet pleasure of talking it all over still to come . [Everybody]2130-everybody seemed asleep and [the house]350-the house was dark and silent . " [She]3186-that anne - girl amuses [me]217-miss barry , and at [my]217-miss barry time of life [an amusing person]3187-an amusing person is a rarity . "[217-miss barry]

[Miss Barry]217-miss barry stayed [her]217-miss barry month out and over . [She]217-miss barry was [a more agreeable guest]1178-a more agreeable guest than usual , for [Anne]124-anne kept [her]217-miss barry in good humor . [They]1179-they became [firm friends]1180-firm friends .

When [Miss Barry]217-miss barry went away [she]217-miss barry said :

" Remember , [[you]217-miss barry [Anne]124-anne - girl]3188-you anne - girl , when [you]217-miss barry come to [town]2009-town [you]217-miss barry 're to visit [me]217-miss barry and [I]217-miss barry 'll put [you]217-miss barry in [[my]217-miss barry very sparest spare - room bed]3190-my very sparest spare - room bed to sleep . "[217-miss barry]

" [Miss Barry]217-miss barry was [a kindred spirit]1082-a kindred spirit , after all , "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne confided to [Marilla]113-marilla . CHAPTER XX . A Good Imagination Gone [Wrong

SPRING]59-wrong spring had come once more to [Green Gables]107-matthew -- [the beautiful capricious , reluctant Canadian spring , lingering along through April and May]1181-the beautiful capricious , reluctant canadian spring , lingering along through april and may in a succession of sweet , fresh , chilly days , with pink sunsets and miracles of resurrection and growth . The maples in [Lover 's Lane]47-lover 's lane were red budded and little curly ferns pushed up around [the Dryad 's Bubble]2728-the dryad 's bubble . Away up in [the barrens]1183-the barrens , behind [[Mr. Silas Sloane]220-mr. silas sloane 's place]1184-mr. silas sloane 's place , the Mayflowers blossomed out , pink and white stars of sweetness under their brown leaves . [All the school girls]1185-all the school girls and [boys]401-boys had one golden afternoon gathering [them]1187-them , coming [home]361-home in the clear , echoing twilight with arms and baskets full of flowery spoil .

" [I]124-anne 'm so sorry for [people who live in [lands where there are]3194-lands where there are [no Mayflowers]221-no mayflowers]3193-people who live in lands where there are no mayflowers , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne . " [Diana]120-diana says perhaps [they]3193-people who live in lands where there are no mayflowers have something better , but there could n't be anything better than Mayflowers , could there , [Marilla]113-marilla ? And [Diana]120-diana says if [they]3193-people who live in lands where there are no mayflowers do n't know what [they]3193-people who live in lands where there are no mayflowers are like [they]3193-people who live in lands where there are no mayflowers do n't miss [them]3193-people who live in lands where there are no mayflowers . But [I]124-anne think that is the saddest thing of all . [I]124-anne think it would be _ tragic _ , [Marilla]113-marilla , not to know what Mayflowers are like and _ not _ to miss them . Do [you]113-marilla know what [I]124-anne think [Mayflowers]221-no mayflowers are , [Marilla]113-marilla ? [I]124-anne think [they]221-no mayflowers must be the souls of the flowers that died last summer and this is [their]221-no mayflowers heaven . But [we]3195-we had a splendid time today , [Marilla]113-marilla . [We]3195-we had [our]3195-we lunch down in [a big mossy hollow by [an old well -- such a _ romantic _ spot]3197-an old well -- such a _ romantic _ spot]3196-a big mossy hollow by an old well -- such a _ romantic _ spot . [Charlie Sloane]173-charlie sloane dared [Arty Gillis]222-arty gillis to jump over it , and [Arty]222-arty gillis did because [he]222-arty gillis would n't take a dare . [Nobody]2118-nobody would in [school]2382-school . It is very _ fashionable _ to dare . [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips gave all the Mayflowers [he]169-mr. phillips found to [Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews and [I]124-anne heard [him]169-mr. phillips to say ? sweets to the sweet . ' [He]169-mr. phillips got that out of a book , [I]124-anne know ; but it shows [he]169-mr. phillips has some imagination . [I]124-anne was offered some Mayflowers too , but [I]124-anne rejected them with scorn . [I]124-anne ca n't tell [you]3200-you [the person]3201-the person 's name because [I]124-anne have vowed never to let it cross [my]124-anne lips . [We]3202-we made wreaths of the Mayflowers and put them on [our]3202-we hats ; and when the time came to go [home]361-home [we]3202-we marched in procession down [the road]413-the road , two by two , with [our]3202-we bouquets and wreaths , singing ? [[My]124-anne Home on [the Hill]60-the hill]3205-my home on the hill . ' Oh , it was so thrilling , [Marilla]113-marilla . [We]3202-we made a real sensation . "[124-anne]

" Not much wonder ! Such silly doings ! "[113-marilla] was [Marilla]113-marilla 's response .

After the Mayflowers came the violets , and [Violet Vale]147-violet vale was empurpled with them . [Anne]124-anne walked through it on [her]124-anne way to [school]2382-school with reverent steps and worshiping eyes , as if [she]124-anne trod on [holy ground]1190-holy ground .

" Somehow , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne told [Diana]120-diana , " when [I]124-anne 'm going through [here]2022-here [I]124-anne do n't really care whether [Gil]174-gil -- whether [anybody]2031-anybody gets ahead of [me]124-anne in class or not . But when [I]124-anne 'm up in [school]2382-school it 's all different and [I]124-anne care as much as ever . There 's such a lot of different [Annes]223-annes in [me]124-anne . [I]124-anne sometimes think that is why [I]124-anne 'm such [a troublesome person]3212-a troublesome person . If [I]124-anne was just the one [Anne]124-anne it would be ever so much more comfortable , but then it would n't be half so interesting . "[124-anne]

One June evening , when [the orchards]1191-the orchards were pink blossomed again , when the frogs were singing silverly sweet in the marshes about [the head of the Lake of [Shining Waters]25-shining waters]1192-the head of the lake of shining waters , and the air was full of the savor of [clover fields]1193-clover fields and balsamic fir woods , [Anne]124-anne was sitting by [her]124-anne gable window . [She]124-anne had been studying [her]124-anne lessons , but it had grown too dark to see the book , so [she]124-anne had fallen into wide - eyed reverie , looking out past the boughs of the Snow Queen , once more bestarred with [its]1194-its tufts of blossom .

In all essential respects [the little gable chamber]1195-the little gable chamber was unchanged . The walls were as white , the pincushion as hard , the chairs as stiffly and yellowly upright as ever . Yet the whole character of [the room]631-the room was altered . It was full of a new vital , pulsing personality that seemed to pervade it and to be quite independent of schoolgirl books and dresses and ribbons , and even of the cracked blue jug full of apple blossoms on the table . It was as if all the dreams , sleeping and waking , of [its vivid occupant]1197-its vivid occupant had taken a visible although unmaterial form and had tapestried [the bare room]1198-the bare room with splendid filmy tissues of rainbow and moonshine . [Presently Marilla]113-marilla came briskly in with some of [Anne]124-anne 's freshly ironed school aprons . [She]124-anne hung them over a chair and sat down with a short sigh . [She]124-anne had had one of [her]124-anne headaches that afternoon , and although the pain had gone [she]124-anne felt weak and " tuckered out , "[124-anne] as [she]124-anne expressed it . [Anne]124-anne looked at [her]124-anne with eyes limpid with sympathy .

" [I]124-anne do truly wish [I]124-anne could have had the headache in [your]124-anne place , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]124-anne would have endured it joyfully for [your]124-anne sake . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla guess [you]124-anne did [your]124-anne part in attending to the work and letting [me]113-marilla rest , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " [You]124-anne seem to have got on fairly well and made fewer mistakes than usual . Of course it was n't exactly necessary to starch [Matthew]107-matthew 's handkerchiefs ! And [most people]3213-most people when [they]3213-most people put a pie in the oven to warm up for dinner take it out and eat it when it gets hot instead of leaving it to be burned to a crisp . But that does n't seem to be [your]124-anne way evidently . "[113-marilla]

Headaches always left [Marilla]113-marilla somewhat sarcastic .

" Oh , [I]124-anne 'm so sorry , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne penitently . " [I]124-anne never thought about that pie from the moment [I]124-anne put it in the oven till now , although [I]124-anne felt _ instinctively _ that there was something missing on the dinner table . [I]124-anne was firmly resolved , when [you]124-anne left [me]124-anne in charge this morning , not to imagine anything , but keep [my]124-anne thoughts on facts . [I]124-anne did pretty well until [I]124-anne put the pie in , and then an irresistible temptation came to [me]124-anne to imagine [I]124-anne was [an enchanted princess shut up in [a lonely tower]3215-a lonely tower with [a handsome knight riding to [my]124-anne rescue on a coal - black steed]3216-a handsome knight riding to my rescue on a coal - black steed]3214-an enchanted princess shut up in a lonely tower with a handsome knight riding to my rescue on a coal - black steed . So that is how [I]124-anne came to forget the pie . [I]124-anne did n't know [I]124-anne starched the handkerchiefs . All the time [I]124-anne was ironing [I]124-anne was trying to think of a name for [a new island]3217-a new island [Diana]120-diana and [I]124-anne have discovered up [the brook]394-the brook . Both [Diana]120-diana and [I]124-anne are very loyal . But [I]124-anne 'm sorry about that pie and the handkerchiefs . [I]124-anne wanted to be extra good today because it 's an anniversary . " [Anne Shirley]124-anne , "[113-marilla] interrupted [Marilla]113-marilla firmly , " [I]113-marilla never want to hear [you]124-anne talking in this fashion again . [Anne]124-anne might plead and cry as [she]124-anne liked -- and did , for [her]124-anne terror was very real . [Her]124-anne imagination had run away with [her]124-anne and [she]124-anne held [the spruce grove]1010-the spruce grove in mortal dread after nightfall . But [Marilla]113-marilla was inexorable . [She]113-marilla marched [the shrinking ghost - seer]1200-the shrinking ghost - seer down to the spring and ordered [her]124-anne to proceed straightaway over [the bridge]500-the bridge and into the dusky retreats of [wailing ladies]1202-wailing ladies and [headless specters beyond]1203-headless specters beyond .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , how can [you]113-marilla be so cruel ? "[124-anne] sobbed [Anne]124-anne . " What would [you]113-marilla feel like if a white thing did snatch [me]124-anne up and carry [me]124-anne off ? "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla 'll risk it , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla unfeelingly . " [You]124-anne know [I]113-marilla always mean what [I]113-marilla say . [I]113-marilla 'll cure [you]124-anne of imagining ghosts into places . March , now . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne marched . That is , [she]124-anne stumbled over [the bridge]500-the bridge and went shuddering up the horrible dim path beyond . [Anne]124-anne never forgot that walk . Bitterly did [she]124-anne repent the license [she]124-anne had given to [her]124-anne imagination . [The goblins of [her]124-anne fancy]1205-the goblins of her fancy lurked in every shadow about [her]124-anne , reaching out [their]1205-the goblins of her fancy cold , fleshless hands to grasp [the terrified small girl who had called them into being]1206-the terrified small girl who had called them into being . A white strip of birch bark blowing up from the hollow over the brown floor of [the grove]933-the grove made [her]124-anne heart stand still . The long - drawn wail of two old boughs rubbing against each other brought out the perspiration in beads on [her]124-anne forehead . The swoop of bats in the darkness over [her]124-anne was as the wings of unearthly creatures . When [she]124-anne reached [[Mr. William Bell]154-mr. bell 's field]1208-mr. william bell 's field [she]124-anne fled across [it]1208-mr. william bell 's field as if pursued by an army of white things , and arrived at [the Barry kitchen]1209-the barry kitchen door so out of breath that [she]124-anne could hardly gasp out [her]124-anne request for the apron pattern . [Diana]120-diana was away so that [she]124-anne had no excuse to linger . The dreadful return journey had to be faced . [Anne]124-anne went back over it with shut eyes , preferring to take the risk of dashing [her]124-anne brains out among the boughs to that of seeing a white thing . When [she]124-anne finally stumbled over [the log bridge]790-the log bridge [she]124-anne drew one long shivering breath of relief .

" Well , so nothing caught [you]124-anne ? "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla unsympathetically .

CHAPTER XXI . A New Departure in [Flavorings]65-flavorings

" DEAR [ME]124-anne , there is nothing but meetings and partings in [this world]2059-this world , as [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says , "[124-anne] remarked [Anne]124-anne plaintively , putting [her]124-anne slate and books down on the [kitchen]691-kitchen table on the last day of June and wiping [her]124-anne red eyes with a very damp handkerchief . " Was n't it fortunate , [Marilla]113-marilla , that [I]124-anne took an extra handkerchief to [school]2382-school today ? [I]124-anne had a presentiment that it would be needed . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla never thought [you]124-anne were so fond of [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips that [you]124-anne 'd require two handkerchiefs to dry [your]124-anne tears just because [he]169-mr. phillips was going away , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla .

" [I]124-anne do n't think [I]124-anne was crying because [I]124-anne was really so very fond of [him]169-mr. phillips , "[124-anne] reflected [Anne]124-anne . " [I]124-anne just cried because [all the others]3257-all the others did . It was [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis started it . [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis has always declared [she]168-ruby gillis hated [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips , but just as soon as [he]169-mr. phillips got up to make [his]169-mr. phillips farewell speech [she]168-ruby gillis burst into tears . Then [all the girls]3258-all the girls began to cry , one after [the other]3259-the other . [I]124-anne tried to hold out , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]124-anne tried to remember the time [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips made [me]124-anne sit with [Gil]174-gil -- with [a boy]406-a boy ; and the time [he]169-mr. phillips spelled [my]124-anne name without an ? e ' on the blackboard ; and how [he]169-mr. phillips said [I]124-anne was [the worst dunce [he]169-mr. phillips ever saw at geometry]3261-the worst dunce he ever saw at geometry and laughed at [my]124-anne spelling ; and all the times [he]169-mr. phillips had been so horrid and sarcastic ; but somehow [I]124-anne could n't , [Marilla]113-marilla , and [I]124-anne just had to cry too . [Jane Andrews]121-jane has been talking for a month about how glad [she]121-jane 'd be when [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips went away and [she]121-jane declared [she]121-jane 'd never shed a tear . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , it was heartrending . [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips made such a beautiful farewell speech beginning , ? The time has come for [us]3262-us to part . ' It was very affecting . And [he]169-mr. phillips had tears in [his]169-mr. phillips eyes too , [Marilla]113-marilla . Oh , [I]124-anne felt dreadfully sorry and remorseful for all the times [I]124-anne 'd talked in [school]2382-school and drawn pictures of [him]169-mr. phillips on [my]124-anne slate and made fun of [him]169-mr. phillips and [Prissy]166-prissy andrews . [I]124-anne can tell [you]3266-you [I]124-anne wished [I]124-anne 'd been [a model pupil]3031-a model pupil like [Minnie Andrews]194-minnie andrews . [She]194-minnie andrews had n't anything on [her]194-minnie andrews conscience . [The girls]2852-the girls cried all the way [home]361-home from [school]2382-school . [Carrie Sloane]211-carrie sloane kept saying every few minutes , ? The time has come for [us]3271-us to part , ' and that would start [us]3271-us off again whenever [we]3271-us were in any danger of cheering up . [I]124-anne do feel dreadfully sad , [Marilla]113-marilla . Monday and Tuesday great preparations went on at [Green Gables]107-matthew . Wednesday morning came . [Anne]232-anne got up at sunrise because [she]232-anne was too excited to sleep . [She]232-anne had caught a severe cold in the head by reason of [her]232-anne dabbling in the spring on the preceding evening ; but nothing short of absolute pneumonia could have quenched [her]232-anne interest in culinary matters that morning . After breakfast [she]232-anne proceeded to make [her]232-anne cake . When [she]232-anne finally shut the oven door upon it [she]232-anne drew a long breath .

" [I]232-anne 'm sure [I]232-anne have n't forgotten anything this time , [Marilla]113-marilla . But do [you]113-marilla think it will rise ? Just suppose perhaps the baking powder is n't good ? [I]232-anne used it out of the new can . And [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says [you]113-marilla can never be sure of getting good baking powder nowadays when everything is so adulterated . " [We]3342-we 'll have plenty without it "[113-marilla] was [Marilla]113-marilla 's unimpassioned way of looking at the subject .

The cake did rise , however , and came out of the oven as light and feathery as golden foam . [Anne]232-anne , flushed with delight , clapped it together with layers of ruby jelly and , in imagination , saw [Mrs. Allan]232-anne eating it and possibly asking for another piece !

" [You]113-marilla 'll be using the best tea set , of course , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne said . " Can [I]232-anne fix the table with ferns and wild roses ? "[232-anne]

" [I]113-marilla think that 's all nonsense , "[113-marilla] sniffed [Marilla]113-marilla . " In [my]113-marilla opinion it 's the eatables that matter and not flummery decorations . "[113-marilla]

" [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry had _ [her]118-mrs. barry _ table decorated , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne , who was not entirely guiltless of the wisdom of the serpent , " and [the minister]2502-the minister paid [her]118-mrs. barry an elegant compliment . [He]2502-the minister said it was a feast for the eye as well as the palate . "[232-anne]

" Well , do as [you]232-anne like , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , who was quite determined not to be surpassed by [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry or [anybody else]1254-anybody else . " Only mind [you]232-anne leave enough room for the dishes and the food . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]232-anne laid [herself]232-anne out to decorate in a manner and after a fashion that should leave [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry 's nowhere . " It 's [Anne]232-anne 's doings , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , grimly just ; and [Anne]232-anne felt that [Mrs. Allan]232-anne 's approving smile was almost too much happiness for [this world]2059-this world .

[Matthew]107-matthew was there , having been inveigled into the party only goodness and [Anne]232-anne knew how . [He]107-matthew had been in such a state of shyness and nervousness that [Marilla]113-marilla had given [him]107-matthew up in despair , but [Anne]232-anne took [him]107-matthew in hand so successfully that [he]107-matthew now sat at the table in [his]107-matthew best clothes and white collar and talked to [the minister]2502-the minister not uninterestingly . [He]107-matthew never said a word to [Mrs. Allan]232-anne , but that perhaps was not to be expected .

All went merry as a marriage bell until [Anne]232-anne 's layer cake was passed . [Mrs. Allan]232-anne , having already been helped to a bewildering variety , declined it . But [Marilla]113-marilla , seeing the disappointment on [Anne]232-anne 's face , said smilingly :

" Oh , [you]232-anne must take a piece of this , [Mrs. Allan]232-anne . [Anne]232-anne made it on purpose for [you]232-anne . "[113-marilla]

" In that case [I]232-anne must sample it , "[232-anne] laughed [Mrs. Allan]232-anne , helping [herself]232-anne to a plump triangle , as did also [the minister]2502-the minister and [Marilla]113-marilla .

[Mrs. Allan]232-anne took a mouthful of [hers]232-anne and a most peculiar expression crossed [her]232-anne face ; not a word did [she]232-anne say , however , but steadily ate away at it . [Marilla]113-marilla saw the expression and hastened to taste the cake .

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne ! "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla exclaimed , " what on earth did [you]232-anne put into that cake ? "[113-marilla]

" Nothing but what the recipe said , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] cried [Anne]124-anne with a look of anguish . " Oh , is n't it all right ? "[124-anne]

" All right ! It 's simply horrible . [Mr. Allan]230-mr. allan , do n't try to eat it . [Anne]124-anne , taste it [yourself]124-anne . What flavoring did [you]124-anne use ? "[113-marilla]

" Vanilla , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , [her]124-anne face scarlet with mortification after tasting the cake . " Only vanilla . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , it must have been the baking powder . [I]124-anne had [my]124-anne suspicions of that bak-- "[124-anne]

" Baking powder fiddlesticks ! Go and bring [me]113-marilla the bottle of vanilla [you]124-anne used . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne fled to [the pantry]2964-the pantry and returned with a small bottle partially filled with a brown liquid and labeled yellowly , " Best Vanilla . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla took it , uncorked it , smelled it .

" Mercy on [us]3344-us , [Anne]124-anne , [you]124-anne 've flavored that cake with _ [Anodyne Liniment]235-anodyne liniment _ . [I]124-anne broke the liniment bottle last week and poured what was left into an old empty vanilla bottle . [I]124-anne suppose it 's partly [my]124-anne fault -- [I]124-anne should have warned [you]124-anne -- but for pity 's sake why could n't [you]124-anne have smelled it ? "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne dissolved into tears under this double disgrace .

" [I]124-anne couldn't -- [I]124-anne had such a cold ! "[124-anne] and with this [she]124-anne fairly fled to [the gable chamber]1262-the gable chamber , where [she]124-anne cast [herself]124-anne on the bed and wept as [one who refuses to be comforted]1263-one who refuses to be comforted .

Presently a light step sounded on the stairs and [somebody]436-somebody entered [the room]631-the room .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] sobbed [Anne]124-anne , without looking up , " [I]124-anne 'm disgraced forever . [I]124-anne shall never be able to live this down . It will get out -- things always do get out in [Avonlea]2-avonlea . [Diana]120-diana will ask [me]124-anne how [my]124-anne cake turned out and [I]124-anne shall have to tell [her]120-diana the truth . [I]124-anne shall always be pointed at as [the girl who flavored a cake with anodyne liniment]3345-the girl who flavored a cake with anodyne liniment . [Gil]174-gil -- [the boys in school]3047-the boys in school will never get over laughing at it . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , if [you]113-marilla have a spark of Christian pity do n't tell [me]124-anne that [I]124-anne must go down and wash the dishes after this . [I]124-anne 'll wash them when [the minister]2502-the minister and [[his]2502-the minister wife]2053-his wife are gone , but [I]124-anne can not ever look [Mrs. Allan]232-anne in the face again . Perhaps [she]232-anne 'll think [I]124-anne tried to poison [her]232-anne . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says [she]105-mrs. lynde knows [an orphan girl who tried to poison [[her]105-mrs. lynde benefactor]3350-her benefactor]3349-an orphan girl who tried to poison her benefactor . But the liniment is n't poisonous . It 's meant to be taken internally -- although not in cakes . Wo n't [you]232-anne tell [Mrs. Allan]232-anne so , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[124-anne]

" Suppose [you]232-anne jump up and tell [her]232-anne so [yourself]232-anne , "[232-anne] said a merry voice .

[Anne]232-anne flew up , to find [Mrs. Allan]232-anne standing by [her]232-anne bed , surveying [her]232-anne with laughing eyes .

" [[My]232-anne dear little girl]3351-my dear little girl , [you]232-anne must n't cry like this , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne said , genuinely disturbed by [Anne]232-anne 's tragic face . " Why , it 's all just a funny mistake that [anybody]2031-anybody might make . "[232-anne]

" Oh , no , it takes [me]232-anne to make such a mistake , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne forlornly . " And [I]232-anne wanted to have that cake so nice for [you]232-anne , [Mrs. Allan]232-anne . "[232-anne]

" Yes , [I]232-anne know , [dear]2414-dear . And [I]232-anne assure [you]2414-dear [I]232-anne appreciate [your]2414-dear kindness and thoughtfulness just as much as if it had turned out all right . Now , [you]2414-dear must n't cry any more , but come down with [me]232-anne and show [me]232-anne [[your]2414-dear flower garden]3354-your flower garden . [Miss Cuthbert]113-marilla tells [me]232-anne [you]2414-dear have a little plot all [your]2414-dear own . [I]232-anne want to see it , for [I]232-anne 'm very much interested in flowers . "[232-anne]

[Anne]232-anne permitted [herself]232-anne to be led down and comforted , reflecting that it was really providential that [Mrs. Allan]232-anne was [a kindred spirit]1082-a kindred spirit . Nothing more was said about the liniment cake , and when [the guests]1267-the guests went away [Anne]232-anne found that [she]232-anne had enjoyed the evening more than could have been expected , considering that terrible incident . Nevertheless , [she]232-anne sighed deeply .

" [Marilla]113-marilla , is n't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet ? "[1267-the guests]

" [I]113-marilla 'll warrant [you]232-anne 'll make plenty in it , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " [I]113-marilla never saw [your]232-anne beat for making mistakes , [Anne]232-anne . "[113-marilla]

" Yes , and well [I]232-anne know it , "[232-anne] admitted [Anne]232-anne mournfully . " But have [you]113-marilla ever noticed one encouraging thing about [me]232-anne , [Marilla]113-marilla ? [I]232-anne never make the same mistake twice . "[232-anne]

" [I]1267-the guests do n't know as that 's much benefit when [you]113-marilla 're always making new ones . "[1267-the guests]

" Oh , do n't [you]113-marilla see , [Marilla]113-marilla ? There must be a limit to the mistakes [one person]3355-one person can make , and when [I]232-anne get to the end of them , then [I]232-anne 'll be through with [them]3356-them . That 's a very comforting thought . "[232-anne]

" Well , [you]113-marilla 'd better go and give that cake to the pigs , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " It is n't fit for [any human]3357-any human to eat , not even [Jerry Boute]236-jerry boute . "[113-marilla]

CHAPTER XXII . [Anne]232-anne is Invited Out to Tea

" AND what are [your]113-marilla eyes popping out of [your]113-marilla head about . Now ? "[113-marilla] asked [Marilla]113-marilla , when [Anne]232-anne had just come in from a run to [the post office]1268-the post office . " Have [you]113-marilla discovered another kindred spirit ? "[232-anne] Excitement hung around [Anne]232-anne like a garment , shone in [her]232-anne eyes , kindled in every feature . [She]232-anne had come dancing up [the lane]380-the lane , like a wind - blown sprite , through the mellow sunshine and lazy shadows of the August evening .

" No , [Marilla]113-marilla , but oh , what do [you]113-marilla think ? [I]232-anne am invited to tea at [the manse]2492-the manse tomorrow afternoon ! [Mrs. Allan]232-anne left the letter for [me]232-anne at [the post office]1268-the post office . Just look at it , [Marilla]113-marilla . ? [Miss Anne Shirley]124-anne , [Green Gables]107-matthew . ' That is the first time [I]232-anne was ever called ? [Miss.]237-miss. ' Such a thrill as it gave [me]232-anne ! [I]232-anne shall cherish it forever among [my]232-anne choicest treasures . "[232-anne]

" [Mrs. Allan]232-anne told [me]113-marilla [she]232-anne meant to have [all the members of [[her]232-anne Sunday - school class]3361-her sunday - school class]3360-all the members of her sunday - school class to tea in turn , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , regarding the wonderful event very coolly . " [You]232-anne need n't get in such a fever over it . Do learn to take things calmly , [child]2497-child . "[113-marilla]

For [Anne]232-anne to take things calmly would have been to change [her]232-anne nature . All " spirit and fire and dew , "[232-anne] as [she]232-anne was , the pleasures and pains of life came to [her]232-anne with trebled intensity . [Marilla]113-marilla felt this and was vaguely troubled over it , realizing that the ups and downs of existence would probably bear hardly on this impulsive soul and not sufficiently understanding that the equally great capacity for delight might more than compensate . Therefore [Marilla]113-marilla conceived it to be [her]113-marilla duty to drill [Anne]232-anne into a tranquil uniformity of disposition as impossible and alien to [her]232-anne as to a dancing sunbeam in one of [the brook shallows]1270-the brook shallows . [She]113-marilla did not make much headway , as [she]113-marilla sorrowfully admitted to [herself]113-marilla . The downfall of some dear hope or plan plunged [Anne]232-anne into " deeps of affliction . "[113-marilla] The fulfillment thereof exalted [her]232-anne to dizzy realms of delight . [Marilla]113-marilla had almost begun to despair of ever fashioning this waif of [the world]409-the world into [[her]113-marilla model little girl of demure manners and prim deportment]1272-her model little girl of demure manners and prim deportment . Neither would [she]113-marilla have believed that [she]113-marilla really liked [Anne]232-anne much better as [she]113-marilla was .

[Anne]232-anne went to bed that night speechless with misery because [Matthew]107-matthew had said the wind was round northeast and [he]107-matthew feared it would be a rainy day tomorrow . The rustle of the poplar leaves about [the house]350-the house worried [her]232-anne , it sounded so like pattering raindrops , and the full , faraway roar of [the gulf]1274-the gulf , to which [she]232-anne listened delightedly at other times , loving its strange , sonorous , haunting rhythm , now seemed like a prophecy of storm and disaster to [a small maiden who particularly wanted a fine day]1275-a small maiden who particularly wanted a fine day . [Anne]232-anne thought that the morning would never come .

But all things have an end , even nights before the day on which [you]1276-you are invited to take tea at [the manse]2492-the manse . The morning , in spite of [Matthew]107-matthew 's predictions , was fine and [Anne]232-anne 's spirits soared to their highest . " Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , there is something in [me]232-anne today that makes [me]232-anne just love [everybody]2130-everybody [I]232-anne see , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne exclaimed as [she]232-anne washed the breakfast dishes . " [You]113-marilla do n't know how good [I]232-anne feel ! Would n't it be nice if it could last ? [I]232-anne believe [I]232-anne could be [a model child]3364-a model child if [I]232-anne were just invited out to tea every day . But oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , it 's a solemn occasion too . [I]232-anne feel so anxious . What if [I]232-anne should n't behave properly ? [You]113-marilla know [I]232-anne never had tea at [a manse]3365-a manse before , and [I]232-anne 'm not sure that [I]232-anne know all the rules of etiquette , although [I]232-anne 've been studying the rules given in [the Etiquette Department of [the Family Herald]3367-the family herald]3366-the etiquette department of the family herald ever since [I]232-anne came [here]2022-here . [I]232-anne 'm so afraid [I]232-anne 'll do something silly or forget to do something [I]232-anne should do . Would it be good manners to take a second helping of anything if [you]113-marilla wanted to _ very _ much ? "[232-anne]

" The trouble with [you]113-marilla , [Anne]232-anne , is that [you]113-marilla 're thinking too much about [yourself]113-marilla . [You]113-marilla should just think of [Mrs. Allan]232-anne and what would be nicest and most agreeable to [her]232-anne , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , hitting for once in [her]113-marilla life on a very sound and pithy piece of advice . [Anne]232-anne instantly realized this .

" [You]113-marilla are right , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]232-anne 'll try not to think about [myself]232-anne at all . "[232-anne]

[Anne]232-anne evidently got through [her]232-anne visit without any serious breach of " etiquette , "[232-anne] for [she]232-anne came [home]361-home through the twilight , under a great , high - sprung sky gloried over with trails of saffron and rosy cloud , in a beatified state of mind and told [Marilla]113-marilla all about it happily , sitting on the big red - sandstone slab at the [kitchen]691-kitchen door with [her]113-marilla tired curly head in [Marilla]113-marilla 's gingham lap .

A cool wind was blowing down over the long harvest fields from [the rims of firry western hills]1280-the rims of firry western hills and whistling through the poplars . One clear star hung over [the orchard]2264-the orchard and the fireflies were flitting over in [[Lover]210-lover 's Lane]1079-lover 's lane , in and out among the ferns and rustling boughs . [Anne]232-anne watched [them]1283-i as [she]113-marilla talked and somehow felt that wind and stars and fireflies were all tangled up together into something unutterably sweet and enchanting .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]1283-i 've had a most _ fascinating _ time . [I]1283-i feel that [I]1283-i have not lived in vain and [I]1283-i shall always feel like that even if [I]1283-i should never be invited to tea at [a manse]3365-a manse again . When [I]1283-i got [there]348-there [Mrs. Allan]232-anne met [me]1283-i at the door . [She]232-anne was dressed in the sweetest dress of pale - pink organdy , with dozens of frills and elbow sleeves , and [she]232-anne looked just like a seraph . [I]1283-i really think [I]1283-i 'd like to be [[a minister]2514-a minister 's wife]3284-a minister 's wife when [I]1283-i grow up , [Marilla]113-marilla . [A minister]2514-a minister might n't mind [my]1283-i red hair because [he]2514-a minister would n't be thinking of such worldly things . But then of course one would have to be naturally good and [I]1283-i 'll never be that , so [I]1283-i suppose there 's no use in thinking about it . [Some people]2127-some people are naturally good , [you]3375-you know , and [others]3376-others are not . [I]1283-i 'm one of [the others]3094-the others . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says [I]1283-i 'm full of original sin . No matter how hard [I]1283-i try to be good [I]1283-i can never make such a success of it as [those who are naturally good]3378-those who are naturally good . It 's a good deal like geometry , [I]1283-i expect . But do n't [you]3375-you think the trying so hard ought to count for something ? [Mrs. Allan]232-anne is one of [the naturally good people]3379-the naturally good people . [I]1283-i love [her]232-anne passionately . [You]3375-you know there are [some people]2127-some people , like [Matthew]107-matthew and [Mrs. Allan]232-anne that [you]3375-you can love right off without any trouble . And there are others , like [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , that [you]3375-you have to try very hard to love . [You]3375-you know [you]3375-you _ ought _ to love [them]3381-them because [they]3381-them know so much and are [such active workers in [the church]751-the church]3382-such active workers in the church , but [you]3375-you have to keep reminding [yourself]3375-you of it all the time or else [you]3375-you forget . There was [another little girl at [the manse]2492-the manse]3384-another little girl at the manse to tea , from [the White Sands Sunday school]3386-the white sands sunday school . [Her]3384-another little girl at the manse name was [Laurette Bradley]238-laurette bradley , and [she]3384-another little girl at the manse was [a very nice little girl]2524-a very nice little girl . Not exactly a kindred spirit , [you]3375-you know , but still very nice . [We]3388-we had an elegant tea , and [I]1283-i think [I]1283-i kept all the rules of etiquette pretty well . After tea [Mrs. Allan]232-anne played and sang and [she]232-anne got [Lauretta]239-lauretta and [me]1283-i to sing too . [Mrs. Allan]232-anne says [I]1283-i have a good voice and [she]232-anne says [I]1283-i must sing in [the Sunday - school choir]3389-the sunday - school choir after this . [You]3375-you ca n't think how [I]1283-i was thrilled at the mere thought . [I]1283-i 've longed so to sing in [the Sunday - [school choir]3391-school choir]3389-the sunday - school choir , as [Diana]120-diana does , but [I]1283-i feared it was an honor [I]1283-i could never aspire to . [Lauretta]239-lauretta had to go [home]361-home early because there is a big concert in [the White Sands Hotel]2408-the white sands hotel tonight and [[her]239-lauretta sister]3394-her sister is to recite at it . [Lauretta]239-lauretta says that [the Americans at [the hotel]3396-the hotel]3395-the americans at the hotel give a concert every fortnight in aid of [the Charlottetown hospital]3397-the charlottetown hospital , and [they]3395-the americans at the hotel ask [lots of [the White Sands people]3399-the white sands people]3398-lots of the white sands people to recite . [Lauretta]239-lauretta said [she]239-lauretta expected to be asked [herself]239-lauretta someday . [I]1283-i just gazed at [her]239-lauretta in awe . After [she]239-lauretta had gone [Mrs. Allan]232-anne and [I]1283-i had a heart - to - heart talk . [I]1283-i told [her]232-anne everything -- about [Mrs. Thomas]132-mrs. thomas and [the twins]3400-the twins and [Katie Maurice]146-katie maurice and [Violetta]147-violet vale and coming to [Green Gables]107-matthew and [my]1283-i troubles over geometry . And would [you]3401-you believe it , [Marilla]113-marilla ? [Mrs. Allan]232-anne told [me]1283-i [she]232-anne was [a dunce at geometry]3402-a dunce at geometry too . [You]3401-you do n't know how that encouraged [me]1283-i . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde came to [the manse]2492-the manse just before [I]1283-i left , and what do [you]3401-you think , [Marilla]113-marilla ? [The trustees]3404-the trustees have hired [a new teacher]3405-a new teacher and it 's [a lady]2451-a lady . [Her]3405-a new teacher name is [Miss Muriel Stacy]240-miss stacy . Is n't that a romantic name ? [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says [they]3404-the trustees 've never had [a female teacher in [Avonlea]2-avonlea]3407-a female teacher in avonlea before and [she]105-mrs. lynde thinks it is a dangerous innovation . But [I]1283-i think it will be splendid to have [a lady teacher]3408-a lady teacher , and [I]1283-i really do n't see how [I]1283-i 'm going to live through the two weeks before school begins . [I]1283-i 'm so impatient to see [her]3408-a lady teacher . "[1283-i]

CHAPTER XXIII . [Anne]232-anne Comes to [Grief]69-grief in an Affair of [Honor

ANNE]241-honor anne had to live through more than two weeks , as it happened . Almost a month having elapsed since the liniment cake episode , it was high time for [her]232-anne to get into fresh trouble of some sort , little mistakes , such as absentmindedly emptying a pan of skim milk into a basket of yarn balls in the pantry instead of into the pigs ' bucket , and walking clean over the edge of the log bridge into [the brook]394-the brook while wrapped in imaginative reverie , not really being worth counting .

A week after the tea at [the manse]2492-the manse [Diana Barry]120-diana gave a party .

" [Small and select]3409-small and select , "[241-honor anne] [Anne]241-honor anne assured [Marilla]113-marilla . " Just [the girls in [our]1286-they class]3410-the girls in our class . "[241-honor anne]

[They]1286-they had a very good time and nothing untoward happened until after tea , when [they]1286-they found [themselves]1286-they in [the Barry garden]786-the barry garden , a little tired of all [their]1286-they games and ripe for any enticing form of mischief which might present itself . This presently took the form of " daring . "[1292-them]

Daring was the fashionable amusement among [the Avonlea small fry]1288-the avonlea small fry just then . It had begun among [the boys]2853-the boys , but soon spread to [the girls]2852-the girls , and all the silly things that were done in [Avonlea]2-avonlea that summer because [the doers thereof]1291-the doers thereof were " dared "[1292-them] to do [them]1292-them would fill a book by [themselves]1291-the doers thereof .

First of all [Carrie Sloane]211-carrie sloane dared [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis to climb to a certain point in the huge old willow tree before the front door ; which [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis , albeit in mortal dread of the fat green caterpillars with which said tree was infested and with the fear of [[her]168-ruby gillis mother]2342-her mother before [her]168-ruby gillis eyes if [she]168-ruby gillis should tear [her]168-ruby gillis new muslin dress , nimbly did , to the discomfiture of [the aforesaid Carrie Sloane]211-carrie sloane . Then [Josie Pye]175-josie pye dared [Jane Andrews]121-jane to hop on [her]121-jane left leg around [the garden]573-the garden without stopping once or putting [her]121-jane right foot to the ground ; which [Jane Andrews]121-jane gamely tried to do , but gave out at the third corner and had to confess [herself]121-jane defeated .

[Josie]175-josie pye 's triumph being rather more pronounced than good taste permitted , [Anne Shirley]124-anne dared [her]175-josie pye to walk along the top of the board fence which bounded [the garden]573-the garden to the east . Now , to " walk "[175-josie pye] board fences requires more skill and steadiness of head and heel than one might suppose who has never tried it . But [Josie Pye]175-josie pye , if deficient in some qualities that make for popularity , had at least a natural and inborn gift , duly cultivated , for walking board fences . [Josie]175-josie pye walked [the Barry fence]1296-the barry fence with an airy unconcern which seemed to imply that a little thing like that was n't worth a " dare . "[175-josie pye] Reluctant admiration greeted [her]175-josie pye exploit , for most of [the other girls]3140-the other girls could appreciate it , having suffered many things [themselves]1298-themselves in [their]1298-themselves efforts to walk fences . [Josie]175-josie pye descended from [her]175-josie pye perch , flushed with victory , and darted a defiant glance at [Anne]124-anne .

[Anne]124-anne tossed [her]124-anne red braids .

" [I]175-josie pye do n't think it 's such a very wonderful thing to walk a little , low , board fence , "[175-josie pye] [she]175-josie pye said . " [I]175-josie pye knew [a girl in [Marysville]33-marysville]3411-a girl in marysville [who could walk the ridgepole of a roof]3412-who could walk the ridgepole of a roof . "[175-josie pye]

" [I]175-josie pye do n't believe it , "[175-josie pye] said [Josie]175-josie pye flatly . " [I]175-josie pye do n't believe [anybody]2031-anybody could walk a ridgepole . _ [You]124-anne _ could n't , anyhow . "[175-josie pye]

" Could n't [I]124-anne ? "[124-anne] cried [Anne]124-anne rashly .

" Then [I]175-josie pye dare [you]124-anne to do it , "[175-josie pye] said [Josie]175-josie pye defiantly . " [I]175-josie pye dare [you]124-anne to climb up there and walk the ridgepole of [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry 's kitchen roof . "[175-josie pye]

[Anne]124-anne turned pale , but there was clearly only one thing to be done . [She]124-anne walked toward [the house]350-the house , where a ladder was leaning against the [kitchen roof]1300-kitchen roof . [All the fifth - class girls]1301-all the fifth - class girls said , " Oh ! "[1301-all the fifth - class girls] partly in excitement , partly in dismay .

" Do n't [you]124-anne do it , [Anne]124-anne , "[120-diana] entreated [Diana]120-diana . " [You]124-anne 'll fall off and be killed . Never mind [Josie Pye]175-josie pye . It is n't fair to dare [anybody]2031-anybody to do anything so dangerous . "[120-diana]

" [I]124-anne must do it . [My]124-anne honor is at stake , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne solemnly . " [I]124-anne shall walk that ridgepole , [Diana]120-diana , or perish in the attempt . If [I]124-anne am killed [you]120-diana are to have [my]124-anne pearl bead ring . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne climbed the ladder amid breathless silence , gained the ridgepole , balanced [herself]124-anne uprightly on that precarious footing , and started to walk along [it]1302-it , dizzily conscious that [she]124-anne was uncomfortably high up in [the world]409-the world and that walking ridgepoles was not a thing in which [your]1304-your imagination helped [you]1304-your out much . Nevertheless , [she]124-anne managed to take several steps before the catastrophe came . Then [she]124-anne swayed , lost [her]124-anne balance , stumbled , staggered , and fell , sliding down over the sun - baked roof and crashing off it through the tangle of [Virginia]70-virginia creeper beneath -- all before [the dismayed circle below]1305-the dismayed circle below could give a simultaneous , terrified shriek .

If [Anne]124-anne had tumbled off the roof on the side up which [she]124-anne had ascended [Diana]120-diana would probably have fallen heir to the pearl bead ring then and there . Fortunately [she]124-anne fell on the other side , where the roof extended down over [the porch]752-the porch so nearly to the ground that a fall therefrom was a much less serious thing . Nevertheless , when [Diana]120-diana and [the other girls]3140-the other girls had rushed frantically around [the house]350-the house -- except [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis , who remained as if rooted to the ground and went into hysterics -- [they]1309-they found [Anne]124-anne lying all white and limp among the wreck and ruin of the [Virginia]70-virginia creeper .

" [Anne]124-anne , are [you]124-anne killed ? "[120-diana] shrieked [Diana]120-diana , throwing [herself]120-diana on [her]120-diana knees beside [[her]120-diana friend]1310-her friend . " Oh , [Anne]124-anne , [dear Anne]124-anne , speak just one word to [me]120-diana and tell [me]120-diana if [you]124-anne 're killed . "[120-diana]

To the immense relief of all [the girls]2852-the girls , and especially of [Josie Pye]175-josie pye , who , in spite of lack of imagination , had been seized with horrible visions of a future branded as [the girl who was the cause of [Anne Shirley]124-anne 's early and tragic death]1312-the girl who was the cause of anne shirley 's early and tragic death , [Anne]124-anne sat dizzily up and answered uncertainly :

" No , [Diana]120-diana , [I]124-anne am not killed , but [I]124-anne think [I]124-anne am rendered unconscious . "[124-anne]

" Where ? "[211-carrie sloane] sobbed [Carrie Sloane]211-carrie sloane . " Oh , where , [Anne]124-anne ? "[124-anne] Before [Anne]124-anne could answer [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry appeared on the scene . At sight of [her]118-mrs. barry [Anne]124-anne tried to scramble to [her]124-anne feet , but sank back again with a sharp little cry of pain .

" What 's the matter ? Where have [you]124-anne hurt [yourself]124-anne ? "[118-mrs. barry] demanded [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry .

" [My]124-anne ankle , "[124-anne] gasped [Anne]124-anne . " Oh , [Diana]120-diana , please find [[your]120-diana father]2949-your father and ask [him]2949-your father to take [me]124-anne [home]361-home . [I]124-anne know [I]124-anne can never walk [there]348-there . And [I]124-anne 'm sure [I]124-anne could n't hop so far on one foot when [Jane]121-jane could n't even hop around [the garden]573-the garden . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla was out in [the orchard]2264-the orchard picking a panful of summer apples when [she]113-marilla saw [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry coming over [the log bridge]790-the log bridge and up [the slope]1315-the slope , with [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry beside [him]119-mr. barry and a whole procession of [little girls]472-little girls trailing after [him]119-mr. barry . In [his]119-mr. barry arms [he]119-mr. barry carried [Anne]124-anne , whose head lay limply against [his]119-mr. barry shoulder .

At that moment [Marilla]113-marilla had a revelation . In the sudden stab of fear that pierced [her]113-marilla very heart [she]113-marilla realized what [Anne]124-anne had come to mean to [her]113-marilla . [She]113-marilla would have admitted that [she]113-marilla liked [Anne]124-anne -- nay , that [she]113-marilla was very fond of [Anne]124-anne . But now [she]113-marilla knew as [she]113-marilla hurried wildly down [the slope]1315-the slope that [Anne]124-anne was dearer to [her]113-marilla than anything else on [earth]647-earth .

" [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry , what has happened to [her]124-anne ? "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla gasped , more white and shaken than [the self - contained , sensible Marilla]1319-the self - contained , sensible marilla had been for many years .

[Anne]124-anne [herself]124-anne answered , lifting [her]124-anne head .

" Do n't be very frightened , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]124-anne was walking [the ridgepole]3419-the ridgepole and [I]124-anne fell off . [I]124-anne expect [I]124-anne have sprained [my]124-anne ankle . But , [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne might have broken [my]124-anne neck . Let [us]3420-us look on the bright side of things . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla might have known [you]113-marilla 'd go and do something of the sort when [I]113-marilla let [you]113-marilla go to that party , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , sharp and shrewish in [her]113-marilla very relief . " Bring [her]1320-her in [here]2022-here , [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry , and lay [her]1320-her on the sofa . Mercy [me]113-marilla , [the child]460-the child has gone and fainted ! "[113-marilla]

It was quite true . Overcome by the pain of [her]1320-her injury , [Anne]124-anne had one more of [her]1320-her wishes granted to [her]1320-her . [She]1320-her had fainted dead away .

[Matthew]107-matthew , hastily summoned from [the harvest field]1321-the harvest field , was straightway dispatched for [the doctor]2016-the doctor , who in due time came , to discover that the injury was more serious than [they]1323-they had supposed . [Anne]124-anne 's ankle was broken .

That night , when [Marilla]113-marilla went up to [the east gable]561-the east gable , where [a white - faced girl]1325-a white - faced girl was lying , a plaintive voice greeted [her]113-marilla from the bed .

" Are n't [you]113-marilla very sorry for [me]1325-a white - faced girl , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[1325-a white - faced girl]

" It was [your]113-marilla own fault , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , twitching down the blind and lighting a lamp .

" And that is just why [you]113-marilla should be sorry for [me]124-anne , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne , " because the thought that it is all [my]124-anne own fault is what makes it so hard . If [I]124-anne could blame it on [anybody]2031-anybody [I]124-anne would feel so much better . But what would [you]113-marilla have done , [Marilla]113-marilla , if [you]113-marilla had been dared to walk [a ridgepole]3424-a ridgepole ? "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla 'd have stayed on [good firm ground]3425-good firm ground and let [them]3426-them dare away . Such absurdity ! "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla .

[Anne]124-anne sighed .

" But [you]113-marilla have such strength of mind , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]124-anne have n't . [I]124-anne just felt that [I]124-anne could n't bear [Josie Pye]175-josie pye 's scorn . [She]175-josie pye would have crowed over [me]124-anne all [my]124-anne life . And [I]124-anne think [I]124-anne have been punished so much that [you]113-marilla need n't be very cross with [me]124-anne , [Marilla]113-marilla . It 's not a bit nice to faint , after all . And [the doctor]2016-the doctor hurt [me]124-anne dreadfully when [he]2016-the doctor was setting [my]124-anne ankle . [I]124-anne wo n't be able to go around for six or seven weeks and [I]124-anne 'll miss [the new lady teacher]3428-the new lady teacher . But [I]124-anne 'll try to bear it all bravely if only [you]113-marilla wo n't be cross with [me]124-anne , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[124-anne]

" There , there , [I]113-marilla 'm not cross , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " [You]113-marilla 're [an unlucky child]3432-an unlucky child , there 's no doubt about that ; but as [you]113-marilla say , [you]113-marilla 'll have the suffering of it . Here now , try and eat some supper . "[113-marilla]

" Is n't it fortunate [I]124-anne 've got such an imagination ? "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne . " It will help [me]124-anne through splendidly , [I]124-anne expect . What do [people who have n't any imagination]3433-people who have n't any imagination do when [they]3433-people who have n't any imagination break [their]3433-people who have n't any imagination bones , do [you]113-marilla suppose , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne had good reason to bless [her]124-anne imagination many a time and oft during the tedious seven weeks that followed . But [she]124-anne was not solely dependent on it . [She]124-anne had [many visitors]1326-many visitors and not a day passed without [one or more of [the schoolgirls]1328-the schoolgirls]1327-one or more of the schoolgirls dropping in to bring [her]124-anne flowers and books and tell [her]124-anne all the happenings in [the juvenile world of [Avonlea]2-avonlea]1329-the juvenile world of avonlea .

" [Everybody]2130-everybody has been so good and kind , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] sighed [Anne]124-anne happily , on the day when [she]124-anne could first limp across the floor . " It is n't very pleasant to be laid up ; but there is a bright side to it , [Marilla]113-marilla . [You]113-marilla find out how many friends [you]113-marilla have . Why , even [Superintendent Bell]234-mr. bell came to see [me]124-anne , and [he]234-mr. bell 's really [a very fine man]3435-a very fine man . [He]234-mr. bell could get over that if [he]234-mr. bell 'd take a little trouble . [I]124-anne gave [him]234-mr. bell a good broad hint . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde always told [me]124-anne that when [she]105-mrs. lynde came to see [me]124-anne ; and [she]105-mrs. lynde said it in a kind of way that made [me]124-anne feel [she]105-mrs. lynde might hope [I]124-anne 'd be [a better girl]3445-a better girl but did n't really believe [I]124-anne would . CHAPTER XXIV . [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy and [[Her]240-miss stacy Pupils]1330-her pupils Get Up a Concert

IT was October again when [Anne]232-anne was ready to go back to [school]2382-school -- a glorious October , all red and gold , with mellow mornings when [the valleys]1332-the valleys were filled with delicate mists as if the spirit of autumn had poured them in for the sun to drain -- amethyst , pearl , silver , rose , and smoke - blue . The dews were so heavy that [the fields]969-the fields glistened like cloth of silver and there were such heaps of rustling leaves in the hollows of many - stemmed woods to run crisply through . [The Birch Path]71-the birch path was a canopy of yellow and the ferns were sear and brown all along it . There was a tang in the very air that inspired the hearts of [small maidens]1334-small maidens tripping , unlike snails , swiftly and willingly to [school]2382-school ; and it _ was _ jolly to be back again at the little brown desk beside [Diana]120-diana , with [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis nodding across the aisle and [Carrie Sloane]211-carrie sloane sending up notes and [Julia Bell]122-julia bell passing a " chew "[3450-the new teacher] of gum down from the back seat . [Anne]232-anne drew a long breath of happiness as [she]232-anne sharpened [her]232-anne pencil and arranged [her]232-anne picture cards in [her]232-anne desk . Life was certainly very interesting .

In [the new teacher]3450-the new teacher [she]232-anne found [another true and helpful friend]1337-another true and helpful friend . [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy was [a bright , sympathetic young woman with the happy gift of winning and holding the affections of [[her]240-miss stacy pupils]1330-her pupils and bringing out the best that was in [them]1330-her pupils mentally and morally]1338-a bright , sympathetic young woman with the happy gift of winning and holding the affections of her pupils and bringing out the best that was in them mentally and morally . [Anne]232-anne expanded like a flower under this wholesome influence and carried [home]361-home to the admiring [Matthew]107-matthew and the critical [Marilla]113-marilla glowing accounts of schoolwork and aims .

" [I]1330-her pupils love [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy with [my]1330-her pupils whole heart , [Marilla]113-marilla . [She]240-miss stacy is so ladylike and [she]240-miss stacy has such a sweet voice . When [she]240-miss stacy pronounces [my]1330-her pupils name [I]1330-her pupils feel _ instinctively _ that [she]240-miss stacy 's spelling it with an E. [We]3458-we had recitations this afternoon . ' [I]1330-her pupils just put [my]1330-her pupils whole soul into it . [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis told [me]1330-her pupils coming [home]361-home that the way [I]1330-her pupils said the line , ? [[my]1330-her pupils woman]3463-my woman 's heart farewell , ' just made [her]3463-my woman blood run cold . "[1330-her pupils]

" Well now , [you]232-anne might recite it for [me]107-matthew some of these days , out in [the barn]353-the barn , "[107-matthew] suggested [Matthew]107-matthew .

" Of course [I]232-anne will , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne meditatively , " but [I]232-anne wo n't be able to do it so well , [I]232-anne know .
