[I]232-anne know [I]232-anne wo n't be able to make [your]232-anne blood run cold . "[232-anne]

" [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says it made _ [her]105-mrs. lynde _ blood run cold to see [the boys]2853-the boys climbing to [the very tops of those big trees on [Bell]122-julia bell 's hill]3466-the very tops of those big trees on bell 's hill after crows ' nests last Friday , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " [I]113-marilla wonder at [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy for encouraging it . "[113-marilla]

" But [we]3467-we wanted a crow 's nest for nature study , "[232-anne] explained [Anne]232-anne . " That was on [our]3467-we field afternoon . Field afternoons are splendid , [Marilla]113-marilla . And [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy explains everything so beautifully . [We]3467-we have to write compositions on [our]3467-we field afternoons and [I]232-anne write the best ones . "[232-anne]

" It 's very vain of [you]113-marilla to say so then . [You]113-marilla 'd better let [[your]113-marilla teacher]2835-your teacher say it . "[232-anne]

" But [she]240-miss stacy _ did _ say it , [Marilla]113-marilla . And indeed [I]232-anne 'm not vain about it . How can [I]232-anne be , when [I]232-anne 'm such a dunce at geometry ? Must n't it be splendid to be remarkable and have compositions written about [you]113-marilla after [you]113-marilla 're dead ? Oh , [I]232-anne would dearly love to be remarkable . [I]232-anne think when [I]232-anne grow up [I]232-anne 'll be [a trained nurse]3471-a trained nurse and go with the Red Crosses to the field of battle as [a messenger of mercy]3472-a messenger of mercy . [We]3476-we have physical culture exercises every day , too . They make [you]3477-you graceful and promote digestion . "[232-anne]

" Promote fiddlesticks ! "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , who honestly thought it was all nonsense .

But all the field afternoons and recitation Fridays and physical culture contortions paled before a project which [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy brought forward in November . This was that [the scholars of [Avonlea]2-avonlea school]1341-the scholars of avonlea school should get up a concert and hold it in [the hall]551-the hall on Christmas Night , for the laudable purpose of helping to pay for a schoolhouse flag . [The pupils]1343-the pupils one and all taking graciously to this plan , the preparations for a program were begun at once . And of [all the excited performers]1344-all the excited performers - elect [none]1345-none was so excited as [Anne Shirley]124-anne , who threw [herself]124-anne into the undertaking heart and soul , hampered as [she]124-anne was by [Marilla]113-marilla 's disapproval . [Marilla]113-marilla thought it all rank foolishness .

" It 's just filling [your]3477-you heads up with nonsense and taking time that ought to be put on [your]3477-you lessons , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla grumbled . " [I]113-marilla do n't approve of [children]330-children 's getting up concerts and racing about to practices . It makes [them]330-children vain and forward and fond of gadding . "[113-marilla]

" But think of the worthy object , "[124-anne] pleaded [Anne]124-anne . " A flag will cultivate a spirit of patriotism , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[124-anne]

" [Fudge]3479-fudge ! There 's precious little patriotism in the thoughts of any of [you]3477-you . All [you]3477-you want is a good time . "[124-anne]

" Well , when [you]3477-you can combine patriotism and fun , is n't it all right ? Of course it 's real nice to be getting up a concert . [We]3480-we 're going to have six choruses and [Diana]120-diana is to sing a solo . [I]124-anne 'm in two dialogues--?The Society for the Suppression of Gossip ' and ? [The Fairy Queen]3481-the fairy queen . ' [The boys]2853-the boys are going to have a dialogue too . And [I]124-anne 'm to have two recitations , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]124-anne just tremble when [I]124-anne think of it , but it 's a nice thrilly kind of tremble . And [we]3480-we 're to have a tableau at the last--?Faith , Hope and Charity . ' [Diana]120-diana and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis and [I]124-anne are to be in it , all draped in white with flowing hair . [I]124-anne 'm to be [Hope]242-hope , with [my]124-anne hands clasped -- so -- and [my]124-anne eyes uplifted . [I]124-anne 'm going to practice [my]124-anne recitations in [the garret]3483-the garret . Do n't be alarmed if [you]3484-you hear [me]124-anne groaning . [I]124-anne have to groan heartrendingly in one of them , and it 's really hard to get up a good artistic groan , [Marilla]113-marilla . [Josie Pye]175-josie pye is sulky because [she]175-josie pye did n't get the part [she]175-josie pye wanted in the dialogue . [She]175-josie pye wanted to be [the fairy queen]3481-the fairy queen . That would have been ridiculous , for who ever heard of [a fairy queen]3486-a fairy queen as fat as [Josie]175-josie pye ? [Fairy queens]3487-fairy queens must be slender . [Jane Andrews]121-jane is to be [the queen]3222-the queen and [I]124-anne am to be [one of [[her]121-jane maids of honor]3490-her maids of honor]3489-one of her maids of honor . [Josie]175-josie pye says [she]175-josie pye thinks [a red - haired fairy]3491-a red - haired fairy is just as ridiculous as [a fat one]3492-a fat one , but [I]124-anne do not let [myself]124-anne mind what [Josie]175-josie pye says . [I]124-anne 'm to have a wreath of white roses on [my]124-anne hair and [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis is going to lend [me]124-anne [her]168-ruby gillis slippers because [I]124-anne have n't any of [my]124-anne own . It 's necessary for [fairies]3493-fairies to have slippers , [you]3494-you know . [You]3494-you could n't imagine [a fairy]3495-a fairy wearing boots , could [you]3494-you ? Especially with copper toes ? [We]3496-we are going to decorate [the hall]551-the hall with creeping spruce and fir mottoes with pink tissue - paper roses in them . And [we]3496-we are all to march in two by two after [the audience]3498-the audience is seated , while [Emma White]186-em white plays a march on the organ . "[124-anne]

" All [I]124-anne hope is that [you]113-marilla 'll behave [yourself]113-marilla . [I]124-anne 'll be heartily glad when all this fuss is over and [you]113-marilla 'll be able to settle down . [You]113-marilla are simply good for nothing just now with [your]113-marilla head stuffed full of dialogues and groans and tableaus . As for [your]113-marilla tongue , it 's a marvel it 's not clean worn out . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne sighed and betook [herself]124-anne to [the back yard]390-the back yard , over which a young new moon was shining through the leafless poplar boughs from an apple - green western sky , and where [Matthew]107-matthew was splitting wood . [Anne]124-anne perched [herself]124-anne on a block and talked the concert over with [him]107-matthew , sure of [an appreciative and sympathetic listener]1347-an appreciative and sympathetic listener in this instance at least .

" Well now , [I]107-matthew reckon it 's going to be a pretty good concert . And [I]107-matthew expect [you]124-anne 'll do [your]124-anne part fine , "[107-matthew] [he]107-matthew said , smiling down into [her]124-anne eager , vivacious little face . [Anne]124-anne smiled back at [him]107-matthew . [Those two]1348-those two were [the best of friends]1349-the best of friends and [Matthew]107-matthew thanked [his]107-matthew stars many a time and oft that [he]107-matthew had nothing to do with bringing [her]124-anne up . That was [Marilla]113-marilla 's exclusive duty ; if it had been [his]107-matthew [he]107-matthew would have been worried over frequent conflicts between inclination and said duty . As it was , [he]107-matthew was free to , " spoil [Anne"--Marilla]243-anne"--marilla[107-matthew] 's phrasing -- as much as [he]107-matthew liked . But it was not such a bad arrangement after all ; a little " appreciation "[107-matthew] sometimes does quite as much good as all the conscientious " bringing up "[107-matthew] in [the world]409-the world .

CHAPTER XXV . [Matthew]107-matthew Insists on [Puffed Sleeves

MATTHEW]107-matthew was having a bad ten minutes of it . [He]107-matthew had come into [the kitchen]557-the kitchen , in the twilight of a cold , gray December evening , and had sat down in the woodbox corner to take off [his]107-matthew heavy boots , unconscious of the fact that [Anne]124-anne and [a bevy of [[her]124-anne schoolmates]1353-her schoolmates]1352-a bevy of her schoolmates were having a practice of " [The Fairy Queen]3481-the fairy queen "[1352-a bevy of her schoolmates] in [the sitting room]2511-the sitting room . Presently [they]1355-they came trooping through [the hall]551-the hall and out into [the kitchen]557-the kitchen , laughing and chattering gaily . [They]1355-they did not see [Matthew]107-matthew , who shrank bashfully back into the shadows beyond the woodbox with a boot in one hand and a bootjack in the other , and [he]107-matthew watched [them]1355-they shyly for the aforesaid ten minutes as [they]1355-they put on caps and jackets and talked about the dialogue and the concert . [Anne]124-anne stood among [them]1355-they , bright eyed and animated as [they]1355-they ; but [Matthew]107-matthew suddenly became conscious that there was something about [her]124-anne different from [[her]124-anne mates]1358-her mates . And what worried [Matthew]107-matthew was that the difference impressed [him]107-matthew as being something that should not exist . [Anne]124-anne had a brighter face , and bigger , starrier eyes , and more delicate features than the other ; even shy , unobservant [Matthew]107-matthew had learned to take note of these things ; but the difference that disturbed [him]107-matthew did not consist in any of these respects . Then in what did it consist ?

[Matthew]107-matthew was haunted by this question long after [the girls]2852-the girls had gone , arm in arm , down [the long , hard - frozen lane]1360-the long , hard - frozen lane and [Anne]124-anne had betaken [herself]124-anne to [her]124-anne books . [He]107-matthew could not refer it to [Marilla]113-marilla , who , [he]107-matthew felt , would be quite sure to sniff scornfully and remark that the only difference [she]113-marilla saw between [Anne]124-anne and [the other girls]3140-the other girls was that [they]2852-the girls sometimes kept [their]2852-the girls tongues quiet while [Anne]124-anne never did . This , [Matthew]107-matthew felt , would be no great help .

[He]107-matthew had recourse to [his]107-matthew pipe that evening to help [him]107-matthew study it out , much to [Marilla]113-marilla 's disgust . After two hours of smoking and hard reflection [Matthew]107-matthew arrived at a solution of [his]107-matthew problem . [Anne]124-anne was not dressed like [the other girls]3140-the other girls !

The more [Matthew]107-matthew thought about the matter the more [he]107-matthew was convinced that [Anne]124-anne never had been dressed like [the other girls]3140-the other girls -- never since [she]124-anne had come to [Green Gables]107-matthew . [Marilla]113-marilla kept [her]124-anne clothed in plain , dark dresses , all made after the same unvarying pattern . If [Matthew]107-matthew knew there was such a thing as fashion in dress it was as much as [he]107-matthew did ; but [he]107-matthew was quite sure that [Anne]124-anne 's sleeves did not look at all like the sleeves [the other girls]3140-the other girls wore . [He]107-matthew recalled the cluster of [little girls [he]107-matthew had seen around [her]124-anne]1365-little girls he had seen around her that evening -- all gay in waists of red and blue and pink and white -- and [he]107-matthew wondered why [Marilla]113-marilla always kept [her]113-marilla so plainly and soberly gowned .

Of course , it must be all right . [Marilla]113-marilla knew best and [Marilla]113-marilla was bringing [her]113-marilla up . Probably some wise , inscrutable motive was to be served thereby . But surely it would do no harm to let [the child]460-the child have one pretty dress -- something like [Diana Barry]120-diana always wore . [Matthew]107-matthew decided that [he]107-matthew would give [her]460-the child one ; that surely could not be objected to as an unwarranted putting in of [his]107-matthew oar . Christmas was only a fortnight off . A nice new dress would be the very thing for a present . [Matthew]107-matthew , with a sigh of satisfaction , put away [his]107-matthew pipe and went to bed , while [Marilla]113-marilla opened all the doors and aired [the house]350-the house .

The very next evening [Matthew]107-matthew betook [himself]107-matthew to [Carmody]5-carmody to buy the dress , determined to get the worst over and have done with it . It would be , [he]107-matthew felt assured , no trifling ordeal . There were some things [Matthew]107-matthew could buy and prove [himself]107-matthew no mean bargainer ; but [he]107-matthew knew [he]107-matthew would be at the mercy of [shopkeepers]1368-shopkeepers when it came to buying [a girl]2066-a girl 's dress .

After much cogitation [Matthew]107-matthew resolved to go to [[Samuel Lawson]246-samuel 's store]1370-samuel lawson 's store instead of [[William Blair]109-william blair 's]1371-william blair 's . To be sure , [the Cuthberts]111-the cuthberts always had gone to [[William Blair]109-william blair 's]1371-william blair 's ; it was almost as much a matter of conscience with [them]111-the cuthberts as to attend [the Presbyterian church]1373-the presbyterian church and vote Conservative . But [[William Blair]109-william blair 's two daughters]1374-william blair 's two daughters frequently waited on [customers there]1375-customers there and [Matthew]107-matthew held [them]1374-william blair 's two daughters in absolute dread . [He]107-matthew could contrive to deal with [them]1374-william blair 's two daughters when [he]107-matthew knew exactly what [he]107-matthew wanted and could point it out ; but in such a matter as this , requiring explanation and consultation , [Matthew]107-matthew felt that [he]107-matthew must be sure of [a man behind the counter]1376-a man behind the counter . So [he]107-matthew would go to [Lawson 's]72-lawson 's , where [Samuel]246-samuel or [[his]246-samuel son]371-his son would wait on [him]107-matthew .

Alas ! [Matthew]107-matthew did not know that [Samuel]246-samuel , in the recent expansion of [[his]246-samuel business]1378-his business , had set up [a lady clerk]1379-a lady clerk also ; [she]1379-a lady clerk was [a niece of [[his]246-samuel wife]2053-his wife 's]1380-a niece of his wife 's and [a very dashing young person]1382-a very dashing young person indeed , with a huge , drooping pompadour , big , rolling brown eyes , and a most extensive and bewildering smile . [She]1379-a lady clerk was dressed with exceeding smartness and wore several bangle bracelets that glittered and rattled and tinkled with every movement of [her]1379-a lady clerk hands . [Matthew]107-matthew was covered with confusion at finding [her]1379-a lady clerk [there]348-there at all ; and those bangles completely wrecked [his]107-matthew wits at one fell swoop .

" What can [I]247-miss harris do for [you]107-matthew this evening , [Mr. Cuthbert]107-matthew ? "[247-miss harris] [Miss Lucilla Harris]247-miss harris inquired , briskly and ingratiatingly , tapping the counter with both hands .

" Have [you]107-matthew any -- any -- any -- well now , say any garden rakes ? "[107-matthew] stammered [Matthew]107-matthew .

[Miss Harris]247-miss harris looked somewhat surprised , as well [she]247-miss harris might , to hear [a man inquiring for garden rakes in the middle of December]1384-a man inquiring for garden rakes in the middle of december .

" [I]247-miss harris believe [we]3501-we have one or two left over , "[247-miss harris] [she]247-miss harris said , " but [they]3502-they 're [upstairs]2564-upstairs in [the lumber room]3504-the lumber room . [I]247-miss harris 'll go and see . "[247-miss harris] During [her]247-miss harris absence [Matthew]107-matthew collected [his]107-matthew scattered senses for another effort .

When [Miss Harris]247-miss harris returned with the rake and cheerfully inquired : " Anything else tonight , [Mr. Cuthbert]107-matthew ? "[247-miss harris] [Matthew]107-matthew took [his]107-matthew courage in both hands and replied : " Well now , since [you]247-miss harris suggest it , [I]107-matthew might as well -- take -- that is -- look at -- buy some -- some hayseed . "[107-matthew]

[Miss Harris]247-miss harris had heard [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew called odd . [She]247-miss harris now concluded that [he]107-matthew was entirely crazy .

" [We]3505-we only keep hayseed in the spring , "[247-miss harris] [she]247-miss harris explained loftily . " [We]3505-we 've none on hand just now . "[247-miss harris]

" Oh , certainly -- certainly -- just as [you]247-miss harris say , "[107-matthew] stammered [unhappy Matthew]107-matthew , seizing the rake and making for the door . At the threshold [he]107-matthew recollected that [he]107-matthew had not paid for it and [he]107-matthew turned miserably back . While [Miss Harris]247-miss harris was counting out [his]107-matthew change [he]107-matthew rallied [his]107-matthew powers for a final desperate attempt .

" Well now -- if it is n't too much trouble -- [I]107-matthew might as well -- that is -- [I'd]107-matthew like to look at -- at -- some sugar . "[107-matthew]

" White or brown ? "[247-miss harris] queried [Miss Harris]247-miss harris patiently .

" Oh -- well now -- brown , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew feebly .

" [I'll]107-matthew -- [I'll]107-matthew take twenty pounds of it , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , with beads of perspiration standing on [his]107-matthew forehead .

[Matthew]107-matthew had driven halfway [home]361-home before [he]107-matthew was [[his]107-matthew own man]1386-his own man again . It had been a gruesome experience , but it served [him]107-matthew right , [he]107-matthew thought , for committing the heresy of going to [a strange store]1387-a strange store . " Brown sugar ! "[113-marilla] exclaimed [Marilla]113-marilla . " Whatever possessed [you]107-matthew to get so much ? [You]107-matthew know [I]113-marilla never use it except for [the hired man]3507-the hired man 's porridge or black fruit cake . " [I]107-matthew -- [I]107-matthew thought it might come in handy sometime , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , making good [his]107-matthew escape .

When [Matthew]107-matthew came to think the matter over [he]107-matthew decided that [a woman]2294-a woman was required to cope with the situation . [Marilla]113-marilla was out of the question . [Matthew]107-matthew felt sure [she]113-marilla would throw cold water on [his]107-matthew project at once . "[666-that good lady]

" Puffs ? Of course . [You]107-matthew need n't worry a speck more about it , [Matthew]107-matthew . To [herself]105-mrs. lynde [she]105-mrs. lynde added when [Matthew]107-matthew had gone :

" It 'll be a real satisfaction to see [that poor child]3510-that poor child wearing something decent for once . The way [Marilla]113-marilla dresses [her]3510-that poor child is positively ridiculous , that 's what , and [I]105-mrs. lynde 've ached to tell [her]3510-that poor child so plainly a dozen times . [I]105-mrs. lynde 've held [my]105-mrs. lynde tongue though , for [I]105-mrs. lynde can see [Marilla]113-marilla does n't want advice and [she]113-marilla thinks [she]113-marilla knows more about bringing [children]330-children up than [I]105-mrs. lynde do for all [she]113-marilla 's [an old maid]2457-an old maid . But that 's always the way . [Folks that has brought up]3513-folks that has brought up [children]330-children know that there 's no hard and fast method in [the world]409-the world that 'll suit [every child]3516-every child . But [them]3513-folks that has brought up as never have think it 's all as plain and easy as Rule of Three -- just set [your]3517-your three terms down so fashion , and the sum ? ll work out correct . [I]105-mrs. lynde suppose [she]113-marilla 's trying to cultivate a spirit of humility in [Anne]124-anne by dressing [her]124-anne as [she]113-marilla does ; but it 's more likely to cultivate envy and discontent . [I]105-mrs. lynde 'm sure [the child]460-the child must feel the difference between [her]460-the child clothes and [the other girls]3140-the other girls ' . But to think of [Matthew]107-matthew taking notice of it ! [That man]2886-that man is waking up after being asleep for over sixty years . "[105-mrs. lynde]

[Marilla]113-marilla knew all the following fortnight that [Matthew]107-matthew had something on [his]107-matthew mind , but what it was [she]113-marilla could not guess , until Christmas Eve , when [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde brought up the new dress . [Marilla]113-marilla behaved pretty well on the whole , although it is very likely [she]113-marilla distrusted [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde 's diplomatic explanation that [she]113-marilla had made the dress because [Matthew]107-matthew was afraid [Anne]124-anne would find out about it too soon if [Marilla]113-marilla made it .

" So this is what [Matthew]107-matthew has been looking so mysterious over and grinning about to [himself]107-matthew for two weeks , is it ? "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said a little stiffly but tolerantly . " [I]113-marilla knew [he]107-matthew was up to some foolishness . Well , [I]113-marilla must say [I]113-marilla do n't think [Anne]124-anne needed any more dresses . [I]113-marilla made [her]124-anne three good , warm , serviceable ones this fall , and anything more is sheer extravagance . There 's enough material in those sleeves alone to make a waist , [I]113-marilla declare there is . [You]3521-you 'll just pamper [Anne]124-anne 's vanity , [Matthew]107-matthew , and [she]124-anne 's as vain as a peacock now . Well , [I]113-marilla hope [she]124-anne 'll be satisfied at last , for [I]113-marilla know [she]124-anne 's been hankering after those silly sleeves ever since they came in , although [she]124-anne never said a word after the first . The puffs have been getting bigger and more ridiculous right along ; they 're as big as balloons now . Next year [anybody who wears them]3522-anybody who wears them will have to go through a door sideways . "[113-marilla]

Christmas morning broke on a beautiful white world . It had been a very mild December and [people]2012-people had looked forward to a green Christmas ; but just enough snow fell softly in the night to transfigure [Avonlea]2-avonlea . [Anne]124-anne peeped out from [her]124-anne frosted gable window with delighted eyes . The firs in [the Haunted Wood]63-the haunted wood were all feathery and wonderful ; the birches and wild cherry trees were outlined in pearl ; [the plowed fields]1395-the plowed fields were stretches of snowy dimples ; and there was a crisp tang in the air that was glorious . [Anne]124-anne ran [downstairs]2619-downstairs singing until [her]124-anne voice reechoed through [Green Gables]107-matthew .

" Merry Christmas , [Marilla]113-marilla ! Merry Christmas , [Matthew]107-matthew ! Is n't it a lovely Christmas ? [I]124-anne 'm so glad it 's white . Any other kind of Christmas does n't seem real , does it ? [I]124-anne do n't like green Christmases . [They]3523-they 're not green -- they're just nasty faded browns and grays . What makes [people]2012-people call [them]3523-they green ? Why -- why -- [Matthew]107-matthew , is that for [me]124-anne ? Oh , [Matthew]107-matthew ! "[124-anne]

[Matthew]107-matthew had sheepishly unfolded the dress from its paper swathings and held it out with a deprecatory glance at [Marilla]113-marilla , who feigned to be contemptuously filling the teapot , but nevertheless watched the scene out of the corner of [her]113-marilla eye with a rather interested air .

[Anne]124-anne took the dress and looked at it in reverent silence . Oh , how pretty it was -- a lovely soft brown gloria with all the gloss of silk ; a skirt with dainty frills and shirrings ; a waist elaborately pintucked in the most fashionable way , with a little ruffle of filmy lace at the neck . But the sleeves -- they were the crowning glory ! Long elbow cuffs , and above them two beautiful puffs divided by rows of shirring and bows of brown - silk ribbon .

" That 's a Christmas present for [you]124-anne , [Anne]124-anne , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew shyly . " Why -- why -- [Anne]124-anne , do n't [you]124-anne like it ? Well now -- well now . "[107-matthew]

For [Anne]124-anne 's eyes had suddenly filled with tears .

When the commonplace breakfast was over [Diana]120-diana appeared , crossing the white log bridge in [the hollow]342-the hollow , a gay little figure in [her]120-diana crimson ulster . [Anne]124-anne flew down [the slope]1315-the slope to meet [her]120-diana .

[All the Avonlea scholars]1399-all the avonlea scholars were in a fever of excitement that day , for [the hall]551-the hall had to be decorated and a last grand rehearsal held .

The concert came off in the evening and was a pronounced success . " Was n't [the boys]2853-the boys ' dialogue fine ? "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana . " [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert was just splendid . [Anne]124-anne , [I]120-diana do think it 's awful mean the way [you]124-anne treat [Gil]174-gil . Wait till [I]120-diana tell [you]124-anne . When [you]124-anne ran off [the platform]449-the platform after the fairy dialogue one of [your]124-anne roses fell out of [your]124-anne hair . [I]120-diana saw [Gil]174-gil pick it up and put it in [his]174-gil breast pocket . There now . [You]124-anne 're so romantic that [I]120-diana 'm sure [you]124-anne ought to be pleased at that . "[120-diana]

" It 's nothing to [me]124-anne what [that person]3146-that person does , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne loftily . " [I]124-anne simply never waste a thought on [him]174-gil , [Diana]120-diana . "[124-anne]

That night [Marilla]113-marilla and [Matthew]107-matthew , who had been out to a concert for the first time in twenty years , sat for a while by the kitchen fire after [Anne]124-anne had gone to bed .

" Well now , [I]107-matthew guess [[our]3542-our [Anne]124-anne]3543-our anne did as well as any of [them]3544-them , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew proudly .

" Yes , [she]124-anne did , "[113-marilla] admitted [Marilla]113-marilla . " [She]124-anne 's [a bright child]3545-a bright child , [Matthew]107-matthew . And [she]124-anne looked real nice too . [I]113-marilla 've been kind of opposed to this concert scheme , but [I]113-marilla suppose there 's no real harm in it after all . Anyhow , [I]113-marilla was proud of [Anne]124-anne tonight , although [I]113-marilla 'm not going to tell [her]124-anne so . "[113-marilla]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew was proud of [her]124-anne and [I]107-matthew did tell [her]124-anne so ? fore [she]124-anne went [upstairs]2564-upstairs , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew . " [We]3547-we must see what [we]3547-we can do for [her]124-anne some of these days , [Marilla]113-marilla . [I]107-matthew guess [she]124-anne 'll need something more than [Avonlea school]3548-avonlea school by and by . "[107-matthew]

" There 's time enough to think of that , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " [She]124-anne 's only thirteen in [March]73-march . Though tonight it struck [me]113-marilla [she]124-anne was growing quite [a big girl]3549-a big girl . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde made that dress a mite too long , and it makes [Anne]124-anne look so tall . [She]124-anne 's quick to learn and [I]113-marilla guess the best thing [we]3550-we can do for [her]124-anne will be to send [her]124-anne to [Queen]3551-queen 's after a spell . But nothing need be said about that for a year or two yet . "[113-marilla]

" Well now , it 'll do no harm to be thinking it over off and on , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew . " Things like that are all the better for lots of thinking over . "[107-matthew]

CHAPTER XXVI . The Story Club Is Formed

[|JUNIOR Avonlea]2-avonlea found it hard to settle down to humdrum existence again . To [Anne]124-anne in particular things seemed fearfully flat , stale , and unprofitable after the goblet of excitement [she]124-anne had been sipping for weeks . Could [she]124-anne go back to the former quiet pleasures of those faraway days before the concert ? At first , as [she]124-anne told [Diana]120-diana , [she]124-anne did not really think [she]124-anne could .

" [I]124-anne 'm positively certain , [Diana]120-diana , that life can never be quite the same again as it was in those olden days , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said mournfully , as if referring to a period of at least fifty years back . " Perhaps after a while [I]124-anne 'll get used to it , but [I]124-anne 'm afraid concerts spoil [people]2012-people for everyday life . [I]124-anne suppose that is why [Marilla]113-marilla disapproves of [them]3553-them . [Marilla]113-marilla is such [a sensible woman]3554-a sensible woman . It must be a great deal better to be sensible ; but still , [I]124-anne do n't believe [I]124-anne 'd really want to be [a sensible person]3555-a sensible person , because [they]3553-them are so unromantic . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says there is no danger of [my]124-anne ever being one , but [you]3556-you can never tell . [I]124-anne feel just now that [I]124-anne may grow up to be sensible yet . But perhaps that is only because [I]124-anne 'm tired . [I]124-anne simply could n't sleep last night for ever so long . [I]124-anne just lay awake and imagined the concert over and over again . That 's one splendid thing about such affairs -- it 's so lovely to look back to [them]3553-them . "[124-anne]

Eventually , however , [[Avonlea]2-avonlea school]3548-avonlea school slipped back into [its]3548-avonlea school old groove and took up [its]3548-avonlea school old interests . To be sure , the concert left traces . [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis and [Emma White]186-em white , who had quarreled over a point of precedence in [their]1406-their platform seats , no longer sat at the same desk , and a promising friendship of three years was broken up . [Josie Pye]175-josie pye and [Julia Bell]122-julia bell did not " speak "[175-josie pye] for three months , because [Josie Pye]175-josie pye had told [Bessie Wright]251-bessie wright that [Julia Bell]122-julia bell 's bow when [she]251-bessie wright got up to recite made [her]251-bessie wright think of a chicken jerking its head , and [Bessie]251-bessie wright told [Julia]122-julia bell . [None of [the Sloanes]252-the sloanes]1407-none of the sloanes would have any dealings with [the Bells]253-the bells , because [the Bells]253-the bells had declared that [the Sloanes]252-the sloanes had too much to do in the program , and [the Sloanes]252-the sloanes had retorted that [the Bells]253-the bells were not capable of doing the little [they]253-the bells had to do properly . Finally , [Charlie Sloane]173-charlie sloane fought [Moody Spurgeon MacPherson]254-moody spurgeon , because [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon had said that [Anne Shirley]124-anne put on airs about [her]124-anne recitations , and [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon was " licked "[254-moody spurgeon] ; consequently [[Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon 's sister]1408-moody spurgeon 's sister , [Ella May]171-minnie macpherson , would not " speak "[254-moody spurgeon] to [Anne Shirley]124-anne all the rest of the winter . With the exception of these trifling frictions , work in [[Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy 's little kingdom]1409-miss stacy 's little kingdom went on with regularity and smoothness .

The winter weeks slipped by . It was an unusually mild winter , with so little snow that [Anne]124-anne and [Diana]120-diana could go to [school]2382-school nearly every day by way of [the Birch Path]844-the birch path . On [Anne]124-anne 's birthday [they]1412-they were tripping lightly down it , keeping eyes and ears alert amid all [their]1412-they chatter , for [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy had told [them]1412-they that [they]1412-they must soon write a composition on " A Winter 's Walk in [the Woods]373-the woods , "[240-miss stacy] and it behooved [them]1412-they to be observant .

" Just think , [Diana]120-diana , [I]124-anne 'm thirteen years old today , "[124-anne] remarked [Anne]124-anne in an awed voice . " [I]124-anne can scarcely realize that [I]124-anne 'm in [my]124-anne teens . When [I]124-anne woke this morning it seemed to [me]124-anne that everything must be different . [You]120-diana 've been thirteen for a month , so [I]124-anne suppose it does n't seem such a novelty to [you]120-diana as it does to [me]124-anne . It makes life seem so much more interesting . In two more years [I]124-anne 'll be really grown up . It 's a great comfort to think that [I]124-anne 'll be able to use big words then without being laughed at . "[124-anne]

" [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis says [she]168-ruby gillis means to have [a beau]3558-a beau as soon as [she]168-ruby gillis 's fifteen , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana .

" [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis thinks of nothing but beaus , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne disdainfully . " [She]168-ruby gillis 's actually delighted when [anyone]2614-anyone writes [her]168-ruby gillis name up in a take - notice for all [she]168-ruby gillis pretends to be so mad . But [I]124-anne 'm afraid that is an uncharitable speech . [Mrs. Allan]232-anne says [we]3560-we should never make uncharitable speeches ; but they do slip out so often before [you]120-diana think , do n't [they]3561-they ? [I]124-anne simply ca n't talk about [Josie Pye]175-josie pye without making an uncharitable speech , so [I]124-anne never mention [her]175-josie pye at all . [You]120-diana may have noticed that . [I]124-anne 'm trying to be as much like [Mrs. Allan]232-anne as [I]124-anne possibly can , for [I]124-anne think [she]175-josie pye 's perfect . [Mr. Allan]230-mr. allan thinks so too . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says [he]230-mr. allan just worships the ground [she]105-mrs. lynde treads on and [she]105-mrs. lynde does n't really think it right for [a minister]2514-a minister to set [his]230-mr. allan affections so much on [a mortal being]3563-a mortal being . But then , [Diana]120-diana , even [ministers]3335-ministers are human and have [their]3335-ministers besetting sins just like [everybody else]2657-everybody else . [I]124-anne had such an interesting talk with [Mrs. Allan]232-anne about besetting sins last Sunday afternoon . There are just a few things it 's proper to talk about on Sundays and that is one of them . [My]124-anne besetting sin is imagining too much and forgetting [my]124-anne duties . [I]124-anne 'm striving very hard to overcome it and now that [I]124-anne 'm really thirteen perhaps [I]124-anne 'll get on better . "[124-anne]

" In four more years [we]3566-we 'll be able to put [our]3566-we hair up , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana . " [Alice Bell]164-alice bell is only sixteen and [she]164-alice bell is wearing [hers]164-alice bell up , but [I]120-diana think that 's ridiculous . [I]120-diana shall wait until [I]120-diana 'm seventeen . "[120-diana]

" If [I]232-anne had [Alice Bell]164-alice bell 's crooked nose , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne decidedly , " [I]232-anne wouldn't -- but there ! [I]232-anne wo n't say what [I]232-anne was going to because it was extremely uncharitable . Besides , [I]232-anne was comparing it with [my]232-anne own nose and that 's vanity . [I]232-anne 'm afraid [I]232-anne think too much about [my]232-anne nose ever since [I]232-anne heard that compliment about it long ago . It really is a great comfort to [me]232-anne . Oh , [Diana]120-diana , look , there 's a rabbit . That 's something to remember for [our]3567-our woods composition . [I]232-anne really think [the woods]373-the woods are just as lovely in winter as in summer . They 're so white and still , as if they were asleep and dreaming pretty dreams . "[232-anne]

" [I]120-diana wo n't mind writing that composition when its time comes , "[120-diana] sighed [Diana]120-diana . " [I]120-diana can manage to write about [the woods]373-the woods , but the one [we]3567-our 're to hand in Monday is terrible . The idea of [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy telling [us]3567-our to write a story out of [our]3567-our own heads ! "[120-diana]

" Why , it 's as easy as wink , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne .

" It 's easy for [you]120-diana because [you]120-diana have an imagination , "[120-diana] retorted [Diana]120-diana , " but what would [you]120-diana do if [you]120-diana had been born without one ? [I]120-diana suppose [you]120-diana have [your]120-diana composition all done ? "[120-diana]

[Anne]232-anne nodded , trying hard not to look virtuously complacent and failing miserably .

" [I]120-diana wrote it last Monday evening . It 's called ? The Jealous Rival ; or In [Death Not Divided]255-death not divided . ' [I]120-diana read it to [Marilla]113-marilla and [she]113-marilla said it was stuff and nonsense . Then [I]120-diana read it to [Matthew]107-matthew and [he]107-matthew said it was fine . That is the kind of critic [I]120-diana like . It 's a sad , sweet story . [I]120-diana just cried like [a child]2075-a child while [I]120-diana was writing it . It 's about [two beautiful maidens]3571-two beautiful maidens called [Cordelia Montmorency]256-cordelia and [Geraldine Seymour]257-geraldine who lived in [the same village]3572-the same village and were devotedly attached to [each other]535-each other . [Cordelia]256-cordelia was [a regal brunette with a coronet of midnight hair and duskly flashing eyes]3574-a regal brunette with a coronet of midnight hair and duskly flashing eyes . [Geraldine]257-geraldine was [a queenly blonde with hair like spun gold and velvety purple eyes]3575-a queenly blonde with hair like spun gold and velvety purple eyes . "[120-diana]

" [I]120-diana never saw [anybody with purple eyes]3576-anybody with purple eyes , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana dubiously .

" Neither did [I.]120-diana [I]120-diana just imagined [them]3576-anybody with purple eyes . [I]120-diana wanted something out of the common . [Geraldine]257-geraldine had an alabaster brow too . [I]120-diana 've found out what an alabaster brow is . That is one of the advantages of being thirteen . [You]3577-you know so much more than [you]3577-you did when [you]3577-you were only twelve . "[120-diana]

" Well , what became of [Cordelia]256-cordelia and [Geraldine]257-geraldine ? "[120-diana] asked [Diana]120-diana , who was beginning to feel rather interested in [their]1413-their fate .

" [They]1413-their grew in beauty side by side until [they]1413-their were sixteen . Then [Bertram DeVere]258-bertram came to [[their]1413-their native village]3578-their native village and fell in love with [the fair Geraldine]257-geraldine . [He]258-bertram saved [her]257-geraldine life when [her]257-geraldine horse ran away with [her]257-geraldine in [a carriage]3579-a carriage , and [she]257-geraldine fainted in [his]258-bertram arms and [he]258-bertram carried [her]257-geraldine [home]361-home three miles ; because , [you]3581-you understand , [the carriage]3582-the carriage was all smashed up . [I]1415-critics found it rather hard to imagine the proposal because [I]1415-critics had no experience to go by . [I]1415-critics asked [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis if [she]168-ruby gillis knew anything about how [men]3583-men proposed because [I]1415-critics thought [she]168-ruby gillis 'd likely be [an authority on the subject]3584-an authority on the subject , having so many [sisters]3585-sisters married . [Ruby]168-ruby gillis told [me]1415-critics [she]168-ruby gillis was hid in [the hall]551-the hall pantry when [Malcolm Andres]259-malcolm andres proposed to [[her]168-ruby gillis sister]3394-her sister [Susan]260-susan . [She]168-ruby gillis said [Malcolm]259-malcolm andres told [Susan]260-susan that [[his]259-malcolm andres dad]3588-his dad had given [him]259-malcolm andres [the farm]2242-the farm in [his]259-malcolm andres own name and then said , ? What do [you]260-susan say , [darling pet]3590-darling pet , if [we]3591-they get hitched this fall ? ' And [Susan]260-susan said , ? Yes -- no -- [I]1415-critics do n't know -- let [me]1415-critics see'--and there [they]3591-they were , engaged as quick as that . But [I]1415-critics did n't think that sort of a proposal was a very romantic one , so in the end [I]1415-critics had to imagine it out as well as [I]1415-critics could . [I]1415-critics made it very flowery and poetical and [Bertram]258-bertram went on [his]258-bertram knees , although [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis says it is n't done nowadays . [Geraldine]257-geraldine accepted [him]258-bertram in a speech a page long . [I]1415-critics can tell [you]3592-you [I]1415-critics took a lot of trouble with that speech . [I]1415-critics rewrote it five times and [I]1415-critics look upon it as [my]1415-critics masterpiece . [Bertram]258-bertram gave [her]257-geraldine a diamond ring and a ruby necklace and told [her]257-geraldine [they]3591-they would go to [Europe]74-europe for a wedding tour , for [he]258-bertram was immensely wealthy . But then , alas , shadows began to darken over [their]3591-they path . [Cordelia]256-cordelia was secretly in love with [Bertram]258-bertram [herself]256-cordelia and when [Geraldine]257-geraldine told [her]256-cordelia about the engagement [she]256-cordelia was simply furious , especially when [she]256-cordelia saw the necklace and the diamond ring . All [her]256-cordelia affection for [Geraldine]257-geraldine turned to bitter hate and [she]256-cordelia vowed that [she]256-cordelia should never marry [Bertram]258-bertram . But [she]256-cordelia pretended to be [[Geraldine]257-geraldine 's friend]3593-geraldine 's friend the same as ever . One evening [they]3591-they were standing on the bridge over [a rushing turbulent stream]3594-a rushing turbulent stream and [Cordelia]256-cordelia , thinking [they]3591-they were alone , pushed [Geraldine]257-geraldine over the brink with a wild , mocking , ? Ha , ha , ha . ' But [Bertram]258-bertram saw it all and [he]258-bertram at once plunged into the current , exclaiming , ? [I]1415-critics will save [thee]257-geraldine , [[my]1415-critics peerless [Geraldine]257-geraldine]3595-my peerless geraldine . ' But alas , [he]258-bertram had forgotten [he]258-bertram could n't swim , and [they]3591-they were both drowned , clasped in [each other]535-each other 's arms . [Their]3591-they bodies were washed ashore soon afterwards . [They]3591-they were buried in [the one grave]3597-the one grave and [their]3591-they funeral was most imposing , [Diana]120-diana . It 's so much more romantic to end a story up with a funeral than a wedding . As for [Cordelia]256-cordelia , [she]256-cordelia went insane with remorse and was shut up in [a lunatic asylum]3598-a lunatic asylum . [I]1415-critics thought that was a poetical retribution for [her]256-cordelia crime . "[1415-critics]

" How perfectly lovely ! "[120-diana] sighed [Diana]120-diana , who belonged to [[Matthew]107-matthew 's school of [critics]1415-critics]1414-matthew 's school of critics . " [I]120-diana do n't see how [you]232-anne can make up such thrilling things out of [your]232-anne own head , [Anne]232-anne .
