" It would be if [you]232-anne 'd only cultivate it , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne cheeringly . " [I]232-anne 've just thought of a plan , [Diana]120-diana . Let [you]120-diana and [me]232-anne have a story club all [our]3599-we own and write stories for practice . [I]232-anne 'll help [you]120-diana along until [you]120-diana can do them by [yourself]120-diana . [You]120-diana ought to cultivate [your]120-diana imagination , [you]120-diana know . [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy says so . Only [we]3599-we must take the right way . [I]232-anne told [her]240-miss stacy about [the Haunted Wood]63-the haunted wood , but [she]240-miss stacy said [we]3599-we went the wrong way about it in that . "[232-anne]

This was how [the story club]1416-the story club came into existence . It was limited to [Diana]120-diana and [Anne]232-anne at first , but soon it was extended to include [Jane Andrews]121-jane and [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis and [one or two others who felt that [their]1417-one or two others who felt that their imaginations needed cultivating imaginations needed cultivating]1417-one or two others who felt that their imaginations needed cultivating . [No boys]2229-no boys were allowed in it -- although [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis opined that [their]1417-one or two others who felt that their imaginations needed cultivating admission would make it more exciting -- and [each member]1419-each member had to produce one story a week .

" It 's extremely interesting , "[232-anne] [Anne]232-anne told [Marilla]113-marilla . " [Each girl]835-each girl has to read [her]835-each girl story out loud and then [we]3599-we talk it over . [We]3599-we are going to keep [them]3601-them all sacredly and have [them]3601-them to read to [[our]3599-we descendants]3602-our descendants . [We]3599-we each write under a nom - de - plume . [Mine]232-anne is [Rosamond Montmorency]261-rosamond montmorency . [All the girls]3258-all the girls do pretty well . [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis is rather sentimental . [She]168-ruby gillis puts too much lovemaking into [her]168-ruby gillis stories and [you]3604-you know too much is worse than too little . [Jane]121-jane never puts any because [she]121-jane says it makes [her]121-jane feel so silly when [she]121-jane had to read it out loud . [Jane]121-jane 's stories are extremely sensible . Then [Diana]120-diana puts too many murders into [hers]120-diana . [She]120-diana says most of the time [she]120-diana does n't know what to do with [the people]3292-the people so [she]120-diana kills [them]3292-the people off to get rid of [them]3292-the people . [I]232-anne mostly always have to tell [them]3292-the people what to write about , but that is n't hard for [I]232-anne 've millions of ideas . "[232-anne]

" [I]113-marilla think this story - writing business is the foolishest yet , "[113-marilla] scoffed [Marilla]113-marilla . " [You]3604-you 'll get a pack of nonsense into [your]3604-you heads and waste time that should be put on [your]3604-you lessons . Reading stories is bad enough but writing them is worse . "[113-marilla]

" But [we]3606-we 're so careful to put a moral into them all , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[232-anne] explained [Anne]232-anne . " [I]232-anne insist upon that . [All the good people]3607-all the good people are rewarded and [all the bad ones]3608-all the bad ones are suitably punished . [I]232-anne 'm sure that must have a wholesome effect . The moral is the great thing . [Mr. Allan]230-mr. allan says so . [I]232-anne read one of [my]232-anne stories to [him]230-mr. allan and [Mrs. Allan]232-anne and [they]3609-they both agreed that the moral was excellent . Only [they]3609-they laughed in the wrong places . [I]232-anne like it better when [people]2012-people cry . [Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis almost always cry when [I]232-anne come to the pathetic parts . [Diana]120-diana wrote [her]120-diana Aunt Josephine about [[our]3611-our club]3612-our club and [[her]120-diana Aunt [Josephine]175-josie pye]3613-her aunt josephine wrote back that [we]3611-our were to send [her]120-diana some of [our]3611-our stories . So [we]3611-our copied out four of [our]3611-our very best and sent them . [Miss Josephine Barry]217-miss barry wrote back that [she]217-miss barry had never read anything so amusing in [her]217-miss barry life . That kind of puzzled [us]3611-our because the stories were all very pathetic and [almost everybody]3614-almost everybody died . But [I]232-anne 'm glad [Miss Barry]217-miss barry liked them . It shows [[our]3611-our club]3612-our club is doing some good in [the world]409-the world . [Mrs. Allan]232-anne says that ought to be [our]3611-our object in everything . [I]232-anne do really try to make it [my]232-anne object but [I]232-anne forget so often when [I]232-anne 'm having fun . [I]232-anne hope [I]232-anne shall be a little like [Mrs. Allan]232-anne when [I]232-anne grow up . Do [you]113-marilla think there is any prospect of it , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[232-anne]

" [I]113-marilla should n't say there was a great deal "[113-marilla] was [Marilla]113-marilla 's encouraging answer . " [I]113-marilla 'm sure [Mrs. Allan]232-anne was never such [a silly , forgetful little girl as [you]113-marilla are]3617-a silly , forgetful little girl as you are . "[113-marilla]

" No ; but [she]232-anne was n't always so good as [she]232-anne is now either , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne seriously . " [She]232-anne told [me]232-anne so [herself]232-anne -- that is , [she]232-anne said [she]232-anne was a dreadful mischief when [she]232-anne was [a girl]2066-a girl and was always getting into scrapes . [I]232-anne felt so encouraged when [I]232-anne heard that . Is it very wicked of [me]232-anne , [Marilla]113-marilla , to feel encouraged when [I]232-anne hear that [other people]2168-other people have been bad and mischievous ? [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says it is . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says [she]105-mrs. lynde always feels shocked when [she]105-mrs. lynde hears of [anyone]2614-anyone ever having been naughty , no matter how small [they]2614-anyone were . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says [she]105-mrs. lynde once heard [a minister]2514-a minister confess that when [he]2514-a minister was [a boy]406-a boy [he]2514-a minister stole a strawberry tart out of [[[his]2514-a minister aunt]3623-his aunt 's pantry]3624-his aunt 's pantry and [she]105-mrs. lynde never had any respect for [that minister]3625-that minister again . Now , [I]232-anne would n't have felt that way . [I]232-anne 'd have thought that it was real noble of [him]2514-a minister to confess it , and [I]232-anne 'd have thought what an encouraging thing it would be for [small boys]488-small boys nowadays who do naughty things and are sorry for [them]488-small boys to know that perhaps [they]488-small boys may grow up to be [ministers]3335-ministers in spite of it . That 's how [I]232-anne 'd feel , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[232-anne]

" The way [I]113-marilla feel at present , [Anne]232-anne , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , " is that it 's high time [you]232-anne had those dishes washed . [You]232-anne 've taken half an hour longer than [you]232-anne should with all [your]232-anne chattering . Learn to work first and talk afterwards . "[113-marilla]

CHAPTER XXVII . Vanity and Vexation of [Spirit

Marilla]113-marilla , walking [home]361-home one late April evening from an Aid meeting , realized that the winter was over and gone with the thrill of delight that spring never fails to bring to the oldest and saddest as well as to [the youngest and merriest]1421-the youngest and merriest . [Marilla]113-marilla was not given to subjective analysis of [her]113-marilla thoughts and feelings . [She]113-marilla probably imagined that [she]113-marilla was thinking about [the Aids]2939-the aids and [their]2939-the aids missionary box and the new carpet for [the vestry room]1423-the vestry room , but under these reflections was a harmonious consciousness of [red fields]1424-red fields smoking into pale - purply mists in the declining sun , of long , sharp - pointed fir shadows falling over [the meadow beyond the brook]1425-the meadow beyond the brook , of still , crimson - budded maples around [a mirrorlike wood pool]1426-a mirrorlike wood pool , of a wakening in [the world and a stir of hidden pulses under the gray sod]1427-the world and a stir of hidden pulses under the gray sod . The spring was abroad in [the land]2799-the land and [Marilla]113-marilla 's sober , middle - aged step was lighter and swifter because of its deep , primal gladness .

[Her]113-marilla eyes dwelt affectionately on [Green Gables]107-matthew , peering through [its]107-matthew network of trees and reflecting the sunlight back from [its]107-matthew windows in several little coruscations of glory . [Marilla]113-marilla , as [she]113-marilla picked [her]113-marilla steps along [the damp lane]1429-the damp lane , thought that it was really a satisfaction to know that [she]113-marilla was going [home]361-home to a briskly snapping wood fire and a table nicely spread for tea , instead of to the cold comfort of old Aid meeting evenings before [Anne]232-anne had come to [Green Gables]107-matthew .

Consequently , when [Marilla]113-marilla entered [[her]113-marilla kitchen]1431-her kitchen and found the fire black out , with no sign of [Anne]232-anne anywhere , [she]113-marilla felt justly disappointed and irritated . [She]113-marilla had told [Anne]232-anne to be sure and have tea ready at five o'clock , but now [she]113-marilla must hurry to take off [her]113-marilla second - best dress and prepare the meal [herself]113-marilla against [Matthew]107-matthew 's return from plowing .

" [I]113-marilla 'll settle [Miss Anne]124-anne when [she]124-anne comes [home]361-home , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla grimly , as [she]113-marilla shaved up kindlings with a carving knife and with more vim than was strictly necessary . [Matthew]107-matthew had come in and was waiting patiently for [his]107-matthew tea in [his]107-matthew corner . " [She]124-anne 's gadding off somewhere with [Diana]120-diana , writing stories or practicing dialogues or some such tomfoolery , and never thinking once about the time or [her]124-anne duties . [She]124-anne 's just got to be pulled up short and sudden on this sort of thing . [I]107-matthew do n't care if [Mrs. Allan]232-anne does say [she]124-anne 's [the brightest and sweetest child [she]124-anne ever knew]3629-the brightest and sweetest child she ever knew . [She]124-anne may be bright and sweet enough , but [her]124-anne head is full of nonsense and there 's never any knowing what shape it 'll break out in next . Just as soon as [she]124-anne grows out of one freak [she]124-anne takes up with another . But there ! Here [I]107-matthew am saying the very thing [I]107-matthew was so riled with [Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde for saying at the Aid today . [I]107-matthew was real glad when [Mrs. Allan]232-anne spoke up for [Anne]232-anne , for if [she]124-anne had n't [I]107-matthew know [I]107-matthew 'd have said something too sharp to [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde before [everybody]2130-everybody . [Anne]232-anne 's got plenty of faults , goodness knows , and far be it from [me]107-matthew to deny it . But [I]107-matthew 'm bringing [her]124-anne up and not [Rachel Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , who 'd pick faults in the Angel [Gabriel]263-gabriel [himself]263-gabriel if [he]263-gabriel lived in [Avonlea]2-avonlea . Just the same , [Anne]232-anne has no business to leave [the house]350-the house like this when [I]107-matthew told [her]124-anne [she]124-anne was to stay [home]361-home this afternoon and look after things . [I]107-matthew must say , with all [her]124-anne faults , [I]107-matthew never found [her]124-anne disobedient or untrustworthy before and [I]107-matthew 'm real sorry to find [her]124-anne so now . "[107-matthew]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew dunno , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , who , being [patient and wise and , above all , hungry]1432-patient and wise and , above all , hungry , had deemed it best to let [Marilla]113-marilla talk [her]113-marilla wrath out unhindered , having learned by experience that [she]113-marilla got through with whatever work was on hand much quicker if not delayed by untimely argument . " Perhaps [you]113-marilla 're judging [her]124-anne too hasty , [Marilla]113-marilla . Do n't call [her]124-anne untrustworthy until [you]113-marilla 're sure [she]124-anne has disobeyed [you]113-marilla . [Mebbe]107-matthew it can all be explained -- [Anne]232-anne 's a great hand at explaining . "[113-marilla]

" [She]124-anne 's not here when [I]113-marilla told [her]124-anne to stay , "[113-marilla] retorted [Marilla]113-marilla . " [I]113-marilla reckon [she]124-anne 'll find it hard to explain _ that _ to [my]113-marilla satisfaction . Of course [I]113-marilla knew [you]113-marilla 'd take [her]124-anne part , [Matthew]107-matthew . But [I]113-marilla 'm bringing [her]124-anne up , not [you]113-marilla . "[113-marilla]

It was dark when supper was ready , and still no sign of [Anne]232-anne , coming hurriedly over [the log bridge]790-the log bridge or up [Lover 's Lane]47-lover 's lane , breathless and repentant with a sense of neglected duties . [Marilla]113-marilla washed and put away the dishes grimly . Then , wanting a candle to light [her]113-marilla way down [the cellar]592-the cellar , [she]113-marilla went up to [the east gable]561-the east gable for [the one that generally stood on [Anne]232-anne 's table]1436-the one that generally stood on anne 's table . Lighting it , [she]113-marilla turned around to see [Anne]232-anne [herself]232-anne lying on the bed , face downward among the pillows .

" Mercy on [us]3633-us , "[113-marilla] said astonished [Marilla]113-marilla , " have [you]232-anne been asleep , [Anne]232-anne ? "[113-marilla]

" No , "[232-anne] was the muffled reply .

" Are [you]232-anne sick then ? "[113-marilla] demanded [Marilla]113-marilla anxiously , going over to the bed .

[Anne]232-anne cowered deeper into [her]232-anne pillows as if desirous of hiding [herself]232-anne forever from mortal eyes .

" No . But please , [Marilla]113-marilla , go away and do n't look at [me]113-marilla . [I]113-marilla 'm in the depths of despair and [I]113-marilla do n't care who gets head in class or writes the best composition or sings in the Sunday - school choir any more . Little things like that are of no importance now because [I]113-marilla do n't suppose [I]113-marilla 'll ever be able to go anywhere again . [My]113-marilla career is closed . Please , [Marilla]113-marilla , go away and do n't look at [me]113-marilla . "[113-marilla]

" Did [anyone]2614-anyone ever hear the like ? "[113-marilla] the mystified [Marilla]113-marilla wanted to know . " [Anne Shirley]124-anne , whatever is the matter with [you]124-anne ? What have [you]124-anne done ? Get right up this minute and tell [me]113-marilla . This minute , [I]113-marilla say . There now , what is it ? "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne had slid to the floor in despairing obedience .

" Look at [my]124-anne hair , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne whispered .

Accordingly , [Marilla]113-marilla lifted [her]113-marilla candle and looked scrutinizingly at [Anne]124-anne 's hair , flowing in heavy masses down [her]124-anne back . It certainly had a very strange appearance .

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne , what have [you]124-anne done to [your]124-anne hair ? Why , it 's _ green ! _ "[124-anne]

Green it might be called , if it were any earthly color -- a queer , dull , bronzy green , with streaks here and there of the original red to heighten the ghastly effect . Never in all [her]113-marilla life had [Marilla]113-marilla seen anything so grotesque as [Anne]124-anne 's hair at that moment .

" Yes , it 's green , "[124-anne] moaned [Anne]124-anne . " [I]124-anne thought nothing could be as bad as red hair . But now [I]124-anne know it 's ten times worse to have green hair . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [you]113-marilla little know how utterly wretched [I]124-anne am . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla little know how [you]113-marilla got into this fix , but [I]113-marilla mean to find out , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " Come right down to [the kitchen]557-the kitchen -- it 's too cold up here -- and tell [me]113-marilla just what [you]113-marilla 've done . [I]113-marilla 've been expecting something queer for some time . [You]113-marilla have n't got into any scrape for over two months , and [I]113-marilla was sure another one was due . Now , then , what did [you]113-marilla do to [your]113-marilla hair ? "[113-marilla]

" [I]124-anne dyed it . "[124-anne]

" Dyed it ! Dyed [your]113-marilla hair ! [Anne Shirley]124-anne , did n't [you]113-marilla know it was a wicked thing to do ? "[113-marilla]

" Yes , [I]124-anne knew it was a little wicked , "[124-anne] admitted [Anne]124-anne . " But [I]124-anne thought it was worth while to be a little wicked to get rid of red hair . [I]124-anne counted the cost , [Marilla]113-marilla . Besides , [I]124-anne meant to be extra good in other ways to make up for it . "[124-anne]

" Well , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla sarcastically , " if [I]113-marilla 'd decided it was worth while to dye [my]113-marilla hair [I]113-marilla 'd have dyed it a decent color at least . [I]113-marilla would n't have dyed it green . "[113-marilla]

" But [I]124-anne did n't mean to dye it green , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] protested [Anne]124-anne dejectedly . " If [I]124-anne was wicked [I]124-anne meant to be wicked to some purpose . [He]3636-he said it would turn [my]124-anne hair a beautiful raven black -- [he]3636-he positively assured [me]124-anne that it would . How could [I]124-anne doubt [his]3636-he word , [Marilla]113-marilla ? [I]124-anne know what it feels like to have [your]113-marilla word doubted . And [Mrs. Allan]232-anne says [we]3637-we should never suspect [anyone]2614-anyone of not telling [us]3637-we the truth unless [we]3637-we have proof that [they]2614-anyone 're not . [I]124-anne have proof now -- green hair is proof enough for [anybody]2031-anybody . But [I]124-anne had n't then and [I]124-anne believed every word [he]3636-he said _ implicitly _ . "[124-anne]

" Who said ? Who are [you]113-marilla talking about ? "[113-marilla]

" The peddler that was [here]2022-here this afternoon . [I]124-anne bought the dye from [him]3636-he . "[124-anne]

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne , how often have [I]113-marilla told [you]124-anne never to let [one of [those Italians]3642-those italians]3641-one of those italians in [the house]350-the house ! [I]113-marilla do n't believe in encouraging [them]3642-those italians to come around at all . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , [I]124-anne did n't let [him]3636-he in [the house]350-the house . [I]124-anne remembered what [you]124-anne told [me]124-anne , and [I]124-anne went out , carefully shut the door , and looked at [his]3636-he things on the step . Besides , [he]3636-he was n't [an Italian]3645-an italian -- [he]3636-he was [a German Jew]3646-a german jew . [He]3636-he had a big box full of very interesting things and [he]3636-he told [me]124-anne [he]3636-he was working hard to make enough money to bring [[his]3636-he wife]2053-his wife and [children]330-children out from [Germany]76-germany . [He]3636-he spoke so feelingly about [them]3649-them that it touched [my]124-anne heart . [I]124-anne wanted to buy something from [him]3636-he to help [him]3636-he in such a worthy object . Then all at once [I]124-anne saw the bottle of hair dye . [The peddler]3650-the peddler said it was warranted to dye any hair a beautiful raven black and would n't wash off . In a trice [I]124-anne saw [myself]124-anne with beautiful raven - black hair and the temptation was irresistible . But the price of the bottle was seventy - five cents and [I]124-anne had only fifty cents left out of [my]124-anne chicken money . [I]124-anne think [the peddler]3650-the peddler had a very kind heart , for [he]3650-the peddler said that , seeing it was [me]124-anne , [he]3650-the peddler 'd sell it for fifty cents and that was just giving it away . So [I]124-anne bought it , and as soon as [he]3650-the peddler had gone [I]124-anne came up [here]2022-here and applied it with an old hairbrush as the directions said . [I]124-anne used up the whole bottle , and oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , when [I]124-anne saw the dreadful color it turned [my]124-anne hair [I]124-anne repented of being wicked , [I]124-anne can tell [you]113-marilla . And [I]124-anne 've been repenting ever since . "[124-anne]

" Well , [I]113-marilla hope [you]124-anne 'll repent to good purpose , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla severely , " and that [you]124-anne 've got [your]124-anne eyes opened to where [your]124-anne vanity has led [you]124-anne , [Anne]124-anne . [Goodness]264-goodness knows what 's to be done . [I]113-marilla suppose the first thing is to give [your]124-anne hair a good washing and see if that will do any good . "[113-marilla]

Accordingly , [Anne]124-anne washed [her]124-anne hair , scrubbing it vigorously with soap and water , but for all the difference it made [she]124-anne might as well have been scouring its original red . [The peddler]3650-the peddler had certainly spoken the truth when [he]3650-the peddler declared that the dye would n't wash off , however [his]3650-the peddler veracity might be impeached in other respects .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , what shall [I]124-anne do ? "[124-anne] questioned [Anne]124-anne in tears . " [I]124-anne can never live this down . [People]2012-people have pretty well forgotten [my]124-anne other mistakes -- the liniment cake and setting [Diana]120-diana drunk and flying into a temper with [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde . But [they]2012-people 'll never forget this . [They]2012-people will think [I]124-anne am not respectable . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , ? what a tangled web [we]3654-we weave when first [we]3654-we practice to deceive . ' That is poetry , but it is true . And oh , how [Josie Pye]175-josie pye will laugh ! [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]124-anne _ can not _ face [Josie Pye]175-josie pye . [I]124-anne am [the unhappiest girl in [Prince Edward Island]16-prince edward island]3655-the unhappiest girl in prince edward island . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne 's unhappiness continued for a week . During that time [she]124-anne went nowhere and shampooed [her]124-anne hair every day . [[Diana]120-diana alone of [outsiders]1439-outsiders]1438-diana alone of outsiders knew the fatal secret , but [she]120-diana promised solemnly never to tell , and it may be stated here and now that [she]120-diana kept [her]120-diana word . At the end of the week [Marilla]113-marilla said decidedly :

" It 's no use , [Anne]124-anne . That is fast dye if ever there was any . [Your]124-anne hair must be cut off ; there is no other way . [You]124-anne ca n't go out with it looking like that . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne 's lips quivered , but [she]124-anne realized the bitter truth of [Marilla]113-marilla 's remarks . With a dismal sigh [she]124-anne went for the scissors .

" Please cut it off at once , [Marilla]113-marilla , and have it over . Oh , [I]113-marilla feel that [my]113-marilla heart is broken . This is such an unromantic affliction . [The girls in books]3656-the girls in books lose [their]3656-the girls in books hair in fevers or sell it to get money for some good deed , and [I]113-marilla 'm sure [I]113-marilla would n't mind losing [my]113-marilla hair in some such fashion half so much . But there is nothing comforting in having [your]124-anne hair cut off because [you]124-anne 've dyed it a dreadful color , is there ? [I]113-marilla 'm going to weep all the time [you]124-anne 're cutting it off , if it wo n't interfere . It seems such a tragic thing . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne wept then , but later on , when [she]124-anne went [upstairs]2564-upstairs and looked in the glass , [she]124-anne was calm with despair . [Marilla]113-marilla had done [her]113-marilla work thoroughly and it had been necessary to shingle the hair as closely as possible . The result was not becoming , to state the case as mildly as may be . [Anne]124-anne promptly turned [her]124-anne glass to the wall .

" [I]124-anne 'll never , never look at [myself]124-anne again until [my]124-anne hair grows , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne exclaimed passionately .

Then [she]124-anne suddenly righted the glass .

" Yes , [I]124-anne will , too . [I]124-anne 'd do penance for being wicked that way . [I]124-anne 'll look at [myself]124-anne every time [I]124-anne come to [[my]124-anne room]2723-my room and see how ugly [I]124-anne am . And [I]124-anne wo n't try to imagine it away , either . [I]124-anne never thought [I]124-anne was vain about [my]124-anne hair , of all things , but now [I]124-anne know [I]124-anne was , in spite of its being red , because it was so long and thick and curly . [I]124-anne expect something will happen to [my]124-anne nose next . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne 's clipped head made a sensation in [school]2382-school on the following Monday , but to [her]124-anne relief [nobody]2118-nobody guessed the real reason for it , not even [Josie Pye]175-josie pye , who , however , did not fail to inform [Anne]124-anne that [she]124-anne looked like a perfect scarecrow .

" [I]124-anne did n't say anything when [Josie]175-josie pye said that to [me]124-anne , "[124-anne] [Anne]124-anne confided that evening to [Marilla]113-marilla , who was lying on the sofa after one of [her]113-marilla headaches , " because [I]113-marilla thought it was part of [my]113-marilla punishment and [I]113-marilla ought to bear it patiently . It 's hard to be told [you]113-marilla look like [a scarecrow]3658-a scarecrow and [I]113-marilla wanted to say something back . But [I]113-marilla did n't . [I]113-marilla just swept [her]113-marilla one scornful look and then [I]113-marilla forgave [her]113-marilla . It makes [you]113-marilla feel very virtuous when [you]113-marilla forgive [people]2012-people , does n't it ? [I]113-marilla mean to devote all [my]113-marilla energies to being good after this and [I]113-marilla shall never try to be beautiful again . Of course it 's better to be good . [I]113-marilla know it is , but it 's sometimes so hard to believe a thing even when [you]113-marilla know it . [I]113-marilla do really want to be good , [Marilla]113-marilla , like [you]113-marilla and [Mrs. Allan]232-anne and [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy , and grow up to be a credit to [you]113-marilla . [Diana]120-diana says when [my]113-marilla hair begins to grow to tie a black velvet ribbon around [my]113-marilla head with a bow at one side . [She]120-diana says [she]120-diana thinks it will be very becoming . [I]113-marilla will call it a snood -- that sounds so romantic . But am [I]113-marilla talking too much , [Marilla]113-marilla ? Does it hurt [your]113-marilla head ? "[113-marilla]

" [My]113-marilla head is better now . It was terrible bad this afternoon , though . These headaches of mine are getting worse and worse . [I]113-marilla 'll have to see [a doctor]2010-a doctor about them . As for [your]113-marilla chatter , [I]113-marilla do n't know that [I]113-marilla mind it -- [I've]113-marilla got so used to it . "[113-marilla]

Which was [Marilla]113-marilla 's way of saying that [she]113-marilla liked to hear it .

CHAPTER XXVIII . An Unfortunate [Lily Maid]265-lily maid

" OF course [you]113-marilla must be [Elaine]163-elaine , [Anne]232-anne , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana . " [I]120-diana could never have the courage to float down there . "[120-diana]

" Nor [I]168-ruby gillis , "[168-ruby gillis] said [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis , with a shiver . " [I]168-ruby gillis do n't mind floating down when there 's two or three of [us]3661-us in [the flat]3662-the flat and [we]3661-us can sit up . It 's fun then . But to lie down and pretend [I]168-ruby gillis was dead -- [I]168-ruby gillis just could n't . [I]168-ruby gillis 'd die really of fright . "[168-ruby gillis]

" Of course it would be romantic , "[121-jane] conceded [Jane Andrews]121-jane , " but [I]121-jane know [I]121-jane could n't keep still . [I]121-jane 'd be popping up every minute or so to see where [I]121-jane was and if [I]121-jane was n't drifting too far out . And [you]232-anne know , [Anne]232-anne , that would spoil the effect . "[121-jane]

" But it 's so ridiculous to have [a redheaded Elaine]3663-a redheaded elaine , "[232-anne] mourned [Anne]232-anne . " [I]232-anne 'm not afraid to float down and [I]232-anne 'd love to be [Elaine]163-elaine . But it 's ridiculous just the same . [Ruby]168-ruby gillis ought to be [Elaine]163-elaine because [she]168-ruby gillis is so fair and has such lovely long golden hair -- [Elaine]163-elaine had ? all [her]163-elaine bright hair streaming down , ' [you]232-anne know . And [Elaine]163-elaine was [the lily maid]3664-the lily maid . Now , [a red - haired person]3665-a red - haired person can not be [a lily maid]3666-a lily maid . "[232-anne]

" [Your]120-diana complexion is just as fair as [Ruby]168-ruby gillis 's , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana earnestly , " and [your]120-diana hair is ever so much darker than it used to be before [you]120-diana cut it . "[120-diana]

" Oh , do [you]232-anne really think so ? "[232-anne] exclaimed [Anne]232-anne , flushing sensitively with delight . " [I]232-anne 've sometimes thought it was [myself]232-anne -- but [I]232-anne never dared to ask [anyone]2614-anyone for fear [she]2614-anyone would tell [me]232-anne it was n't . Do [you]232-anne think it could be called auburn now , [Diana]120-diana ? "[232-anne]

" Yes , and [I]120-diana think it is real pretty , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana , looking admiringly at the short , silky curls that clustered over [Anne]232-anne 's head and were held in place by a very jaunty black velvet ribbon and bow .

[They]1443-they were standing on [the bank of [the pond]501-the pond]1444-the bank of the pond , below [Orchard Slope]24-orchard slope , where [a little headland]1446-a little headland fringed with birches ran out from the bank ; at [its]1446-a little headland tip was a small wooden platform built out into the water for the convenience of [fishermen]1447-fishermen and [duck hunters]1448-duck hunters . [Ruby]168-ruby gillis and [Jane]121-jane were spending the midsummer afternoon with [Diana]120-diana , and [Anne]232-anne had come over to play with [them]1443-they .

[Anne]232-anne and [Diana]120-diana had spent most of [their]1443-they playtime that summer on and about [the pond]501-the pond . [Idlewild]45-idlewild was a thing of the past , [Mr. Bell]234-mr. bell having ruthlessly cut down the little circle of trees in [[his]234-mr. bell back pasture]1450-his back pasture in the spring . [Anne]232-anne had sat among the stumps and wept , not without an eye to the romance of it ; but [she]232-anne was speedily consoled , for , after all , as [she]232-anne and [Diana]120-diana said , [big girls of thirteen]1451-big girls of thirteen , going on fourteen , were too old for such childish amusements as playhouses , and there were more fascinating sports to be found about [the pond]501-the pond . It was splendid to fish for trout over [the bridge]500-the bridge and [the two girls]1454-the two girls learned to row [themselves]1454-the two girls about in the little flat - bottomed dory [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry kept for duck shooting .

It was [Anne]232-anne 's idea that [they]1454-the two girls dramatize [Elaine]163-elaine . [They]1454-the two girls had studied [Tennyson]266-tennyson 's poem in [school]2382-school the preceding winter , [the Superintendent of Education]1456-the superintendent of education having prescribed it in the English course for [the Prince Edward Island schools]1457-the prince edward island schools . [They]1454-the two girls had analyzed and parsed it and torn it to pieces in general until it was a wonder there was any meaning at all left in it for [them]1454-the two girls , but at least [the fair lily maid]1458-the fair lily maid and [Lancelot]267-lancelot and [Guinevere]268-guinevere and [King Arthur]269-king arthur had become very real people to [them]1454-the two girls , and [Anne]232-anne was devoured by secret regret that [she]232-anne had not been born in [Camelot]77-camelot . Those days , [she]232-anne said , were so much more romantic than the present .

[Anne]232-anne 's plan was hailed with enthusiasm . [The girls]2852-the girls had discovered that if [the flat]3662-the flat were pushed off from [the landing place]1461-the landing place [it]3662-the flat would drift down with the current under [the bridge]500-the bridge and finally strand itself on [another headland]1463-another headland lower down which ran out at a curve in [the pond]501-the pond . [They]2852-the girls had often gone down like this and nothing could be more convenient for playing [Elaine]163-elaine .

" Well , [I]232-anne 'll be [Elaine]163-elaine , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne , yielding reluctantly , for , although [she]232-anne would have been delighted to play [the principal character]1465-the principal character , yet [her]232-anne artistic sense demanded fitness for it and this , [she]232-anne felt , [her]232-anne limitations made impossible . " [Ruby]168-ruby gillis , [you]168-ruby gillis must be [King Arthur]269-king arthur and [Jane]121-jane will be [Guinevere]268-guinevere and [Diana]120-diana must be [Lancelot]267-lancelot . But first [you]168-ruby gillis must be [the brothers]3668-the brothers and [the father]3669-the father . [We]3670-we ca n't have [the old dumb servitor]3671-the old dumb servitor because there is n't room for two in [the flat]3662-the flat when [one]385-one is lying down . [We]3670-we must pall [the barge]3674-the barge all [its]3674-the barge length in blackest samite . That old black shawl of [[your]168-ruby gillis mother]2947-your mother 's will be just the thing , [Diana]120-diana . "[232-anne]

The black shawl having been procured , [Anne]232-anne spread it over the flat and then lay down on the bottom , with closed eyes and hands folded over [her]232-anne breast .

" Oh , [she]2947-your mother does look really dead , "[168-ruby gillis] whispered [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis nervously , watching the still , white little face under the flickering shadows of the birches . " It makes [me]168-ruby gillis feel frightened , [girls]2854-girls . Do [you]168-ruby gillis suppose it 's really right to act like this ? [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says that all play - acting is abominably wicked . "[168-ruby gillis]

" [Ruby]168-ruby gillis , [you]168-ruby gillis should n't talk about [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne severely . " It spoils the effect because this is hundreds of years before [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde was born . [Jane]121-jane , [you]121-jane arrange this . It 's silly for [Elaine]163-elaine to be talking when [she]163-elaine 's dead . "[232-anne]

[Jane]121-jane rose to the occasion . Cloth of gold for coverlet there was none , but an old piano scarf of yellow Japanese crepe was an excellent substitute . A white lily was not obtainable just then , but the effect of a tall blue iris placed in one of [Anne]232-anne 's folded hands was all that could be desired .

" Now , [she]2947-your mother 's all ready , "[121-jane] said [Jane]121-jane . " [We]3677-we must kiss [her]2947-your mother quiet brows and , [Diana]120-diana , [you]120-diana say , ? [Sister]270-sister , farewell forever , ' and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis , [you]120-diana say , ? Farewell , [sweet sister]3678-sweet sister , ' both of [you]120-diana as sorrowfully as [you]120-diana possibly can . [Anne]232-anne , for goodness sake smile a little . [You]232-anne know [Elaine]163-elaine ? lay as though [she]163-elaine smiled . ' That 's better . Now push the flat off . "[121-jane]

[The flat]3662-the flat was accordingly pushed off , scraping roughly over an old embedded stake in the process . [Diana]120-diana and [Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis only waited long enough to see it caught in the current and headed for [the bridge]500-the bridge before scampering up through [the woods]373-the woods , across [the road]413-the road , and down to [the lower headland]1470-the lower headland where , as [Lancelot]267-lancelot and [Guinevere]268-guinevere and [the King]1471-the king , [they]1472-they were to be in readiness to receive [the lily maid]3664-the lily maid .

For a few minutes [Anne]232-anne , drifting slowly down , enjoyed the romance of [her]232-anne situation to the full . Then something happened not at all romantic . [The flat]3662-the flat began to leak . In a very few moments it was necessary for [Elaine]163-elaine to scramble to [her]163-elaine feet , pick up [her]163-elaine cloth of gold coverlet and pall of blackest samite and gaze blankly at a big crack in the bottom of [[her]163-elaine barge]1475-her barge through which the water was literally pouring . That sharp stake at [the landing]1476-the landing had torn off the strip of batting nailed on [the flat]3662-the flat . [Anne]232-anne did not know this , but it did not take [her]232-anne long to realize that [she]232-anne was in a dangerous plight . At this rate [the flat]3662-the flat would fill and sink long before it could drift to [the lower headland]1470-the lower headland . Where were the oars ? Left behind at [the landing]1476-the landing !

[Anne]232-anne gave one gasping little scream which [nobody]2118-nobody ever heard ; [she]232-anne was white to the lips , but [she]232-anne did not lose [her]232-anne self - possession . There was one chance -- just one .

" [I]232-anne was horribly frightened , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne told [Mrs. Allan]232-anne the next day , " and it seemed like years while [the flat]3662-the flat was drifting down to [the bridge]500-the bridge and the water rising in it every moment . [I]232-anne prayed , [Mrs. Allan]232-anne , most earnestly , but [I]232-anne did n't shut [my]232-anne eyes to pray , for [I]232-anne knew the only way [God]145-god could save [me]232-anne was to let the flat float close enough to one of the bridge piles for [me]232-anne to climb up on it . [You]3681-you know the piles are just old tree trunks and there are lots of knots and old branch stubs on them . It was proper to pray , but [I]232-anne had to do [my]232-anne part by watching out and right well [I]232-anne knew it . [I]232-anne just said , ? [Dear God]145-god , please take [the flat]3662-the flat close to a pile and [I]232-anne 'll do the rest , ' over and over again . Under such circumstances [you]3681-you do n't think much about making a flowery prayer . But [mine]232-anne was answered , for the flat bumped right into a pile for a minute and [I]232-anne flung the scarf and the shawl over [my]232-anne shoulder and scrambled up on a big providential stub . And there [I]232-anne was , [Mrs. Allan]232-anne , clinging to that slippery old pile with no way of getting up or down . It was a very unromantic position , but [I]232-anne did n't think about that at the time . [You]3681-you do n't think much about romance when [you]3681-you have just escaped from a watery grave . [I]232-anne said a grateful prayer at once and then [I]232-anne gave all [my]232-anne attention to holding on tight , for [I]232-anne knew [I]232-anne should probably have to depend on human aid to get back to [dry land]3683-dry land . "[232-anne]

[The flat]3662-the flat drifted under [the bridge]500-the bridge and then promptly sank in midstream . [Ruby]168-ruby gillis , [Jane]121-jane , and [Diana]120-diana , already awaiting it on [the lower headland]1470-the lower headland , saw it disappear before [their]1485-their very eyes and had not a doubt but that [Anne]232-anne had gone down with it . For a moment [they]1485-their stood still , white as sheets , frozen with horror at the tragedy ; then , shrieking at the tops of [their]1485-their voices , [they]1485-their started on a frantic run up through [the woods]373-the woods , never pausing as [they]1485-their crossed [the main road]745-the main road to glance the way of [the bridge]500-the bridge . [Anne]232-anne , clinging desperately to [her]232-anne precarious foothold , saw [their]1485-their flying forms and heard [their]1485-their shrieks . [Help]271-help would soon come , but meanwhile [her]232-anne position was a very uncomfortable one .

The minutes passed by , each seeming an hour to [the unfortunate lily maid]1489-the unfortunate lily maid . Why did n't [somebody]436-somebody come ? Where had [the girls]2852-the girls gone ? Suppose [they]2852-the girls had fainted , one and all ! Suppose [nobody]2118-nobody ever came ! Suppose [she]232-anne grew so tired and cramped that [she]232-anne could hold on no longer ! [Anne]232-anne looked at the wicked green depths below [her]232-anne , wavering with long , oily shadows , and shivered . [Her]232-anne imagination began to suggest all manner of gruesome possibilities to [her]232-anne .

Then , just as [she]232-anne thought [she]232-anne really could not endure the ache in [her]232-anne arms and wrists another moment , [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert came rowing under [the bridge]500-the bridge in [[Harmon Andrews]158-mr. harmon andrews 's dory]1494-harmon andrews 's dory !

[Gilbert]140-gilbert glanced up and , much to [his]140-gilbert amazement , beheld a little white scornful face looking down upon [him]140-gilbert with big , frightened but also scornful gray eyes .

" [Anne Shirley]124-anne ! How on earth did [you]124-anne get [there]348-there ? "[140-gilbert] [he]140-gilbert exclaimed .

Without waiting for an answer [he]140-gilbert pulled close to the pile and extended [his]140-gilbert hand . There was no help for it ; [Anne]124-anne , clinging to [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert 's hand , scrambled down into [the dory]1495-the dory , where [she]124-anne sat , drabbled and furious , in the stern with [her]124-anne arms full of dripping shawl and wet crepe . It was certainly extremely difficult to be dignified under the circumstances !

" What has happened , [Anne]124-anne ? "[140-gilbert] asked [Gilbert]140-gilbert , taking up [his]140-gilbert oars . " [We]3685-we were playing [Elaine]163-elaine "[124-anne] explained [Anne]124-anne frigidly , without even looking at [[her]124-anne rescuer]1496-her rescuer , " and [I]124-anne had to drift down to [Camelot]77-camelot in [the barge]3674-the barge -- [I]124-anne mean [the flat]3662-the flat . [The flat]3662-the flat began to leak and [I]124-anne climbed out on the pile . [The girls]2852-the girls went for help . Will [you]140-gilbert be kind enough to row [me]124-anne to [the landing]1476-the landing ? "[124-anne]

[Gilbert]140-gilbert obligingly rowed to [the landing]1476-the landing and [Anne]124-anne , disdaining assistance , sprang nimbly on [shore]1498-shore .

" [I]124-anne 'm very much obliged to [you]140-gilbert , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said haughtily as [she]124-anne turned away . But [Gilbert]140-gilbert had also sprung from [the boat]2132-the boat and now laid a detaining hand on [her]124-anne arm .

" [Anne]124-anne , "[140-gilbert] [he]140-gilbert said hurriedly , " look here . Ca n't [we]3691-we be [good friends]3692-good friends ? [I]140-gilbert 'm awfully sorry [I]140-gilbert made fun of [your]124-anne hair that time . [I]140-gilbert did n't mean to vex [you]124-anne and [I]140-gilbert only meant it for a joke . Besides , it 's so long ago . [I]140-gilbert think [your]124-anne hair is awfully pretty now -- honest [I]140-gilbert do . Let 's be [friends]677-friends . "[140-gilbert]

For a moment [Anne]124-anne hesitated . [She]124-anne had an odd , newly awakened consciousness under all [her]124-anne outraged dignity that the half - shy , half - eager expression in [Gilbert]140-gilbert 's hazel eyes was something that was very good to see . [Her]124-anne heart gave a quick , queer little beat . But the bitterness of [her]124-anne old grievance promptly stiffened up [her]124-anne wavering determination . That scene of two years before flashed back into [her]124-anne recollection as vividly as if it had taken place yesterday . [Gilbert]140-gilbert had called [her]124-anne " carrots "[140-gilbert] and had brought about [her]124-anne disgrace before [the whole school]902-the whole school . [Her]124-anne resentment , which to [other and older people]1501-other and older people might be as laughable as [its]1502-its cause , was in no whit allayed and softened by time seemingly . [She]124-anne hated [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert ! [She]124-anne would never forgive [him]140-gilbert !

" No , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said coldly , " [I]124-anne shall never be [friends]677-friends with [you]140-gilbert , [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert ; and [I]124-anne do n't want to be ! "[124-anne]

" All right ! "[140-gilbert] [Gilbert]140-gilbert sprang into [his]140-gilbert skiff with an angry color in [his]140-gilbert cheeks . " [I]140-gilbert 'll never ask [you]124-anne to be [friends]677-friends again , [Anne Shirley]124-anne . And [I]140-gilbert do n't care either ! "[140-gilbert]

[He]140-gilbert pulled away with swift defiant strokes , and [Anne]124-anne went up [the steep , ferny little path under the maples]1503-the steep , ferny little path under the maples . [She]124-anne held [her]124-anne head very high , but [she]124-anne was conscious of an odd feeling of regret . [She]124-anne almost wished [she]124-anne had answered [Gilbert]140-gilbert differently . Of course , [he]140-gilbert had insulted [her]124-anne terribly , but still-- ! Altogether , [Anne]124-anne rather thought it would be a relief to sit down and have a good cry . [She]124-anne was really quite unstrung , for the reaction from [her]124-anne fright and cramped clinging was making itself felt .

Halfway up [the path]3242-the path [she]124-anne met [Jane]121-jane and [Diana]120-diana rushing back to [the pond]501-the pond in a state narrowly removed from positive frenzy . [They]1506-we had found [nobody]2118-nobody at [Orchard Slope]24-orchard slope , both [Mr.]1508-mr. and [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry being away . Here [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis had succumbed to hysterics , and was left to recover from [them]1509-them as best [she]168-ruby gillis might , while [Jane]121-jane and [Diana]120-diana flew through [the Haunted Wood]3226-the haunted wood and across [the brook]394-the brook to [Green Gables]107-matthew . There [they]1506-we had found [nobody]2118-nobody either , for [Marilla]113-marilla had gone to [Carmody]5-carmody and [Matthew]107-matthew was making hay in [the back field]1513-the back field .

" Oh , [Anne]124-anne , "[120-diana] gasped [Diana]120-diana , fairly falling on [the former]1514-the former 's neck and weeping with relief and delight , " oh , [Anne]124-anne -- [we]1506-we thought -- [you]124-anne were -- drowned -- and [we]1506-we felt like [murderers]3696-murderers -- because [we]1506-we had made -- [you]124-anne be -- [Elaine]163-elaine . And [Ruby]168-ruby gillis is in hysterics -- oh , [Anne]124-anne , how did [you]124-anne escape ? "[120-diana]

" [I]124-anne climbed up on one of the piles , "[124-anne] explained [Anne]124-anne wearily , " and [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert came along in [Mr. Andrews]158-mr. harmon andrews 's dory and brought [me]124-anne to [land]3697-land . "[124-anne]

" Oh , [Anne]124-anne , how splendid of [him]140-gilbert ! Why , it 's so romantic ! "[121-jane] said [Jane]121-jane , finding breath enough for utterance at last . " Of course [you]124-anne 'll speak to [him]140-gilbert after this . "[121-jane]

" Of course [I]124-anne wo n't , "[124-anne] flashed [Anne]124-anne , with a momentary return of [her]124-anne old spirit . " And [I]124-anne do n't want ever to hear the word ? romantic ' again , [Jane Andrews]121-jane . [I]124-anne 'm awfully sorry [you]121-jane were so frightened , [girls]2854-girls . It is all [my]124-anne fault . [I]124-anne feel sure [I]124-anne was born under an unlucky star . Everything [I]124-anne do gets [me]124-anne or [[my]124-anne dearest friends]3699-my dearest friends into a scrape . [We]3700-we 've gone and lost [[[your]121-jane father]2949-your father 's flat]3702-your father 's flat , [Diana]120-diana , and [I]124-anne have a presentiment that [we]3700-we 'll not be allowed to row on [the pond]501-the pond any more . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne 's presentiment proved more trustworthy than presentiments are apt to do . Great was the consternation in [the Barry and [Cuthbert]107-matthew households]1515-the barry and cuthbert households when the events of the afternoon became known .

" Will [you]124-anne ever have any sense , [Anne]124-anne ? "[113-marilla] groaned [Marilla]113-marilla .

" Oh , yes , [I]124-anne think [I]124-anne will , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] returned [Anne]124-anne optimistically . A good cry , indulged in the grateful solitude of [the east gable]561-the east gable , had soothed [her]124-anne nerves and restored [her]124-anne to [her]124-anne wonted cheerfulness . " [I]124-anne think [my]124-anne prospects of becoming sensible are brighter now than ever . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla do n't see how , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla .

" Well , "[124-anne] explained [Anne]124-anne , " [I]124-anne 've learned a new and valuable lesson today . Ever since [I]124-anne came to [Green Gables]107-matthew [I]124-anne 've been making mistakes , and each mistake has helped to cure [me]124-anne of some great shortcoming . The affair of the amethyst brooch cured [me]124-anne of meddling with things that did n't belong to [me]124-anne . The Haunted Wood mistake cured [me]124-anne of letting [my]124-anne imagination run away with [me]124-anne . The liniment cake mistake cured [me]124-anne of carelessness in cooking . Dyeing [my]124-anne hair cured [me]124-anne of vanity . [I]124-anne never think about [my]124-anne hair and nose now -- at least , very seldom . And today 's mistake is going to cure [me]124-anne of being too romantic . [I]124-anne have come to the conclusion that it is no use trying to be romantic in [Avonlea]2-avonlea . It was probably easy enough in towered [Camelot]77-camelot hundreds of years ago , but romance is not appreciated now . [I]124-anne feel quite sure that [you]113-marilla will soon see a great improvement in [me]124-anne in this respect , [Marilla]113-marilla . "[124-anne]

" [I]113-marilla 'm sure [I]113-marilla hope so , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla skeptically .

But [Matthew]107-matthew , who had been sitting mutely in [his]107-matthew corner , laid a hand on [Anne]124-anne 's shoulder when [Marilla]113-marilla had gone out .

" Do n't give up all [your]124-anne romance , [Anne]124-anne , "[107-matthew] [he]107-matthew whispered shyly , " a little of it is a good thing -- not too much , of course -- but keep a little of it , [Anne]124-anne , keep a little of it . "[107-matthew]

CHAPTER XXIX . An Epoch in [[Anne]124-anne 's Life]1517-anne 's life

|ANNE was bringing the cows [home]361-home from [the back pasture]706-the back pasture by way of [Lover 's Lane]47-lover 's lane . [It]1520-it was a September evening and all the gaps and clearings in [the woods]373-the woods were brimmed up with ruby sunset light . Here and there [the lane]380-the lane was splashed with [it]1523-it , but for the most part [it]380-the lane was already quite shadowy beneath the maples , and the spaces under the firs were filled with a clear violet dusk like airy wine . The winds were out in their tops , and there is no sweeter music on [earth]647-earth than that which the wind makes in the fir trees at evening .

The cows swung placidly down [the lane]380-the lane , and [Anne]124-anne followed [them]1526-them dreamily , repeating aloud the battle canto from _ [Marmion_--which]272-marmion_--which had also been part of [their]1526-them English course the preceding winter and which [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy had made [them]1526-them learn off by heart -- and exulting in its rushing lines and the clash of spears in its imagery . When [she]124-anne came to the lines

[The stubborn spearsmen]1527-the stubborn spearsmen still made good [Their]1527-the stubborn spearsmen dark impenetrable wood ,

[she]124-anne stopped in ecstasy to shut [her]124-anne eyes that [she]124-anne might the better fancy [herself]124-anne one of that heroic ring . When [she]124-anne opened [them]1528-i again it was to behold [Diana]120-diana coming through the gate that led into [the Barry field]1529-the barry field and looking so important that [Anne]124-anne instantly divined there was news to be told . But betray too eager curiosity [she]124-anne would not .

" Is n't this evening just like a purple dream , [Diana]120-diana ? It makes [me]1528-i so glad to be alive . In the mornings [I]1528-i always think the mornings are best ; but when evening comes [I]1528-i think it 's lovelier still . "[1528-i]

" It 's a very fine evening , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana , " but oh , [I]120-diana have such news , [Anne]124-anne . Guess . [You]124-anne can have three guesses . "[120-diana]

" [Charlotte Gillis]273-charlotte gillis is going to be married in [the church]751-the church after all and [Mrs. Allan]232-anne wants [us]3705-us to decorate [it]751-the church , "[232-anne] cried [Anne]232-anne .

" No . [[Charlotte]273-charlotte gillis 's beau]3706-charlotte 's beau wo n't agree to that , because [nobody]2118-nobody ever has been married in [the church]751-the church yet , and [he]3706-charlotte 's beau thinks it would seem too much like a funeral . It 's too mean , because it would be such fun . Guess again . "[1528-i]

" [[Jane]121-jane 's mother]3709-jane 's mother is going to let [her]121-jane have a birthday party ? "[120-diana]

[Diana]120-diana shook [her]120-diana head , [her]120-diana black eyes dancing with merriment .

" [I]232-anne ca n't think what it can be , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne in despair , " unless it 's that [Moody Spurgeon MacPherson]254-moody spurgeon saw [you]120-diana [home]361-home from prayer meeting last night . Did [he]254-moody spurgeon ? "[232-anne]

" [I]120-diana should think not , "[120-diana] exclaimed [Diana]120-diana indignantly . " [I]120-diana would n't be likely to boast of it if [he]254-moody spurgeon did , [the horrid creature]3711-the horrid creature ! [I]120-diana knew [you]232-anne could n't guess it . [Mother]207-mother had a letter from [Aunt Josephine]216-aunt josephine today , and [Aunt Josephine]216-aunt josephine wants [you]232-anne and [me]120-diana to go to [town]2009-town next Tuesday and stop with [her]216-aunt josephine for the Exhibition . There ! "[120-diana]

" Oh , [Diana]120-diana , "[232-anne] whispered [Anne]232-anne , finding it necessary to lean up against a maple tree for support , " do [you]120-diana really mean it ? But [I]232-anne 'm afraid [Marilla]113-marilla wo n't let [me]232-anne go . [She]113-marilla will say that [she]113-marilla ca n't encourage gadding about . That was what [she]113-marilla said last week when [Jane]121-jane invited [me]232-anne to go with [them]3713-them in [their]3713-them double - seated buggy to the American concert at [the White Sands Hotel]2408-the white sands hotel . [I]232-anne wanted to go , but [Marilla]113-marilla said [I]232-anne 'd be better at [home]361-home learning [my]232-anne lessons and so would [Jane]121-jane . [I]232-anne was bitterly disappointed , [Diana]120-diana . [I]232-anne felt so heartbroken that [I]232-anne would n't say [my]232-anne prayers when [I]232-anne went to bed . But [I]232-anne repented of that and got up in the middle of the night and said them . "[232-anne]

" [I]120-diana 'll tell [you]232-anne , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana , " [we]3716-we 'll get [Mother]207-mother to ask [Marilla]113-marilla . [She]207-mother 'll be more likely to let [you]232-anne go then ; and if [she]207-mother does [we]3716-we 'll have the time of [our]3716-we lives , [Anne]232-anne . [I]120-diana 've never been to [an Exhibition]3717-an exhibition , and it 's so aggravating to hear [the other girls]3140-the other girls talking about [their]3140-the other girls trips . [Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis have been twice , and [they]3140-the other girls 're going this year again . "[120-diana]

" [I]232-anne 'm not going to think about it at all until [I]232-anne know whether [I]232-anne can go or not , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne resolutely . " If [I]232-anne did and then was disappointed , it would be more than [I]232-anne could bear . But in case [I]232-anne do go [I]232-anne 'm very glad [my]232-anne new coat will be ready by that time . [Marilla]113-marilla did n't think [I]232-anne needed a new coat . [She]113-marilla said [my]232-anne old one would do very well for another winter and that [I]232-anne ought to be satisfied with having a new dress . The dress is very pretty , [Diana]120-diana -- navy blue and made so fashionably . [Marilla]113-marilla always makes [my]232-anne dresses fashionably now , because [she]113-marilla says [she]113-marilla does n't intend to have [Matthew]107-matthew going to [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde to make them . [I]232-anne 'm so glad . It is ever so much easier to be good if [your]3719-your clothes are fashionable . At least , it is easier for [me]232-anne . [I]232-anne suppose it does n't make such a difference to [naturally good people]3720-naturally good people . But [Matthew]107-matthew said [I]232-anne must have a new coat , so [Marilla]113-marilla bought a lovely piece of blue broadcloth , and it 's being made by [a real dressmaker over at [Carmody]5-carmody]3721-a real dressmaker over at carmody . It 's to be done Saturday night , and [I]232-anne 'm trying not to imagine [myself]232-anne walking up [the church]751-the church aisle on Sunday in [my]232-anne new suit and cap , because [I]232-anne 'm afraid it is n't right to imagine such things . But it just slips into [my]232-anne mind in spite of [me]232-anne . [My]232-anne cap is so pretty . [Matthew]107-matthew bought it for [me]232-anne the day [we]3723-we were over at [Carmody]5-carmody . It is one of those little blue velvet ones that are all the rage , with gold cord and tassels . [Your]232-anne new hat is elegant , [Diana]120-diana , and so becoming . When [I]232-anne saw [you]232-anne come into [church]2482-church last Sunday [my]232-anne heart swelled with pride to think [you]232-anne were [[my]232-anne dearest friend]3725-my dearest friend . Do [you]232-anne suppose it 's wrong for [us]3723-we to think so much about [our]3723-we clothes ? [Marilla]113-marilla says it is very sinful . But it is such an interesting subject , is n't it ? "[232-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla agreed to let [Anne]232-anne go to [town]2009-town , and it was arranged that [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry should take [the girls]2852-the girls in on the following Tuesday . As [Charlottetown]18-charlottetown was thirty miles away and [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry wished to go and return the same day , it was necessary to make a very early start . But [Anne]232-anne counted it all joy , and was up before sunrise on Tuesday morning . A glance from [her]232-anne window assured [her]232-anne that the day would be fine , for the eastern sky behind [the firs of [the Haunted Wood]63-the haunted wood]1532-the firs of the haunted wood was all silvery and cloudless . Through the gap in the trees a light was shining in the western gable of [Orchard Slope]24-orchard slope , a token that [Diana]120-diana was also up .

[Anne]232-anne was dressed by the time [Matthew]107-matthew had the fire on and had the breakfast ready when [Marilla]113-marilla came down , but for [her]232-anne own part was much too excited to eat . After breakfast the jaunty new cap and jacket were donned , and [Anne]232-anne hastened over [the brook]394-the brook and up through the firs to [Orchard Slope]24-orchard slope . [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry and [Diana]120-diana were waiting for [her]232-anne , and [they]2852-the girls were soon on [the road]413-the road .

It was a long drive , but [Anne]232-anne and [Diana]120-diana enjoyed every minute of it . It was delightful to rattle along over [the moist roads]1535-the moist roads in the early red sunlight that was creeping across [the shorn harvest fields]1536-the shorn harvest fields . The air was fresh and crisp , and little smoke - blue mists curled through [the valleys]1332-the valleys and floated off from [the hills]1538-the hills . Sometimes [the road]413-the road went through woods where maples were beginning to hang out scarlet banners ; sometimes it crossed rivers on bridges that made [Anne]232-anne 's flesh cringe with the old , half - delightful fear ; sometimes it wound along [a harbor shore]1540-a harbor shore and passed by a little cluster of [weather - gray fishing huts]1541-weather - gray fishing huts ; again [it]413-the road mounted to [hills whence a far sweep of curving upland or misty - blue sky]1542-hills whence a far sweep of curving upland or misty - blue sky could be seen ; but wherever it went there was much of interest to discuss . It was almost noon when [they]2852-the girls reached [town]2009-town and found [their]2852-the girls way to " [Beechwood]90-beechwood . "[217-miss barry] [It]1544-it was quite [a fine old mansion]1545-a fine old mansion , set back from [the street]1546-the street in [a seclusion of green elms and branching beeches]1547-a seclusion of green elms and branching beeches . [Miss Barry]217-miss barry met [them]2852-the girls at the door with a twinkle in [her]217-miss barry sharp black eyes .

" Is n't it just like [a palace]3728-a palace ? "[120-diana] whispered [Diana]120-diana . "[120-diana]

[Their]1551-them sojourn in [town]2009-town was something that [Anne]232-anne and [Diana]120-diana dated from for years . From first to last [it]1553-it was crowded with delights .

On Wednesday [Miss Barry]217-miss barry took [them]1551-them to [the Exhibition grounds]1554-the exhibition grounds and kept them [there]348-there all day .

[Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde was [there]348-there that day , and [I]232-anne never knew how much [I]232-anne really liked [her]105-mrs. lynde until [I]232-anne saw [her]105-mrs. lynde familiar face among [all those strangers]3736-all those strangers . [Diana]120-diana got so excited that [she]120-diana offered to bet [me]232-anne ten cents that the red horse would win . And [I]232-anne was very glad [I]232-anne did n't bet , because the red horse _ did _ win , and [I]232-anne would have lost ten cents . So [you]3743-you see that virtue was its own reward . [We]3749-we saw [a man]2052-a man go up in a balloon . Thursday [the girls]2852-the girls had a drive in [the park]1557-the park , and in the evening [Miss Barry]217-miss barry took [them]2852-the girls to a concert in [the Academy of Music]1558-the academy of music , where [a noted prima donna]1559-a noted prima donna was to sing . To [Anne]232-anne the evening was a glittering vision of delight .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , it was beyond description . [I]232-anne was so excited [I]232-anne could n't even talk , so [you]113-marilla may know what it was like . [I]232-anne just sat in enraptured silence . [Madame Selitsky]276-madame selitsky was perfectly beautiful , and wore white satin and diamonds . But when [she]276-madame selitsky began to sing [I]232-anne never thought about anything else . Oh , [I]232-anne ca n't tell [you]113-marilla how [I]232-anne felt . But it seemed to [me]232-anne that it could never be hard to be good any more . [I]232-anne felt like [I]232-anne do when [I]232-anne look up to the stars . [I]232-anne was so sorry when it was all over , and [I]232-anne told [Miss Barry]217-miss barry [I]232-anne did n't see how [I]232-anne was ever to return to common life again . [She]217-miss barry said [she]217-miss barry thought if [we]3760-we went over to [the restaurant across [the street]1546-the street]3761-the restaurant across the street and had an ice cream it might help [me]232-anne . That sounded so prosaic ; but to [my]232-anne surprise [I]232-anne found it true . The ice cream was delicious , [Marilla]113-marilla , and it was so lovely and dissipated to be sitting there eating it at eleven o'clock at night . [Diana]120-diana said [she]120-diana believed [she]120-diana was born for city life . [Miss Barry]217-miss barry asked [me]232-anne what [my]232-anne opinion was , but [I]232-anne said [I]232-anne would have to think it over very seriously before [I]232-anne could tell [her]217-miss barry what [I]232-anne really thought . So [I]232-anne thought it over after [I]232-anne went to bed . That is the best time to think things out . And [I]232-anne came to the conclusion , [Marilla]113-marilla , that [I]232-anne was n't born for city life and that [I]232-anne was glad of it . It 's nice to be eating ice cream at [brilliant restaurants at eleven o'clock]3763-brilliant restaurants at eleven o'clock at night once in a while ; but as a regular thing [I]232-anne 'd rather be in [the east gable]561-the east gable at eleven , sound asleep , but kind of knowing even in [my]232-anne sleep that the stars were shining outside and that the wind was blowing in the firs across [the brook]394-the brook . [I]232-anne told [Miss Barry]217-miss barry so at breakfast the next morning and [she]217-miss barry laughed . [Miss Barry]217-miss barry generally laughed at anything [I]232-anne said , even when [I]232-anne said the most solemn things . [I]232-anne do n't think [I]232-anne liked it , [Marilla]113-marilla , because [I]232-anne was n't trying to be funny . But [she]217-miss barry is [a most hospitable lady]3766-a most hospitable lady and treated [us]3767-us royally . "[232-anne]

Friday brought going - [home]361-home time , and [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry drove in for [the girls]2852-the girls .

" Indeed [we]3767-us have , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana .

" And [you]232-anne , [[Anne]232-anne - girl]3768-anne - girl ? "[1562-the old woman]

" [I]232-anne 've enjoyed every minute of the time , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne , throwing [her]232-anne arms impulsively about [the old woman]1562-the old woman 's neck and kissing [her]232-anne wrinkled cheek . [Diana]120-diana would never have dared to do such a thing and felt rather aghast at [Anne]232-anne 's freedom . But [Miss Barry]217-miss barry was pleased , and [she]217-miss barry stood on [[her]217-miss barry veranda]1563-her veranda and watched [the buggy]358-the buggy out of sight . [Miss Barry]217-miss barry was [a rather selfish old lady]1566-a rather selfish old lady , if the truth must be told , and had never cared much for [[anybody]2031-anybody but [herself]217-miss barry]1568-anybody but herself . [Anne]232-anne had amused [her]217-miss barry , and consequently stood high in [the old lady]1175-the old lady 's good graces . But [Miss Barry]217-miss barry found [herself]217-miss barry thinking less about [Anne]232-anne 's quaint speeches than of [her]232-anne fresh enthusiasms , [her]232-anne transparent emotions , [her]232-anne little winning ways , and the sweetness of [her]232-anne eyes and lips .

" [I]217-miss barry thought [Marilla Cuthbert]113-marilla was [an old fool]3769-an old fool when [I]217-miss barry heard [she]113-marilla 'd adopted [a girl]2066-a girl out of [an orphan asylum]408-an orphan asylum , "[217-miss barry] [she]217-miss barry said to [herself]217-miss barry , " but [I]217-miss barry guess [she]113-marilla did n't make much of a mistake after all . "[217-miss barry]

[Anne]232-anne and [Diana]120-diana found the drive [home]361-home as pleasant as [the drive in]1572-the drive in -- pleasanter , indeed , since there was the delightful consciousness of [home]361-home waiting at the end of [it]361-home . It was sunset when [they]1574-them passed through [White Sands]27-white sands and turned into [the shore road]2314-the shore road . Beyond , [the Avonlea hills]1576-the avonlea hills came out darkly against the saffron sky . Behind [them]1574-them the moon was rising out of [the sea]609-the sea that grew all radiant and transfigured in [her]232-anne light . [Every little cove along [the curving road]1579-the curving road]1578-every little cove along the curving road was a marvel of dancing ripples . The waves broke with a soft swish on the rocks below [them]1574-them , and the tang of [the sea]609-the sea was in the strong , fresh air .

" Oh , but it 's good to be alive and to be going [home]361-home , "[232-anne] breathed [Anne]232-anne .

When [she]232-anne crossed the log bridge over [the brook]394-the brook the kitchen light of [Green Gables]107-matthew winked [her]232-anne a friendly welcome back , and through the open door shone the hearth fire , sending out its warm red glow athwart the chilly autumn night . [Anne]232-anne ran blithely up [the hill]357-the hill and into [the kitchen]557-the kitchen , where a hot supper was waiting on the table .

" So [you]232-anne 've got back ? "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , folding up [her]113-marilla knitting .

" Yes , and oh , it 's so good to be back , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne joyously . " [I]232-anne could kiss everything , even to the clock . [Marilla]113-marilla , a broiled chicken ! [You]113-marilla do n't mean to say [you]113-marilla cooked that for [me]232-anne ! "[232-anne]

" Yes , [I]113-marilla did , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " [I]113-marilla thought [you]232-anne 'd be hungry after such a drive and need something real appetizing . Hurry and take off [your]232-anne things , and [we]3776-we 'll have supper as soon as [Matthew]107-matthew comes in . [I]113-marilla 'm glad [you]232-anne 've got back , [I]113-marilla must say . It 's been fearful lonesome here without [you]232-anne , and [I]113-marilla never put in four longer days . "[113-marilla]

After supper [Anne]232-anne sat before the fire between [Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]113-marilla , and gave [them]1584-them a full account of [her]232-anne visit .

" [I]232-anne 've had a splendid time , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne concluded happily , " and [I]232-anne feel that it marks an epoch in [my]232-anne life . But the best of it all was the coming [home]361-home . "[232-anne]

CHAPTER XXX . The Queens Class Is Organized

|MARILLA laid [her]232-anne knitting on [her]232-anne lap and leaned back in [her]232-anne chair . [Her]232-anne eyes were tired , and [she]232-anne thought vaguely that [she]232-anne must see about having [her]232-anne glasses changed the next time [she]232-anne went to [town]2009-town , for [her]232-anne eyes had grown tired very often of late .

It was nearly dark , for the full November twilight had fallen around [Green Gables]107-matthew , and the only light in [the kitchen]557-the kitchen came from the dancing red flames in the stove .

[Anne]232-anne was curled up Turk - fashion on the hearthrug , gazing into that joyous glow where the sunshine of a hundred summers was being distilled from the maple cordwood . [She]232-anne had been reading , but [her]232-anne book had slipped to the floor , and now [she]232-anne was dreaming , with a smile on [her]232-anne parted lips . [Glittering castles in [Spain]79-spain]1587-glittering castles in spain were shaping themselves out of the mists and rainbows of [her]232-anne lively fancy ; adventures wonderful and enthralling were happening to [her]232-anne in [cloudland]1588-cloudland -- adventures that always turned out triumphantly and never involved [her]232-anne in scrapes like those of actual life .

[Marilla]113-marilla looked at [her]113-marilla with a tenderness that would never have been suffered to reveal itself in any clearer light than that soft mingling of fireshine and shadow . The lesson of a love that should display itself easily in spoken word and open look was one [Marilla]113-marilla could never learn . But [she]113-marilla had learned to love [this slim , gray - eyed girl]1589-this slim , gray - eyed girl with an affection all the deeper and stronger from [its]1590-its very undemonstrativeness . [Her]113-marilla love made [her]113-marilla afraid of being unduly indulgent , indeed . [She]113-marilla had an uneasy feeling that it was rather sinful to set [one]385-one 's heart so intensely on any human creature as [she]113-marilla had set hers on [Anne]232-anne , and perhaps [she]113-marilla performed a sort of unconscious penance for this by being stricter and more critical than if [the girl]2093-the girl had been less dear to [her]232-anne . Certainly [Anne]232-anne [herself]232-anne had no idea how [Marilla]113-marilla loved [her]232-anne . [She]113-marilla sometimes thought wistfully that [Marilla]113-marilla was very hard to please and distinctly lacking in sympathy and understanding . But [she]113-marilla always checked the thought reproachfully , remembering what [she]113-marilla owed to [Marilla]113-marilla .

" [Anne]232-anne , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla abruptly , " [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy was [here]2022-here this afternoon when [you]232-anne were out with [Diana]120-diana . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]232-anne came back from [her]232-anne other world with a start and a sigh .

" Was [she]240-miss stacy ? Oh , [I]113-marilla 'm so sorry [I]113-marilla was n't in . Why did n't [you]232-anne call [me]113-marilla , [Marilla]113-marilla ? [Diana]120-diana and [I]113-marilla were only over in [the Haunted Wood]3226-the haunted wood . It 's lovely in [the woods]373-the woods now . All the little wood things -- the ferns and the satin leaves and the crackerberries -- have gone to sleep , just as if [somebody]436-somebody had tucked them away until spring under a blanket of leaves . [I]113-marilla think it was [a little gray fairy with a rainbow scarf that came tiptoeing along the last moonlight night]3782-a little gray fairy with a rainbow scarf that came tiptoeing along the last moonlight night and did it . [Diana]120-diana would n't say much about that , though . [The Queen]3222-the queen 's class was organized in due time . " What is [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert going to be ? "[113-marilla] queried [Marilla]113-marilla , seeing that [Anne]124-anne was opening [her]124-anne Caesar .

" [I]124-anne do n't happen to know what [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert 's ambition in life is -- if [he]140-gilbert has any , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne scornfully .

There was open rivalry between [Gilbert]140-gilbert and [Anne]124-anne now . Previously the rivalry had been rather one - sided , but there was no longer any doubt that [Gilbert]140-gilbert was as determined to be first in class as [Anne]124-anne was . [He]140-gilbert was [a foeman worthy of [her]124-anne steel]1602-a foeman worthy of her steel . [The other members of the class]1603-the other members of the class tacitly acknowledged [their]1603-the other members of the class superiority , and never dreamed of trying to compete with [them]1603-the other members of the class .

Since the day by [the pond]501-the pond when [she]124-anne had refused to listen to [his]140-gilbert plea for forgiveness , [Gilbert]140-gilbert , save for the aforesaid determined rivalry , had evinced no recognition whatever of the existence of [Anne Shirley]124-anne . [He]140-gilbert talked and jested with [the other girls]3140-the other girls , exchanged books and puzzles with [them]3140-the other girls , discussed lessons and plans , sometimes walked [home]361-home with one or the other of [them]3140-the other girls from prayer meeting or [Debating Club]81-debating club . But [Anne Shirley]124-anne [he]140-gilbert simply ignored , and [Anne]124-anne found out that it is not pleasant to be ignored . It was in vain that [she]124-anne told [herself]124-anne with a toss of [her]124-anne head that [she]124-anne did not care . Deep down in [her]124-anne wayward , feminine little heart [she]124-anne knew that [she]124-anne did care , and that if [she]124-anne had that chance of [the Lake of Shining Waters]23-the lake of shining waters again [she]124-anne would answer very differently . All at once , as it seemed , and to [her]124-anne secret dismay , [she]124-anne found that the old resentment [she]124-anne had cherished against [him]140-gilbert was gone -- gone just when [she]124-anne most needed its sustaining power . It was in vain that [she]124-anne recalled every incident and emotion of that memorable occasion and tried to feel the old satisfying anger . That day by [the pond]501-the pond had witnessed its last spasmodic flicker . [Anne]124-anne realized that [she]124-anne had forgiven and forgotten without knowing it . But it was too late .

And at least neither [Gilbert]140-gilbert nor [anybody else]1254-anybody else , not even [Diana]120-diana , should ever suspect how sorry [she]124-anne was and how much [she]124-anne wished [she]124-anne had n't been so proud and horrid ! [She]124-anne determined to " shroud [her]124-anne feelings in deepest oblivion , "[124-anne] and it may be stated here and now that [she]124-anne did it , so successfully that [Gilbert]140-gilbert , who possibly was not quite so indifferent as [he]140-gilbert seemed , could not console [himself]140-gilbert with any belief that [Anne]124-anne felt [his]140-gilbert retaliatory scorn . The only poor comfort [he]140-gilbert had was that [she]124-anne snubbed [Charlie Sloane]173-charlie sloane , unmercifully , continually , and undeservedly .

Otherwise the winter passed away in a round of pleasant duties and studies . For [Anne]124-anne the days slipped by like golden beads on the necklace of the year . [She]124-anne was happy , eager , interested ; there were lessons to be learned and honor to be won ; delightful books to read ; new pieces to be practiced for [the Sunday - school choir]3389-the sunday - school choir ; pleasant Saturday afternoons at [the manse]2492-the manse with [Mrs. Allan]232-anne ; and then , almost before [Anne]232-anne realized it , spring had come again to [Green Gables]107-matthew and all [the world]409-the world was abloom once more .

Studies palled just a wee bit then ; [[the Queen]3222-the queen 's class]1613-the queen 's class , left behind in [school]2382-school while the others scattered to [green lanes]1615-green lanes and leafy wood cuts and [meadow byways]1616-meadow byways , looked wistfully out of the windows and discovered that Latin verbs and French exercises had somehow lost the tang and zest [they]1617-they had possessed in the crisp winter months . Even [Anne]232-anne and [Gilbert]140-gilbert lagged and grew indifferent . [Teacher]1618-teacher and [taught]1619-taught were alike glad when the term was ended and the glad vacation days stretched rosily before [them]1620-you .

" But [you]1620-you 've done good work this past year , "[240-miss stacy] [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy told [them]1620-you on the last evening , " and [you]1620-you deserve a good , jolly vacation . It will be the tug of war , [you]1620-you know -- the last year before the Entrance . "[240-miss stacy]

" Are [you]240-miss stacy going to be back next year , [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy ? "[175-josie pye] asked [Josie Pye]175-josie pye .
