" Hurrah ! "[254-moody spurgeon] said [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon . [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon had never been so carried away by [his]254-moody spurgeon feelings before , and [he]254-moody spurgeon blushed uncomfortably every time [he]254-moody spurgeon thought about it for a week .

" Oh , [I]232-anne 'm so glad , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne , with shining eyes . " [Dear Stacy]240-miss stacy , it would be perfectly dreadful if [you]240-miss stacy did n't come back . [I]232-anne do n't believe [I]232-anne could have the heart to go on with [my]232-anne studies at all if [another teacher]3839-another teacher came [here]2022-here . "[232-anne]

When [Anne]232-anne got [home]361-home that night [she]232-anne stacked all [her]232-anne textbooks away in an old trunk in [the attic]1630-the attic , locked it , and threw the key into the blanket box .

" [I]232-anne 'm not even going to look at a schoolbook in vacation , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne told [Marilla]113-marilla . " [I]232-anne 've studied as hard all the term as [I]232-anne possibly could and [I]232-anne 've pored over that geometry until [I]232-anne know every proposition in the first book off by heart , even when the letters _ are _ changed . [I]232-anne just feel tired of everything sensible and [I]232-anne 'm going to let [my]232-anne imagination run riot for the summer . But [I]232-anne want to have a real good jolly time this summer , for maybe it 's the last summer [I]232-anne 'll be [a little girl]2083-a little girl . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says that if [I]232-anne keep stretching out next year as [I]232-anne 've done this [I]232-anne 'll have to put on longer skirts . [She]105-mrs. lynde says [I]232-anne 'm all running to legs and eyes . It wo n't even do to believe in fairies then , [I]232-anne 'm afraid ; so [I]232-anne 'm going to believe in [them]3842-them with all [my]232-anne whole heart this summer . [I]232-anne think [we]3843-we 're going to have a very gay vacation . And [Mr. Barry]119-mr. barry says that some evening [he]119-mr. barry 'll take [Diana]120-diana and [me]232-anne over to [the White Sands Hotel]2408-the white sands hotel and have dinner [there]348-there . [They]3846-they have dinner [there]348-there in the evening , [you]3848-you know . [Jane Andrews]121-jane was over once last summer and [she]121-jane says it was a dazzling sight to see the electric lights and the flowers and [all the lady guests]3849-all the lady guests in such beautiful dresses . [Jane]121-jane says it was [her]121-jane first glimpse into high life and [she]121-jane 'll never forget it to [her]121-jane dying day . "[232-anne]

[Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde came up the next afternoon to find out why [Marilla]113-marilla had not been at the Aid meeting on Thursday . When [Marilla]113-marilla was not at Aid meeting [people]2012-people knew there was something wrong at [Green Gables]107-matthew .

" [Matthew]107-matthew had a bad spell with [his]107-matthew heart Thursday , "[113-marilla] [Marilla]113-marilla explained , " and [I]113-marilla did n't feel like leaving [him]107-matthew . [The doctor]2016-the doctor says [he]107-matthew must be careful to avoid excitement . That 's easy enough , for [Matthew]107-matthew does n't go about looking for excitement by any means and never did , but [he]107-matthew 's not to do any very heavy work either and [you]105-mrs. lynde might as well tell [Matthew]107-matthew not to breathe as not to work . " Well , seeing [you]105-mrs. lynde 're so pressing , perhaps [I]105-mrs. lynde might as well , stay "[105-mrs. lynde] said [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde , who had not the slightest intention of doing anything else .

[Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde and [Marilla]113-marilla sat comfortably in [the parlor]622-the parlor while [Anne]232-anne got the tea and made hot biscuits that were light and white enough to defy even [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde 's criticism .

" [I]105-mrs. lynde must say [Anne]232-anne has turned out [a real smart girl]3851-a real smart girl , "[105-mrs. lynde] admitted [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde , as [Marilla]113-marilla accompanied [her]232-anne to the end of [the lane]380-the lane at sunset . " [She]232-anne must be a great help to [you]105-mrs. lynde . "[113-marilla]

" [She]232-anne is , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , " and [she]232-anne 's real steady and reliable now . "[113-marilla]

" [I]105-mrs. lynde never would have thought [she]232-anne 'd have turned out so well that first day [I]105-mrs. lynde was here three years ago , "[105-mrs. lynde] said [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde . " [Lawful heart]3852-lawful heart , shall [I]105-mrs. lynde ever forget that tantrum of [hers]232-anne ! [I]105-mrs. lynde did make a mistake in judging [Anne]232-anne , but it were n't no wonder , for [an odder , unexpecteder witch of a child]3855-an odder , unexpecteder witch of a child there never was in [this world]2059-this world , that 's what . [She]232-anne 's [a real pretty girl]3858-a real pretty girl got to be , though [I]105-mrs. lynde ca n't say [I]105-mrs. lynde 'm overly partial to that pale , big - eyed style [myself]105-mrs. lynde . "[105-mrs. lynde]

CHAPTER XXXI . Where [the Brook]82-the brook and [River]83-river Meet

|ANNE had [her]1634-her " good "[1634-her] summer and enjoyed it wholeheartedly . [She]1634-her and [Diana]120-diana fairly lived outdoors , reveling in all the delights that [Lover]210-lover 's [Lane]84-lane and [the Dryad 's Bubble]85-the dryad 's bubble and [Willowmere]48-willowmere and [Victoria Island]62-victoria island afforded . [Marilla]113-marilla offered no objections to [Anne]232-anne 's gypsyings . [The Spencervale doctor who had come the night [Minnie May]1636-minnie may had [the croup]1637-the croup met [Anne]232-anne at [the house of [a patient]1639-a patient]1638-the house of a patient one afternoon early in vacation]1635-the spencervale doctor who had come the night minnie may had the croup met anne at the house of a patient one afternoon early in vacation , looked [her]232-anne over sharply , screwed up [his]1635-the spencervale doctor who had come the night minnie may had the croup met anne at the house of a patient one afternoon early in vacation mouth , shook [his]1635-the spencervale doctor who had come the night minnie may had the croup met anne at the house of a patient one afternoon early in vacation head , and sent a message to [Marilla Cuthbert]113-marilla by [another person]1640-another person . It was :

" Keep [that redheaded girl of yours]3861-that redheaded girl of yours in the open air all summer and do n't let [her]3861-that redheaded girl of yours read books until [she]3861-that redheaded girl of yours gets more spring into [her]3861-that redheaded girl of yours step . "[1635-the spencervale doctor who had come the night minnie may had the croup met anne at the house of a patient one afternoon early in vacation]

This message frightened [Marilla]113-marilla wholesomely . [She]113-marilla read [Anne]232-anne 's death warrant by consumption in it unless it was scrupulously obeyed . As a result , [Anne]232-anne had the golden summer of [her]232-anne life as far as freedom and frolic went . [She]232-anne walked , rowed , berried , and dreamed to [her]232-anne heart 's content ; and when [September]280-september came [she]232-anne was bright - eyed and alert , with a step that would have satisfied [the Spencervale doctor and a heart full of ambition and zest once more]1641-the spencervale doctor and a heart full of ambition and zest once more .

" [I]232-anne feel just like studying with might and main , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne declared as [she]232-anne brought [her]232-anne books down from [the attic]1630-the attic . " Oh , [[you]113-marilla good old friends]3862-you good old friends , [I]232-anne 'm glad to see [your]113-marilla honest faces once more -- yes , even [you]113-marilla , [geometry]3863-geometry . [I]232-anne 've had a perfectly beautiful summer , [Marilla]113-marilla , and now [I]232-anne 'm rejoicing as [a strong man to run a race]3864-a strong man to run a race , as [Mr. Allan]230-mr. allan said last Sunday . Does n't [Mr. Allan]230-mr. allan preach magnificent sermons ? [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says [he]230-mr. allan is improving every day and the first thing [we]3865-we know [some city church]3866-some city church will gobble [him]230-mr. allan up and then [we]3865-we 'll be left and have to turn to and break in [another green preacher]3867-another green preacher . But [I]232-anne do n't see the use of meeting trouble halfway , do [you]113-marilla , [Marilla]113-marilla ? [I]232-anne think it would be better just to enjoy [Mr. Allan]230-mr. allan while [we]3865-we have [him]230-mr. allan . If [I]232-anne were [a man]2052-a man [I]232-anne think [I]232-anne 'd be [a minister]2514-a minister . [They]3870-they can have such an influence for good , if [their]3870-they theology is sound ; and it must be thrilling to preach splendid sermons and stir [[your]113-marilla hearers]3871-your hearers ' hearts . Why ca n't [women]423-women be [ministers]3335-ministers , [Marilla]113-marilla ? [I]232-anne asked [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde that and [she]105-mrs. lynde was shocked and said it would be a scandalous thing . [She]105-mrs. lynde said there might be [female ministers in [the States]2034-the states]3874-female ministers in the states and [she]105-mrs. lynde believed there was , but thank goodness [we]3876-we had n't got to that stage in [Canada]54-canada yet and [she]105-mrs. lynde hoped [we]3876-we never would . But [I]232-anne do n't see why . [I]232-anne think [women]423-women would make [splendid ministers]3878-splendid ministers . When there is a social to be got up or a church tea or anything else to raise money [the women]1063-the women have to turn to and do the work . [I]232-anne 'm sure [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde can pray every bit as well as [Superintendent Bell]234-mr. bell and [I]232-anne 've no doubt [she]105-mrs. lynde could preach too with a little practice . "[232-anne]

" Yes , [I]113-marilla believe [she]105-mrs. lynde could , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla dryly . " [She]105-mrs. lynde does plenty of unofficial preaching as it is . [Nobody]2118-nobody has much of a chance to go wrong in [Avonlea]2-avonlea with [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde to oversee [them]2118-nobody . "[113-marilla]

" [Marilla]113-marilla , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne in a burst of confidence , " [I]232-anne want to tell [you]113-marilla something and ask [you]113-marilla what [you]113-marilla think about it . It has worried [me]232-anne terribly -- on Sunday afternoons , that is , when [I]232-anne think specially about such matters . [I]232-anne do really want to be good ; and when [I]232-anne 'm with [you]113-marilla or [Mrs. Allan]232-anne or [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy [I]232-anne want it more than ever and [I]232-anne want to do just what would please [you]113-marilla and what [you]113-marilla would approve of . But mostly when [I]232-anne 'm with [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde [I]232-anne feel desperately wicked and as if [I]232-anne wanted to go and do the very thing [she]105-mrs. lynde tells [me]232-anne [I]232-anne ought n't to do . [I]232-anne feel irresistibly tempted to do it . Now , what do [you]113-marilla think is the reason [I]232-anne feel like that ? Do [you]113-marilla think it 's because [I]232-anne 'm really bad and unregenerate ? "[232-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla looked dubious for a moment . Then [she]113-marilla laughed .

" If [you]113-marilla are [I]232-anne guess [I]232-anne am too , [Anne]232-anne , for [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde often has that very effect on [me]232-anne . [I]232-anne sometimes think [she]105-mrs. lynde 'd have more of an influence for good , as [you]113-marilla say [yourself]113-marilla , if [she]105-mrs. lynde did n't keep nagging [people]2012-people to do right . There should have been a special commandment against nagging . But there , [I]232-anne should n't talk so . [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde is [a good Christian woman]3882-a good christian woman and [she]105-mrs. lynde means well . There is n't [a kinder soul in [Avonlea]2-avonlea]3883-a kinder soul in avonlea and [she]105-mrs. lynde never shirks [her]105-mrs. lynde share of work . "[232-anne]

" [I]232-anne 'm very glad [you]113-marilla feel the same , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne decidedly . " It 's so encouraging . [I]232-anne sha n't worry so much over that after this . But [I]232-anne dare say there 'll be other things to worry [me]232-anne . [They]3884-they keep coming up new all the time -- things to perplex [you]113-marilla , [you]113-marilla know . [You]113-marilla settle one question and there 's another right after . There are so many things to be thought over and decided when [you]113-marilla 're beginning to grow up . It keeps [me]232-anne busy all the time thinking them over and deciding what is right . It 's a serious thing to grow up , is n't it , [Marilla]113-marilla ? But when [I]232-anne have such good friends as [you]113-marilla and [Matthew]107-matthew and [Mrs. Allan]232-anne and [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy [I]232-anne ought to grow up successfully , and [I]232-anne 'm sure it will be [my]232-anne own fault if [I]232-anne do n't . [I]232-anne feel it 's a great responsibility because [I]232-anne have only the one chance . If [I]232-anne do n't grow up right [I]232-anne ca n't go back and begin over again . [I]232-anne 've grown two inches this summer , [Marilla]113-marilla . [Mr. Gillis]281-mr. gillis measured [me]232-anne at [Ruby]168-ruby gillis 's party . [I]232-anne 'm so glad [you]113-marilla made [my]232-anne new dresses longer . That dark - green one is so pretty and it was sweet of [you]113-marilla to put on the flounce . Of course [I]232-anne know it was n't really necessary , but flounces are so stylish this fall and [Josie Pye]175-josie pye has flounces on all [her]175-josie pye dresses . [I]232-anne know [I]232-anne 'll be able to study better because of [mine]232-anne . [I]232-anne shall have such a comfortable feeling deep down in [my]232-anne mind about that flounce . "[232-anne]

" It 's worth something to have that , "[113-marilla] admitted [Marilla]113-marilla .

[Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy came back to [Avonlea school]2-avonlea and found all [[her]240-miss stacy pupils]1330-her pupils eager for work once more . Especially did [[the Queen]3222-the queen 's class]1613-the queen 's class gird up [their]1330-her pupils loins for the fray , for at the end of the coming year , dimly shadowing [their]1330-her pupils pathway already , loomed up that fateful thing known as " the Entrance , "[1646-one and all] at the thought of which [one and all]1646-one and all felt [their]1330-her pupils hearts sink into [their]1330-her pupils very shoes . Suppose [they]1330-her pupils did not pass ! That thought was doomed to haunt [Anne]232-anne through the waking hours of that winter , Sunday afternoons inclusive , to the almost entire exclusion of moral and theological problems . When [Anne]232-anne had bad dreams [she]232-anne found [herself]232-anne staring miserably at pass lists of the Entrance exams , where [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert 's name was blazoned at the top and in which [hers]232-anne did not appear at all .

But it was a jolly , busy , happy swift - flying winter . [Schoolwork]1647-schoolwork was as interesting , class rivalry as absorbing , as of yore . New worlds of thought , feeling , and ambition , fresh , fascinating fields of unexplored knowledge seemed to be opening out before [Anne]232-anne 's eager eyes .

" Hills peeped [o'er hill and Alps on [Alps]87-alps]3885-o'er hill and alps on alps arose . "[1649-the school trustees]

Much of all this was due to [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy 's tactful , careful , broadminded guidance . [She]240-miss stacy led [[her]240-miss stacy class]1648-her class to think and explore and discover for [themselves]1648-her class and encouraged straying from the old beaten paths to a degree that quite shocked [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde and [the school trustees]1649-the school trustees , who viewed all innovations on established methods rather dubiously .

Apart from [her]232-anne studies [Anne]232-anne expanded socially , for [Marilla]113-marilla , mindful of [the Spencervale doctor]1650-the spencervale doctor 's dictum , no longer vetoed occasional outings . The Debating Club flourished and gave several concerts ; there were one or two parties almost verging on grown - up affairs ; there were sleigh drives and skating frolics galore .

Between times [Anne]232-anne grew , shooting up so rapidly that [Marilla]113-marilla was astonished one day , when [they]1651-they were standing side by side , to find [the girl]2093-the girl was taller than [herself]2093-the girl .

" Why , [Anne]232-anne , how [you]232-anne 've grown ! "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla said , almost unbelievingly . A sigh followed on the words . [Marilla]113-marilla felt a queer regret over [Anne]232-anne 's inches . [The child [she]113-marilla had learned to love]1653-the child she had learned to love had vanished somehow and here was [this tall , serious - eyed girl of fifteen]1654-this tall , serious - eyed girl of fifteen , with the thoughtful brows and the proudly poised little head , in [her]1654-this tall , serious - eyed girl of fifteen place . [Marilla]113-marilla loved [the girl]2093-the girl as much as [she]113-marilla had loved [the child]460-the child , but [she]113-marilla was conscious of a queer sorrowful sense of loss . And that night , when [Anne]232-anne had gone to prayer meeting with [Diana]120-diana , [Marilla]113-marilla sat alone in the wintry twilight and indulged in the weakness of a cry . [Matthew]1657-matthew , coming in with a lantern , caught [her]113-marilla at it and gazed at [her]113-marilla in such consternation that [Marilla]113-marilla had to laugh through [her]113-marilla tears .

" [I]113-marilla was thinking about [Anne]232-anne , "[113-marilla] [she]113-marilla explained . " [She]232-anne 's got to be such [a big girl]3549-a big girl -- and [she]232-anne 'll probably be away from [us]3887-us next winter . [I]113-marilla 'll miss [her]232-anne terrible . "[113-marilla]

" [She]232-anne 'll be able to come [home]361-home often , "[107-matthew] comforted [Matthew]107-matthew , to whom [Anne]232-anne was as yet and always would be [the little , eager girl [he]107-matthew had brought [home]361-home from [Bright River]6-bright river]1658-the little , eager girl he had brought home from bright river on that June evening four years before . " [The branch railroad]3889-the branch railroad will be built to [Carmody]5-carmody by that time . "[107-matthew]

" It wo n't be the same thing as having [her]232-anne [here]2022-here all the time , "[113-marilla] sighed [Marilla]113-marilla gloomily , determined to enjoy [her]113-marilla luxury of grief uncomforted . " But there -- [men]3583-men ca n't understand these things ! "[113-marilla]

There were other changes in [Anne]232-anne no less real than the physical change . For one thing , [she]232-anne became much quieter . Perhaps [she]232-anne thought all the more and dreamed as much as ever , but [she]232-anne certainly talked less . [Marilla]113-marilla noticed and commented on this also .

" [You]232-anne do n't chatter half as much as [you]232-anne used to , [Anne]232-anne , nor use half as many big words . What has come over [you]232-anne ? "[232-anne]

[Anne]232-anne colored and laughed a little , as [she]232-anne dropped [her]232-anne book and looked dreamily out of the window , where big fat red buds were bursting out on the creeper in response to the lure of the spring sunshine .

" [I]232-anne do n't know -- [I]232-anne do n't want to talk as much , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne said , denting [her]232-anne chin thoughtfully with [her]232-anne forefinger . " It 's nicer to think dear , pretty thoughts and keep them in [one]385-one 's heart , like treasures . [I]232-anne do n't like to have [them]3893-them laughed at or wondered over . And somehow [I]232-anne do n't want to use big words any more . It 's almost a pity , is n't it , now that [I]232-anne 'm really growing big enough to say them if [I]232-anne did want to . It 's fun to be almost grown up in some ways , but it 's not the kind of fun [I]232-anne expected , [Marilla]113-marilla . There 's so much to learn and do and think that there is n't time for big words . Besides , [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy says the short ones are much stronger and better . [She]240-miss stacy makes [us]3894-us write all [our]3894-us essays as simply as possible . It was hard at first . [I]232-anne was so used to crowding in all the fine big words [I]232-anne could think of -- and [I]232-anne thought of any number of them . But [I]232-anne 've got used to it now and [I]232-anne see it 's so much better . "[232-anne]

" What has become of [[your]113-marilla story club]3895-your story club ? [I]232-anne have n't heard [you]113-marilla speak of it for a long time . "[232-anne]

" [The story club]1416-the story club is n't in existence any longer . [We]3894-us had n't time for it -- and anyhow [I]232-anne think [we]3894-us had got tired of it . It was silly to be writing about love and murder and elopements and mysteries . [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy sometimes has [us]3894-us write a story for training in composition , but [she]240-miss stacy wo n't let [us]3894-us write anything but what might happen in [Avonlea]2-avonlea in [our]3894-us own lives , and [she]240-miss stacy criticizes it very sharply and makes [us]3894-us criticize [our]3894-us own too . [I]232-anne never thought [my]232-anne compositions had so many faults until [I]232-anne began to look for them [myself]232-anne . [I]232-anne felt so ashamed [I]232-anne wanted to give up altogether , but [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy said [I]232-anne could learn to write well if [I]232-anne only trained [myself]232-anne to be [[my]232-anne own severest critic]3897-my own severest critic . And so [I]232-anne am trying to . "[232-anne]

" [You]113-marilla 've only two more months before the Entrance , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla . " Do [you]113-marilla think [you]113-marilla 'll be able to get through ? "[113-marilla]

[Anne]232-anne shivered .

" [I]232-anne do n't know . Sometimes [I]232-anne think [I]232-anne 'll be all right -- and then [I]232-anne get horribly afraid . [We]3898-we 've studied hard and [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy has drilled [us]3898-we thoroughly , but [we]3898-we may n't get through for all that . [We]3898-we 've each got a stumbling block . [Mine]3899-mine is geometry of course , and [Jane]121-jane 's is Latin , and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis and [Charlie]173-charlie sloane 's is algebra , and [Josie]175-josie pye 's is arithmetic . [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon says [he]254-moody spurgeon feels it in [his]254-moody spurgeon bones that [he]254-moody spurgeon is going to fail in English history . [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy is going to give [us]3898-we examinations in [June]282-june just as hard as [we]3898-we 'll have at the Entrance and mark [us]3898-we just as strictly , so [we]3898-we 'll have some idea . [I]232-anne wish it was all over , [Marilla]113-marilla . It haunts [me]232-anne . Sometimes [I]232-anne wake up in the night and wonder what [I]232-anne 'll do if [I]232-anne do n't pass . "[232-anne]

" Why , go to [school]2382-school next year and try again , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla unconcernedly .

" Oh , [I]232-anne do n't believe [I]232-anne 'd have the heart for it . It would be such a disgrace to fail , especially if [Gil]174-gil -- if [the others]3094-the others passed . And [I]232-anne get so nervous in an examination that [I]232-anne 'm likely to make a mess of it . [I]232-anne wish [I]232-anne had nerves like [Jane Andrews]121-jane . Nothing rattles [her]121-jane . "[232-anne]

[Anne]232-anne sighed and , dragging [her]232-anne eyes from the witcheries of [the spring world]1660-the spring world , the beckoning day of breeze and blue , and the green things upspringing in [the garden]573-the garden , buried [herself]232-anne resolutely in [her]232-anne book . There would be other springs , but if [she]232-anne did not succeed in passing the Entrance , [Anne]232-anne felt convinced that [she]232-anne would never recover sufficiently to enjoy them .

CHAPTER XXXII . The Pass List Is Out

|WITH the end of [June]282-june came the close of the term and the close of [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy 's rule in [Avonlea school]3548-avonlea school . [Anne]232-anne and [Diana]120-diana walked [home]361-home that evening feeling very sober indeed . Red eyes and damp handkerchiefs bore convincing testimony to the fact that [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy 's farewell words must have been quite as touching as [Mr. Phillips]169-mr. phillips 's had been under similar circumstances three years before . [Diana]120-diana looked back at [the schoolhouse]871-the schoolhouse from the foot of [the spruce hill]866-the spruce hill and sighed deeply .

" It does seem as if it was the end of everything , does n't it ? "[120-diana] [she]120-diana said dismally .

" [You]232-anne ought n't to feel half as badly as [I]232-anne do , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne , hunting vainly for a dry spot on [her]232-anne handkerchief . " [You]232-anne 'll be back again next winter , but [I]232-anne suppose [I]232-anne 've left [the dear old school]3902-the dear old school forever -- if [I]232-anne have good luck , that is . "[232-anne]

" It wo n't be a bit the same . [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy wo n't be [there]348-there , nor [you]232-anne nor [Jane]121-jane nor [Ruby]168-ruby gillis probably . [I]120-diana shall have to sit all alone , for [I]120-diana could n't bear to have [another deskmate]3904-another deskmate after [you]232-anne . Oh , [we]3905-we have had jolly times , have n't [we]3905-we , [Anne]232-anne ? It 's dreadful to think they 're all over . "[120-diana]

Two big tears rolled down by [Diana]120-diana 's nose .

" If [you]232-anne would stop crying [I]232-anne could , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne imploringly . " Just as soon as [I]232-anne put away [my]232-anne hanky [I]232-anne see [you]232-anne brimming up and that starts [me]232-anne off again . As [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says , ? If [you]232-anne ca n't be cheerful , be as cheerful as [you]232-anne can . ' After all , [I]232-anne dare say [I]232-anne 'll be back next year . This is one of the times [I]232-anne _ know _ [I]232-anne 'm not going to pass . [They]3906-they 're getting alarmingly frequent . "[232-anne]

" Why , [you]232-anne came out splendidly in the exams [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy gave . "[232-anne]

" Yes , but those exams did n't make [me]232-anne nervous . When [I]232-anne think of the real thing [you]232-anne ca n't imagine what a horrid cold fluttery feeling comes round [my]232-anne heart . And then [my]232-anne number is thirteen and [Josie Pye]175-josie pye says it 's so unlucky . [I]232-anne am _ not _ superstitious and [I]232-anne know it can make no difference . But still [I]232-anne wish it was n't thirteen . "[232-anne]

" [I]120-diana do wish [I]120-diana was going in with [you]232-anne , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana . " Would n't [we]3907-we have a perfectly elegant time ? But [I]120-diana suppose [you]232-anne 'll have to cram in the evenings . "[120-diana]

" No ; [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy has made [us]3907-we promise not to open a book at all . [She]240-miss stacy says it would only tire and confuse [us]3907-we and [we]3907-we are to go out walking and not think about the exams at all and go to bed early . It 's good advice , but [I]120-diana expect it will be hard to follow ; good advice is apt to be , [I]120-diana think . [Prissy Andrews]166-prissy andrews told [me]120-diana that [she]166-prissy andrews sat up half the night every night of [her]166-prissy andrews Entrance week and crammed for dear life ; and [I]120-diana had determined to sit up _ at least _ as long as [she]166-prissy andrews did . It was so kind of [your]232-anne Aunt [Josephine]175-josie pye to ask [me]120-diana to stay at [Beechwood]90-beechwood while [I]120-diana 'm in [town]2009-town . "[120-diana]

" [You]232-anne 'll write to [me]120-diana while [you]232-anne 're in , wo n't [you]232-anne ? "[120-diana]

" [I]232-anne 'll write Tuesday night and tell [you]232-anne how the first day goes , "[232-anne] promised [Anne]232-anne .

" [I]120-diana 'll be haunting [the post office]1268-the post office Wednesday , "[120-diana] vowed [Diana]120-diana .

[Anne]232-anne went to [town]2009-town the following Monday and on Wednesday [Diana]120-diana haunted [the post office]1268-the post office , as agreed , and got [her]120-diana letter .

" [Dearest Diana]283-dearest diana "[232-anne] [ wrote [Anne]232-anne ] ,

" Here it is Tuesday night and [I]120-diana 'm writing this in [the library at [Beechwood]90-beechwood]3910-the library at beechwood . Last night [I]120-diana was horribly lonesome all alone in [[my]120-diana room]2723-my room and wished so much [you]232-anne were with [me]120-diana . [I]120-diana could n't ? cram ' because [I]120-diana 'd promised [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy not to , but it was as hard to keep from opening [my]120-diana history as it used to be to keep from reading a story before [my]120-diana lessons were learned . "[120-diana]

" This morning [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy came for [me]120-diana and [we]3912-we went to [the Academy]3913-the academy , calling for [Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis and [Josie]175-josie pye on [our]3912-we way . [Ruby]168-ruby gillis asked [me]120-diana to feel [her]168-ruby gillis hands and they were as cold as ice . [Josie]175-josie pye said [I]120-diana looked as if [I]120-diana had n't slept a wink and [she]175-josie pye did n't believe [I]120-diana was strong enough to stand the grind of [the teacher]3313-the teacher 's course even if [I]120-diana did get through . There are times and seasons even yet when [I]120-diana do n't feel that [I]120-diana 've made any great headway in learning to like [Josie Pye]175-josie pye ! "[120-diana]

" When [we]3912-we reached [the Academy]3913-the academy there were [scores of students there from all over [the Island]11-the island]3916-scores of students there from all over the island . [The first person [we]3912-we saw]3917-the first person we saw was [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon sitting on the steps and muttering away to [himself]254-moody spurgeon . [Jane]121-jane asked [him]254-moody spurgeon what on earth [he]254-moody spurgeon was doing and [he]254-moody spurgeon said [he]254-moody spurgeon was repeating the multiplication table over and over to steady [his]254-moody spurgeon nerves and for pity 's sake not to interrupt [him]254-moody spurgeon , because if [he]254-moody spurgeon stopped for a moment [he]254-moody spurgeon got frightened and forgot everything [he]254-moody spurgeon ever knew , but the multiplication table kept all [his]254-moody spurgeon facts firmly in their proper place ! "[120-diana]

" When [we]3912-we were assigned to [[our]3912-we rooms]3918-our rooms [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy had to leave [us]3912-we . [Jane]121-jane and [I]120-diana sat together and [Jane]121-jane was so composed that [I]120-diana envied [her]121-jane . No need of the multiplication table for good , steady , sensible [Jane]121-jane ! [I]120-diana wondered if [I]120-diana looked as [I]120-diana felt and if [they]3919-they could hear [my]120-diana heart thumping clear across [the room]631-the room . Then [a man]2052-a man came in and began distributing the English examination sheets . [My]120-diana hands grew cold then and [my]120-diana head fairly whirled around as [I]120-diana picked it up . Just one awful moment -- [Diana]120-diana , [I]120-diana felt exactly as [I]120-diana did four years ago when [I]120-diana asked [Marilla]113-marilla if [I]120-diana might stay at [Green Gables]107-matthew -- and then everything cleared up in [my]120-diana mind and [my]120-diana heart began beating again -- [I]120-diana forgot to say that it had stopped altogether!--for [I]120-diana knew [I]120-diana could do something with _ that _ paper anyhow . "[120-diana]

" At noon [we]3922-we went [home]361-home for dinner and then back again for history in the afternoon . The history was a pretty hard paper and [I]120-diana got dreadfully mixed up in the dates . Still , [I]120-diana think [I]120-diana did fairly well today . But oh , [Diana]120-diana , tomorrow the geometry exam comes off and when [I]120-diana think of it it takes every bit of determination [I]120-diana possess to keep from opening [my]120-diana Euclid . If [I]120-diana thought the multiplication table would help [me]120-diana any [I]120-diana would recite it from now till tomorrow morning . "[120-diana]

" [I]120-diana went down to see [the other girls]3140-the other girls this evening . On [my]120-diana way [I]120-diana met [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon wandering distractedly around . [He]254-moody spurgeon said [he]254-moody spurgeon knew [he]254-moody spurgeon had failed in history and [he]254-moody spurgeon was born to be [a disappointment to [[his]254-moody spurgeon parents]3926-his parents]3925-a disappointment to his parents and [he]254-moody spurgeon was going [home]361-home on [the morning train]3928-the morning train ; and it would be easier to be [a carpenter]3929-a carpenter than [a minister]2514-a minister , anyhow . [I]120-diana cheered [him]254-moody spurgeon up and persuaded [him]254-moody spurgeon to stay to the end because it would be unfair to [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy if [he]254-moody spurgeon did n't . Sometimes [I]120-diana have wished [I]120-diana was born [a boy]406-a boy , but when [I]120-diana see [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon [I]120-diana 'm always glad [I]120-diana 'm [a girl]2066-a girl and not [[his]254-moody spurgeon sister]3933-his sister . "[120-diana]

" [Ruby]168-ruby gillis was in hysterics when [I]120-diana reached [[their]3934-we boardinghouse]3935-their boardinghouse ; [she]168-ruby gillis had just discovered a fearful mistake [she]168-ruby gillis had made in [her]168-ruby gillis English paper . When [she]168-ruby gillis recovered [we]3934-we went [uptown]3936-uptown and had an ice cream . How [we]3934-we wished [you]120-diana had been with [us]3934-we . "[120-diana]

" Oh , [Diana]120-diana , if only the geometry examination were over ! But there , as [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde would say , the sun will go on rising and setting whether [I]120-diana fail in geometry or not . That is true but not especially comforting . [I]120-diana think [I]120-diana 'd rather it did n't go on if [I]120-diana failed ! "[120-diana]

" [Yours]120-diana devotedly , "[120-diana]

" [Anne]232-anne "[120-diana]

The geometry examination and [all the others]3257-all the others were over in due time and [Anne]232-anne arrived [home]361-home on Friday evening , rather tired but with an air of chastened triumph about [her]232-anne . [Diana]120-diana was over at [Green Gables]107-matthew when [she]120-diana arrived and [they]1670-they met as if [they]1670-they had been parted for years .

" [[You]120-diana old darling]3937-you old darling , it 's perfectly splendid to see [you]120-diana back again . It seems like an age since [you]120-diana went to [town]2009-town and oh , [Anne]232-anne , how did [you]120-diana get along ? "[120-diana]

" Pretty well , [I]232-anne think , in everything but the geometry . [I]232-anne do n't know whether [I]232-anne passed in it or not and [I]232-anne have a creepy , crawly presentiment that [I]232-anne did n't . Oh , how good it is to be back ! [Green Gables]107-matthew is [the dearest , loveliest spot in [the world]409-the world]3939-the dearest , loveliest spot in the world . "[232-anne]

" How did [the others]3094-the others do ? "[120-diana]

" [The girls]2852-the girls say [they]2852-the girls know [they]2852-the girls did n't pass , but [I]232-anne think [they]2852-the girls did pretty well . [Josie]175-josie pye says the geometry was so easy [a child of ten]3943-a child of ten could do it ! [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon still thinks [he]254-moody spurgeon failed in history and [Charlie]173-charlie sloane says [he]173-charlie sloane failed in algebra . But [we]3944-we do n't really know anything about it and wo n't until the pass list is out . That wo n't be for a fortnight . Fancy living a fortnight in such suspense ! [I]232-anne wish [I]232-anne could go to sleep and never wake up until it is over . "[232-anne]

[Diana]120-diana knew it would be useless to ask how [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert had fared , so [she]120-diana merely said :

" Oh , [you]140-gilbert 'll pass all right . Do n't worry . "[120-diana]

" [I]232-anne 'd rather not pass at all than not come out pretty well up on the list , "[232-anne] flashed [Anne]232-anne , by which [she]232-anne meant -- and [Diana]120-diana knew [she]232-anne meant -- that success would be incomplete and bitter if [she]232-anne did not come out ahead of [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert .

With this end in view [Anne]232-anne had strained every nerve during the examinations . So had [Gilbert]140-gilbert . [They]1671-they had met and passed [each other]535-each other on [the street]1546-the street a dozen times without any sign of recognition and every time [Anne]232-anne had held [her]232-anne head a little higher and wished a little more earnestly that [she]232-anne had made friends with [Gilbert]140-gilbert when [he]140-gilbert asked [her]232-anne , and vowed a little more determinedly to surpass [him]140-gilbert in the examination . [She]232-anne knew that [all [Avonlea]2-avonlea junior]1674-all avonlea junior was wondering which would come out first ; [she]232-anne even knew that [Jimmy Glover]181-jimmy glover and [Ned Wright]284-ned wright had a bet on the question and that [Josie Pye]175-josie pye had said there was no doubt in [the world]409-the world that [Gilbert]140-gilbert would be first ; and [she]232-anne felt that [her]232-anne humiliation would be unbearable if [she]232-anne failed .

But [she]232-anne had another and nobler motive for wishing to do well . [She]232-anne wanted to " pass high "[107-matthew] for the sake of [Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]113-marilla -- especially [Matthew]107-matthew . [Matthew]107-matthew had declared to [her]232-anne [his]107-matthew conviction that [she]232-anne " would beat [the whole Island]3945-the whole island . "[232-anne] That , [Anne]232-anne felt , was something it would be foolish to hope for even in the wildest dreams . But [she]232-anne did hope fervently that [she]232-anne would be among [the first ten]1676-the first ten at least , so that [she]232-anne might see [Matthew]107-matthew 's kindly brown eyes gleam with pride in [her]232-anne achievement . That , [she]232-anne felt , would be a sweet reward indeed for all [her]232-anne hard work and patient grubbing among unimaginative equations and conjugations .

At the end of the fortnight [Anne]232-anne took to " haunting "[232-anne] [the post office]1268-the post office also , in the distracted company of [Jane]121-jane , [Ruby]168-ruby gillis , and [Josie]175-josie pye , opening [the [Charlottetown]18-charlottetown dailies]1678-the charlottetown dailies with shaking hands and cold , sinkaway feelings as bad as any experienced during the Entrance week . [Charlie]173-charlie sloane and [Gilbert]140-gilbert were not above doing this too , but [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon stayed resolutely away .

" [I]254-moody spurgeon have n't got the grit to go [there]348-there and look at a paper in cold blood , "[254-moody spurgeon] [he]254-moody spurgeon told [Anne]232-anne . " [I]254-moody spurgeon 'm just going to wait until [somebody]436-somebody comes and tells [me]254-moody spurgeon suddenly whether [I]254-moody spurgeon 've passed or not . "[254-moody spurgeon]

When three weeks had gone by without the pass list appearing [Anne]232-anne began to feel that [she]232-anne really could n't stand the strain much longer . [Her]232-anne appetite failed and [her]232-anne interest in [Avonlea]2-avonlea doings languished . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde wanted to know what else [you]1679-you could expect with [a Tory superintendent of education at the head of affairs]1680-a tory superintendent of education at the head of affairs , and [Matthew]107-matthew , noting [Anne]232-anne 's paleness and indifference and the lagging steps that bore [her]232-anne [home]361-home from [the post office]1268-the post office every afternoon , began seriously to wonder if [he]107-matthew had n't better vote Grit at the next election .

But one evening the news came . [Anne]232-anne was sitting at [her]232-anne open window , for the time forgetful of the woes of examinations and the cares of [the world]409-the world , as [she]232-anne drank in the beauty of the summer dusk , sweet - scented with flower breaths from [the garden]573-the garden below and sibilant and rustling from the stir of poplars . The eastern sky above the firs was flushed faintly pink from the reflection of the west , and [Anne]232-anne was wondering dreamily if the spirit of color looked like that , when [she]232-anne saw [Diana]120-diana come flying down through the firs , over [the log bridge]790-the log bridge , and up [the slope]1315-the slope , with a fluttering newspaper in [her]120-diana hand .

[Anne]232-anne sprang to [her]232-anne feet , knowing at once what that paper contained . The pass list was out ! [Her]232-anne head whirled and [her]232-anne heart beat until it hurt [her]232-anne . [She]232-anne could not move a step . It seemed an hour to [her]232-anne before [Diana]120-diana came rushing along [the hall]551-the hall and burst into [the room]631-the room without even knocking , so great was [her]232-anne excitement .

" [Anne]232-anne , [you]232-anne 've passed , "[120-diana] [she]120-diana cried , " passed the _ very [first_--you]232-anne and [Gilbert]140-gilbert both -- [you're]232-anne ties -- but [your]232-anne name is first . Oh , [I]120-diana 'm so proud ! "[120-diana]

[Diana]120-diana flung the paper on the table and [herself]120-diana on [Anne]232-anne 's bed , utterly breathless and incapable of further speech . [Anne]232-anne lighted the lamp , oversetting the match safe and using up half a dozen matches before [her]232-anne shaking hands could accomplish the task . Then [she]232-anne snatched up the paper . Yes , [she]232-anne had passed -- there was [her]232-anne name at the very top of a list of two hundred ! That moment was worth living for .

" [You]232-anne did just splendidly , [Anne]232-anne , "[120-diana] puffed [Diana]120-diana , recovering sufficiently to sit up and speak , for [Anne , starry eyed and rapt]232-anne , had not uttered a word . " [Father]133-father brought the paper [home]361-home from [Bright River]6-bright river not ten minutes ago -- it came out on [the afternoon train]3949-the afternoon train , [you]232-anne know , and wo n't be here till tomorrow by mail -- and when [I]232-anne saw the pass list [I]232-anne just rushed over like a wild thing . [You]232-anne 've all passed , [every one of [you]232-anne]3950-every one of you , [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon and all , although [he]254-moody spurgeon 's conditioned in history . [Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis did pretty well -- [they're]3951-they're halfway up -- and so did [Charlie]173-charlie sloane . [Josie]175-josie pye just scraped through with three marks to spare , but [you]232-anne 'll see [she]175-josie pye 'll put on as many airs as if [she]175-josie pye 'd led . Wo n't [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy be delighted ? Oh , [Anne]232-anne , what does it feel like to see [your]232-anne name at the head of a pass list like that ? If it were [me]232-anne [I]232-anne know [I]232-anne 'd go crazy with joy . [I]232-anne am pretty near crazy as it is , but [you]232-anne 're as calm and cool as a spring evening . "[232-anne]

" [I]232-anne 'm just dazzled inside , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne . " [I]232-anne want to say a hundred things , and [I]232-anne ca n't find words to say them in . [I]232-anne never dreamed of this -- yes , [I]232-anne did too , just once ! [I]232-anne let [myself]232-anne think _ once _ , ? What if [I]232-anne should come out first ? ' quakingly , [you]232-anne know , for it seemed so vain and presumptuous to think [I]232-anne could lead [the Island]11-the island . Excuse [me]232-anne a minute , [Diana]120-diana . [I]232-anne must run right out to [the field]3952-the field to tell [Matthew]107-matthew . Then [we]1689-we 'll go up [the road]413-the road and tell the good news to [the others]3094-the others . "[232-anne]

[They]1689-we hurried to [the hayfield below [the barn]353-the barn where [Matthew]107-matthew was coiling hay]1690-the hayfield below the barn where matthew was coiling hay , and , as luck would have it , [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde was talking to [Marilla]113-marilla at the lane fence .

" Oh , [Matthew]107-matthew , "[232-anne] exclaimed [Anne]232-anne , " [I]232-anne 've passed and [I]232-anne 'm first -- or one of the first ! [I]232-anne 'm not vain , but [I]232-anne 'm thankful . "[232-anne]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew always said it , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , gazing at [the pass list]1692-the pass list delightedly . " [I]107-matthew knew [you]232-anne could beat [them]3955-them all easy . "[107-matthew]

" [You]232-anne 've done pretty well , [I]113-marilla must say , [Anne]232-anne , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , trying to hide [her]113-marilla extreme pride in [Anne]232-anne from [Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde 's critical eye . But [that good soul]1693-that good soul said heartily :

" [I]1693-that good soul just guess [she]105-mrs. lynde has done well , and far be it from [me]1693-that good soul to be backward in saying it . [You]232-anne 're a credit to [[your]232-anne friends]3956-your friends , [Anne]232-anne , that 's what , and [we]3957-we 're all proud of [you]232-anne . "[1693-that good soul]

That night [Anne]232-anne , who had wound up the delightful evening with a serious little talk with [Mrs. Allan]232-anne at [the manse]2492-the manse , knelt sweetly by [her]232-anne open window in a great sheen of moonshine and murmured a prayer of gratitude and aspiration that came straight from [her]232-anne heart . There was in it thankfulness for the past and reverent petition for the future ; and when [she]232-anne slept on [her]232-anne white pillow [her]232-anne dreams were as fair and bright and beautiful as maidenhood might desire .

CHAPTER XXXIII . [The Hotel Concert]1695-the hotel concert

" PUT on [your]232-anne white organdy , by all means , [Anne]232-anne , "[120-diana] advised [Diana]120-diana decidedly .

[They]1696-they were together in [the east gable chamber]1697-the east gable chamber ; outside it was only twilight -- a lovely yellowish - green twilight with a clear - blue cloudless sky . A big round moon , slowly deepening from [her]232-anne pallid luster into burnished silver , hung over the Haunted Wood ; the air was full of sweet summer sounds -- sleepy birds twittering , freakish breezes , faraway voices and laughter . But in [[Anne]232-anne 's room]1698-anne 's room the blind was drawn and the lamp lighted , for an important toilet was being made .

The east gable was a very different place from what [it]1699-it had been on that night four years before , when [Anne]232-anne had felt its bareness penetrate to the marrow of [her]232-anne spirit with its inhospitable chill . Changes had crept in , [Marilla]113-marilla conniving at [them]1700-them resignedly , until it was as sweet and dainty a nest as [a young girl]1701-a young girl could desire .

The velvet carpet with the pink roses and the pink silk curtains of [Anne]232-anne 's early visions had certainly never materialized ; but [her]232-anne dreams had kept pace with [her]232-anne growth , and it is not probable [she]232-anne lamented them . The floor was covered with a pretty matting , and the curtains that softened the high window and fluttered in the vagrant breezes were of pale - green art muslin . The walls , hung not with gold and silver brocade tapestry , but with a dainty apple - blossom paper , were adorned with a few good pictures given [Anne]232-anne by [Mrs. Allan]232-anne . [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy 's photograph occupied [the place of honor]1702-the place of honor , and [Anne]232-anne made a sentimental point of keeping fresh flowers on the bracket under it . Tonight a spike of white lilies faintly perfumed [the room]631-the room like the dream of a fragrance . There was no " mahogany furniture , "[240-miss stacy] but there was a white - painted bookcase filled with books , a cushioned wicker rocker , a toilet table befrilled with white muslin , a quaint , gilt - framed mirror with chubby pink Cupids and purple grapes painted over its arched top , that used to hang in [the spare room]549-the spare room , and a low white bed .

[Anne]232-anne was dressing for a concert at [the White Sands Hotel]91-the white sands hotel . [The guests]1267-the guests had got [it]1706-it up in aid of [the Charlottetown hospital]3397-the charlottetown hospital , and had hunted out all the available amateur talent in [the surrounding districts]1708-the surrounding districts to help it along . [Bertha Sampson]285-bertha sampson and [Pearl Clay]286-pearl clay of [the White Sands Baptist choir]1709-the white sands baptist choir had been asked to sing a duet ; [Milton Clark]287-milton clark of [Newbridge]20-newbridge was to give a violin solo ; [Winnie Adella Blair]288-winnie adella blair of [Carmody]5-carmody was to sing a Scotch ballad ; and [Laura Spencer]289-laura spencer of [Spencervale]52-spencervale and [[Anne Shirley]124-anne of [Avonlea]2-avonlea]1710-anne shirley of avonlea were to recite .

As [Anne]124-anne would have said at one time , it was " an epoch in [her]232-anne life , "[124-anne] and [she]232-anne was deliciously athrill with the excitement of it . [Matthew]107-matthew was in the seventh heaven of gratified pride over the honor conferred on [[his]107-matthew Anne]1711-his anne and [Marilla]113-marilla was not far behind , although [she]113-marilla would have died rather than admit it , and said [she]113-marilla did n't think it was very proper for [a lot of [young folks]1713-young folks]1712-a lot of young folks to be gadding over to [the hotel]3396-the hotel without [any responsible person]1715-any responsible person with [them]1712-a lot of young folks .

[Anne]124-anne and [Diana]120-diana were to drive over with [Jane Andrews]121-jane and [[her]121-jane brother]3263-her brother [Billy]109-william blair in [their]1717-their double - seated buggy ; and [several other [Avonlea]2-avonlea girls and [boys]401-boys]1718-several other avonlea girls and boys were going too . There was a party of [visitors]1720-visitors expected out from [town]2009-town , and after the concert a supper was to be given to [the performers]1722-the performers .

" Do [you]120-diana really think the organdy will be best ? "[124-anne] queried [Anne]124-anne anxiously . " [I]124-anne do n't think it 's as pretty as [my]124-anne blue - flowered muslin -- and it certainly is n't so fashionable . "[124-anne]

" But it suits [you]124-anne ever so much better , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana . " It 's so soft and frilly and clinging . The muslin is stiff , and makes [you]124-anne look too dressed up . But the organdy seems as if it grew on [you]124-anne . "[120-diana]

[Anne]124-anne sighed and yielded . [Diana]120-diana was beginning to have a reputation for notable taste in dressing , and [her]120-diana advice on such subjects was much sought after . [She]120-diana was looking very pretty [herself]120-diana on this particular night in a dress of the lovely wild - rose pink , from which [Anne]124-anne was forever debarred ; but [she]120-diana was not to take any part in the concert , so [her]120-diana appearance was of minor importance . All [her]120-diana pains were bestowed upon [Anne]124-anne , who , [she]120-diana vowed , must , for the credit of [Avonlea]2-avonlea , be dressed and combed and adorned to [the Queen]3222-the queen 's taste .

" Pull out that frill a little more -- so ; here , let [me]120-diana tie [your]124-anne sash ; now for [your]124-anne slippers . [I]120-diana 'm going to braid [your]124-anne hair in two thick braids , and tie them halfway up with big white bows -- no , do n't pull out a single curl over [your]124-anne forehead -- just have the soft part . [I]120-diana shall fasten this little white house rose just behind [your]124-anne ear . There was just one on [my]120-diana bush , and [I]120-diana saved it for [you]124-anne . "[120-diana]

" Shall [I]232-anne put [my]232-anne pearl beads on ? "[232-anne] asked [Anne]232-anne . " [Matthew]107-matthew brought [me]232-anne a string from [town]2009-town last week , and [I]232-anne know [he]107-matthew 'd like to see them on [me]232-anne . "[232-anne]

[Diana]120-diana pursed up [her]120-diana lips , put [her]120-diana black head on one side critically , and finally pronounced in favor of the beads , which were thereupon tied around [Anne]232-anne 's slim milk - white throat .

" There 's something so stylish about [you]124-anne , [Anne]232-anne , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana , with unenvious admiration . " [You]124-anne hold [your]124-anne head with such an air . " But [you]124-anne have such dimples , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne , smiling affectionately into the pretty , vivacious face so near [her]232-anne own . " Lovely dimples , like little dents in cream . [I]232-anne have given up all hope of dimples . " [She]113-marilla looks neat and proper . [I]232-anne like that way of fixing [her]113-marilla hair . " There are [Billy]109-william blair and [Jane]121-jane now -- [I]232-anne hear the wheels . Come on . "[232-anne]

[Billy Andrews]291-billy insisted that [Anne]232-anne should ride on the front seat with [him]291-billy , so [she]232-anne unwillingly climbed up . [She]232-anne would have much preferred to sit back with [the girls]2852-the girls , where [she]232-anne could have laughed and chattered to [her]232-anne heart 's content . [Anne]232-anne , by dint of talking over [her]232-anne shoulder to [the girls]2852-the girls and occasionally passing a sop of civility to [Billy]291-billy -- who grinned and chuckled and never could think of any reply until it was too late -- contrived to enjoy the drive in spite of all . It was a night for enjoyment . [The road]413-the road was full of buggies , all bound for [the hotel]3396-the hotel , and laughter , silver clear , echoed and reechoed along it . When [they]1735-they reached [the hotel]3396-the hotel it was a blaze of light from top to bottom . [They]1735-they were met by [the ladies of the concert committee]1737-the ladies of the concert committee , one of whom took [Anne]232-anne off to [[the performers]1722-the performers ' dressing room]1739-the performers ' dressing room which was filled with [the members of [a Charlottetown Symphony Club]92-a charlottetown symphony club , among whom [Anne]232-anne felt suddenly shy and frightened and countrified]1740-the members of a charlottetown symphony club , among whom anne felt suddenly shy and frightened and countrified . [Her]232-anne dress , which , in the east gable , had seemed so dainty and pretty , now seemed simple and plain -- too simple and plain , [she]232-anne thought , among all the silks and laces that glistened and rustled around [her]232-anne . What were [her]232-anne pearl beads compared to the diamonds of [the big , handsome lady near [her]232-anne]1741-the big , handsome lady near her ? And how poor [her]232-anne one wee white rose must look beside all the hothouse flowers [the others]3094-the others wore ! [Anne]232-anne laid [her]232-anne hat and jacket away , and shrank miserably into a corner . [She]232-anne wished [herself]232-anne back in [the white room at [Green Gables]107-matthew]1743-the white room at green gables .

It was still worse on the platform of [the big concert hall of [the hotel]3396-the hotel]1744-the big concert hall of the hotel , where [she]232-anne presently found [herself]232-anne . The electric lights dazzled [her]232-anne eyes , the perfume and hum bewildered [her]232-anne . [She]232-anne wished [she]232-anne were sitting down in the audience with [Diana]120-diana and [Jane]121-jane , who seemed to be having a splendid time away at the back . [She]232-anne was wedged in between [a stout lady in pink silk]1746-a stout lady in pink silk and [a tall , scornful - looking girl in a white - lace dress]1747-a tall , scornful - looking girl in a white - lace dress . [The stout lady]1748-the stout lady occasionally turned [her]1748-the stout lady head squarely around and surveyed [Anne]232-anne through [her]1748-the stout lady eyeglasses until [Anne]232-anne , acutely sensitive of being so scrutinized , felt that [she]232-anne must scream aloud ; and [the white - lace girl]1749-the white - lace girl kept talking audibly to [[her]1749-the white - lace girl next neighbor]1750-her next neighbor about the " country bumpkins "[1749-the white - lace girl] and " rustic belles "[3498-the audience] in [the audience]3498-the audience , languidly anticipating " such fun "[1749-the white - lace girl] from the displays of local talent on the program . [Anne]232-anne believed that [she]232-anne would hate [that white - lace girl]1752-that white - lace girl to the end of life .

Unfortunately for [Anne]232-anne , [a professional elocutionist]1753-a professional elocutionist was staying at [the hotel]3396-the hotel and had consented to recite . [She]1753-a professional elocutionist was [a lithe , dark - eyed woman in a wonderful gown of shimmering gray stuff like woven moonbeams , with gems on [her]1753-a professional elocutionist neck and in [her]1753-a professional elocutionist dark hair]1755-a lithe , dark - eyed woman in a wonderful gown of shimmering gray stuff like woven moonbeams , with gems on her neck and in her dark hair . [She]1753-a professional elocutionist had a marvelously flexible voice and wonderful power of expression ; [the audience]3498-the audience went wild over [her]1753-a professional elocutionist selection . [Anne]232-anne , forgetting all about [herself]232-anne and [her]232-anne troubles for the time , listened with rapt and shining eyes ; but when the recitation ended [she]232-anne suddenly put [her]232-anne hands over [her]232-anne face . [She]232-anne could never get up and recite after that -- never . Had [she]232-anne ever thought [she]232-anne could recite ? Oh , if [she]232-anne were only back at [Green Gables]107-matthew !

At this unpropitious moment [her]232-anne name was called . [Somehow [Anne]232-anne -- who did not notice the rather guilty little start of surprise [the white - lace girl]1749-the white - lace girl gave , and would not have understood the subtle compliment implied therein if [she]232-anne had]232-anne -- got on [her]232-anne feet , and moved dizzily out to the front . [She]1753-a professional elocutionist was so pale that [Diana]120-diana and [Jane]121-jane , down in [the audience]3498-the audience , clasped [each other]535-each other 's hands in nervous sympathy .

[Anne]232-anne was the victim of an overwhelming attack of stage fright . Often as [she]232-anne had recited in public , [she]232-anne had never before faced such an audience as this , and the sight of it paralyzed [her]232-anne energies completely . Everything was so strange , so brilliant , so bewildering -- the rows of [ladies in evening dress , the critical faces]1760-ladies in evening dress , the critical faces , the whole atmosphere of wealth and culture about [her]232-anne . Very different this from the plain benches at [the Debating Club]3129-the debating club , filled with the homely , sympathetic faces of [friends]677-friends and [neighbors]1763-neighbors . [These people]1764-these people , [she]232-anne thought , would be [merciless critics]1765-merciless critics . Perhaps , like [the white - lace girl]1749-the white - lace girl , [they]1764-these people anticipated amusement from [her]232-anne " rustic "[1749-the white - lace girl] efforts . [She]232-anne felt hopelessly , helplessly ashamed and miserable . [Her]232-anne knees trembled , [her]232-anne heart fluttered , a horrible faintness came over [her]232-anne ; not a word could [she]232-anne utter , and the next moment [she]232-anne would have fled from [the platform]449-the platform despite the humiliation which , [she]232-anne felt , must ever after be [her]232-anne portion if [she]232-anne did so .

But suddenly , as [her]232-anne dilated , frightened eyes gazed out over [the audience]3498-the audience , [she]232-anne saw [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert away at the back of [the room]631-the room , bending forward with a smile on [his]140-gilbert face -- a smile which seemed to [Anne]232-anne at once triumphant and taunting . In reality it was nothing of the kind . [Gilbert]140-gilbert was merely smiling with appreciation of the whole affair in general and of the effect produced by [Anne]232-anne 's slender white form and spiritual face against a background of palms in particular . [Josie Pye]175-josie pye , whom [he]140-gilbert had driven over , sat beside [him]140-gilbert , and [her]175-josie pye face certainly was both triumphant and taunting . But [Anne]232-anne did not see [Josie]175-josie pye , and would not have cared if [she]232-anne had . [She]232-anne drew a long breath and flung [her]232-anne head up proudly , courage and determination tingling over [her]232-anne like an electric shock . [She]232-anne _ would not _ fail before [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert -- [he]140-gilbert should never be able to laugh at [her]232-anne , never , never ! [Her]232-anne fright and nervousness vanished ; and [she]232-anne began [her]232-anne recitation , [her]232-anne clear , sweet voice reaching to the farthest corner of [the room]631-the room without a tremor or a break . Self - possession was fully restored to [her]232-anne , and in the reaction from that horrible moment of powerlessness [she]232-anne recited as [she]232-anne had never done before . When [she]232-anne finished there were bursts of honest applause . [Anne]232-anne , stepping back to [her]232-anne seat , blushing with shyness and delight , found [her]232-anne hand vigorously clasped and shaken by [the stout lady in pink silk]1771-the stout lady in pink silk .

" [[My]232-anne dear]3969-my dear , [you]3969-my dear did splendidly , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne puffed . " [I]232-anne 've been crying like [a baby]3970-a baby , actually [I]232-anne have . " Oh , [I]232-anne ca n't go , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne confusedly . " But yet -- [I]232-anne must , or [Matthew]107-matthew will be disappointed . [He]107-matthew said [they]3971-they would encore [me]232-anne . "[232-anne]

" Then do n't disappoint [Matthew]107-matthew , "[1772-the pink lady] said [the pink lady]1772-the pink lady , laughing .

Smiling , blushing , limpid eyed , [Anne]232-anne tripped back and gave a quaint , funny little selection that captivated [[her]232-anne audience]1773-her audience still further . The rest of the evening was quite a little triumph for [her]232-anne .

When the concert was over , [the stout , pink lady]1774-the stout , pink lady -- who was [the wife of [an American millionaire]1776-an american millionaire]1775-the wife of an american millionaire -- took [her]232-anne under [her]1774-the stout , pink lady wing , and introduced [her]232-anne to [everybody]2130-everybody ; and [everybody]2130-everybody was very nice to [her]232-anne . [They]1781-they had supper in [the big , beautifully decorated dining room]1782-the big , beautifully decorated dining room ; [Diana]120-diana and [Jane]121-jane were invited to partake of this , also , since [they]1781-they had come with [Anne]232-anne , but [Billy]291-billy was nowhere to be found , having decamped in mortal fear of some such invitation . [He]291-billy was in waiting for [them]1781-they , with [the team]1783-the team , however , when it was all over , and [the three girls]1784-the three girls came merrily out into the calm , white moonshine radiance . [Anne]232-anne breathed deeply , and looked into the clear sky beyond the dark boughs of the firs .

Oh , it was good to be out again in the purity and silence of the night ! How great and still and wonderful everything was , with the murmur of [the sea]609-the sea sounding through it and the darkling cliffs beyond like grim giants guarding [enchanted coasts]1786-enchanted coasts .

" Has n't it been a perfectly splendid time ? "[121-jane] sighed [Jane]121-jane , as [they]1781-they drove away . " [I]121-jane just wish [I]121-jane was [a rich American]3972-a rich american and could spend [my]121-jane summer at [a hotel]3973-a hotel and wear jewels and low - necked dresses and have ice cream and chicken salad every blessed day . " _ Did _ [you]232-anne see all the diamonds [those ladies]3989-those ladies wore ? "[121-jane] sighed [Jane]121-jane . " [They]3989-those ladies were simply dazzling . Would n't [you]232-anne just love to be rich , [girls]2854-girls ? "[121-jane]

" [We]3984-we _ are _ rich , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne staunchly . " Why , [we]3984-we have sixteen years to [our]3984-we credit , and [we]3984-we 're happy as [queens]3991-queens , and [we]3984-we 've all got imaginations , more or less .
