[You]2854-girls would n't change into any of [those women]2389-those women if [you]2854-girls could . Would [you]2854-girls want to be [that white - lace girl]1752-that white - lace girl and wear a sour look all [your]2854-girls life , as if [you]2854-girls 'd been born turning up [your]2854-girls nose at [the world]409-the world ? Or [the pink lady]1772-the pink lady , kind and nice as [she]1772-the pink lady is , so stout and short that [you]2854-girls 'd really no figure at all ? Or even [Mrs. Evans]292-mrs. evans , with that sad , sad look in [her]292-mrs. evans eyes ? [She]292-mrs. evans must have been dreadfully unhappy sometime to have such a look . [You]2854-girls _ know _ [you]2854-girls would n't , [Jane Andrews]121-jane ! "[232-anne]

" [I]121-jane _ do n't _ know -- exactly , "[121-jane] said [Jane]121-jane unconvinced . " [I]121-jane think diamonds would comfort [a person]2165-a person for a good deal . "[121-jane]

" Well , [I]232-anne do n't want to be anyone but [myself]232-anne , even if [I]232-anne go uncomforted by diamonds all [my]232-anne life , "[232-anne] declared [Anne]232-anne . " [I]232-anne 'm quite content to be [Anne]232-anne of [Green Gables]107-matthew , with [my]232-anne string of pearl beads . [I]232-anne know [Matthew]107-matthew gave [me]232-anne as much love with [them]3999-them as ever went with [Madame the Pink Lady]295-madame the pink lady 's jewels . "[232-anne]

CHAPTER XXXIV . [A Queen 's Girl]1787-a queen 's girl

|THE next three weeks were busy ones at [Green Gables]107-matthew , for [Anne]232-anne was getting ready to go to [Queen]128-queen 's 's , and there was much sewing to be done , and many things to be talked over and arranged . [Anne]232-anne 's outfit was ample and pretty , for [Matthew]107-matthew saw to that , and [Marilla]113-marilla for once made no objections whatever to anything [he]107-matthew purchased or suggested . More -- one evening [she]113-marilla went up to [the east gable]561-the east gable with [her]113-marilla arms full of a delicate pale green material .

" [Anne]232-anne , here 's something for a nice light dress for [you]232-anne . [I]113-marilla do n't suppose [you]232-anne really need it ; [you]232-anne 've plenty of pretty waists ; but [I]113-marilla thought maybe [you]232-anne 'd like something real dressy to wear if [you]232-anne were asked out anywhere of an evening in [town]2009-town , to a party or anything like that . [I]113-marilla hear that [Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis and [Josie]175-josie pye have got ? evening dresses , ' as [they]4001-they call them , and [I]113-marilla do n't mean [you]232-anne shall be behind [them]4001-they . [I]113-marilla got [Mrs. Allan]232-anne to help [me]113-marilla pick it in [town]2009-town last week , and [we]4003-we 'll get [Emily Gillis]296-emily gillis to make it for [you]232-anne . [Emily]4004-emily has got taste , and [her]4004-emily fits are n't to be equaled . "[113-marilla]

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , it 's just lovely , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne . " Thank [you]113-marilla so much . [I]232-anne do n't believe [you]113-marilla ought to be so kind to [me]232-anne -- it 's making it harder every day for [me]232-anne to go away . "[232-anne]

The green dress was made up with as many tucks and frills and shirrings as [Emily]296-emily gillis 's taste permitted . [Anne]232-anne put it on one evening for [Matthew]107-matthew 's and [Marilla]113-marilla 's benefit , and recited " [The Maiden]3967-the maiden 's Vow "[1789-them] for [them]1789-them in [the kitchen]557-the kitchen . As [Marilla]113-marilla watched the bright , animated face and graceful motions [her]113-marilla thoughts went back to the evening [Anne]232-anne had arrived at [Green Gables]107-matthew , and memory recalled a vivid picture of [the odd , frightened child]1791-the odd , frightened child in [her]1791-the odd , frightened child preposterous yellowish - brown wincey dress , the heartbreak looking out of [her]1791-the odd , frightened child tearful eyes . Something in the memory brought tears to [Marilla]113-marilla 's own eyes .

" [I]232-anne declare , [my]232-anne recitation has made [you]113-marilla cry , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne gaily stooping over [Marilla]113-marilla 's chair to drop a butterfly kiss on [that lady]686-that lady 's cheek . " Now , [I]232-anne call that a positive triumph . "[232-anne]

" No , [I]113-marilla was n't crying over [your]113-marilla piece , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla , who would have scorned to be betrayed into such weakness by any poetry stuff . " [I]113-marilla just could n't help thinking of [the little girl [you]113-marilla used to be]4006-the little girl you used to be , [Anne]232-anne . And [I]113-marilla was wishing [you]113-marilla could have stayed [a little girl]2083-a little girl , even with all [your]113-marilla queer ways . [You]113-marilla 've grown up now and [you]113-marilla 're going away ; and [you]113-marilla look so tall and stylish and so -- so -- different altogether in that dress -- as if [you]113-marilla did n't belong in [Avonlea]2-avonlea at all -- and [I]113-marilla just got lonesome thinking it all over . "[113-marilla]

" [Marilla]113-marilla ! "[232-anne] [Anne]232-anne sat down on [Marilla]113-marilla 's gingham lap , took [Marilla]113-marilla 's lined face between [her]232-anne hands , and looked gravely and tenderly into [Marilla]113-marilla 's eyes . " [I]232-anne 'm not a bit changed -- not really . [I]232-anne 'm only just pruned down and branched out . The real _ me_--back here -- is just the same . It wo n't make a bit of difference where [I]232-anne go or how much [I]232-anne change outwardly ; at heart [I]232-anne shall always be [[your]113-marilla little Anne]3499-your little anne , who will love [you]113-marilla and [Matthew]107-matthew and [dear Green Gables]107-matthew more and better every day of [her]232-anne life . "[232-anne]

[Anne]232-anne laid [her]232-anne fresh young cheek against [Marilla]113-marilla 's faded one , and reached out a hand to pat [Matthew]107-matthew 's shoulder . [Marilla]113-marilla would have given much just then to have possessed [Anne]232-anne 's power of putting [her]232-anne feelings into words ; but nature and habit had willed it otherwise , and [she]113-marilla could only put [her]113-marilla arms close about [[her]113-marilla girl]1727-her girl and hold [her]1727-her girl tenderly to [her]113-marilla heart , wishing that [she]113-marilla need never let [her]1727-her girl go .

[Matthew]107-matthew , with a suspicious moisture in [his]107-matthew eyes , got up and went out - of - doors . Under the stars of the blue summer night [he]107-matthew walked agitatedly across [the yard]2099-the yard to the gate under the poplars .

" Well now , [I]107-matthew guess [she]232-anne ai n't been much spoiled , "[107-matthew] [he]107-matthew muttered , proudly . " [I]107-matthew guess [my]107-matthew putting in [my]107-matthew oar occasional never did much harm after all . [She]232-anne 's smart and pretty , and loving , too , which is better than all the rest . [She]232-anne 's been a blessing to [us]4009-us , and there never was a luckier mistake than what [Mrs. Spencer]114-mrs. spencer made -- if it _ was _ luck . [I]107-matthew do n't believe it was any such thing . It was [Providence]143-providence , because [the Almighty]4010-the almighty saw [we]4009-us needed [her]232-anne , [I]107-matthew reckon . "[107-matthew]

The day finally came when [Anne]232-anne must go to [town]2009-town . [She]232-anne and [Matthew]107-matthew drove in one fine September morning , after a tearful parting with [Diana]120-diana and an untearful practical one -- on [Marilla]113-marilla 's side at least -- with [Marilla]113-marilla . But when [Anne]232-anne had gone [Diana]120-diana dried [her]120-diana tears and went to a beach picnic at [White Sands]27-white sands with [some of [[her]120-diana Carmody cousins]1797-her carmody cousins , where [she]120-diana contrived to enjoy [herself]120-diana tolerably well]1796-some of her carmody cousins , where she contrived to enjoy herself tolerably well ; while [Marilla]113-marilla plunged fiercely into unnecessary work and kept at it all day long with the bitterest kind of heartache -- the ache that burns and gnaws and can not wash itself away in ready tears . But that night , when [Marilla]113-marilla went to bed , acutely and miserably conscious that [the little gable room at the end of [the hall]551-the hall]1798-the little gable room at the end of the hall was untenanted by any vivid young life and unstirred by any soft breathing , [she]113-marilla buried [her]113-marilla face in [her]113-marilla pillow , and wept for [[her]113-marilla girl]1727-her girl in a passion of sobs that appalled [her]113-marilla when [she]113-marilla grew calm enough to reflect how very wicked it must be to take on so about [a sinful fellow creature]1801-a sinful fellow creature .

[Anne]232-anne and [the rest of [the Avonlea scholars]1803-the avonlea scholars]1802-the rest of the avonlea scholars reached [town]2009-town just in time to hurry off to [the Academy]3913-the academy . That first day passed pleasantly enough in a whirl of excitement , meeting [all the new students]1806-all the new students , learning to know [the professors]1807-the professors by sight and being assorted and organized into classes . [Anne]232-anne intended taking up the Second Year work being advised to do so by [Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy ; [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert elected to do the same . This meant getting [a First Class teacher]1808-a first class teacher 's license in one year instead of two , if [they]1806-all the new students were successful ; but it also meant much more and harder work . [Jane]121-jane , [Ruby]168-ruby gillis , [Josie]175-josie pye , [Charlie]173-charlie sloane , and [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon , not being troubled with the stirrings of ambition , were content to take up the Second Class work . [Anne]232-anne was conscious of a pang of loneliness when [she]232-anne found [herself]232-anne in [a room]1809-a room with [fifty other students]1810-fifty other students , [not one of whom [she]232-anne knew]1811-not one of whom she knew , except [the tall , brown - haired boy across [the room]631-the room]1812-the tall , brown - haired boy across the room ; and knowing [him]1812-the tall , brown - haired boy across the room in the fashion [she]232-anne did , did not help [her]232-anne much , as [she]232-anne reflected pessimistically . Yet [she]232-anne was undeniably glad that [they]1814-they were in [the same class]1815-the same class ; the old rivalry could still be carried on , and [Anne]232-anne would hardly have known what to do if it had been lacking .

" [I]232-anne would n't feel comfortable without it , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne thought . " [Gilbert]140-gilbert looks awfully determined . [I]232-anne suppose [he]140-gilbert 's making up [his]140-gilbert mind , here and now , to win the medal . What a splendid chin [he]140-gilbert has ! [I]232-anne never noticed it before . [I]232-anne do wish [Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis had gone in for First Class , too . [I]232-anne suppose [I]232-anne wo n't feel so much like a cat in a strange garret when [I]232-anne get acquainted , though . [I]232-anne wonder which of [the girls [here]2022-here]4011-the girls here are going to be [[my]232-anne friends]4013-my friends . It 's really an interesting speculation . Of course [I]232-anne promised [Diana]120-diana that [[no Queen]4014-no queen 's girl]4015-no queen 's girl , no matter how much [I]232-anne liked [her]120-diana , should ever be as dear to [me]232-anne as [she]120-diana is ; but [I]232-anne 've lots of second - best affections to bestow . [I]232-anne like the look of [that girl with the brown eyes and the crimson waist]4016-that girl with the brown eyes and the crimson waist . [She]4016-that girl with the brown eyes and the crimson waist looks vivid and red - rosy ; there 's that pale , fair one gazing out of the window . [She]4016-that girl with the brown eyes and the crimson waist has lovely hair , and looks as if [she]4016-that girl with the brown eyes and the crimson waist knew a thing or two about dreams . [I]232-anne 'd like to know [them]4017-them both -- know [them]4017-them well -- well enough to walk with [my]232-anne arm about [their]4017-them waists , and call [them]4017-them nicknames . But just now [I]232-anne do n't know [them]4017-them and [they]4017-them do n't know [me]232-anne , and probably do n't want to know [me]232-anne particularly . Oh , it 's lonesome ! "[232-anne]

It was lonesomer still when [Anne]232-anne found [herself]232-anne alone in [[her]232-anne hall bedroom]1816-her hall bedroom that night at twilight . [She]232-anne was not to board with [the other girls , who all had relatives in [town]2009-town to take pity on [them]1817-the other girls , who all had relatives in town to take pity on them]1817-the other girls , who all had relatives in town to take pity on them . [Miss Josephine Barry]217-miss barry would have liked to board [her]232-anne , but [Beechwood]90-beechwood was so far from [the Academy]3913-the academy that it was out of the question ; so [Miss Barry]217-miss barry hunted up [a boarding - house]1820-a boarding - house , assuring [Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]113-marilla that [it]1820-a boarding - house was the very place for [Anne]232-anne .

" [The lady who keeps it]4018-the lady who keeps it is [a reduced gentlewoman]4019-a reduced gentlewoman , "[217-miss barry] explained [Miss Barry]217-miss barry . " [[Her]4018-the lady who keeps it husband]2923-her husband was [a British officer]4021-a british officer , and [she]4018-the lady who keeps it is very careful what sort of [boarders]4022-boarders [she]4018-the lady who keeps it takes . [Anne]232-anne will not meet with [any objectionable persons under [her]4018-the lady who keeps it roof]4023-any objectionable persons under her roof . The table is good , and [the house]350-the house is near [the Academy]3913-the academy , in [a quiet neighborhood]4026-a quiet neighborhood . "[217-miss barry]

All this might be quite true , and indeed , proved to be so , but it did not materially help [Anne]232-anne in the first agony of homesickness that seized upon [her]232-anne . [She]232-anne looked dismally about [[her]232-anne narrow little room]1821-her narrow little room , with [its]1821-her narrow little room dull - papered , pictureless walls , [its]1821-her narrow little room small iron bedstead and empty book - case ; and a horrible choke came into [her]232-anne throat as [she]232-anne thought of [[her]232-anne own white room at [Green Gables]107-matthew]1822-her own white room at green gables , where [she]232-anne would have the pleasant consciousness of [a great green still outdoors]1823-a great green still outdoors , of sweet peas growing in [the garden]573-the garden , and moonlight falling on [the orchard]2264-the orchard , of [the brook below the slope]1826-the brook below the slope and the spruce boughs tossing in the night wind beyond [it]2264-the orchard , of a vast starry sky , and the light from [Diana]120-diana 's window shining out through the gap in the trees . Here there was nothing of this ; [Anne]232-anne knew that outside of [her]232-anne window was [a hard street]1827-a hard street , with a network of telephone wires shutting out the sky , the tramp of alien feet , and a thousand lights gleaming on stranger faces . [She]232-anne knew that [she]232-anne was going to cry , and fought against it .

" [I]232-anne _ wo n't _ cry . It 's silly -- and weak -- there 's the third tear splashing down by [my]232-anne nose . There are more coming ! [I]232-anne must think of something funny to stop [them]4027-them . But there 's nothing funny except what is connected with [Avonlea]2-avonlea , and that only makes things worse -- four -- five -- I'm going [home]361-home next Friday , but that seems a hundred years away . Oh , [Matthew]107-matthew is nearly [home]361-home by now -- and [Marilla]113-marilla is at the gate , looking down [the lane]380-the lane for [him]107-matthew -- six -- seven -- eight -- oh , there 's no use in counting [them]4027-them ! [They]4027-them 're coming in a flood presently . [I]232-anne ca n't cheer up -- [I]232-anne do n't _ want _ to cheer up . It 's nicer to be miserable ! "[232-anne]

The flood of tears would have come , no doubt , had not [Josie Pye]175-josie pye appeared at that moment . In the joy of seeing a familiar face [Anne]232-anne forgot that there had never been much love lost between [her]232-anne and [Josie]175-josie pye . As a part of [Avonlea]2-avonlea life even a [Pye]175-josie pye was welcome .

" [I]232-anne 'm so glad [you]175-josie pye came up , "[232-anne] [Anne]232-anne said sincerely .

" [You]175-josie pye 've been crying , "[175-josie pye] remarked [Josie]175-josie pye , with aggravating pity . " [I]175-josie pye suppose [you]175-josie pye 're homesick -- [some people]2127-some people have so little self - control in that respect . [I]175-josie pye 've no intention of being homesick , [I]175-josie pye can tell [you]175-josie pye . [Town]2009-town 's too jolly after [that poky old Avonlea]4033-that poky old avonlea . [I]175-josie pye wonder how [I]175-josie pye ever existed [there]348-there so long . [You]175-josie pye should n't cry , [Anne]232-anne ; it is n't becoming , for [your]175-josie pye nose and eyes get red , and then [you]175-josie pye seem _ all _ red . [I]175-josie pye 'd a perfectly scrumptious time in [the Academy]3913-the academy today . [[Our]4036-our French professor]4037-our french professor is simply a duck . [His]4037-our french professor moustache would give [you]175-josie pye kerwollowps of the heart . Have [you]175-josie pye anything eatable around , [Anne]232-anne ? [I]175-josie pye 'm literally starving . Ah , [I]175-josie pye guessed likely [Marilla]113-marilla ? d load [you]175-josie pye up with cake . That 's why [I]175-josie pye called round . Otherwise [I]175-josie pye 'd have gone to [the park]1557-the park to hear [the band]4039-the band play with [Frank Stockley]297-frank stockley . [He]297-frank stockley boards same place as [I]175-josie pye do , and [he]297-frank stockley 's a sport . [He]297-frank stockley noticed [you]175-josie pye in class today , and asked [me]175-josie pye who [the red - headed girl]4040-the red - headed girl was . [I]175-josie pye told [him]297-frank stockley [you]175-josie pye were [an orphan that [the Cuthberts]111-the cuthberts had adopted]4041-an orphan that the cuthberts had adopted , and [nobody]2118-nobody knew very much about what [you]175-josie pye 'd been before that . "[175-josie pye]

[Anne]232-anne was wondering if , after all , solitude and tears were not more satisfactory than [Josie Pye]175-josie pye 's companionship when [Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis appeared , each with an inch of Queen 's color ribbon -- purple and scarlet -- pinned proudly to [her]175-josie pye coat . As [Josie]175-josie pye was not " speaking "[175-josie pye] to [Jane]121-jane just then [she]175-josie pye had to subside into comparative harmlessness .

" Well , "[121-jane] said [Jane]121-jane with a sigh , " [I]121-jane feel as if [I]121-jane 'd lived many moons since the morning . [I]121-jane ought to be [home]361-home studying [my]121-jane Virgil -- [that horrid old professor]4044-that horrid old professor gave [us]4045-us twenty lines to start in on tomorrow . But [I]121-jane simply could n't settle down to study tonight . [Anne]232-anne , methinks [I]121-jane see the traces of tears . If [you]232-anne 've been crying _ do _ own up . It will restore [my]121-jane self - respect , for [I]121-jane was shedding tears freely before [Ruby]168-ruby gillis came along . [I]121-jane do n't mind being a goose so much if [somebody else]4046-somebody else is goosey , too . [Cake]298-cake ? [You]232-anne 'll give [me]121-jane a teeny piece , wo n't [you]232-anne ? Thank [you]232-anne . It has the real [Avonlea]2-avonlea flavor . "[121-jane]

[Ruby]168-ruby gillis , perceiving the Queen 's calendar lying on the table , wanted to know if [Anne]232-anne meant to try for the gold medal .

[Anne]232-anne blushed and admitted [she]232-anne was thinking of it .

" Oh , that reminds [me]175-josie pye , "[175-josie pye] said [Josie]175-josie pye , " Queen 's is to get one of the Avery scholarships after all . The word came today . [Frank Stockley]297-frank stockley told [me]175-josie pye -- [[his]297-frank stockley uncle]2919-his uncle is one of [the board of governors]4048-the board of governors , [you]232-anne know . It will be announced in [the Academy]3913-the academy tomorrow . "[175-josie pye]

An Avery scholarship ! [Anne]232-anne felt [her]232-anne heart beat more quickly , and the horizons of [her]232-anne ambition shifted and broadened as if by magic . Before [Josie]175-josie pye had told the news [Anne]232-anne 's highest pinnacle of aspiration had been a [teacher]1618-teacher 's provincial license , First Class , at the end of the year , and perhaps the medal ! But now in one moment [Anne]232-anne saw [herself]232-anne winning the Avery scholarship , taking an Arts course at [Redmond College]94-redmond college , and graduating in a gown and mortar board , before the echo of [Josie]175-josie pye 's words had died away . For the Avery scholarship was in English , and [Anne]232-anne felt that here [her]232-anne foot was on [native heath]1829-native heath .

[A wealthy manufacturer of [New Brunswick]14-new brunswick]1830-a wealthy manufacturer of new brunswick had died and left part of [his]1830-a wealthy manufacturer of new brunswick fortune to endow a large number of scholarships to be distributed among [the various high schools and academies of [the Maritime Provinces]1832-the maritime provinces]1831-the various high schools and academies of the maritime provinces , according to [their]1831-the various high schools and academies of the maritime provinces respective standings . There had been much doubt whether [one]385-one would be allotted to [Queen]128-queen 's 's , but the matter was settled at last , and at the end of the year [the graduate who made the highest mark in English and English Literature]1834-the graduate who made the highest mark in english and english literature would win the scholarship -- two hundred and fifty dollars a year for four years at [Redmond College]94-redmond college . No wonder that [Anne]232-anne went to bed that night with tingling cheeks !

" [I]232-anne 'll win that scholarship if hard work can do it , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne resolved . " Would n't [Matthew]107-matthew be proud if [I]232-anne got to be [a B.A.]4050-a b.a. ? Oh , it 's delightful to have ambitions . [I]232-anne 'm so glad [I]232-anne have such a lot . And there never seems to be any end to them -- that 's the best of it . Just as soon as [you]4051-you attain to one ambition [you]4051-you see another one glittering higher up still . It does make life so interesting . "[232-anne]

CHAPTER XXXV . The Winter at [Queen 's]128-queen 's

|ANNE 'S homesickness wore off , greatly helped in the wearing by [her]232-anne weekend visits [home]361-home . As long as the open weather lasted [the [Avonlea]2-avonlea [students]1837-students]1836-the avonlea students went out to [Carmody]5-carmody on [the new branch railway]1838-the new branch railway every Friday night . [Diana]120-diana and [several other [Avonlea]2-avonlea [young folks]1713-young folks]1839-several other avonlea young folks were generally on hand to meet [them]1836-the avonlea students and [they]1836-the avonlea students all walked over to [Avonlea]2-avonlea in a merry party . [Anne]232-anne thought those Friday evening gypsyings over [the autumnal hills]1841-the autumnal hills in the crisp golden air , with [the homelights of [Avonlea]2-avonlea]1842-the homelights of avonlea twinkling beyond , were the best and dearest hours in the whole week .

[Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert nearly always walked with [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis and carried [her]168-ruby gillis satchel for [her]168-ruby gillis . [Ruby]168-ruby gillis was [a very handsome young lady , now thinking [herself]168-ruby gillis quite as grown up as [she]168-ruby gillis really was]1843-a very handsome young lady , now thinking herself quite as grown up as she really was ; [she]168-ruby gillis wore [her]168-ruby gillis skirts as long as [[her]168-ruby gillis mother]2342-her mother would let [her]168-ruby gillis and did [her]168-ruby gillis hair up in [town]2009-town , though [she]168-ruby gillis had to take it down when [she]168-ruby gillis went [home]361-home . [She]168-ruby gillis had large , bright - blue eyes , a brilliant complexion , and a plump showy figure . [She]168-ruby gillis laughed a great deal , was cheerful and good - tempered , and enjoyed the pleasant things of life frankly .

" But [I]121-jane should n't think [she]168-ruby gillis was the sort of girl [Gilbert]140-gilbert would like , "[121-jane] whispered [Jane]121-jane to [Anne]232-anne . [Anne]232-anne did not think so either , but [she]232-anne would not have said so for the Avery scholarship . [She]232-anne could not help thinking , too , that it would be very pleasant to have [such a friend]1847-such a friend as [Gilbert]140-gilbert to jest and chatter with and exchange ideas about books and studies and ambitions . [Gilbert]140-gilbert had ambitions , [she]232-anne knew , and [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis did not seem [the sort of person with whom such could be profitably discussed]1848-the sort of person with whom such could be profitably discussed .

There was no silly sentiment in [Anne]232-anne 's ideas concerning [Gilbert]140-gilbert . [Boys]401-boys were to [her]232-anne , when [she]232-anne thought about [them]401-boys at all , merely [possible good comrades]1850-possible good comrades . If [she]232-anne and [Gilbert]140-gilbert had been [friends]677-friends [she]232-anne would not have cared how many other friends [he]140-gilbert had nor with whom [he]140-gilbert walked . [She]232-anne had a genius for friendship ; [girl friends [she]232-anne had in plenty]1852-girl friends she had in plenty ; but [she]232-anne had a vague consciousness that masculine friendship might also be a good thing to round out one 's conceptions of companionship and furnish broader standpoints of judgment and comparison . Not that [Anne]232-anne could have put [her]232-anne feelings on the matter into just such clear definition . But [she]232-anne thought that if [Gilbert]140-gilbert had ever walked [home]361-home with [her]232-anne from [the train]2020-the train , over [the crisp fields]1855-the crisp fields and along [the ferny byways]1856-the ferny byways , [they]1857-they might have had many and merry and interesting conversations about the new world that was opening around [them]1857-they and [their]1857-they hopes and ambitions therein . [Gilbert]140-gilbert was [a clever young fellow]1858-a clever young fellow , with [his]140-gilbert own thoughts about things and a determination to get the best out of life and put the best into it . [Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis told [Jane Andrews]121-jane that [she]168-ruby gillis did n't understand half the things [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert said ; [he]140-gilbert talked just like [Anne Shirley]124-anne did when [she]124-anne had a thoughtful fit on and for [her]124-anne part [she]124-anne did n't think it any fun to be bothering about books and that sort of thing when [you]1859-you did n't have to . [Frank Stockley]297-frank stockley had lots more dash and go , but then [he]297-frank stockley was n't half as good - looking as [Gilbert]140-gilbert and [she]124-anne really could n't decide which [she]124-anne liked best !

In [the Academy]3913-the academy [Anne]124-anne gradually drew [a little circle of friends]1861-a little circle of friends about [her]124-anne , [thoughtful , imaginative , ambitious students like [herself]124-anne]1862-thoughtful , imaginative , ambitious students like herself . With [the " rose - red "[1863-the " rose - red " girl] girl]1863-the " rose - red " girl , [Stella Maynard]299-stella maynard , and the " dream girl , "[300-priscilla grant] [Priscilla Grant]300-priscilla grant , [she]124-anne soon became intimate , finding [the latter pale spiritual - looking maiden]1864-the latter pale spiritual - looking maiden to be full to the brim of mischief and pranks and fun , while [the vivid , black - eyed Stella]1865-the vivid , black - eyed stella had a heartful of wistful dreams and fancies , as aerial and rainbow - like as [Anne]124-anne 's own .

After the Christmas holidays [the [Avonlea]2-avonlea [students]1837-students]1836-the avonlea students gave up going [home]361-home on Fridays and settled down to hard work . By this time [[all the Queen]1869-all the queen 's scholars]1870-all the queen 's scholars had gravitated into [their]1870-all the queen 's scholars own places in the ranks and [the various classes]1871-the various classes had assumed distinct and settled shadings of individuality . Certain facts had become generally accepted . It was admitted that the medal contestants had practically narrowed down to three -- [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert , [Anne Shirley]124-anne , and [Lewis Wilson]301-lewis wilson ; the Avery scholarship was more doubtful , any one of a certain six being [a possible winner]1872-a possible winner . The bronze medal for mathematics was considered as good as won by [a fat , funny little up - country boy with a bumpy forehead and a patched coat]1873-a fat , funny little up - country boy with a bumpy forehead and a patched coat .

[Ruby Gillis]168-ruby gillis was [the handsomest girl of the year]1874-the handsomest girl of the year at [the Academy]3913-the academy ; in the Second Year classes [Stella Maynard]299-stella maynard carried off the palm for beauty , with small but critical minority in favor of [Anne Shirley]124-anne . [Ethel Marr]302-ethel marr was admitted by [all competent judges]1876-all competent judges to have the most stylish modes of hair - dressing , and [Jane Andrews -- plain , plodding , conscientious Jane]121-jane -- carried off the honors in the domestic science course . [Even Josie Pye]175-josie pye attained a certain preeminence as [the sharpest - tongued young lady in attendance at [Queen 's]128-queen 's]1877-the sharpest - tongued young lady in attendance at queen 's . So it may be fairly stated that [[Miss Stacy]240-miss stacy 's old pupils]1878-miss stacy 's old pupils held [their]1878-miss stacy 's old pupils own in the wider arena of the academical course .

[Anne]124-anne worked hard and steadily . [Her]124-anne rivalry with [Gilbert]140-gilbert was as intense as it had ever been in [[Avonlea]2-avonlea school]3548-avonlea school , although it was not known in the class at large , but somehow the bitterness had gone out of it . [Anne]124-anne no longer wished to win for the sake of defeating [Gilbert]140-gilbert ; rather , for the proud consciousness of a well - won victory over [a worthy foeman]1880-a worthy foeman . It would be worth while to win , but [she]124-anne no longer thought life would be insupportable if [she]124-anne did not .

In spite of lessons [the students]1881-the students found opportunities for pleasant times . [Anne]124-anne spent many of [her]124-anne spare hours at [Beechwood]90-beechwood and generally ate [her]124-anne Sunday dinners [there]348-there and went to [church]2482-church with [Miss Barry]217-miss barry . The latter was , as [she]124-anne admitted , growing old , but [her]124-anne black eyes were not dim nor the vigor of [her]124-anne tongue in the least abated . But [she]124-anne never sharpened the latter on [Anne]124-anne , who continued to be a prime favorite with [the critical old lady]1884-the critical old lady .

" [That [Anne]124-anne - girl]3186-that anne - girl improves all the time , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said . " [I]124-anne get tired of [other girls]4053-other girls -- there is such a provoking and eternal sameness about [them]4053-other girls . [Anne]124-anne has as many shades as a rainbow and every shade is the prettiest while it lasts . [I]124-anne do n't know that [she]124-anne is as amusing as [she]124-anne was when [she]124-anne was [a child]2075-a child , but [she]124-anne makes [me]124-anne love [her]124-anne and [I]124-anne like people who make [me]124-anne love [them]4053-other girls . It saves [me]124-anne so much trouble in making [myself]124-anne love [them]4053-other girls . "[124-anne]

Then , almost before [anybody]2031-anybody realized it , spring had come ; out in [Avonlea]2-avonlea the Mayflowers were peeping pinkly out on the sere barrens where snow - wreaths lingered ; and the " mist of green "[124-anne] was on [the woods]373-the woods and in [the valleys]1332-the valleys . But in [Charlottetown]18-charlottetown harassed [[Queen]3551-queen 's students]1889-queen 's students thought and talked only of examinations .

" It does n't seem possible that the term is nearly over , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne . " Why , last fall it seemed so long to look forward to -- a whole winter of studies and classes . And here [we]4055-we are , with the exams looming up next week . [Girls]2854-girls , sometimes [I]124-anne feel as if those exams meant everything , but when [I]124-anne look at the big buds swelling on those chestnut trees and the misty blue air at the end of [the streets]4057-the streets [they]1889-queen 's students do n't seem half so important . "[124-anne]

[Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis and [Josie]175-josie pye , who had dropped in , did not take this view of it . To [them]1889-queen 's students the coming examinations were constantly very important indeed -- far more important than chestnut buds or Maytime hazes . It was all very well for [Anne]124-anne , who was sure of passing at least , to have [her]124-anne moments of belittling [them]1889-queen 's students , but when [your]1890-you whole future depended on [them]1889-queen 's students -- as [the girls]2852-the girls truly thought [theirs]2852-the girls did -- [you]1890-you could not regard [them]1889-queen 's students philosophically .

" [I]121-jane 've lost seven pounds in the last two weeks , "[121-jane] sighed [Jane]121-jane . " It 's no use to say do n't worry . [I]121-jane _ will _ worry . [Worrying]304-worrying helps [you]1890-you some -- it seems as if [you]1890-you were doing something when [you]1890-you 're worrying . It would be dreadful if [I]121-jane failed to get [my]121-jane license after going to [Queen]3551-queen 's all winter and spending so much money . "[121-jane]

" _ [I]175-josie pye _ do n't care , "[175-josie pye] said [Josie Pye]175-josie pye . " If [I]175-josie pye do n't pass this year [I]175-josie pye 'm coming back next . [[My]175-josie pye father]2316-my father can afford to send [me]175-josie pye . [Anne]124-anne , [Frank Stockley]297-frank stockley says that [Professor Tremaine]305-professor tremaine said [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert was sure to get the medal and that [Emily Clay]306-emily clay would likely win the Avery scholarship . "[175-josie pye]

" That may make [me]124-anne feel badly tomorrow , [Josie]175-josie pye , "[124-anne] laughed [Anne]124-anne , " but just now [I]124-anne honestly feel that as long as [I]124-anne know the violets are coming out all purple down in [the hollow below [Green Gables]107-matthew]4060-the hollow below green gables and that little ferns are poking their heads up in [Lovers ' Lane]96-lovers ' lane , it 's not a great deal of difference whether [I]124-anne win [the Avery]307-the avery or not . [I]124-anne 've done [my]124-anne best and [I]124-anne begin to understand what is meant by the ? joy of the strife . ' Next to trying and winning , the best thing is trying and failing . [Girls]2854-girls , do n't talk about exams ! Look at that arch of pale green sky over [those houses]4062-those houses and picture to [yourself]2854-girls what it must look like over [the purply - dark beech - woods back of [Avonlea]2-avonlea]4063-the purply - dark beech - woods back of avonlea . "[124-anne]

" What are [you]121-jane going to wear for commencement , [Jane]121-jane ? "[168-ruby gillis] asked [Ruby]168-ruby gillis practically .

[Jane]121-jane and [Josie]175-josie pye both answered at once and the chatter drifted into a side eddy of fashions . But [Anne]124-anne , with [her]124-anne elbows on the window sill , [her]124-anne soft cheek laid against [her]124-anne clasped hands , and [her]124-anne eyes filled with visions , looked out unheedingly across [city roof]1892-city roof and spire to that glorious dome of sunset sky and wove [her]124-anne dreams of a possible future from the golden tissue of youth 's own optimism . All [the Beyond]98-the beyond was [hers]124-anne with its possibilities lurking rosily in the oncoming years -- each year a rose of promise to be woven into [an immortal chaplet]1893-an immortal chaplet .

CHAPTER XXXVI . The Glory and the Dream

|ON the morning when the final results of all the examinations were to be posted on the bulletin board at [Queen 's]128-queen 's , [Anne]124-anne and [Jane]121-jane walked down [the street]1546-the street together . [Jane]121-jane was smiling and happy ; examinations were over and [she]121-jane was comfortably sure [she]121-jane had made a pass at least ; further considerations troubled [Jane]121-jane not at all ; [she]121-jane had no soaring ambitions and consequently was not affected with the unrest attendant thereon . For [we]1895-we pay a price for everything [we]1895-we get or take in [this world]2059-this world ; and although ambitions are well worth having , they are not to be cheaply won , but exact [their]1897-their dues of work and self - denial , anxiety and discouragement . [Anne]124-anne was pale and quiet ; in ten more minutes [she]124-anne would know who had won the medal and who the [Avery]307-the avery . Beyond those ten minutes there did not seem , just then , to be anything worth being called Time .

" Of course [you]124-anne 'll win one of them anyhow , "[121-jane] said [Jane]121-jane , who could n't understand how [the faculty]1898-the faculty could be so unfair as to order it otherwise .

" [I]124-anne have not hope of [the Avery]307-the avery , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne . " [Everybody]2130-everybody says [Emily Clay]306-emily clay will win it . And [I]124-anne 'm not going to march up to that bulletin board and look at it before [everybody]2130-everybody . [I]124-anne have n't the moral courage . [I]124-anne 'm going straight to [[the girls]2852-the girls ' dressing room]4067-the girls ' dressing room . [You]121-jane must read the announcements and then come and tell [me]124-anne , [Jane]121-jane . And [I]124-anne implore [you]121-jane in the name of [our]1899-they old friendship to do it as quickly as possible . If [I]124-anne have failed just say so , without trying to break it gently ; and whatever [you]121-jane do _ do n't _ sympathize with [me]124-anne . Promise [me]124-anne this , [Jane]121-jane . "[124-anne]

[Jane]121-jane promised solemnly ; but , as it happened , there was no necessity for such a promise . When [they]1899-they went up the entrance steps of [[Queen]3551-queen 's]1901-queen 's [they]1899-they found [the hall]551-the hall full of boys who were carrying [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert around on [their]1899-they shoulders and yelling at the tops of [their]1899-they voices , " Hurrah for [Blythe]140-gilbert , [Medalist]308-medalist ! "[1899-they]

For a moment [Anne]124-anne felt one sickening pang of defeat and disappointment . So [she]124-anne had failed and [Gilbert]140-gilbert had won ! Well , [Matthew]107-matthew would be sorry -- [he]107-matthew had been so sure [she]124-anne would win .

And then !

[Somebody]436-somebody called out :

" Three cheers for [Miss Shirley]124-anne , [winner of the Avery]4068-winner of the avery ! "[436-somebody]

" Oh , [Anne]124-anne , "[121-jane] gasped [Jane]121-jane , as [they]1899-they fled to [[the girls]2852-the girls ' dressing room]4067-the girls ' dressing room amid hearty cheers . " Oh , [Anne]124-anne [I]1899-they 'm so proud ! Is n't it splendid ? "[1899-they]

And then [the girls]2852-the girls were around [them]1899-they and [Anne]124-anne was the center of [a laughing , congratulating group]1907-a laughing , congratulating group . [Her]124-anne shoulders were thumped and [her]124-anne hands shaken vigorously . [She]124-anne was pushed and pulled and hugged and among it all [she]124-anne managed to whisper to [Jane]121-jane :

" Oh , wo n't [Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]113-marilla be pleased ! [I]124-anne must write the news [home]361-home right away . "[124-anne]

Commencement was the next important happening . The exercises were held in [the big assembly hall of [the Academy]3913-the academy]1908-the big assembly hall of the academy . Addresses were given , essays read , songs sung , the public award of diplomas , prizes and medals made .

[Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]113-marilla were there , with eyes and ears for only [one student on the platform]1910-one student on the platform -- [a tall girl in pale green , with faintly flushed cheeks and starry eyes]1911-a tall girl in pale green , with faintly flushed cheeks and starry eyes , who read the best essay and was pointed out and whispered about as [the Avery winner]1912-the avery winner .

" Reckon [you]124-anne 're glad [we]4070-we kept [her]1911-a tall girl in pale green , with faintly flushed cheeks and starry eyes , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[107-matthew] whispered [Matthew]107-matthew , speaking for the first time since [he]107-matthew had entered [the hall]551-the hall , when [Anne]124-anne had finished [her]124-anne essay .

" It 's not the first time [I]113-marilla 've been glad , "[113-marilla] retorted [Marilla]113-marilla . " [You]124-anne do like to rub things in , [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew . "[113-marilla]

[Miss Barry]217-miss barry , who was sitting behind [them]1914-them , leaned forward and poked [Marilla]113-marilla in the back with [her]217-miss barry parasol .

" Are n't [you]124-anne proud of [that Anne - girl]3186-that anne - girl ? [I]217-miss barry am , "[217-miss barry] [she]217-miss barry said .

[Anne]124-anne went home to [Avonlea]2-avonlea with [Matthew]107-matthew and [Marilla]113-marilla that evening . [She]124-anne had not been [home]361-home since April and [she]124-anne felt that [she]124-anne could not wait another day . The apple blossoms were out and [the world]409-the world was fresh and young . [Diana]120-diana was at [Green Gables]107-matthew to meet [her]124-anne . In [[her]124-anne own white room , where [Marilla]113-marilla had set [a flowering house]1918-a flowering house rose on the window sill]1917-her own white room , where marilla had set a flowering house rose on the window sill , [Anne]124-anne looked about [her]124-anne and drew a long breath of happiness .

" Oh , [Diana]120-diana , it 's so good to be back again . It 's so good to see those pointed firs coming out against the pink sky -- and [that white orchard]4072-that white orchard and [the old Snow Queen]4073-the old snow queen . Is n't the breath of the mint delicious ? And that tea rose -- why , it 's a song and a hope and a prayer all in one . And it 's _ good _ to see [you]120-diana again , [Diana]120-diana ! "[124-anne]

" [I]120-diana thought [you]120-diana liked that [Stella Maynard]299-stella maynard better than [me]120-diana , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana reproachfully . " [Josie Pye]175-josie pye told [me]120-diana [you]120-diana did . [Josie]175-josie pye said [you]120-diana were _ infatuated _ with [her]299-stella maynard . "[120-diana]

[Anne]124-anne laughed and pelted [Diana]120-diana with the faded " June lilies "[124-anne] of [her]124-anne bouquet .

" [Stella Maynard]299-stella maynard is [the dearest girl in [the world]409-the world]4074-the dearest girl in the world except one and [you]120-diana are that one , [Diana]120-diana , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said . " [I]124-anne love [you]120-diana more than ever -- and [I]124-anne 've so many things to tell [you]120-diana . But just now [I]124-anne feel as if it were joy enough to sit here and look at [you]120-diana . [I]124-anne 'm tired , [I]124-anne think -- tired of being studious and ambitious . [I]124-anne mean to spend at least two hours tomorrow lying out in [the orchard grass]4076-the orchard grass , thinking of absolutely nothing . "[124-anne]

" [You]120-diana 've done splendidly , [Anne]124-anne . [I]124-anne suppose [you]120-diana wo n't be teaching now that [you]120-diana 've won [the Avery]307-the avery ? "[124-anne]

" No . [I]124-anne 'm going to [Redmond]99-redmond in [September]280-september . Does n't it seem wonderful ? [I]124-anne 'll have a brand new stock of ambition laid in by that time after three glorious , golden months of vacation . [Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis are going to teach . Is n't it splendid to think [we]4077-we all got through even to [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon and [Josie Pye]175-josie pye ? "[124-anne]

" [The Newbridge trustees]4078-the newbridge trustees have offered [Jane]121-jane [[their]4078-the newbridge trustees school]4079-their school already , "[120-diana] said [Diana]120-diana . " [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert is going to teach , too . [He]140-gilbert has to . [[His]140-gilbert father]2867-his father ca n't afford to send [him]140-gilbert to college next year , after all , so [he]140-gilbert means to earn [his]140-gilbert own way through . [I]120-diana expect [he]140-gilbert 'll get [the school]867-the school [here]2022-here if [Miss Ames]309-miss ames decides to leave . "[120-diana]

[Anne]124-anne felt a queer little sensation of dismayed surprise . [She]124-anne had not known this ; [she]124-anne had expected that [Gilbert]140-gilbert would be going to [Redmond]99-redmond also . What would [she]124-anne do without [their]1919-their inspiring rivalry ? Would not work , even at a coeducational [college with a real degree in prospect]1920-college with a real degree in prospect , be rather flat without [[her]124-anne friend]1310-her friend [the enemy]1922-the enemy ?

The next morning at breakfast it suddenly struck [Anne]124-anne that [Matthew]107-matthew was not looking well . Surely [he]107-matthew was much grayer than [he]107-matthew had been a year before .

" [Marilla]113-marilla , "[124-anne] [she]124-anne said hesitatingly when [he]107-matthew had gone out , " is [Matthew]107-matthew quite well ? "[124-anne]

" No , [he]107-matthew is n't , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla in a troubled tone . " [He]107-matthew 's had some real bad spells with [his]107-matthew heart this spring and [he]107-matthew wo n't spare [himself]107-matthew a mite . [I]113-marilla 've been real worried about [him]107-matthew , but [he]107-matthew 's some better this while back and [we]4083-we 've got [a good hired man]4084-a good hired man , so [I]113-marilla 'm hoping [he]107-matthew 'll kind of rest and pick up . Maybe [he]107-matthew will now [you]124-anne 're [home]361-home . [You]124-anne always cheer [him]107-matthew up . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]124-anne leaned across the table and took [Marilla]113-marilla 's face in [her]124-anne hands .

" [You]113-marilla are not looking as well [yourself]113-marilla as [I]124-anne 'd like to see [you]113-marilla , [Marilla]113-marilla . [You]113-marilla look tired . [I]124-anne 'm afraid [you]113-marilla 've been working too hard . [You]113-marilla must take a rest , now that [I]124-anne 'm [home]361-home . [I]124-anne 'm just going to take this one day off to visit all the dear old spots and hunt up [my]124-anne old dreams , and then it will be [your]113-marilla turn to be lazy while [I]124-anne do the work . "[124-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla smiled affectionately at [[her]113-marilla girl]1727-her girl .

" It 's not the work -- it 's [my]124-anne head . [I]124-anne 've got a pain so often now -- behind [my]124-anne eyes . [Doctor Spencer]310-doctor spencer 's been fussing with glasses , but [they]4087-they do n't do [me]124-anne any good . There is [a distinguished oculist]4088-a distinguished oculist coming to [the Island]11-the island the last of [June]282-june and [the doctor]2016-the doctor says [I]124-anne must see [him]4088-a distinguished oculist . [I]124-anne guess [I]124-anne 'll have to . [I]124-anne ca n't read or sew with any comfort now . Well , [Anne]124-anne , [you]124-anne 've done real well at [Queen]3551-queen 's [I]124-anne must say . To take First Class License in one year and win the Avery scholarship -- well , well , [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde says pride goes before a fall and [she]105-mrs. lynde does n't believe in the higher education of [women]423-women at all ; [she]105-mrs. lynde says it unfits [them]423-women for [woman]4092-woman 's true sphere . [I]124-anne do n't believe a word of it . Speaking of [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde reminds [me]124-anne -- did [you]124-anne hear anything about [the Abbey Bank]4093-the abbey bank lately , [Anne]124-anne ? "[124-anne]

" [I]124-anne heard it was shaky , "[124-anne] answered [Anne]124-anne . " Why ? "[124-anne]

" That is what [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde said . [She]105-mrs. lynde was up here one day last week and said there was some talk about it . [Matthew]107-matthew felt real worried . All [we]4094-we have saved is in [that bank]4095-that bank -- every penny . [I]124-anne wanted [Matthew]107-matthew to put it in [the Savings Bank]4096-the savings bank in the first place , but [old Mr. Abbey]311-old mr. abbey was [a great friend of [father]2327-father 's]4097-a great friend of father 's and [he]311-old mr. abbey 'd always banked with [him]311-old mr. abbey . [Matthew]107-matthew said [any bank with [him]107-matthew at the head of [it]4096-the savings bank]4099-any bank with him at the head of it was good enough for [anybody]2031-anybody . "[124-anne]

" [I]124-anne think [he]107-matthew has only been its nominal head for many years , "[124-anne] said [Anne]124-anne . " [He]107-matthew is [a very old man]4101-a very old man ; [[his]107-matthew nephews]4102-his nephews are really at the head of [the institution]4103-the institution . "[124-anne]

" Well , when [Rachel]105-mrs. lynde told [us]4104-us that , [I]124-anne wanted [Matthew]107-matthew to draw [our]4104-us money right out and [he]107-matthew said [he]107-matthew 'd think of it . But [Mr. Russell]312-mr. russell told [him]107-matthew yesterday that [the bank]4105-the bank was all right . "[124-anne]

[Anne]124-anne had [her]124-anne good day in the companionship of [the outdoor world]1924-the outdoor world . [She]124-anne never forgot that day ; it was so bright and golden and fair , so free from shadow and so lavish of blossom . [Anne]124-anne spent some of [its]1925-its rich hours in [the orchard]2264-the orchard ; [she]124-anne went to [the Dryad 's Bubble]2728-the dryad 's bubble and [Willowmere]48-willowmere and [Violet Vale]147-violet vale ; [she]124-anne called at [the manse]2492-the manse and had a satisfying talk with [Mrs. Allan]232-anne ; and finally in the evening [she]124-anne went with [Matthew]107-matthew for the cows , through [Lovers ' Lane]96-lovers ' lane to [the back pasture]706-the back pasture . [The woods]373-the woods were all gloried through with sunset and the warm splendor of it streamed down through the hill gaps in the west . [Matthew]107-matthew walked slowly with bent head ; [Anne]232-anne , tall and erect , suited [her]232-anne springing step to [his]107-matthew .

" [You]107-matthew 've been working too hard today , [Matthew]107-matthew , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne said reproachfully . " Why wo n't [you]107-matthew take things easier ? "[232-anne]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew ca n't seem to , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew , as [he]107-matthew opened [the yard]2099-the yard gate to let the cows through . " It 's only that [I]107-matthew 'm getting old , [Anne]232-anne , and keep forgetting it . Well , well , [I]107-matthew 've always worked pretty hard and [I]107-matthew 'd rather drop in harness . "[107-matthew]

" If [I]232-anne had been [the boy [you]107-matthew sent for]4106-the boy you sent for , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne wistfully , " [I]232-anne 'd be able to help [you]107-matthew so much now and spare [you]107-matthew in a hundred ways . [I]232-anne could find it in [my]232-anne heart to wish [I]232-anne had been , just for that . "[232-anne]

" Well now , [I]107-matthew 'd rather have [you]232-anne than [a dozen boys]4107-a dozen boys , [Anne]232-anne , "[107-matthew] said [Matthew]107-matthew patting [her]232-anne hand . " Just mind [you]232-anne that -- rather than [a dozen boys]4107-a dozen boys . Well now , [I]107-matthew guess it was n't [a boy that took the [Avery]307-the avery scholarship]4109-a boy that took the avery scholarship , was it ? It was [a girl]2066-a girl -- [[my]107-matthew girl]4111-my girl -- [[my]107-matthew girl that [I]107-matthew 'm proud of]4112-my girl that i 'm proud of . "[107-matthew]

[He]107-matthew smiled [his]107-matthew shy smile at [her]232-anne as [he]107-matthew went into [the yard]2099-the yard . [Anne]232-anne took the memory of it with [her]232-anne when [she]232-anne went to [[her]232-anne room]807-her room that night and sat for a long while at [her]232-anne open window , thinking of the past and dreaming of the future . Outside [the Snow Queen]2484-the snow queen was mistily white in the moonshine ; the frogs were singing in [the marsh beyond [Orchard Slope]24-orchard slope]1935-the marsh beyond orchard slope . [Anne]232-anne always remembered the silvery , peaceful beauty and fragrant calm of that night . It was the last night before sorrow touched [her]232-anne life ; and no life is ever quite the same again when once that cold , sanctifying touch has been laid upon it .

CHAPTER XXXVII . The Reaper Whose Name Is [Death]255-death not divided

" [MATTHEW]107-matthew -- [Matthew]107-matthew -- what is the matter ? [Matthew]4113-matthew , are [you]4113-matthew sick ? "[113-marilla]

It was [Marilla]113-marilla who spoke , alarm in every jerky word . [Anne]232-anne came through [the hall]551-the hall , [her]232-anne hands full of white narcissus,--it was long before [Anne]232-anne could love the sight or odor of white narcissus again,--in time to hear [her]232-anne and to see [Matthew]107-matthew standing in [the porch]752-the porch doorway , a folded paper in [his]107-matthew hand , and [his]107-matthew face strangely drawn and gray . [Anne]232-anne dropped [her]232-anne flowers and sprang across [the kitchen]557-the kitchen to [him]107-matthew at the same moment as [Marilla]113-marilla . [They]1939-they were both too late ; before [they]1939-they could reach [him]107-matthew [Matthew]107-matthew had fallen across the threshold .

" [He]107-matthew 's fainted , "[113-marilla] gasped [Marilla]113-marilla . " [Anne]232-anne , run for [Martin]313-martin -- quick , quick ! [He]107-matthew 's at [the barn]353-the barn . "[113-marilla]

[Martin]313-martin , [the hired man]3507-the hired man , who had just driven [home]361-home from [the post office]1268-the post office , started at once for [the doctor]2016-the doctor , calling at [Orchard Slope]24-orchard slope on [his]313-martin way to send [Mr.]1944-mr. and [Mrs. Barry]118-mrs. barry over . [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , who was there on an errand , came too . [They]1939-they found [Anne]232-anne and [Marilla]113-marilla distractedly trying to restore [Matthew]107-matthew to consciousness .

[Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde pushed [them]1939-they gently aside , tried [his]107-matthew pulse , and then laid [her]105-mrs. lynde ear over [his]107-matthew heart . [She]105-mrs. lynde looked at [their]1939-they anxious faces sorrowfully and the tears came into [her]105-mrs. lynde eyes .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[105-mrs. lynde] [she]105-mrs. lynde said gravely . " [I]105-mrs. lynde do n't think -- [we]1939-they can do anything for [him]107-matthew . "[105-mrs. lynde]

" [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde , [you]105-mrs. lynde do n't think -- [you]105-mrs. lynde ca n't think [Matthew]107-matthew is -- is-- "[232-anne] [Anne]232-anne could not say the dreadful word ; [she]232-anne turned sick and pallid .

" [Child]314-child , yes , [I]2016-the doctor 'm afraid of it . Look at [his]107-matthew face . When [you]105-mrs. lynde 've seen that look as often as [I]2016-the doctor have [you]105-mrs. lynde 'll know what it means . "[2016-the doctor]

[Anne]232-anne looked at the still face and there beheld the seal of the Great Presence .

When [the doctor]2016-the doctor came [he]2016-the doctor said that death had been instantaneous and probably painless , caused in all likelihood by some sudden shock . The secret of the shock was discovered to be in the paper [Matthew]107-matthew had held and which [Martin]313-martin had brought from [the office]1946-the office that morning . It contained an account of the failure of [the Abbey Bank]101-the abbey bank .

The news spread quickly through [Avonlea]2-avonlea , and [all day friends]1947-all day friends and [neighbors]1763-neighbors thronged [Green Gables]107-matthew and came and went on errands of kindness for [the dead and living]1949-the dead and living . For the first time shy , quiet [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew was [a person of central importance]1950-a person of central importance ; the white majesty of death had fallen on [him]107-matthew and set [him]107-matthew apart as [one crowned]1951-one crowned .

When the calm night came softly down over [Green Gables]1952-green gables [the old house]1953-the old house was hushed and tranquil . In [the parlor]622-the parlor lay [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew in [his]107-matthew coffin , [his]107-matthew long gray hair framing [his]107-matthew placid face on which there was a little kindly smile as if [he]107-matthew but slept , dreaming pleasant dreams . There were flowers about [him]107-matthew -- sweet old - fashioned flowers which [[his]107-matthew mother]2361-his mother had planted in [the homestead garden]1956-the homestead garden in [her]2361-his mother bridal days and for which [Matthew]107-matthew had always had a secret , wordless love . [Anne]232-anne had gathered them and brought them to [him]107-matthew , [her]232-anne anguished , tearless eyes burning in [her]232-anne white face . It was the last thing [she]232-anne could do for [him]107-matthew .

[The Barrys]219-the barrys and [Mrs. Lynde]105-mrs. lynde stayed with [them]1957-them that night . [Diana]120-diana , going to [the east gable]561-the east gable , where [Anne]232-anne was standing at [her]232-anne window , said gently :

" [[Anne]232-anne dear]4115-anne dear , would [you]232-anne like to have [me]120-diana sleep with [you]232-anne tonight ? "[120-diana]

" Thank [you]232-anne , [Diana]120-diana . "[232-anne] [Anne]232-anne looked earnestly into [[her]232-anne friend]1310-her friend 's face . " [I]232-anne think [you]232-anne wo n't misunderstand [me]232-anne when [I]232-anne say [I]232-anne want to be alone . [I]232-anne 'm not afraid . [I]232-anne have n't been alone one minute since it happened -- and [I]232-anne want to be . [I]232-anne want to be quite silent and quiet and try to realize it . [I]232-anne ca n't realize it . Half the time it seems to [me]232-anne that [Matthew]107-matthew ca n't be dead ; and the other half it seems as if [he]107-matthew must have been dead for a long time and [I]232-anne 've had this horrible dull ache ever since . "[232-anne]

[Diana]120-diana did not quite understand . [Marilla]113-marilla 's impassioned grief , breaking all the bounds of natural reserve and lifelong habit in its stormy rush , [she]113-marilla could comprehend better than [Anne]232-anne 's tearless agony . But [she]113-marilla went away kindly , leaving [Anne]232-anne alone to keep [her]232-anne first vigil with sorrow .

[Anne]232-anne hoped that the tears would come in solitude . It seemed to [her]232-anne a terrible thing that [she]232-anne could not shed a tear for [Matthew]107-matthew , whom [she]232-anne had loved so much and who had been so kind to [her]232-anne , [Matthew]107-matthew who had walked with [her]232-anne last evening at sunset and was now lying in [the dim room below]1960-the dim room below with that awful peace on [his]107-matthew brow . But no tears came at first , even when [she]232-anne knelt by [her]232-anne window in the darkness and prayed , looking up to the stars beyond [the hills]1538-the hills -- no tears , only the same horrible dull ache of misery that kept on aching until [she]232-anne fell asleep , worn out with the day 's pain and excitement .

In the night [she]232-anne awakened , with the stillness and the darkness about [her]232-anne , and the recollection of the day came over [her]232-anne like a wave of sorrow . [She]232-anne could see [Matthew]107-matthew 's face smiling at [her]232-anne as [he]107-matthew had smiled when [they]1962-they parted at the gate that last evening -- [she]232-anne could hear [his]107-matthew voice saying , " [[My]107-matthew girl]4111-my girl -- [[my]107-matthew girl]4111-my girl that [I]107-matthew 'm proud of . "[107-matthew] Then the tears came and [Anne]232-anne wept [her]232-anne heart out . [Marilla]113-marilla heard [her]232-anne and crept in to comfort [her]232-anne .

" There -- there -- don't cry so , [dearie]4118-dearie . [It]4119-it ca n't bring [him]107-matthew back . [It]4119-it -- it -- isn't right to cry so . [I]107-matthew knew that today , but [I]107-matthew could n't help it then . [He]107-matthew 'd always been such [a good , kind brother to [me]107-matthew]4120-a good , kind brother to me -- but [God]145-god knows best . "[107-matthew]

" Oh , just let [me]232-anne cry , [Marilla]113-marilla , "[232-anne] sobbed [Anne]232-anne . " The tears do n't hurt [me]232-anne like that ache did . Stay here for a little while with [me]232-anne and keep [your]113-marilla arm round [me]232-anne -- so . [I]232-anne could n't have [Diana]120-diana stay , [she]120-diana 's good and kind and sweet -- but it 's not [her]120-diana sorrow -- [she]120-diana 's outside of it and [she]120-diana could n't come close enough to [my]232-anne heart to help [me]232-anne . It 's [our]4121-we sorrow -- [yours]113-marilla and [mine]232-anne . Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , what will [we]4121-we do without [him]4122-him ? "[232-anne]

" [We]4121-we 've got [each other]535-each other , [Anne]232-anne . [I]1963-i do n't know what [I]1963-i 'd do if [you]232-anne were n't here -- if [you]232-anne 'd never come . Oh , [Anne]232-anne , [I]1963-i know [I]1963-i 've been kind of strict and harsh with [you]232-anne maybe -- but [you]232-anne must n't think [I]1963-i did n't love [you]232-anne as well as [Matthew]107-matthew did , for all that . [I]1963-i want to tell [you]232-anne now when [I]1963-i can . It 's never been easy for [me]1963-i to say things out of [my]1963-i heart , but at times like this it 's easier . [I]1963-i love [you]232-anne as dear as if [you]232-anne were [my]1963-i own flesh and blood and [you]232-anne 've been [my]1963-i joy and comfort ever since [you]232-anne came to [Green Gables]107-matthew . "[1963-i]

Two days afterwards [they]1963-i carried [Matthew Cuthbert]107-matthew over [[his]107-matthew homestead]374-his homestead threshold and away from [the fields [he]107-matthew had tilled]1965-the fields he had tilled and [the orchards [he]107-matthew had loved and the trees [he]107-matthew had planted]1966-the orchards he had loved and the trees he had planted ; and then [Avonlea]2-avonlea settled back to [its]2-avonlea usual placidity and even at [Green Gables]107-matthew affairs slipped into [their]1963-i old groove and work was done and duties fulfilled with regularity as before , although always with the aching sense of " loss in all familiar things . "[232-anne] [Anne]232-anne , new to grief , thought it almost sad that it could be so -- that [they]1963-i _ could _ go on in the old way without [Matthew]107-matthew . [She]232-anne felt something like shame and remorse when [she]232-anne discovered that the sunrises behind the firs and the pale pink buds opening in [the garden]573-the garden gave [her]232-anne the old inrush of gladness when [she]232-anne saw them -- that [Diana]120-diana 's visits were pleasant to [her]232-anne and that [Diana]120-diana 's merry words and ways moved [her]232-anne to laughter and smiles -- that , in brief , the beautiful world of blossom and love and friendship had lost none of its power to please [her]232-anne fancy and thrill [her]232-anne heart , that life still called to [her]232-anne with many insistent voices .

" It seems like disloyalty to [Matthew]107-matthew , somehow , to find pleasure in these things now that [he]107-matthew has gone , "[232-anne] [she]232-anne said wistfully to [Mrs. Allan]232-anne one evening when [they]1963-i were together in [the manse garden]1968-the manse garden . " [I]232-anne miss [him]107-matthew so much -- all the time -- and yet , [Mrs. Allan]232-anne , [the world]409-the world and life seem very beautiful and interesting to [me]232-anne for all . Today [Diana]120-diana said something funny and [I]232-anne found [myself]232-anne laughing . [I]232-anne thought when it happened [I]232-anne could never laugh again . And it somehow seems as if [I]232-anne ought n't to . "[232-anne]

" When [Matthew]107-matthew was [here]2022-here [he]107-matthew liked to hear [you]232-anne laugh and [he]107-matthew liked to know that [you]232-anne found pleasure in the pleasant things around [you]232-anne , "[232-anne] said [Mrs. Allan]232-anne gently . " [He]107-matthew is just away now ; and [he]107-matthew likes to know it just the same . [I]232-anne am sure [we]4126-we should not shut [our]4126-we hearts against the healing influences that nature offers [us]4126-we . But [I]232-anne can understand [your]232-anne feeling . [I]232-anne think [we]4126-we all experience the same thing . [We]4126-we resent the thought that anything can please [us]4126-we when [[someone]4127-someone [we]4126-we love]4128-someone we love is no longer here to share the pleasure with [us]4126-we , and [we]4126-we almost feel as if [we]4126-we were unfaithful to [our]4126-we sorrow when [we]4126-we find [our]4126-we interest in life returning to [us]4126-we . "[232-anne]

" [I]232-anne was down to [the graveyard]2958-the graveyard to plant a rosebush on [[Matthew]107-matthew 's grave]4130-matthew 's grave this afternoon , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne dreamily . " [I]232-anne took a slip of the little white Scotch rosebush [[his]107-matthew mother]2361-his mother brought out from [Scotland]102-scotland long ago ; [Matthew]107-matthew always liked those roses the best -- they were so small and sweet on their thorny stems . It made [me]232-anne feel glad that [I]232-anne could plant it by [[his]107-matthew grave]4132-his grave -- as if [I]232-anne were doing something that must please [him]107-matthew in taking it there to be near [him]107-matthew . [I]232-anne hope [he]107-matthew has roses like them in [heaven]4133-heaven . Perhaps the souls of all those little white roses that [he]107-matthew has loved so many summers were all there to meet [him]107-matthew . [I]232-anne must go [home]361-home now . [Marilla]113-marilla is all alone and [she]113-marilla gets lonely at twilight . "[232-anne]

" [She]113-marilla will be lonelier still , [I]232-anne fear , when [you]232-anne go away again to [college]4135-college , "[232-anne] said [Mrs. Allan]232-anne .

[Anne]232-anne did not reply ; [she]232-anne said good night and went slowly back to [green Gables]107-matthew . [Marilla]113-marilla was sitting on the front door - steps and [Anne]232-anne sat down beside [her]113-marilla . The door was open behind [them]1969-them , held back by a big pink conch shell with hints of sea sunsets in its smooth inner convolutions .

[Anne]232-anne gathered some sprays of pale - yellow honeysuckle and put them in [her]232-anne hair . [She]232-anne liked the delicious hint of fragrance , as some aerial benediction , above [her]232-anne every time [she]232-anne moved .

" [Doctor [Spencer]310-doctor spencer]4136-doctor spencer was here while [you]232-anne were away , "[113-marilla] [Marilla]113-marilla said . " [He]4136-doctor spencer says that [the specialist]4137-the specialist will be in [town]2009-town tomorrow and [he]4136-doctor spencer insists that [I]113-marilla must go in and have [my]113-marilla eyes examined . [I]113-marilla suppose [I]113-marilla 'd better go and have it over . [I]113-marilla 'll be more than thankful if [the man]3306-the man can give [me]113-marilla the right kind of glasses to suit [my]113-marilla eyes . [You]232-anne wo n't mind staying here alone while [I]113-marilla 'm away , will [you]232-anne ? [Martin]313-martin will have to drive [me]113-marilla in and there 's ironing and baking to do . "[113-marilla]

" [I]232-anne shall be all right . [Diana]120-diana will come over for company for [me]232-anne . [I]232-anne shall attend to the ironing and baking beautifully -- [you]232-anne need n't fear that [I]232-anne 'll starch the handkerchiefs or flavor the cake with liniment . "[232-anne]

[Marilla]113-marilla laughed .

" What [a girl]2066-a girl [you]232-anne were for making mistakes in [them]4141-them days , [Anne]232-anne . [You]232-anne were always getting into scrapes . [I]232-anne did use to think [you]232-anne were possessed . Do [you]232-anne mind the time [you]232-anne dyed [your]232-anne hair ? "[232-anne]

" Yes , indeed . [I]232-anne shall never forget it , "[232-anne] smiled [Anne]232-anne , touching the heavy braid of hair that was wound about [her]232-anne shapely head . " [I]232-anne laugh a little now sometimes when [I]232-anne think what a worry [my]232-anne hair used to be to [me]232-anne -- but [I]232-anne do n't laugh _ much _ , because it was a very real trouble then . [I]232-anne did suffer terribly over [my]232-anne hair and [my]232-anne freckles . [My]232-anne freckles are really gone ; and [people]2012-people are nice enough to tell [me]232-anne [my]232-anne hair is auburn now -- all but [Josie Pye]175-josie pye . [She]175-josie pye informed [me]232-anne yesterday that [she]175-josie pye really thought it was redder than ever , or at least [my]232-anne black dress made it look redder , and [she]175-josie pye asked [me]232-anne if [people who had red hair]4143-people who had red hair ever got used to having it . [Marilla]113-marilla , [I]232-anne 've almost decided to give up trying to like [Josie Pye]175-josie pye . [I]232-anne 've made what [I]232-anne would once have called a heroic effort to like [her]175-josie pye , but [Josie Pye]175-josie pye wo n't _ be _ liked . "[232-anne]

" [Josie]175-josie pye is [a Pye]4144-a pye , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla sharply , " so [she]175-josie pye ca n't help being disagreeable . [I]113-marilla suppose [people of that kind]4145-people of that kind serve some useful purpose in society , but [I]113-marilla must say [I]113-marilla do n't know what it is any more than [I]113-marilla know the use of thistles . Is [Josie]175-josie pye going to teach ? "[113-marilla]

" No , [she]175-josie pye is going back to [Queen]3551-queen 's next year . So are [Moody Spurgeon]254-moody spurgeon and [Charlie Sloane]173-charlie sloane . [Jane]121-jane and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis are going to teach and [they]4147-they have both got [schools]4148-schools -- [Jane]121-jane at [Newbridge]20-newbridge and [Ruby]168-ruby gillis at [some place up west]4149-some place up west . "[232-anne]

" [Gilbert Blythe]140-gilbert is going to teach too , is n't [he]140-gilbert ? "[113-marilla]

" Yes"--briefly[232-anne] .

" What [a nice - looking fellow]4150-a nice - looking fellow [he]140-gilbert is , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla absently . " [I]113-marilla saw [him]140-gilbert in [church]2482-church last Sunday and [he]140-gilbert seemed so tall and manly . [He]140-gilbert looks a lot like [[his]140-gilbert father]2867-his father did at the same age . [John Blythe]315-john blythe was [a nice boy]4153-a nice boy . [We]4154-we used to be [real good friends]4155-real good friends , [he]140-gilbert and [I.]113-marilla People called [him]140-gilbert [[my]113-marilla beau]4156-my beau . "[113-marilla]

[Anne]232-anne looked up with swift interest .

" Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla -- and what happened?--why did n't [you--]4157-you-- "[232-anne]

" [We]4154-we had a quarrel . [I]232-anne would n't forgive [him]140-gilbert when [he]140-gilbert asked [me]232-anne to . [I]232-anne meant to , after awhile -- but [I]232-anne was sulky and angry and [I]232-anne wanted to punish [him]140-gilbert first . [He]140-gilbert never came back -- [the Blythes]316-the blythes were all mighty independent . But [I]232-anne always felt -- rather sorry . [I]232-anne 've always kind of wished [I]232-anne 'd forgiven [him]140-gilbert when [I]232-anne had the chance . "[232-anne]

" So [you]113-marilla 've had a bit of romance in [your]113-marilla life , too , "[232-anne] said [Anne]232-anne softly .

" Yes , [I]113-marilla suppose [you]113-marilla might call it that . [You]113-marilla would n't think so to look at [me]113-marilla , would [you]113-marilla ? But [you]113-marilla never can tell about [[people]2012-people from [their]2012-people outsides]4159-people from their outsides . [Everybody]2130-everybody has forgot about [me]113-marilla and [John]315-john blythe . [I]113-marilla 'd forgotten [myself]113-marilla . But it all came back to [me]113-marilla when [I]113-marilla saw [Gilbert]140-gilbert last Sunday . "[113-marilla]

CHAPTER XXXVIII . The Bend in [the road]413-the road

|MARILLA went to [town]2009-town the next day and returned in the evening . [Anne]232-anne had gone over to [Orchard Slope]24-orchard slope with [Diana]120-diana and came back to find [Marilla]113-marilla in [the kitchen]557-the kitchen , sitting by the table with [her]113-marilla head leaning on [her]113-marilla hand . Something in [her]113-marilla dejected attitude struck a chill to [Anne]232-anne 's heart . [She]232-anne had never seen [Marilla]113-marilla sit limply inert like that .

" Are [you]113-marilla very tired , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[113-marilla]

" Yes -- no -- [I]113-marilla do n't know , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla wearily , looking up . " [I]113-marilla suppose [I]113-marilla am tired but [I]113-marilla have n't thought about it . It 's not that . "[113-marilla]

" Did [you]113-marilla see [the oculist]4161-the oculist ? What did [he]4161-the oculist say ? "[232-anne] asked [Anne]232-anne anxiously .

" Yes , [I]113-marilla saw [him]4161-the oculist . [He]4161-the oculist examined [my]113-marilla eyes . [He]4161-the oculist says that if [I]113-marilla give up all reading and sewing entirely and any kind of work that strains the eyes , and if [I]113-marilla 'm careful not to cry , and if [I]113-marilla wear the glasses [he]4161-the oculist 's given [me]113-marilla [he]4161-the oculist thinks [my]113-marilla eyes may not get any worse and [my]113-marilla headaches will be cured . But if [I]113-marilla do n't [he]4161-the oculist says [I]113-marilla 'll certainly be stone - blind in six months . Blind ! [Anne]232-anne , just think of it ! "[113-marilla]

For a minute [Anne]232-anne , after [her]232-anne first quick exclamation of dismay , was silent . It seemed to [her]232-anne that [she]232-anne could _ not _ speak . Then [she]232-anne said bravely , but with a catch in [her]232-anne voice :

" [Marilla]113-marilla , _ do n't _ think of it . [You]113-marilla know [he]4161-the oculist has given [you]113-marilla hope . If [you]113-marilla are careful [you]113-marilla wo n't lose [your]113-marilla sight altogether ; and if [his]4161-the oculist glasses cure [your]113-marilla headaches it will be a great thing . "[232-anne]

" [I]113-marilla do n't call it much hope , "[113-marilla] said [Marilla]113-marilla bitterly . " What am [I]113-marilla to live for if [I]113-marilla ca n't read or sew or do anything like that ? [I]113-marilla might as well be blind -- or dead . And as for crying , [I]113-marilla ca n't help that when [I]113-marilla get lonesome . But there , it 's no good talking about it . If [you]113-marilla 'll get [me]113-marilla a cup of tea [I]113-marilla 'll be thankful . [I]113-marilla 'm about done out . Do n't say anything about this to [any one]2583-any one for a spell yet , anyway . [I]113-marilla ca n't bear that [folks]2346-folks should come here to question and sympathize and talk about it . "[113-marilla]

When [Marilla]113-marilla had eaten [her]113-marilla lunch [Anne]232-anne persuaded [her]113-marilla to go to bed . Then [Anne]232-anne went [herself]232-anne to [the east gable]561-the east gable and sat down by [her]232-anne window in the darkness alone with [her]232-anne tears and [her]232-anne heaviness of heart . How sadly things had changed since [she]232-anne had sat there the night after coming [home]361-home ! Then [she]232-anne had been full of hope and joy and the future had looked rosy with promise . [Anne]232-anne felt as if [she]232-anne had lived years since then , but before [she]232-anne went to bed there was a smile on [her]232-anne lips and peace in [her]232-anne heart . [She]232-anne had looked [her]232-anne duty courageously in the face and found it [a friend]1027-a friend -- as duty ever is when [we]1976-we meet it frankly .

One afternoon a few days later [Marilla]113-marilla came slowly in from [the front yard]2333-the front yard where [she]113-marilla had been talking to [a caller]1978-a caller -- [a man whom [Anne]232-anne knew by sight as [Sadler]317-sadler from [Carmody]5-carmody]1979-a man whom anne knew by sight as sadler from carmody . [Anne]232-anne wondered what [he]1979-a man whom anne knew by sight as sadler from carmody could have been saying to bring that look to [Marilla]113-marilla 's face .

" What did [Mr. Sadler]317-sadler want , [Marilla]113-marilla ? "[1979-a man whom anne knew by sight as sadler from carmody]

" [He]317-sadler heard that [I]113-marilla was going to sell [Green Gables]107-matthew and [he]317-sadler wants to buy it . "[113-marilla]

" Buy it ! Buy [Green Gables]107-matthew ? "[232-anne] [Anne]232-anne wondered if [she]232-anne had heard aright . " Oh , [Marilla]113-marilla , [you]113-marilla do n't mean to sell [Green Gables]107-matthew ! "[232-anne]

" [Anne]232-anne , [I]113-marilla do n't know what else is to be done . [I]113-marilla 've thought it all over . [I]113-marilla may lose [my]113-marilla sight altogether ; and anyway [I]113-marilla 'll not be fit to run things . "[113-marilla]

[Mrs. Rachel]105-mrs. lynde deposited [[her]105-mrs. lynde substantial person]1987-her substantial person upon the stone bench by the door , behind which grew a row of tall pink and yellow hollyhocks , with a long breath of mingled weariness and relief .

" [I]1987-her substantial person declare [I]1987-her substantial person 'm getting glad to sit down .
